description:
I normally go to the Home Cafe on Clement but found myself in the Sunset today so I thought I'd check it out. First of all, I love the aesthetics of this Home, it's very well-thought-out, comfortable, and of course home-y. ;) 

They have different food at the 2 locations. This location has warm food, such as warm sandwiches, while the Clement location has different types of avocado toast. 

A must try for food is the Cinn-ful Sugar (sweet) and the Truffle in Paradise (savory). And if you're a fan of lavender, try the Lavender Jasmine Tea Latte.
author: Sydney G.

description:
I was able to try this cute coffee shop out this weekend and was pretty satisfied. They have two locations in SF and the one I went to worked out perfectly for the day I had planned out. 

Parking is pretty easy (surprisingly) as its right in front of the store with plenty of spaces. 

The shop itself is quite cute and has a friendly "no laptops" policy to endorse talking and hanging out with friends. They have a good menu and a variety of aesthetic looking coffee to try out. 

I got the famous Birthday Cake Latte (vanilla latte). The coffee flavor is amazing and makes you think twice about getting starbucks ever again. My friends got the Salted Caramel and Red Velvet lattes which were also really yummy. Not gonna lie though, out of all three, the Salted Caramel was the best. 

Definitely try to stop by here if you're in the area and looking for nice coffee and wonderful service!
author: Nabiha A.

description:
Stopped by because we were headed into the City for the day. Easily found parking & headed in. Line wasn't too bad when we arrived but quickly started to fill up. We did have to wait a little for a table big enough For all of us but not too long and there was other seating in the meantime. We ordered a couple of pastries including the blueberry mochi doughnut and a raspberry almond croissant. Both were tasty. We also ordered a cinnamon sugar toast, an egg in a basket toast, and their specialty toast which had corn and egg and cheese. I think the bread that they use was really tasty but the toppings on the special toast could use a little improvement. It was essentially just canned corn thrown on the toast with an egg on top. The egg in a basket toast Was probably the yummiest apart from the cinnamon sugar.

For drinks we ordered a birthday cake latte which is what really brought us there because we saw it on IG. lol. The art on that was cute! My husband ordered a coconut iced latte or smtn like that that he enjoyed it! For the girls we ordered a nutella hot chocolate and they garnished it with cookie crisp. Also ordered an orange juice for the littlest one which was good. 

Over all the prices were about standard for a coffee shop of that sort and the vibe was very modern. 

I would recommend a Stop if you are in the area and have some time. They do also have some tables where you could sit and work with your laptop and some tables where they request you not have your laptop so more people are able to sit and come through. 

There are more flavors of coffee that I would like to try so I'll stop by again someday.
author: Carmen A.

description:
I got a red velvet latte, holy cow, chicken pesto, and egg in a basket.

This place is close to the bus stop and although the outside looks a bit plain, the interior is nicely done albeit compact.

I came here during the afternoon on a weekday and there was very limited seating. There's a no laptop policy but it didn't seem enforced so a lot of people were still on their laptops.

The service was great, the workers knew how to make this place feel like Home (lmfao). The red velvet latte was great but it also stains a lot. The toasts were a bit smaller than I thought and wasn't filling.

Overall, it's a great place and I would definitely like to come again.
author: Jeffrey C.

description:
Such a cute modern-ish cafe in Outer sunset!
I went here with my friend on Tuesday around 11am! We got lucky because we found our seats as soon as we walked in! We got Birthday cake latte ($5) and cookie monster latte ($5.25)! I love their Instagram worthy latte arts! It was too pretty to drink! Love that small cookies on my cookie monster latte! They have good wifi so it'a great place for work only if you find seats! :) overall cute coffee shop! I'd definitely go back to try their toasts and other lattes!
author: Clare L.

description:
Finally got to try this place last weekend! I've seen their drinks everywhere and I'm glad I finally got to try!
Came here around 3pm on a Sunday and it was pretty full. There was a short line but we were really scouting out where to sit down. 
The place is quite small with some bar seating and tables alongside the right side. 
Parking is on Noriega St so it can be easy or hard depending on the time you go. 

We decided to try the Birthday Cake Latte since it is the most popular drink because of how pretty it is. I was really surprised in how good it tasted! It was really just a vanilla latte made all pretty. It wasn't too sweet and it was a pretty good latte overall. We came from lunch so we didn't order any of their food. 
The only complaint is the people sitting there. Everyone had their laptops when I think there are signs to not use a laptop. I guess people don't know how to read? We sat by the window and these two girls sat in the middle leaving one seat on each end of them. I sat on the edge and they still didn't seem to get the clue until my boyfriend took the chair at the other end. Then they were like oh we can move down one so you guys can sit together! Clueless much *eye roll*

It was pretty pricey for a latte but it was for the pics. I don't think I would come back often but it was a good latte!
author: Kristie L.

description:
Great spot to catch up with a friend over coffee and a small meal! Love the environment of the place. It has a lot of natural lighting coming in to fill the white space. The baristas here are so nice and helpful. Everyone welcomes you with a smile. 

Albeit being a little pricy, the drinks and food here are tasty. I've had the salted caramel latte (hot) and the chicken meatball toast with an egg added. My latte was creamy and more bitter (less sweet), just the way I like it. I loved that they serve oat milk here. The toast was awesome as well. The meatball was slightly sweet and savory. The yolk from the egg on top marinated the whole dish together. The brioche toast was springy and perfectly toasted. 

Overall, I would come here again! I came here to study but found it to be too loud to concentrate. The sound echoes in this place so I wouldn't recommend doing work here if you can't tune out loud chatter.
author: Natalie D.

description:
Today's orders:
* Matcha Latte
     + They use organic matcha
* Coconut Vanilla Latte
     * There isn't an über strong coconut taste but 
        you can tell it's there
* Birthday Cake Latte
     + Very fun drink

Story time:
I came to Home far more times than I can count over the course of my last few semesters at SFSU. Even after visiting numerous cafes in and out of SF I always find myself coming back to Home. The reason Home deserves five stars is because of how In and Annie (owners) built up and structured Home. I've only been to the Noriega location so I can only speak about this one. The customer service and drinks are always consistently meeting and exceeding expectations. Their "Creative" drinks are both aesthetic (Instagram worthy even when you order to go) and tasty! But what really pushes them to five stars for me is the atmosphere of Home. It's perfect for doing work, catching up with friends, or a moment of respite from our busy lives. I look forward to coming back to Home after I come back from the East Coast!
author: Dillon T.

description:
I went here a few months ago when I visited my friend in SF, but I still remember how cute this place was! It was pretty packed when my friends and I walked in, but the workers were really friendly and helpful. From pictures I'd seen on Instagram, I pretty much already knew what I wanted to order--something with their rainbow design!

Of course, I got the Birthday Cake Latte because that's the one that comes with the cute rainbow design on top (plus I just love vanilla lattes). Each rainbow design is different, too! 

My friend and I both got the Birthday Cake one and my other friend got the Red Velvet Latte. Both types were delicious and the perfect amount of sweetness. Unfortunately, we did have to wait a little to find a seat since it was so crowded inside. However, once we sat down we got to take pictures and enjoy our cute and yummy lattes. Oh yeah, my friend also got a croissant which she enjoyed. 

Overall, this place didn't disappoint and was pretty much on par with my expectations. The interior was aesthetic, the workers were nice, and the lattes were cute, yummy and unique. Plus, I don't remember them being overpriced or anything. What more could you ask for? If you're in the area, I'd recommend checking out this place at least once.
author: Rachel E.

description:
I came with high hopes, as I've not only seen beautiful pictures on instagram but I've also heard fantastic things from my friends (in particular about the breakfast toasts).

Unfortunately, the kitchen wasn't open when I arrived, so I stuck with just the Cookie Monster latte, which is supposed to be peanut butter flavored. I don't think I really tasted the peanut butter, and the cookie crisps were a nice touch but probably unnecessary given how soggy they got by the time I ate them. The novelty was appreciated though.

I think my biggest hope for this place would be for the kitchen to open sooner than 9AM on a weekday! I'll definitely be back to try the pesto toast, and hopefully upgrade this to a 5 star review. :)
author: Sherry L.

description: Home...I heart you. Birthday lattes are so good and so festive. Matcha mochi donut sooo good! Please don't change.
author: Linda H.

description:
I love Home! This is the cafe I go to when I want a creative caffeine fix along with a filling toast to quell any hunger pangs.

My favorite latte is always the birthday cake latte with it's rainbow sprinkles and art pour. It really stands out and catches the eye. It tastes as great as it looks.

My go-to order for toast used to be the Eggs in a Basket, but now I'm liking their chicken meatball pesto toast quite a bit. It's pretty filling and make on a brioche toast.

It's hard to find seating here because it's so popular. The decor is impeccably marble-white and Instagram-worthy. If you manage to snag a seat, the atmosphere is quite lively, but calm enough for you to get some light work done.
author: Anna F.

description: Delicious toast and great coffee. Huge drinks menu. Nice spot. Recommend the Milky Way. Their bread and condensed milk go together perfectly!
author: Aakash G.

description: It was pretty packed when my boyfriend and I went here yesterday. The nutella latte and coconut vanilla latte were pretty good. I loved how the nutella latte was not super sweet like other places. You can actually taste the coconut and vanilla in the coconut vanilla latte. The best part was the form art on top. I was thinking since we ordered ours to go that it would just be regular lattes, but nope we got art on ours. Nice!
author: Thu L.

description:
I'm a wanderlust coffee lover..came all the way from Los Angeles and had to stop here to see what's up!
And boy !! I was not let down

Staff is super nice, they are quick for how busy they are.
author: Mira M.

description: This is what I came for.... it's kinda disappointing. I feel like it was done in a rush and they think it's acceptable to be served. Hmmm...
author: Ong M.

description:
Home is where the basic is at. Yeah, I'm sure you've seen all the pictures of rainbow lattes and all that jazz. Frankly, it's a one time thing then you try the rest of the menu.

Home is a very trendy cafe with overpriced coffee and toast though that's not to say that it's bad. The coffee and toast selections are actually quite good. The lattes aren't incredibly sweet which I appreciate. The toast, as simple as it sounds, is actually pretty good! They got a wide assortment of options like Egg in a Basket or Chicken Pesto. I'd say it's worth a try though I wouldn't regularly come here though, it's quite noisy despite the great ambiance. 

So whether you want that instagram latte or good toast, Home sweet Home.
author: Derek T.

description:
Quick Summary
- Cups are large
- Outlets in each table, but there are two tables designated for no laptops
- Specialty coffees (the sweet ones) can be its own dessert, so no need to pair with a dessert pastry. (maybe toast)

It was a really great experience. I discovered this cafe when I entered "latte art" in the search engine, and since then I listed this as the must-go places for coffee.

The cafe exceeded my expectations. One, the birthday cake latte wasn't extremely sweet despite the color and the name. I also ordered the coconut vanilla latte, so there were two coffees. They were sweet coffees, as the barista explained, so it was fine without ordering other dessert tarts or pastries. Both coffees weren't overpoweringly sweet, so they left a light aftertaste. 

Before leaving, I also ordered the London Fog Latte, and this was very good too. The tea bag was left in the cup, but the tea never great bitter, so I realized they used a high grade of tea leaves.

I would like to visit the other Home cafe on another day to explore other drinks too because all three were very delicious.
author: Mito I.

description:
I've had 6 of the drinks here and they're all amazing (and beautiful). Same with the food. Do yourself a favor and order 'for here'. grab a table, put away your phone, people watch, chat with friends, nibble on delicious treats, and sip gorgeous and spectacular drinks from an actual mug. 

Here are the things I've tried....

Birthday cake latte: absolutely gorgeous presentation. luckily, it doesn't taste like overly sweet cake, but rather the perfect vanilla latte. 

Red velvet latte: usually red velvet flavors mean the product tastes the same but happens to be red. not this. it's amazing and has a perfectly balanced hint of red velvet without being overwhelming. 

Lavender / rose lattes: both of these were divine, but don't order them if you don't actually like floral flavors. the flavor was present without being overwhelming. the rose is probably my overall favorite. sweet and light and floral and welcoming. if was amazing. 

Green tea latte: they don't skimp on the matcha, so it's perfect for green tea lovers. earthy matcha with soft, frothy milk. and again, beautiful presentation. 

Jasmine tea latte: I remember saying to my friend I actually wish it was cold and raining when I was drinking this. its so light and juuuust a hint sweet and makes you want to curl up with a book and blanket. 

Chicken pesto toast: delicious, and definitely big enough for a full meal. I especially love how they don't skimp on the chicken sausage or pesto. every single bite is full of flavor. do yourself a favor and add a fried egg! 

Mango pastry: again, absolutely delicious. the mango was crazy flavorful and the pastry was delectably flaky and delicate. the pastries are sweet, so keep that in mind and consider ordering a less sweet drink to pair with it. 

I'm sad I live on the east coast and can't go here every day.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
Delicious toasts and super beautiful lattes! Dragged my boyfriend here on a Saturday morning and he was initially reluctant because he didn't get the appeal of going to a place that only serves toast.

Needless to say, by the end of brunch he was very into Home! The toasts are very filling and delicious! My boyfriend, sister, and I split 4 different toasts and left feeling very satisfied.

Egg in a basket toast: 8/10

Tomato truffle toast: 9/10

Chicken pesto toast: 7.5/10

Condensed milk toast: 9/10

I liked all of the toasts to verying degrees because of my own taste preferences - I love truffle flavored stuff and sweets! 

The lattes were so cute and beautiful. The nutella hot coco was delicious and had latte art as well!

This place was not too pricey and it was a super cute place to brunch! The first time I went it was soo crowded but this time there was empty tables and no wait at all. I will definitely be back :)
author: Kaitlynn L.

description:
IG-worthy, cozy, fun cafe w/ warm, festive, cheery, celebrative, down-to-earth vibes. Simple interiors and furniture. Perfect hangout spot for special occasions! 

- Came here first-time to try the Birthday Latte. Definitely an IG worhty drink!  (Sprinkles + vibrant, pastel colors of latte art- such an aesthetic charm in person & in photography)

The aesthetics are great, but the coffee itself tastes okay. Tastes a bit artificial, sweet, and candy-like. Not too surprised though, this could be a perfect drink for the youngsters. 

- A variety of delicious pastries lined up! Great place to grab a late-afternoon snack w/ a friend. Very friendly & helpful staff, that introduces the menu to you patiently. 

- Overall ambiance is relaxed & causal. Nothing fancy or sophisticated. 

- Sound level is a bit high. Regarding space, I personally find the hallway  narrow, which makes the store space feel crowded. The seats were mostly taken, by students doing their homework or chatting. Would not be ideal for work, considering these reasons.
author: Jess W.

description:
I used to love posting up here on the weekends and sipping on picturesque lattes while grading my students' papers on those big, spacious tables... But alas, they've gotten super crowded and have a policy against laptops at the majority of tables on weekends. Makes sense from a business perspective, but bummer from a neighborhood teacher's perspective.

My favorite has been the rose latte. Tasty and less freaking out about floral choking hazards or flowers getting stuck in teeth than there is with the lavender latte. Chicken meatball toast is nice but a bit spendy. 

Wouldn't recommend the baked goods-- ones that should be moist have been dry and ones that should be flaky or crunchy have been doughy.
author: Anastasia Z.

description: I came here specifically for the birthday latte and indeed it did not disappoint. The latte art was instagram worthy of course. The latte was mildly sweet with a creamy texture. Staff was friendly.
author: Huy D.

description:
Welcome Home!  

That was the friendly greeting that I received and it felt so warm already when entering this cozy cafe! 

I adore the atmosphere and contemporary uniqueness to their menu pastries and latte art items. 

If it's not your birthday, still order the birthday latte because the design is made individually and one of a kind!  It brings a cup of joy when it is served up.  

Their lavender latte is a calming smell, but a counterproductive drink because it's caffeine with the aroma of relaxing, therapeutic vibes.  Interesting mix for a tester like I! 

They offer sunny side up egg pastries that is delightful to the eye and delicious to the taste buds!  Avocado toast is available as well.  

There's a sectioned off area for laptop use versus communal space for chit chat. 

Home is where the heart is!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
After last year's Unicorn hot chocolate craze I was so excited to to see somewhere that offered something similar looking: the birthday cake latte!  I think most people come for this but they have a creative selection of many other amazing lattes as well such as the lavender, cookie crisp, Nutella, and red velvet latte.

The birthday cake latte is pretty and looks like a work of art but unless you like extremely sweet I'd suggest getting something else. I'd highly recommend the rose latte which has rose flavor with edible rose petals.  It's really good and smells amazing.

Since the lattes are so instagramable Home has attracted quite a following and just a heads up this place can get really crowded.  Overcrowded, and it's hard to find someplace to sit especially when people bring their laptops taking up space for long periods of time.  This can hinder the experience if you have to get your latte to go because there is no place to sit.  My suggestion to Home is to close a couple of hours later and enforce their no laptop at table policy during their busier times.
author: Joan W.

description: Super artsy and cute! Their specialty drink menu is very diverse and they all sound yummy. We tried the birthday cake rainbow latte and lavender latte. Both were delish and not as sweet as I was expecting (which is a good thing). We also split the truffle in paradise toast with an egg. It was really good but we couldn't taste the truffle at all. I found them on insta and was happy I finally tried them out myself. I'd go back.
author: Emily P.

description: Came here for the first time and tried their lavender latte with oat milk. It is the best lavender latte I had yet. Definitely come again.
author: Jessica T.

description:
Been meaning to try this place for so long after all the hype I've seen on Instagram!! 

It's really out of the way near Golden Gate Park so you'd need a car (or Bart in and take an uber/lyft) but I think it's worth the trip. It's a super cute cafe with great drinks and vibes, seating can be a bit limited especially on weekends. 

Tried the Birthday Cake Latte which is what they're most famous for, and the condensed milk toast. The latte art was sooo pretty!! However the latte is pretty much like any other normal latte, but I did it for the Instagram :P My friend ordered the lavender latte. Really want to come back and try their other lattes. 

The condensed milk toast was really yummy, but it can be a bit hard to cut.
author: Valerie T.

description:
I made it my mission to always stop here when I'm in town. This has the best latte art I've ever seen with color. Service was super friendly and I still love the minimal decor.

RAINBOW LATTE
The art was absolutely beautiful, but the flavor was just too light. It was really sweet and the coffee flavor was lacking because the sweetness was a bit overwhelming. I really like the latte art so I might order this again, but mostly just for pictures and not for the purpose of drinking it.

CHAI TEA LATTE
The chai was a bit lacking this time around. It was too light and seemed too milky. I would've preferred a stronger black tea flavor. 

Overall, the drinks are not the best, but the latte art is on point. I'm sure I'll be back and next time, I'll order something else. I'm determined to find something I'll really like and I also want to try their food too.
author: Anh L.

description:
Home...I have my own narrative why this place is named that. We'll talk about that later. 

So many drinks. I had the matcha latte with soy milk, the vanilla coconut latte, and a plain black drip. I drank all of that by myself. 

Mmmm. Delicious caffeine. 

My daughters enjoyed their iced hot chocolate and iced coffee. Younger also had a cappuccino. She takes after my love for caffeine me thinks. 

My girls had the sweet toasts: condensed milk and butter and cinnamon sugar. 

I had the savory egg in basket toast with the perfect runny yolk that made the thick slab of toast more delicious and practical. 

$37 for all this. It was worth it. 

My narrative why this place is called home is because if I wasn't sick with the flu, I could have made all this myself...at home. 

Since I couldn't - they did. I appreciate that. 

There's no place like home - unless you're sick, then come here for a take away order (don't share cooties) and all will be right in the world. 

I'll be back for the birthday latte, chicken meatball toast, and the tomato toast with a fried egg add on. 

This is why you love me. I know.
author: Jennifer C P.

description:
I wouldn't say I'm a coffee expert but man this is some good coffee. Everything about this place screams aesthetic. YOUR INSTAGRAM WILL BE HAPPY. It's a little pricey but I would say it's worth to try at least once. 

If you are looking for a nice trendy coffee shop to have a chat with friends or get some work done, this is your place.  It's a little noisy but something about the ambiance just puts you at ease.
author: Graciela T.

description:
Came in for a pick-me-up to help start my day out with my niece. It's a Sunday morning around 11am. Line was to the door and tables were filled. Variety of groups there; students studying, friends chatting, women with their children(all taking their time). So we jumped once the first two seats came open. 

Service was very friendly. Told the woman at the counter that it was our first time and she offered some suggestions. Also, the girl who was serving the food was so accommodating. Anytime we needed something, she was there with a smile.

For my niece, i ordered the frozen hot chocolate. It's just chocolate milk with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. Good but nothing special. For myself, I ordered the birthday cake latte. It's very visually appealing. The woman taking my order explained that it wouldn't have a cake flavor, that it's just a vanilla latte with colored design...a bit misleading. But it was a really great drink! THE TOAST...OMG...AMAZING!!! I didn't think I'd enjoy it as much as I did! Thick sliced bread with a crunchy crust slathered with condensed milk. Yummmm. And you taste a bit of salt from the butter. Which is perfect. 

Definitely would love to come back to try other tea or coffee drinks and their other toasts.
author: Mary R.

description: I was getting sick when I tried this place in 2015 when it was new. I decided to stop by today and check out the menu. It is really cute with a concept. I decided to get the young coconut for $5 and a Japanese curry scone(which is not made fresh there) for $4ish. It was a nice treat and stop in the neighborhood. It can get you out of the house to do something cute and uplifting, so thanks. And when the cafe opened, I met the nice owner lady, but those days are over. They have staff and there were like 5-6 people around. So I guess the cafe business is a score.
author: Denise C.

description:
Drinks don't disappoint! 

What I've tried: 
*Lavender latte- not usually a lavender fan but seemed like a popular drink and this was actually really good 

*Rose latte- so unique, fragrant and flavors worked so well 

Overall thoughts: 
*The first time I came here it was so crowded with all seats filled and a line. I made a note to never come to this location again since I'm closer to the Home at Richmond location anyway. I ended up coming back because I liked their drinks so much  but knowing I had time to spare and was grabbing the drink to go

*Great service 

*Nice presentation 

*Unique and delicious drinks 

*Most latte drinks are pretty sweet but not too sweet to drink 

*Not necessarily the place to get your strong coffee fix since they are known for their flavored lattes but they do have your regular coffee drinks
author: Sarah W.

description:
I've tried a few lattes here including the birthday cake latte, the lavender jasmine green tea latte, and the cookie latte. Out of those 3, my favorite is the birthday cake latte. You can easily customize how sweet you want it to be and it actually has zero birthday cake flavor, just the amazing latte art. The lavender jasmine green tea latte is my least favorite because the bits of lavender don't actually taste very good when it gets into your mouth. 

The cafe is almost always packed on the weekend, so it might be difficult to find a seat. Try to come early or during odd times in the day!
author: Jacqueline H.

description:
Okay I definitely have mixed feelings about this place. 
The staff was supper friendly, the the toast itself was great.
Personally, my drink sucked, I basically wanted a hot chocolate with a pretty design, and I thought I had communicated that, but obviously not. But I don't blame the staff, it was supper busy.
The other issue is the crowd and crowd control, it was definitely a fire hazard with how many people were in there at one time, and there were fights over tables. It was crazy and took away from the peaceful environment the cafe was trying to go for.
author: Gabi K.

description:
I've seen countless pics of the birthday cake latte so I had to stop by.

I came here a few months back and thought it was just ok. The decor is super cute and made the drinks very insta-worthy. The pricing is a bit on the higher side, but the drinks are also pretty big, so I guess it evens out.

I ordered a regular latte and it was decent. My friend ordered a matcha latte and she said it was just ok, as well. Neither of us wanted to get the birthday cake latte or red velvet latte since they sounded extremely sweet.

Despite being a fairly large building, there was little to no seating available. Most people were taking up tables for 2-4 while on their laptops and the back of the shop was very odd and uninviting.

Overall: 3.5 stars - super cute for pics, but probably won't make the trip all the way out here again.
author: Shirley H.

description:
This is a lovely coffee shop with a cute space. It's located along Noreiga, so parking can get a little tough. But if you look around long enough something good should pop up. The interior is well-designed for friends to hang out, enjoy some toast and coffee, and do some work. It often seems there's always a few people with labtops doing work, so it def has a great work vibe.

The drink menu is pretty unique. There are interesting types of lattes. This time around I ordered a godzilla, which is sparking iced matcha. I don't like my drinks terribly sweet so the baristas were kind to accommodate and make it less sweet. It was overall very yummy and would def order it again. The baristas as well are fantastic - super friendly and helpful in ordering drinks. Such a fun spot and will def be coming back to do some work another day ;D
author: Jackie C.

description:
Impromptu stop after eating  a few blocks away. I was drawn in by the pretty birthday cake latte.

The girl who took my order was sweet and knowledgeable. She double checked to see if I had ever had the birthday cake latte before. I told her I hadn't, so she ran the ingredients by me to make sure I was okay with them. Little did she know, but she had me at condense milk! Hahaha 

To be honest, I wasn't looking to love the latte. I figured that it would taste like any other latte. My expectations weren't that high for taste, but more for appearance. 

I was knocked off my feet at first sip. Not to mention the fact that it took me quite some time to work up the courage to take a sip because I didn't want to ruin the pretty design! IT WAS SOOOOOO GOOOOOD!!! it probably tasted even better because it took me by surprise. 

I'm a tad bit sad because as good as it is... its quite a distance for me to travel for coffee. Nonetheless, when I'm ever in the area, I will definitely grab a cup of joe from here.

I LOVE IT A LATTE!!!
author: Lily T.

description:
"Have you been here before? No? Welcome Home." was the perfect greeting for this place! 

The cute, colorful, IG-gold lattes might draw you here, but the quality coffee beans and super friendly baristas won me over to become a loyal "Homie." 

The birthday cake latte was as yummy as it is beautiful with a rich, creamy flavor that's light on the coffee. The Hangover was the exact opposite with a punch you in the face dose of carbonated potent espresso. It reminded us of those diet cleanses or Emergen-C which bubble up when you mix with water. In other words this drink is exactly the remedy you need after a night out. 

Love that they have tons of community tables to encourage chatting with new people and no laptop zones! The place does get pretty crowded in waves and it's a small store but it moves quickly. The tables to the left do get hit pretty hard by sunlight glare but hey, great golden lighting for your pictures.
author: Jennifer D.

description:
What a nice place to call 'home.' This little cafe is located in the Outer Sunset. It is an inviting environment. There are a few tables that allow laptops and others which are 'no laptops' to encourage patrons to sit and chat. They have a cool selection of toasts and cafe lattes which are super colorful. I got the salted caramel hot chocolate and the chicken meatball pesto toast.

The toast was soooo yummy!! It was a great size and it came nicely presented. I loved the taste of the meatball and the pesto. It paired with each other very nicely. The salted caramel was yummy too (not too sweet). I do want to try their other latte concoctions though because those seemed more interesting! (I just didn't want caffeine that day).

Overall, this place is fun to meet a friend or to have a light meal with some goood coffee/tea drinks.
author: Natalie M.

description: I went here for their special lattes. I ordered a Nutella latte. The pretty cashier told me it was one of their sweeter lattes, but I didn't find it super sweet (I also have a super duper sweet tooth, so my standards are atypical) but the coffee was flavorful and not bitter so I enjoyed it. My friend ordered the "Hangover" - an iced sparkling americano. He loved it. We split a raspberry almond croissant that was absolutely divine. The prices are a bit much but typical for San Francisco (lattes are from $5 to $5.75), , and they have different fun lattes to try (coconut vanilla latte, sea salt caramel latte, hazelnut latte, red velvet latte, lavender latte, chocolate mint latte, Nutella latte, Cookie Monster latte, birthday cake matte). If you can stomach the prices, this place is a good place to check out!
author: Christine S.

description:
Officially one of my go-to coffee shops!

I came here to get some work done since I was around the area. Parking was not bad at all- it's metered parking though. 

Immediately noticed the interior and how welcoming it was. Really bright and awesome decor! I immediately grabbed a seat next to an outlet before ordering because it was packed! 

Lined up and got the infamous birthday cake latte and eggs in a basket. Sat right back down and started work on my laptop. Food came out pretty quickly and I was hooked on the latte. I'm not a fan of birthday cake flavored anything so I was skeptical about ordering this one. To my surprise, it's a simple vanilla latte. I'm really glad I ordered it. The eggs in a basket was alright. 

Overall, glad I stopped by. I'm excited to try other drinks off the menu!
author: Elaine C.

description:
If home is where the heart is then this is the place for you! ( I love coffee!)

What a fun way to ring in New Year's day then with an awesome brunch?!

My friend recommended this place after seeing their Instagram. I was in the city for the Holiday and my friends and I came over today for brunch. We arrived a little before 11 and the place was a bit busy but we were able to find a place to sit. 

I wanted to try their signature birthday latte. The vibrant colors is what drew me to this place. 

When it was my turn to order I was greeted bya nice barista. He took my order and asked for my name, this is how your order is called out.

Soon after our drinks were ready. I headed to the bar and picked up our drinks. My friends was a swan and mine was a floral pattern. They looked awesome!

We quickly sat and took our pics for the gram. We  did have to wait a bit longer for our breakfast toast.

The baristas are nice and the food is delish!
author: Evangelina B.

description:
As I sit here on Christmas eve, enjoying a cup of subtly sweet lavender jasmine tea latte (10/10) and immersing in the calm, ambient noises, I felt inspired to write a holiday ode to this cute little cafe.

'Twas the night before Christmas, when all through Home,
Not a latte was stirring, not even the foam;
My jacket was hung on the back of my chair with care,
In hopes that my condensed milk toast soon would be there.

I'm an absolute fan of this whimsical coffeeshop full of string lights, chromatic coffee art, and delicious variations of toasts. The space is mindfully set up to split between no-tech conversation tables and productive work tables. Sadly no heating, so I'm typing this review as a human popsicle from my perch, but I'll be back again once warmer seasons roll around!
author: Jenni H.

description: YAY! Having a colorful coffee to #doitforthegram was a totally necessary stop for me in SF.  The woman working there warned that the bday latte was sweet, which it was but only compared to a "normal" latte, but I didn't find it to be annoyingly sweet.  I also got the truffle in paradise toast which was tomato, truffle oil, pesto and mozzarella. It couldn't have been that bad because I ate the whole thing :-)
author: Dana Z.

description:
Love their lattes! I've tried their rose latte and lavender latte thus far, and am totally hooked! Both lattes are subtly sweet, though strong in coffee flavor. Both the rose and lavender give the perfect kick without overpowering the delicious lattes. And of course, the lattes are 100% Instagram-worthy. I haven't tried their toast as I've heard they are $7-$8 each, but I'll need to sometime as I hear they're fabulous!

Parking may be scarce in the area. You'll want to come early to snag a table that has an outlet if your sole purpose is to get work done here. It gets pretty crowded, but not so loud that you can't drown out the noise with your headphones in. Staff are friendly when taking your order and are so skilled with their latte art! Free WiFi and cute decor make this a great place to work!
author: Kristi T.

description: I love love their birthday latte. I'm not a big fan of latte in general but their bday latte is so good, it's not bitter and it's pretty. They use condensed milk to make it sweet. Their cinnamon toast is bomb too, sugary and cinnamonyyy! Like Christmas in a toast haha
author: Debbie D.

description:
Super cute coffee place. 
I love the vibe. 
Coffee was PERFECTION !! 
I WAS unsure about there food options - thinking "Ok this is way too much for that" BUT when you see it you kind of start thinking "Ok it looks super worth it for the price"

will be back ;)
author: Silvia R.

description:
Looking for a place to study? Welcome home! This cafe is super cute and offers a large selection of interesting flavored drinks (besides their insta worthy birthday cake latté)! 

The ambience is casual and is perfect for a date but also perfect for studying. Bring some headphones if you're particular about your music.

Even though I overstayed my welcomed (stayed past closing - oops) they were very nice about kicking us out. 

They're still not done furnishing the entire place as the backroom acted as extra seating and storage. I  would LOVE to go back again and try all their other latte's and see how the back looks once I'm in SF again.
author: Julia Y.

description:
Birthday cake latte for me because my birthday is coming up. My hubby got the s'mores latte. We also got the mochi muffin, Thai tea custard muffin and honey toast. Overall, we like the lattes and pastries. 

The register was really nice, except for the barista that rolled her eyes and gave us an attitude, when we followed up on our order. Girl, you don't roll your eyes on us like that, because of that I don't think we will come back here. Maybe we will try the other location.
author: Khristine H.

description:
What a trek from the East Bay, but oh so worth it!

Went here today with some friends to work on some projects. Immediately when you walk in, you are "welcomed home," with some kind smiles and a really friendly environment. Now this place gets busy so may not want to assume that you'll get a table. They do a good job of making sure they have a mix of tables for people who are working on laptops and those who are just looking to hangout by indicating certain tables do not allow laptop users.

My first drink was the rose latte which was absolutely delicious. With a slightly sweet taste and a rose forward flavor, it definitely woke me up. The tomato truffle toast is a must try and of course with a fried egg on top. The prices are just around where you expect it to be at a place like this.

I do wish there was more seating and a quieter ambience, but it is what it is - a Home for people searching for a very instagramable coffee shop, and yelpable items!

See you soon.
author: Tar R.

description:
I've been meaning to try this place for a while and finally got a chance to! It's a bit out of the way for me but definitely worth the trip. The cafe's a great place to either sit and chat with friends or study. There's a decent amount of tables and seats but limited amount of plugs. Some of the tables have "no laptop" signs, so there's an even amount of people who are hanging out with friends and people who are studying. 

I didn't have too many interactions with the staff, but when I did, they were generally pretty pleasant. 

I tried the famous Birthday Latte and condensed milk bread. The latte was beautiful! I didn't think it tasted any different from the lattes I've tried but it was definitely aesthetically pleasing. I saw that they had lavender and red velvet lattes, so I'll definitely try those next time. 

The condensed milk bread was delicious! It wasn't too sweet and it had a nice toasty texture. I thought it went well with the latte I ordered.
author: Elizabeth L.

description: Ok ok I know, but it was my birthday so I just had to go get a birthday cake latte, and I loved it, for of course the pic worthiness of it, the happy colors, I have to say I was a little fearful it would be really sweet and taste more like candy, but no it's good coffee! I really liked the vibe, it was very relaxed, the barista's were very nice, it seemed like a neighborhood place even with the insta factor of their latte art. I'll go back when I'm in San Fran again for sure!
author: Karen R.

description:
The lattes here are really cute. I ordered the birthday cake latte, and it came with sprinkles and rainbow latte art - perfect for Instagram or just for the #aesthetics. Although I wasn't expecting much, I was pleasantly surprised by the frothy, light taste of the latte.

Aside from the cute drinks, the decor is also very well thought out, and it's perfect for photos or just a casual day studying. Although the drinks are, in my opinion, way overpriced, and there isn't enough seating, I would still recommend visiting this cafe at least once - if not for the novelty, then for the taste of the drinks themselves.
author: Ella C.

description:
Great place, very fine briochtoasts, good coffeevariations. Very Crazy variations
I had an Espresso with vanillaice and mixed up with coke.
author: Christopher F.

description: My local spot. Lovely for toast and lavender latte with a friend or a meet up to chit chat with friends!
author: Phee F.

description:
I wanted to write a review to say that the staff are all very nice. I came by on a Saturday morning and everyone was very friendly and welcoming.

I ordered a lavender latte, which I enjoyed initially at the long table facing the window. Later, it got so crowded with the line getting longer behind me and I moved to a table farther in the back, which had some plugs. Overall, I had a lovely experience, and I will be back!
author: Stephanie C.

description: I could imagine how much San Franciscans love Home because it is always alwayssss packed! Not a best home to study but an aesthetic home you will definitely consider to come back!
author: Shuyi L.

description: I've had this place bookmarked for quite some time, so I was so excited when I came here the other day. A cute coffee shop in the city that actually serves good coffee (what a concept... other coffee shops please take note). First off, there was actually parking in front of the shop (thank goodness). Second, there was a decent amount of seating inside considering the size of the shop. The menu was expansive in terms of drinks, but not too overwhelming to the point where you didn't know what to order when it you approach the front of the line. Ordered the lavender latte and an avocado toast with Italian sausage and an egg. The latte and food were served fairly quickly. The tricky part of this place was finding a seat during peak hours of the weekend. Other than that, this place was great. I loved how our table had a "no laptop" sign indicating that this shop wanted people to engage with each other rather then their personal devices. I would recommend coming here if you are ever in the area. You won't be disappointed!
author: Franchesca B.

description:
I stopped by here to grab some coffee to go before heading to Petaluma on wednesday morning. i just had breakfast with my friend but decided to grab coffee here before heading out of the city. After seeing all the pretty lattes on instagram of COURSE I had to order one to go!

I'm so glad they make the colorful latte art in to go cups because there are coffee shops that say they cant do it since the cup is too small. So props to this spot for being able to put it in smaller cup. 

$5 for a birthday cake latte to go. Very delicious. Not too sweet and not too overwhelming. It was just right. Just wish they had one a bit closer to where I stay when im in the Bay. Definitely would come back and highly recommend this spot if you're in the area for coffee or even just a place to catch up with an old friend.

Yelp Review 2018 Challenge 38/100
author: Linda L.

description:
I've lost count how many times I come here and definitely more than the 7 check-ins I've done on Yelp. I usually get the lavender latte and maybe some pastry/toast. Always great. 

The one thing I did get and it was an ehh...was the rose latte. I had better Rose one but their lavender is the best I've ever had so far
author: Linda C.

description:
I love this place! They serve the most instagrammable lattes and a wide assortment of brioche toasts. I love the chicken sausage + pesto one and my bf loves the tomato + pesto one with truffle oil.

The cookie monster latte is my fav because it's not too sweet and is topped with a few cookie crisps. My bf likes the birthday cake latte.

It does get crowded, but I've never had to wait more than a few minutes for a table on a weekend.

Note: You need to bus yourself, but most people don't know that and will leave their dirty dishes on the table when they leave.
author: Grace C.

description: My girlfriend and I love how photogenic this place is, not to mention the coffee and brunch is phenomenally tasty!
author: Moises L.

description:
This place is totally worth the drive from the East Bay! 

My friend and I visited in on a Tuesday afternoon around 12:30pm and the tables were packed! Home definitely has a calm, home-y feeling inside and the baristas make you feel at home as well, they're all very friendly and the guy who took our order was extremely nice and made conversation with just about every customer he came across. Great customer service :)

The main reason for our visit was for MatchaSF's Matcha Brûlée Bae toast, but I'm so glad I came in and discovered Home itself! The Matcha Brûlée toast was to DIE for. I wanted to order ten more and take them home with me - the consistency of the toast was perfect because it was fluffy but just the perfect amount of crispness on the outside, the Matcha was sweetened just enough, and they topped it off with a creamy vanilla ice cream in the middle. AMAZING. The Matcha latte was great as well! Not overpowering, perfect amount of Matcha, and creamy, with a cute leaf design on top :)

My friend ordered an iced rose latte and I had a taste of it as well - SO GOOD. Not too rose-y and sweetened just right. 

I was thinking Home should have a location near Walnut Creek since that's where I am, HOWEVER, I think making the drive over to the city s totally worth it. It's in a cute little area where you can walk around afterwards as well and the beach is just a short drive away!

Definitely recommend to come here: expect great customer service, a comfortable "home" environment, and amazing coffee and treats. I'm coming back for the Birthday Cake latte!!! *heart eyes*
author: Cassandra K.

description:
My sister was in town, and I wanted to treat her to something special. I previously came across Home's latte art on the interwebs. When I showed them to my sister she was down for the trip! I had a few expectations in terms of the artwork... and I'm happy to say they were solidly met (and exceeded).

AMBIANCE reminds me a little bit of the coffee shops in Nashville... a small, intimate space tucked away in the city. A number of students were studying, so it's a quiet atmosphere for multiple needs. Plenty of table space for working and/or enjoying why I was there- sippin' some good latte.

ORDERED matcha, birthday cake and lavender lattes, and condensed milk toast.

DRINKS + FOOD was 5 stars. The lattes were a great size, and the art was incredible! I asked for a Totoro matcha latte, and the barista whipped it up in no time (did I mention it was also her first time making it?). The kitchen was closed or we would have ordered more food! They were kind enough to make a condensed milk toast, which was fantastic. To top it off, one of the baristas changed up the traditional birthday latte art and made us a unicorn! Best. Latte. Trip. Ever.

RATING would be a six if I could. When you pair kind and personable staff and service with amazing food and drinks, it really does feel like "home".
author: Nicholas G.

description:
Easily my new favorite coffee shop in the area! The shop itself wasn't too big and all the tables were lined against a very aesthetic wall. We had to wait awhile for a table to clear up. There was a good mix of people socializing and studying. 

[Birthday Cake Latte] The barista told us that this drink is the rainbow-colored one. I love how the barista's decide what design to create in the latte. The element of surprise made the experience that much more exciting! My cup came with a rainbow-colored leaf design that was topped with a lot of sprinkles.

[Red Velvet Latte] This latte came in the form of an adorable bear! The red color of the drink made the design pop. I didn't really enjoy the flavor of the drink but its cuteness made up for it.
author: Annie Z.

description:
Birthday Cake Latte 5/5; Tastes pretty amazing and the rainbow latte art is definitely very snap and instagram worthy. Sweetness level is just right for someone who likes their coffee barely sweet. Highly recommend. Probably the pretties cup of coffee I have ever had.

Nutella Coffee 4/5; If you are into hazelnut, you are going to love this one. You definitely taste the hazelnut and it is very rich. Sweetness level is perfect again. Not too big of a hazelnut fan, but I still really liked this one.

These people really know how to make good coffee. If you don't come here for the coffee, at least come for the impressive latte art, c'mon. I will definitely be back soon.
author: Jennie T.

description:
What to get: lattes and toast
Service: 4/5
Atmosphere: cafe, meet for coffee + chat
Wait: 10 mins (Wednesday 10AM for 1)
Parking: street

The Experience: [December 2016]
Yes, I have been raving about this place since I visited a year ago and I'm finally reviewing it. It's rare for me to be in the City on a solo food adventure, so I get to have whatever my heart desires and I chose Home.

This place gets busy! Even on a weekday (mind you, it was during the holiday break, so more students were off at that time). I knew I was just going to get something quick and leave, but for the few moments I wanted to sit down, there was rarely a spot for a single person! That should tell you how busy it gets out there.

Home is famous for its latte art. One of the most Instagrammed coffee shops, every one of their lattes is a piece of art. The lavender latte was light and not too overpowering or sweet. I'll try some of their more colorful lattes next time, but the lavender one is a solid first choice.

Another claim to fame here is their toasts. It's a tasty snack, but not meant to be very filling. I had the tomato, pesto, and cheese toast and added an egg for protein (and a better picture). It takes a bit for the toast to come out, but it's a nice addition to the latte. Not a must, but good to try.

Not that they need more publicity, but I hope people who are in the City get to check out Home. It's one of my favorite places in the City now and I have special foodie memories here. Until next time!
author: Ellyse L.

description: Yummy ... the birthday cake latte !!! My husband had a Nutella coco with a big piece of toast. Love the space... love love love
author: Jenny P.

description:
Love this place as it has great creative and tasty drinks. Bonus points that they can make anything with low sugar and decaf! I only wish they had heavy cream instead of half and half for those on a keto diet. Their pastry selection and toast was amazing. I can here to have a Mochi muffin and it's def with the carbs and sugar. It's chewy and light and not too sweet. It's like eating dessert for breakfast! 
As for their drinks, their rainbow latte is famous but my personal favorite is the chocolate mint. It's much lighter and refreshing. I also tried the one with speculoos cookie butter and since I asked for it lightly sweetened I couldn't really taste the cookie butter but that's my fault. 
Seating is tough but most people don't mind table sharing which is nice and they have a few tables that are non work spaces so people can sit and just enjoy a cup of coffee. Come early and don't bring a large group as this place is tiny!
author: Jen C.

description:
I LOVE this place.

I saw a beautifully rainbow decorated latte on instagram, asked where I could get my hands on one, and that's how I heard about the Birthday Cake Late. I decided to wait and get one on my actual birthday to make it a little more special :)

I was not disappointed! It not only looks beautiful (got great photos too) but it tastes great! Not sure what the extra flavoring they add in but it's good.

I wish I could've tried one of the toasts bit we got there too late, right at 4:30 pm where they close the kitchen :/ next time! I'll have to come back to try one and another flavors late.
author: Monica G.

description:
Home is such a cute small hipster cafe! The interior is so tiny, bright, and modern. When my friend and I first walked in, we were greeted with a warm welcome. The first thing we noticed was how crowded it was inside on a Sunday afternoon. There were no tables when we first walked in so we had to wait a few minutes for someone to leave. 

We stared at the expansive menu on the wall. The cashier recommended the birthday cake latte which was one of the more popular drinks. My friend ordered an iced tea, which was lightly sweetened and refreshing.

*Birthday cake latte -- So aesthetically pleasing and colorful! The latte art is rainbow colored and is decorated with sprinkles. However, it doesn't exactly tastes like a cake. It has more vanilla hazelnut notes inside the latte. 

* Condensed milk toast -- The thick slice of bread has a layer of condensed milk. It was a little bit too sweet, and the crust was a little burnt. I had to cut around the bread and eat the nonburnt parts. This toast would pair well with a latte. 

The drinks are well made and the environments is super chill. Home is great place to sip some coffee and catch up with friends. I will be back next time with my laptop to get work done while drinking lattes!
author: Michelle F.

description: I went here for a Bumble Bizz meet up! It was a great place, because the food was awesome and they had a very interesting things on the menu with a variety of lattes, teas, and etc. The atmosphere was awesome and a perfect place to meet someone, especially to talk about business. But the other person and I got to know each other and I got to talk about photography and helped get me connections!
author: Jai-la H.

description: I love the location on Clement! They have amazing roasts! But this one was disappointing. I got the chicken meatball pesto toast and the chicken meatballs were gross. Pre-made store-bought meatballs sliced up and put on toast. Coffee was still pretty and good. Will be going to Clement location from now on.
author: Laura K.

description: My lavender latte was definitely not worth the price.   I ordered the ice lavender latte but didn't taste much like latte and there was no lavender flavor at all.  Maybe the ice didn't not bring the flavors out but was disappointed after my first sip.   It was just sweet as if drinking ice sugar water.   The quality of goods does not match the price, however, the service was pretty good and friendly despite how busy the place is.
author: Tiffany Q.

description: My curiosity was peaked after seeing pictures posted of colorful drinks so I had to check it out. For those who are curious the drink with sprinkles and color is birthday cake. It was pretty delicious but a bit pricey. This place can get pretty packed so be mindful that you might have to get your drinks to go. They also had some interesting toasts on their menu which I didn't try but perhaps next time. If you are planning on hanging out here for a while there is all day street parking available just around the block.
author: Shristi R.

description: There is no place like Home! Their lattes are fun and most importantly tasty. I love their Instagram worthy latte art, especially the Cookie Monster and Birthday Cake latte. Their condensed milk toast is so yummy, it reminds me of brick toast you'd get at taiwanese dessert places. It does get busy with students so tables may all be taken, but the servers will try their best to find you a spot even though it means you may have to share a table with a stranger.
author: Donna M.

description: The Birthday Cake Latte is all looks and no substance. It wasn't worth the hassle of being in that cramped and crowded space. The table my friend and I sat at prohibited laptops presumably to keep the flow of customers moving. You would have to get there very early to claim a workstation spot. I saw that many opted to get their orders to go, but I feel like the food and drinks here are better suited for dining in. The only other thing I remember vividly were the rude glances I got from the two people sitting across from us while I was taking photos of the latte art and that just left a bitter impression.
author: Lauren H.

description:
I found out about Home after friends posted pictures of their magical lattes on Instagram (of course). After visiting this cozy coffee shop in the Inner Sunset, my experience was nothing short of delightful!

First of all, they have such a creative drink selection. From the rainbow-swirled Birthday Cake Latte to the Cookie Monster Latte topped with actual cookies, their whimsical coffee menu makes it hard to decide what to order. The insanely photogenic Birthday Cake Latte proved too hard to pass up. What a fun drink! I'm usually not a huge fan of sweet coffee drinks, but this one was sweet without being overly saccharine. It's pretty, tasty, AND topped with sprinkles -- what's not to love?! My friend ordered a regular latte and it was also delicious (as well as pretty). You can tell that the baristas put a lot of care and attention into crafting their lattes.

But what makes Home better than the typical trendy SF coffee shop is the genuine friendliness of the people who work there. I was asked how my day was going, the barista wanted to know if I liked my drink, and everyone who worked there was just so...nice. I'll take sincerity over apathy any day! With such beautiful lattes, I would have expected a bit more pretension. What a refreshing SF coffee experience! I'll definitely be back.
author: Elyse W.

description: Super cute place with super cute drinks. Everyone comes here for the latte art and it didn't disappoint. The drinks are quite sugary so be aware of that!
author: Erica C.

description:
Absolutely adored this coffee shop! 

The aesthetic inside is on point, with a minimalistic vibe that's rather inviting. The workers behind the counter also greeted us with a smile and made conversation although they didn't have to, which was nice. There are plenty of tables inside so seating wasn't an issue either. They have signs that say please no laptops, but this isn't enforced because there were at least 4 laptops out when I went, so I'd say it isn't a bad place to study. It did feel a little stuffy inside, though.

I had to try the birthday cake latte for the instagram (@reddyseteat) and I have to say, it didn't disappoint one bit! It tasted even better than it looked--the coffee was super rich and smooth, very enjoyable! And best of all, it wasn't cloyingly sweet as I'd expected it to be from the name and all the colors. This latte is definitely one of my new favorites! 

Overall, I really enjoyed my cup of coffee and the ambiance was on point, so I'd love to go back and I'd definitely recommend checking it out!
author: Nikki R.

description: I'm not a coffee addict but the aesthetic of the shop and the absolute cuteness of the drinks was enough for me to pay five dollars. Super friendly staff and amazing drink! The environment is so ambient. As someone from San Francisco, I can say this is one of my favorite places to get a latte and do some studying!
author: Jennalynn F.

description:
Wow gorgeous lattes and extremely friendly service. My "birthday latte" not only tasted deliciously but it was one of the prettiest coffee drinks I have ever seen. Our barista  has some artistic skills.

There are 2 locations and note this location does not have avocado toast, only the location on clement does.

There are several tables that are laptop free zones and most of the tables are packed so you will likely be sharing a table with a neighbor if you are coming during a
midday workday. Most other patrons are very nice though.

Prices were also very fair. 

If I didn't live across town I would be a frequent patron for sure! 

Keep up the  excellent artwork! Beautiful!
author: Betty C.

description: Found via Instagram and wow it did not disappoint! Stop by when in town, the food was fabulous, coffee delish atmosphere relaxing and staff pleasant, will return on my next trip to San Francisco.
author: Mary W.

description:
Aesthetically pleasing to the eye yet like it's name, HOME gives a very comforting, and homely experience. My friends and I had decided to come here on a whim, as they had heard much about the infamous Birthday Cake Lattes that Home was known for crafting.

Walking in, Home was very aesthetically pleasing to the eye. To the right, adorned with hanging lights on the side, and the lit up name HOME, the atmosphere was very warm and inviting, yet very chic. To the left side of the wall, a wooden display held various bags of coffee from different locations, along with various types of succulents. The atmosphere of Home is calm and welcoming, with a very chill hipster vibe to it. Perfect for studying and getting work done, as it reminds me of a very modern but chill coffee house.

They also have WiFi (Just ask!), but also have tables where they have table markers that state some tables are 'Laptop free', where they ask that if you're sitting at a table with that particular table card, to respect the laptop free card and to talk to the person across from you instead. I know a lot of people personally don't care for these table markers, but I think it's actually kind of a sweet reminder to talk to the person you're with and not be so focused on your laptop. They also have tables facing the outside where it's laptop okay. HOME actually is a great place to study/get work done as well because of how calm/chill the atmosphere is.

The staff were extremely welcoming and kind as well helping my friends and I choose what to order despite coming slightly during their rush hour. They were also certainly accommodating when my friend asked if they can do different types of latte art on their drinks. While I certainly think and understand that the baristas are capable of latte art, I also think it depends on the skill of each latte barista, so please don't be too demanding on them although they can certainly try for your requests.

I had ordered the infamous Birthday Cake Latte, and it certainly did not disappoint me aesthetically as well as the taste. Featuring the infamous rainbow latte art embellished with tiny rainbow sprinkles on the side, I was more than pleased with my drink, and I appreciated how although the drink looks like it would be overly sweet because of the Birthday Cake Latte name, it wasn't an explosion of sugar in my mouth, as I could still taste the notes of the smooth, enriched coffee swirled throughout my drink. Though I am certainly by no means any type of coffee snob, I was more than pleased with how my drink turned out to be.

My friend had also ordered a Birthday Cake Latte, which was equally as well received, and my other friend ordered a Mocha. As a proclaimed coffee snob, my friend had said that although it probably wasn't the best mocha she's had in her life (to be fair, she's had a lot of coffee to drink before though), she found her Mocha to be pleasantly smooth and she enjoyed it a lot as well.

My only downside and possible con that I could really think of when looking back at Home would be the wait time, but that also could be factored into the fact that I had come during the possible afternoon rush time. Finding an open available seat proved to be a challenge but I was able to find a place to sit with my friends after an allotted 10-15 minutes of standing and patiently waiting for people who had finished their drinks to leave.

Overall I would definitely give Home two thumbs up for sure, and I would not hesitate to recommend for others to come and give it a try! I'd most definitely recommend giving the Birthday Cake Latte a try!
author: Allison O.

description: Now I can say this: The best latte I ever had was at a place called Home. You only get that experience once, in a world like SF full of coffee shops there's gotta be something, anything unique, that makes a place stand out like this one has to me. It was that Lavendar Latte, with j added a floating marshmallow and brown sugar to. I'm super impressed with the smooth coffee and light lavender notes in the background. Wow, and every once in a while you get that little jab of lavender aroma when you bite into the bits of lavender they sprinkle on top of this aromatic Latte. Kudos to this place for making me stick around for hours on my laptop, sipping two or three of these  in one sitting. So happy with my experience, will be back!
author: Mona L.

description:
More like a 3.5.
Home is a cozy little cafe with IG-worthy lattes and toasts. I bought my friend from LA here because it seemed like a cute brunch place. In actuality, it's a place where students and other people who need wifi occupy. Which is fine, because I've been one of them before. Unfortunately, I was hoping to have a cute brunch with  my friend. We did struggle to find a table as there isn't that many here and most only seat two, which was good for us. The toasts were really pricey. I got the chicken meatball one? Yeah, it's cute but I swear, I'm only ever going to get this ~$7 toast once. I see this more as a coffee place and mostly for pick up. It's pretty packed with students. However, if you are a student, this might be the kind of place you're looking for. Definitely come here early.
author: Michelle R.

description:
There's definitely no place like Home. I'd been seeing beautiful pictures of this place all over Instagram for years, from rainbow lattes to avocado toast to string lights, and I couldn't wait to finally, finally go. The interior is so beautiful! It ticked everything off my basic b list: string lights, minimalistic decor, inspirational quotes, and succulents. It was super crowded and we luckily were able to grab a table while someone else was leaving! 

What I Ordered:

-Birthday Cake Latte (4/5): This was probably the most beautiful latte I'd ever seen in my entire life. God, I nearly teared up imagining this in my Instagram feed. It features rainbow latte art and funfetti; it tasted pretty similar to a red velvet latte, which also doesn't really taste like cake to me. 

-Special of the Day Toast (5/5): This had butter, corn, and bacon on brioche bread, and we added an egg on top. This was amazing! I've had toast from many cafes before, and this was honestly the best cafe toast I've ever had. The bread was perfectly toasted and amazingly buttery. I love that you can add an egg to any toast! I'm such a sucker for runny yolk.

All in all, I really hope I can come back here--I really loved this place! It's definitely out of the way and I'm not in the area much, but it just might be worth the trek.
author: Stephanie N.

description:
ICED ROSE LATTE was aesthetically pleasing and delicious! 

After hearing all the great yelp reviews and people raving about this place, I decided to come on Monday for a noon study sesh. 

I was definitely not disappointed. I asked about the most popular drinks they have and decided to get the iced rose latte, as well as their Eggs in a Basket for lunch. 

The iced rose latte was very pretty--put in an open mason jar with some rose petals to garnish. It was actually really delicious as well--creamy and sweet due to the condensed milk. The rose flavor was light and not overpowering. For about $5, it was pretty reasonable for a good drink as well as nice presentation. 

The Eggs in a Basket was also really yummy. The toast was fluffy, buttery, and crispy. The slightly gooey egg in the center was also great because it soaked into the bread. While it was yummy and I might get it again for the taste, it was a little pricey at $6.75. 

They have free wifi here, but even on a Monday it got a bit crowded, though people studying often don't mind sharing the other half of the table. The window seats can get a little stuffy and sunny, especially around noontime when I was here. 

tl;dr: great place to get specialty coffee drinks, yummy toast but kind of pricey, and is a decent place to study but gets packed.
author: Clarissa C.

description:
Tried out this cute, trendy (highly instagrammable) cafe on a Saturday morning. The small space was full, but we were able to find a table pretty easily. The vibe was cozy and cute, a fun place to take your girl friends. 

Besides the cafe basics (espresso, macchiato, etc) they have a huge list of "creative" coffees to choose from. We got the birthday cake latte and red velvet latte. I also got the special of the day, Rose latte with a bacon/corn cheese toast. The toast was just alright and had a burned flavor. I wasn't a huge fan of the toast, but maybe I just got unlucky with it being overcooked. The creative coffees were the highlight for me and tasted just as good as they looked. I was expecting it to be way too sweet, but it was surprisingly well-balanced and smooth. The flavors also came through, and I really enjoyed the Rose Latte the best. 

I'll definitely be coming back here for the drinks and to try some more flavors. Will probably skip the toast next time.
author: Sara S.

description:
My boyfriend and I were up early on a Saturday morning for an InstaMeet at Mt. Davidson and afterward I asked him what he wanted to eat because hello- I'm hungry. He offered me two suggestions. Either go to Home on Noriega St. which was close by OR go to a coffee house somewhere in the Mission. I'm a total sucker for pretty aesthetics so I chose Home. When we got here around 130pm the place was crowded and all the tables were taken so I was a bit iffy on whether or not we were gonna be able to sit and chill or if we would have to take everything back to the car and chill.... well, safe to say we were able to sit down after ordering because some nice people left after finishing their work. 

Parking on Noriega was tough on a Saturday afternoon. It was like everyone and their grandmas were out and about enjoying the nice sunshine so my boyfriend and I ended up circling a few times and on our last attempt at finding closer parking we saw a car pull out just outside of the cafe so score! Parking is metered Mon - Sat till 6pm so keep your eyes opened. 

Their menu for this place isn't super extensive like I thought, mainly their food items. Their drink list is extensive and my boyfriend and I opted for their hazelnut latte, birthday cake latte, and the sweet condense toast I think that's what it is called. Food wise / drink wise - neither item took long to appear before we were able to sit down, take a few photos, post said photos, and then dig in while talking about what we had planned for the rest of the day.

I don't recall prices. My boyfriend paid so... hehe. But we both enjoyed our drinks and I was worried that the birthday cake latte was going to be too sweet because of its name, but it's honestly just like a normal latte with added colors and sprinkles so it's a safe drink to drink without worrying about tooth aches. 

Service is also friendly and they call out your name when your items are ready for pick up at the bar, except for the toast. A worker actually came through calling out my boyfriend's name and delivering the toast to our table which was neat. After all, how any Mark's can there be in the city right? 

Overall, down to come again.
author: Venus L.

description:
I finally got to try the most instagrammed coffee shop in SF (Idk if it's actually true but it seems like it). Boy, is this place the definition of hipster haha but it's adorable and has a ton of seating so I'll give it a pass. 

Now this place has a ton of specialty coffee drinks available but the one everyone takes pictures of is the birthday cake latte. I hate to say it but my old soul can't take that much sweetness so I had to pass on that for an iced coconut vanilla latte. The coconut flavor definitely stood out and made the drink sweeter. It was a great variation of my go-to vanilla latte order so I'd probably get this again. 

My friend and I order the eggs in a basket toast and YAS that was so good. It's basically an egg in a piece of toast that's topped with cheese and bacon. Um hello yes. I probably enjoyed it more than the latte lol. However that piece of toast was $7 sooo this place is not cheap. My friend and I ordered two lattes and that one toast and we spent about $20. Das esspensive. 

They have free wifi and a ton of tables so it'd be a great place to study. They also have a few tables with a sign on it that doesn't allow laptops, save these tables for conversation! Or taking pretty pictures, whatever floats your boat. 

It's a great coffee shop in the sunset with hipster pricing so be prepared to pay more than usual. If that doesn't bother you, go for the great ambiance and enjoy your $5 latte.
author: Stefanie S.

description:
Of course seeing the toasts and lattes on instagram I had to bookmark this place.  I am a sucker for those kinds of pictures. This review is only for the toast, I did not feel like having one of their specialty lattes.  

First off, the shop is super cute.  Very hipster and the decoration inside are really cute.  You do feel like at "home".  I felt like I walked into an anthropology shop.  

I decided I needed to try the toast, I ordered the tomato pesto truffle toast and of course had to upgrade to the fried egg.  In total it came out to $9, which is a bit pricey for toast in my opinion.  The toast was beautiful when I received it and the blow torch effect is very nice.  All in all not worth $9, I can definitely make this toast at home but it's always better when someone else makes it for you right?  I did love the brioche toast, not sure where the bread comes from.  

Great atmosphere, but it is just overpriced toast in my opinion.
author: Lauren S.

description:
Definently a creative place! 

I had to get the rainbow latte (birthday cake latte) here obviously, and while it was pretty, it wasn't any different than any other latte I've had. Another interesting drink I tried was a match powder with perrier and ice. It was an odd combination but strangely refreshing.

For food I tried the chicken meatball toast, the egg in a nest, and the condensed milk toast. All of them were delicious but my favorite was the egg in a nest which was pretty much an egg in the middle of the toast. Their toast was really good, it was thick but fluffy and just the right amount of buttery flavor. 

They offered free water to the guests in reusable cups, so this place is obviously considering the environment. The actually cafe is very modern and has plants on the table. It is very well lit and a good place to study. They also have designated non laptop tables so that there are tables available for those who are not working/studying.

The staff was very friendly and down to earth. They were nice and gave suggestions and explanations.

If I lived around here I would probabaly frequent here, but I wouldn't go out of my way to bust a mission and come here again.
author: Rasha S.

description:
Stephanie S. and I headed over to this cute coffee shop to do some more work. Hipsters and Instagrammers will love this place because of their pretty drinks: birthday cake, cookie monster, etc. All so picture perfect!

Their specialty lattes are about $4-6, and they have other classic options from $2.75 - $4.75. I had their lavender latte ($4.75), and I think it could've had a stronger flavor. But that's just my personal preference.

The front area of the coffee shop is a laptop free zone. It's solely for people who want to enjoy their coffee and hang out with their friends. You can do work and/or study at the tables that line the wall. Free wifi, but they ask you to only stay for 2 hours!
author: Christine S.

description:
Made a trip to Home SF from my conference host hotel (Marriott Marquis) and didn't realize quite how far it was. Long trip aside, easily the cutest coffee shop I've been to in recent memory. I ordered the birthday cake vanilla latte and not only was it beautiful it was so yummy! If you have a sweet tooth you'll appreciate this drink.  Another friend ordered the matcha latte and it also was adorable and she said she loved it. 

I didn't take a picture of the food, but the egg in a basket toast was amazing! Fresh brioche bread sliced thick and carefully toasted with butter and a slightly runny egg in the center. Perfect portion for breakfast!
author: Kati S.

description:
Amazing craft lattes that are all Instagram worthy. The birthday latte is the most famous as it looks like a birthday cake with confetti, and it's only $5 for such an aesthetically pleasing drink, that also tastes really good. Unlike other places that are all for show, the coffee here is really high quality. I'd know, as I've been to Colombia, Costa Rica, Peru, and Vietnam to try coffee, and Home SF's is very good. The lavender and rose lattes are also great, ask for condensed milk if you like it sweeter or thicker.

Service is excellent as is the ambience, they rotate the design and art, so definitely stop by often for your IG background changes lol.

The breakfast meals are also really good. Overpriced toast with eggs, but worth it. The eggs in a basket is tasty, but the weekend only special of a whole egg on top of bacon, corn and cheese toast is the hit. Try it.
author: Chuck N.

description:
TL;DR take your aesthetic coffee photos here!

I got the sea salted caramel latte ($4.75), which I thought was very overpriced.
