A lot of Yelpers talked about the birthday cake latte, which I was skeptical about b/c I was afraid it'd be way to sweet. My caramel latte wasn't very exciting & ended up being very sweet (ironic for salted caramel huh?). If I came here again I'd probably get the birthday cake latte. Go big or go home, right?

The vibe was super hipster, they have minimalistic decor. Most people were on their laptops, even though there are signs EVERYWHERE that say you can't be on your laptops. There were several people who weren't on laptops and enjoying the company of their friends/family (yay!).
author: Sophia L.

description:
I got a whole latte love for Home.  Super friendly staff that always make small talk with you when you order :)

What I've tried:
Red velvet latte--my go to, very smooth 

Lavender latte--very fragrant and dusted with real lavender leaves

Birthday cake latte--the presentation is phenomenal, colorful and makes for a great Instagram pic

Matcha tea latte--sweet, but a little on the powdery/chalky side

Frozen hot chocolate--who doesn't like ice cream and chocolate?

Condensed milk toast--very sweet with firm bread on the bottom that holds up well to the topping and doesn't get soggy 

Chicken meatball toast--the chicken has slight sweet tinge, and with the pesto it has a balanced flavor profile

Tomato pesto truffle oil toast--crispy, tangy, cheesy, and salty.  Yum!

The place is spacious and clean and is a hot spot for students, so beware it can fill up fast even on days when you least expect it.  Also, some tables don't allow lap tops, FYI.  

Great music, free wifi, outlets, friendly staff, and delicious and good looking drinks and food make for one of my favorite cafes ever.
author: Emmeline C.

description:
I honestly love this place! It definitely gives a homey feel to it and the interior is simple, which I loved. I came here on a Saturday morning around 9:30 & it was a little crowded but the line moved pretty quick. The cashier was super sweet and very welcoming!

I ordered the s'mores latte & my friend ordered the chocolate & roses latte, both were so beautiful & tasted amazing! I'd definitely come back again!
author: Stacie I.

description:
Great service, great coffee, great environment

Stopped by around a week ago and I loved this coffee spot, small and cozy and just a great place to sit down and have a chat or do some studying. 

They have a lot of interesting drink choices but I stuck with a basic iced caramel latte, and it came out great! Kept me up all day and tasted good, unlike some of the other coffee joints i've stumbled across during my time in SF. They also have some yummy toast options. They don't look like much but they are delicious, my girlfriend ordered a toast with condensed milk and I got one with bacon, corn, and egg. Both were super yummy. 

Service was amazing and I wanted to give a shoutout to Jody, who took our orders and gave us great recommendations. She was kind, helpful, and had a great sense of humor, thanks Jody you're awesome!

You're probably looking at the menu or pictures here and thinking it's a hipster shithole but it's actually not, it's just aesthetically pleasing but I didn't get a bad vibe at all when I was here, just very pleasant and welcoming. Definitely stop by if you get the chance.
author: Kyle L.

description: Actually expected more from this cafe. It is pretty cool though, they try to make sure all seats are filled so people are not left standing and there's certain tables where you can't sit if you're using a laptop. I got the hot matcha latte because I wanted to art on it. I wanted the rainbow art on it but I think you've to make a special request on that one.
author: Elizabeth L.

description:
OMG I think I found my true love at Home today.

I have always loved their lavender latte, but now after I tried the rose latte, the latter became my new favorite!  It had the lovely rose aroma and taste, right amount of milk, and not overly sweet.  It was made perfect!!  Thank you!!!
author: Toasty H.

description: This place is perfect if you want some Instagram worthy latte and toast! The staff is super friendly and greets you with the convenient "welcome home" slogan. The decor is very hip and fresh with marble counters and wooden counters, and small potted succulents on each table. The Cookie Monster drink comes with a bear and some cookie cereal and was surprisingly not too sweet. The birthday cake latte comes with a rainbow design and is significantly sweeter. The Clement location doesn't have poached eggs and you'd have to go to the Noriega one for eggs.  But the toasts were tasty and cute. Overall very aesthetically pleasing place with friendly staff and good food!
author: Ellen G.

description:
A local friend took me to Home and I was delighted. It's an adorable cafe with an inventive, fun menu. It's a perfect brunch place for very light fare if you intend to keep eating throughout the day. 

Collectively we had the matcha-affragato (I couldn't resist), a rainbow latte, matcha latte, the toast with tomato and truffle oil, and the special toast that day with bacon, cheese, and corn. Everything was beautiful and delicious. They have a fair amount of seating but it still gets very busy - after we'd ordered a line going out the door formed. 

My only complaint is a vegan member of our party asked for almond milk and they mixed it with regular dairy milk. They were more than happy to redo it, however. 
Overall adorable place and I can't wait to try more of their drinks!
author: Kim B.

description:
My girlfriend introduced me to this place (big fan of toast) and I'm glad she did. 

There was a real homey vibe (no pun intended) when I first entered. Aside from eating, there were people studying there as well which gave the place a more comfy, hangout type of feel to it.

Ordered the Chicken Meatball Pesto and the Tomato, Truffle oil Pesto toast. I'd have to say that both orders were satisfying so I can't rank one over the other. We ended the meal with an Affogato (huge fan so I had to order it when I saw it on the menu) and it did not disappoint.

Overall, Home is a must-try! What got me was their selection of drinks along with the ambience of the place.
author: Joshua H.

description:
I came here after seeing some beautiful pictures on instagram. Okay - I can be a little obsessive with my instagram and the pictures I put on there. 

I ended up getting the birthday cake latte (with soy - apparently they look better with almond milk for those of use lactose intolerant) and the corn, bacon, onion, and egg toast. Everything was delicious. I highly suggest coming here early in the morning, with a book in hand, or some great friends and getting a latte and toast and staring the morning off right.
author: Nina Y.

description:
Foodie Son and GF in town and they wanted to try this "hot" coffee/cafe joint.   Place was packed with people loitering after completing their drinks.  Had to sit seperately since people were not leaving and single-single drinkers, laptop users were camping at four-spots.  Geez, have some courtesy and move to the window or a twosie or just plain leave when done.

Place is known for their "Birthday Cake" Latte,  a colorful concoction that everyone seems to order just to brighten the day.  Colorful but weak coffee.  Others in our party had Lavendar, Salted Caramel, and plain Lattes.  Two star deduct for warm lattes, we like it hot, and for lack of seats due to too many loiterers.  Cashier was nice and friendly while barista was rushed due to long lines, maybe the reason for the Luke warm lattes....  Quality Control needs to be put in place.
author: Scott L.

description: This is an incredibly cute space with friendly service. It feels very homey indeed! I've had both the iced lavender latte and the birthday cake latte. The former was very floral (I didn't mind) and the latter was a faint vanilla, but note that the emphasis seems to be more on the specialty drinks (aka Instagrammability) than the coffee itself. That is, the latte flavors are good, but this is more of a place to study.
author: Heidi L.

description: First time here & all I had heard about this spot was the rainbow latte... which I wasn't keen on trying. I got the lavender jasmine tea latte... and it is GOOD. Pleasantly surprised! Creative lattes are fun options to mix it up!
author: Chelsea G.

description:
I made the trek to Inner Sunset just for this cafe! On a Saturday morning, the line for coffee or brunch was from the register to the front entrance - expect a long wait for your latte or toast. 
The staff here is extremely friendly and seem to be college students from USF. The decor is very minimal with fake succulents and some hanging lights, but large tables perfect to prop yourself down for some serious studying.

I got the BIRTHDAY CAKE LATTE, which surprisingly wasn't too sweet and topped with delicate sprinkles! I don't think the espresso is the strongest in this city, but it was definitely a fun & different way to enjoy coffee in this city that is packed with coffee shops. They have tons of interesting drinks in their "Creative Menu" like Hangover (sparkling Americano), Red Velvet Latte, Holy Cow (condensed milk), and Lavender latte. I would definitely come back for their other lattes.

We also sampled their weekend brunch toasts, the CHICKEN MEATBALL & PESTO TOAST topped with egg & the EGG IN A BASKET. Neither were very impressive, since you can definitely make these at home, but we were starving on Saturday morning and had to get them! Between the food & lattes, I would come back for the lattes.
author: Sophie P.

description: Home is fun! Their long list of specialty drinks is what keeps me coming back. They are most famous for their Birthday Cake Latte, which is literally what unicorns and mermaids must drink and somehow we got lucky enough to try it too. The staff is always friendly and efficient while creating their lovely works of art. Home also serves up savory toast creations that are drool worthy but do take a minute to make. There's plenty of tables and bar space but on the weekends it's always packed. Many tables are reserved for human interaction instead of lap top time. Don't be afraid to share space and  interact over a coconut vanilla or salted caramel latte.
author: Jen R.

description: Came here about two years ago and it's gotten extremely popular since then. Seating is limited, people tend to study/work while they drink their coffee. Ordered the rainbow vanilla latte with soy milk. Pretty looking, but I think I'll try something else next time. They have a pretty broad menu of coffee and tea options. Definitely would come back for the avocado toast!
author: Jessica J.

description:
Cute ambiance, very instagram worthy! Sweet stuff and good for meet ups and hangs :) 
Latte art = on point. 

Didn't try any food, but must go if you're in SF
author: Ruth Awit S.

description:
Really cute and creative coffee and coffee art, and great WiFi! I came here on a Monday at 9 AM, and there was plenty of seating. I got the Nutella latte with almond milk and a cinnamon sugar toast. The latte was good, and not overbearingly sweet like Nutella can be. The latte came in a large porcelain mug with a cute heart drawn on top. The other flavors also sounded delicious - next time, I want to try the hazelnut latte. I unfortunately spilled my latte before I could take a photo. 

A plus is also the various outlets you can use to charge your laptop and the speedy WiFi - I was pulling reports for work and uploading them onto the internet and had no issues at all. Great spot, and can't wait to come back to try other flavors!
author: Victoria L.

description: One of our absolute favorite places to visit when we find ourselves in SF.  Drinks are amazing !  I would add a star if there were more food options...but to each their own.  Their focus is definitely a nice clean environment with delicious quality beverages.  We love it here at Home!
author: Brook W.

description:
I knew I had to give this place a try after seeing a picture of the Birthday Cake Latte!

Home Cafe offers a big variety of caffeinated drinks from Green Tea Lattes, to Lavender Soy, to Cookie Monster Lattes. The possibilities here are endless and it's every coffee lovers dream come true!

The Birthday Cake was delicious and definitely worth trying! The drink wasn't too sweet and had the right amount of caffeine to help me stay awake for the rest of the day. The avocado toast was also delicious and perfect pairing with my coffee!  

Too bad this place isn't closer to the Mission or else I would be visiting all the time!
author: MyTien P.

description:
On my list for their well know "rainbow latte," I was stoked when my former colleague selected Home as a meet up spot for a quick life catch up session.
Of course, I ordered the birthday cake latte, warned while placing the order that it tastes much like a funfetti cake. Fair enough... but I had to have it for the 'gram. 
The latte came out nice and quick, and it looked absolutely beautiful with a rainbow swan decorating the cupful of caffeine. Per the warning, it was definitely on the sweeter side for a latte, but the coffee was still palatable. I had to skip the last couple sips to avoid a sugar rush.
After a quick walk over to the 16th street steps, I came back to Home, waiting for my husband to pick me up. He had heard about the meatball toast and suggested we give it a try. 
Enter round two of the Home experience: this time I ordered a meatball toast, tomato pesto toast, and a rose latte. The latte, again, was sweeter than anticipated, but the Rose accents gave it a refreshing feel. I loved the tomato pesto toast, and the husband loved the meatball toast so much he ordered a second, this time with an egg on top.
Definitely worth the adventure out to the Outer Outer Outer of SF :)
author: Roma R.

description: Very instagrammable coffee shop and unique lattes, but they actually taste really good!!! I loved the Nutella latte, delicious. I tried some of my friends coffees and they were all delicious too, but def want to always get the Nutella latte :)
author: Raquel Y.

description:
I haven't had a really great chai tea latte in awhile and theirs just really hit the spot. Might be the second best I've had in my life.. But best one at a sit down place. 

Not the foamiest I've had, but pretty up there. So smooth down your throat.. 

For reference I'm talking about foam that takes up most of cup (you want more content than just air), but just the smooth foam on top when time is taken to make a cup of this.

And I also got the 'dirty' chai. You can get the non-cinnamon version if it's not your thing. 

Eggs in a Basket & Chicken Meatball with Pesto are two things I'd recommend for food that I've had. Eggs in a Basket seems to be a favorite though. There's not too much to say on it. It's pretty good. 

I've had two people tell me they thought I would get the lavender latte (someone I know well and someone I don't know well).. so maybe I'll give it a go.. but although I like lavender.. I've never liked lavender flavored things. So maybe it's best to avoid.. but, it's a popular choice here apparently. 

Tip on etiquette: It's shared seating here which is nice (not everyone's cup of tea). Please don't be a jerk and hog a WHOLE TABLE if you're just one person.. you could pick elsewhere to sit instead.
author: Lilian L.

description:
So cute! My pals and I came here for Sunday morning caffeine after seeing a crazy line at Andytown. The place was packed already and much cuter and hipster than I anticipated. When did the Sunset become so gentrified?! And when did people start their days so early (9 am) Sundays?! 

We each got a slightly different drank: lavender latte, Holy cow, Birthday cake latte regular and one with almond milk. Aesthetically the Birthday cake latte takes the cake (almond milk is probably vanilla flavored since it was sweeter than the regular), but the Holy Cow with its luscious condensed milk was the most appealing since it was the sweetest and creamiest.

The baristas were very nice and not haughty in the least as I have now sadly come to expect from modern coffee shops. The clientele leaves much to be desired as people take up whole tables with their laptops or will defensively ask "Why? Do you work here?" when asked if they are vacating their tables. 

Value is average for an artisanal drink at about $5 each. They also have baked goods and breakfast items that I would not be averse to try in the future.

Would not be a great place to study or expect to sit and chat with a group during peak hours but I would return if I was in the area for their cute and yummy drinks!
author: Angela L.

description: Very cool, hipstery place with tons of young kids taking pics of their beautiful latte art. Good food and good coffee. Kinda $$ tho.
author: Lillian W.

description: Amazing tasting drinks. Amazing looking drinks (if you don't know by now... they're very "instagrammable") Plus a cozy environment to do some work or studying. Highly recommend.
author: Justin C.

description: Home absolutely has the cutest latte art. For my design, I got a cute bunny with rose petals sprinkled on top for my rose latte! The shop itself feels modern and cozy. With great coffee and nice interior, no wonder this place is packed! All different types of people flock here, from college students, to families, to high school kids when they get off of class. If you're looking for a quiet place to study or do some work, this might not be the best option as it can get noisy from all the commotion.
author: Amanda T.

description: My friend and I drove for 45 minutes just to try one of their decadent lattes and honestly, it was worth I. We both got the birthday cake flavored latte and while it was very rich, it was also beautifully decorated and yummy
author: Liza H.

description: We're in the city visiting one of our friends and this morning we were in dire need of caffeine so we paid Home a visit and it is such a cute, quaint little coffee shop. I got the birthday cake latté with almond milk and my friend got the lavender latté and both were extremely delicious and so pretty! The cashier was a sweetheart and was very gregarious. Definitely recommend this place to anyone in town.
author: Itati V.

description:
If you're in the area, do stop by Home for the Instagram-worthy Birthday Cake latte. Be aware though, it can get really crowded and you'll to hunt for a place to sit. The place is pretty small and there aren't too many tables. The prices are on the expensive side but I guess that's the norm in SF! 

I got the lavender latte with soy milk. So good!!! It was absolutely delicious. If you don't want something too sweet, I highly suggest the lavender latte. Overall, the vibe is really cute and I would definitely come to Home again.
author: Jean K.

description: Tucked away on the street, Home is where my coffee heart lives. This place has atmosphere out the door of it's charming location! And you can tell from the moment you set foot inside that you've come to a place where they take care in providing you the best espresso drink or anything drink. I'd feel comfortable that I'd enjoy any drink off of their menu, coffee or tea! All prepared exquisitely.
author: Cindy L.

description:
Great products, services and setting. Parking was so easy to find. However, if you want front of the store parking then get ready for meter paying parking. They're popular for their rainbow foam arts. They also have food on the side, but I would probably skip out on the food. For, it's not what they are popular for. 

The only down side I can think of is the cafe is always busy and crowded. Might have a hard time looking for seats.
author: John N.

description: I really like this cafe. I have been taken friends there. I actually wanted o give 4.5 cuz some toasts are too sweet for me. Also I wish that they can have different combinations. For example I wish they could do condensed milk with bananas but without cinnamon. Overall, it is a very relaxing place, nice coffee, and the environment is good too.
author: Jane W.

description:
Aesthetically pleasing lattes and truffle oil, you got me.

For the palate: I'm a bit of a coffee snob but their creative simplicity hits home (!) with the Holy Cow latte for me. The toast is everything! I love that they use truffle oil in some of their creations (two that I've tried so far) and it smells and tastes absolutely scrumptious. I can devour the Tomato, Truffle Oil Pesto toast over and over again. How can you not love truffle oil?

For the soul: If I was still on the market for Mr. Tech, I'd probably hang out here every day! This is a decent sized room with a good number of shared seating. It is quite likely to find these seats occupied by students and professionals alike. Always be prepared to opt for take-out if you see the tables covered by MacBooks though.
author: Joyce Z.

description:
# H O M E

- B R E A K D O W N (# of + stars = rating)
* A T M O S P H E R E/C O N C E P T: +1 star
* F O O D/P R E S E N T A T I O N: +1 star
* P O R T I O N/C O S T: +1 star
* S E R V I C E: +1 star
* R E V I S I T: +1 star

You honestly really feel like home here! I'm SO IMPRESSED by the lady that took in our order. She literally knew all the regulars by name! If we were in the area, I'm sure she would know mine as well. Alas, this was only a stop since we live in Los Angeles but I definitely would like to come back! She really went above and beyond to make you feel at home. She deserves a raise! I want all my coffee shops to make me feel this way! Thank you!

As for the coffee, I purchased the birthday latte and my boyfriend had the cookie latte. Hot, delicious, and uniquely beautiful. The beautiful rainbow swirls on top of my latte was excellent. Perfectly made and perfectly colorful! I was definitely drinking the magic of unicorns in that latte! The tables were clean, white, and the decor was comfortable especially on the chilly and drizzly day!

Definitely want to come back when I'm in the area!

P A R K I N G

Meter parking but I can see this place being difficult during busy hours. We went pretty early on a weekend morning - not usually when people drink coffee, so just FYI. I could see it being busier during the weekdays.
author: Stephie L.

description:
They always say, home is where the heart is. In this case, my heart took a trip out to the Sunset District in San Francisco where I got the pleasure of checking out a quaint yet modern coffee house/breakfast joint simply titled "Home". Actually, my fiancée gets all the credit for finding this place on Yelp and after I saw the stellar reviews and pictures, we both agreed on checking this place out.

Since we took the ferry into San Francisco, we had to rely on public transportation in getting us here. And it was a very simply trek. From the Ferry Building/Embarcadero area, we simply took the "L Taravel" streetcar, transferred to the "28 19th Ave" bus, and we were there. "Home" is located directly on Noriega St. and very close to busy 19th Ave. We arrived on the morning of Easter Sunday (4/16/17) at around 11:00am.

Once entering the business, I absolutely loved the ambiance, decor, and atmosphere as it had a chic, modern look to it. Much of it looked like it was out of an IKEA catalog but in a good way. There were several tables throughout as we saw a relatively young crowd (20 to 30-something demographics) engaging in coffee and conversation while many of them were glued to their laptops. Wi-Fi here is fast and efficient as this made browsing the web all the more better.

As far as the ordering process, you simply go up to the register, order your food and/or beverages, and you're set. There are separate menus for the drinks located on a unique rolling paper sheet while the food items are on a clear laminated sheet on a clipboard. Since we both wanted to take advantage of everything this place has to offer (as well as being hungry after traveling here from Sacramento), we both opted for savory breakfast items and espresso drinks. Seating is available as a first-come/first-serve basis. Luckily a few people left as soon as we finished ordering our items.

My drink of choice was a "Chocolate Mint Latte" while hers was something a little more elaborate, a "Birthday Cake Latte". As far as our breakfast items, I went for their "Egg in a Basket". This consisted of a fried egg on crispy buttered toast, ground pepper, and red pepper flakes. I also requested bacon crumbles and cheese for extra added flavor. She tried their "Condensed Milk & Butter" which essentially looked like French toast. Total price for everything, around $26.

Our drinks come out first and I've got to say, this place hits a home run every way possible. My mint latte was absolutely delicious while not being overbearingly chocolatey. I tried my ladies' birthday cake latte and was astounded at the colorful artwork on top of her drink. Taste wise, it was also delicious while the sprinkles on top created more of a sweet flavor to it. My egg in a basket was much different than what I normally eat. I have to be honest that it was just okay for me as it didn't have that "wow" factor. The bacon bits definitely helped but it just wasn't fulfilling. I did like the buttery crumpet that accommodated my main entree though.

Overall, "Home" is definitely worth checking out, especially for the eclectic variety of specialty coffee items they serve. The atmosphere, vibe, service, presentation, and cost factor all were above average. It does get loud in here so if you do plan on studying, do come prepared. This place definitely is unique but then again, you are in San Francisco where you must wow your customers. My overall rating for "Home", a solid four stars.
author: Donovan H.

description: Really good coffee shop ! the wait can be pretty long at times, but it's a must try (at least once). i got the drink on the bottom, it's the Cookie Monster but iced and it's one of my favorites. The one on the top is Birthday Cake which is really good too. Good coffee shop overall !
author: Meg C.

description: The coffee, cookies and ambiance is amazing. The interior is very simple, clean and cozy. The cookies taste handmade and organic. The Vanilla Latte Coffee is on point and perfectly made, just the right temperature & just the right sweetness. Found my new favorite Coffee shop in the Sunset neighborhood.
author: Yuriy T.

description:
I'd say this place would be for... "coffee drinkers". In that you'd be more enthralled by "instagram"-friendly lattes, and that you're more in it for the looks. As a side note, I would recommend this place in that it's a good stepping stone towards more...serious, coffee shops. 

I do enjoy the aesthetic of this place and what they aim to do, which is why I'm giving it this rating. But in terms of actual coffee, the flavored drinks usually mask/overwhelm the overlying flavor. Espresso/coffee standard drinks (cappuccinos, lattes, pour over/drip) are not the norm amongst people here (even though it is an option), but I do enjoy bringing friends here once and a while. So if you're not tooooooo into coffee, start here.
author: Rowby O.

description:
I've been here twice.

The first time, I had their famous rainbow vanilla latte and a toast with pesto, sausage, and an egg. Both were extremely good! The latte was very pretty and sweet and the toast was savory and delicious.

My second time here, I had an iced red velvet latte and it was great! It tasted just like a red velvet cake.

I would highly recommend this place! If you don't like sweet coffee, the rainbow and red velvet lattes are definitely not for you. But they have tons of other choices.
author: Derek K.

description:
This is a small little Cafe in a quiet area of San Francisco. Very unexpected location for this coffee shop. Went around 4pm On a Saturday and there was a few seats available however this is absolutely a spot where a lot of people come to just use the wifi. There were a lot of people who took up tables with their computers and other personal devices.

The decor was very" homey" and the service was very prompt.
Being this our first time here we didn't know what to order however a fellow yelper did recommend the birthday cake coffee. This was also one that the lady at the register recommended. SO THIS IS EXACTLY WHAT WE GOT.

We ordered a Tomato Truffle oil pesto toast. This was literally a toast topped with tomato , truffle oil, pesto , freshly grated cheese and freshly ground pepper. To my surprise this was pretty good.

Now coming to the main part of this cafe- The drinks.

Ordered a Lavender latte. Presentation of the drink was very pretty.The drinks itself was light and frothy. You tasted the lavender which was the best part of it. I loved this drink. This drink was $4.75. For the size it was a decent price.

The birthday cake drink was $5.00. It was worth every bit. I was expecting this drink to be extremely sweet however it was nice and light with just enough sweetness. It was perfect. Oh also can't go wrong with the presentation. It was done very well.( See pictures).

Overall, I give this coffee shop 5 stars for their service, presentation, decor and food.
I do wish they served more food options however if you are looking for just a coffee shop this is the place to go with very unique drinks.

Absolutely a must go to if you are in San Francisco.I was only visiting otherwise I Would be here at least once a week if not more.
author: Binita S.

description: I tried the velvet and lavender latte, both gave a pleasing taste. Has a warm atmosphere, plenty seatings, and attentive baristas.
author: Rick M.

description: Not really sure what the hype is about. Since a lot of people commented that it would be a good study spot, my friend and I came here on a weekday afternoon with our books and laptops in tow. After waiting a bit, we got two seats at the window. We ordered the lavender jasmine tea latte, which looked pretty and tasted good. The toasts were pretty expensive so we didn't try them. We didn't end up staying long because it was really hot inside and too loud for reading. However, décor was nice and unique and the place was clean with friendly staff. A cute café, but overrated and not a great place to study in my opinion.
author: Nicole M.

description:
I first discovered Home when I moved back to SF a few weeks ago. Lucky for me, this is close by (within walking distance). It's been packed here every time I've come, but I always manage to snag a spot for me and my laptop. Occasionally I have to ask someone if I can share a table and others have asked me if I'd mind sharing mine. The answer is always yes, which is the culture here and I love it. All the tables along the wall have plugs under the seats while the windows do not. Laptops aren't allowed on the two tables by the book shelves, which I don't mind. I actually love that Home reserves them for human interaction lol. 

I've never had a cafe au lait before, but after ordering it here, it's my go-to drink. It's smooth and doesn't have that bitter taste. Their chai latte with cinnamon is also great (always get the cinnamon)! I love that there is latte art with every cup. It makes each drink here special... and Instagram worthy! Haha it's actually pretty funny because every time I look up, someone is taking a pic of their coffee or toast. But that's the world we live in nowadays! 

This is a great place to catch up with friends, to run into friends (I've ran into 3 friends here in the span of one week), and to work. I work remotely now and although it is not the quietest place, I actually get a lot done! Their free and fast wifi definitely helps. And the fact that my bed is not in the next room also helps lol. I've been here many times already... and of course I'll be back many more times.
author: Angie Y.

description: Great cup of gimmicky coffee. The Birthday cake latte was perfect. We also tried the PSL and it was on point. The cafe is super clean with great decor. The staff is very helpful and willing to make recommendations. I love the fact that some of the tables are communal and encourage you to socialize with your neighbor. Great concept in a great location. If you are in the area you have to stop in for a pick me up.
author: Manny G.

description: Such a fun place to visit from being from the Midwest! Definitely get a birthday cake latte!
author: Angela L.

description:
I already know your question and the answer is The Birthday Cake Latte.

That's the one with the rainbow-colored latte art and sprinkles that's actually really good despite its novelty aesthetic. 

Loved the drinks here though the flavors on some are closer to their unique names than others. As a person who loves creamer more than coffee, the menu here of fun flavored lattes is an ideal one for me. 

The only problem here: The customers. 
I know its in poor taste to rip on the customers of a business but Home should take some responsibility in enforcing thier own rules to make the experience a better one for customers. 

They've got signs on every.single.table saying no laptop use permitted. What do you see at every single table? 100% of customers on laptops. 90% of them without any drinks. Taking up every single seat in the place, less the seats their bags are so selfishly taking up. 

There's a line out the door and the entire place is taken up by people who aren't or are no longer patronizing them and blatantly breaking the very clear rule displayed on a sign at every table. Not sure why the staff at Home doesn't do more to enforce the rule, but let me tell ya, it was maddening to fight to find a seat to drink the stuff I paid for with the laptoppers who had nothing from the cafe on their table. 

Home: You need a electronics bouncer to come in and be the mean mom to these millennials and get them to realize that the world does not revolve around their need to stare at a screen and take up space. 

People Tempted To Use Your Laptops At Home: This is not your home. Read the rules, don't occupy space when you're no longer in the realm of patronizing the business, and don't be prick and think you're above the laptop rule. You're not special. The rules absolutely apply to you, me, and everyone else. 

Everyone: Go to Home, get their silly and incredible lattes and if you see someone on their laptop, it seems within your rights to verbally accost the jerks about it. Unless they're bigger than you, of course, then just think of all the stuff you'd like to say to them in your head and give them the side-eye of a lifetime.
author: Candice G.

description:
Once again, I'm suckered in for cute presentation but Home is a well deserved place of the recognition. 

Right off of 19th st, it's an easy location to find. I've lived here for a few years but never tried them until recently. They have a simple yet elegant storefront which makes for very social media-worthy photos ;) they have a coffee menu and brunch menu ( different types of brick toast with toppings). Eggs in a basket looked tempting,  but I was won over by their pesto sauce in which I also added a fried egg on top. Simple yet delicious. 

I also ordered the birthday cake latte. Presentation was on point of course with the rainbow lead art work.
author: Sheila B.

description:
I've been going to Home for a few years now and its honestly one of my favorite coffee shops ever (I've even mentioned them in a couple Spoon University articles and featured them in a video). 
I've tried a quite a lot on their menu and I highly recommend the coconut vanilla latte--it's super coconutty and refreshing. If you're not into coconut, honestly everything else is good, and their latte art is beautiful. The cinnamon toast at the Noriega location is also one of my favorites, although it's a little pricey at $5, its definitely worth it. 
Also, not only is the coffee and toast delicious, but the service is amazing. The employees at both locations are super sweet and really willing to take time and explain each item on the menu to find the perfect drink or snack for you! 
Next time you're in the Sunset or Richmond districts, I highly recommend stopping by one of their locations. 

To sum it up--they have super creative, delicious lattes with beautiful art, great aesthetics, and amazing employees. 

Check Out This Link For More Details:
http://spoonuniversity.com/place/san-francisco-home-cafe-review?utm_source=publishedemail&utm_medium=publishedemail&utm_campaign=publishedemail&utm_campaign=website&utm_source=sendgrid.com&utm_medium=email
author: Kelsey T.

description: This place has great coffee, tea, and toast. The prices are fair and the service is friendly and personable. The atmosphere is beautiful and clean feeling, but also cozy. I love the slight twists to traditional coffee drinks. I wish it was opened later, but its understandable since its a coffee shop.
author: Mario V.

description: I have been stalking "HOME" on Instagram for a long time, and finally got to come in! Cutest place ever!!! Right off 19th Ave on Noriega. I found parking right away at a meter. The place is big, comfy, homey, and fun. The workers and the barista were AWESOME! So friendly and welcoming. I told them of my Instagram love and they went out of their way to be nice to me. I had the birthday cake latte which has beautiful rainbow latte art on top. I love that stuff!!! The coffee was creamy and delicious. Such a great experience! Thank you Home!!
author: Wanda G.

description: Love love their unique and delicious lattes. They taste as beautiful as they look. The staff is super friendly and the cafe super fun and comfy to work. I got their birthday cake latte and lavender chai latte, which were yummmmyyy (yes, I got both and drank both). My friend got the plain latte which was also super good. When back in Cali, I definitely will be going back.
author: Daljit K.

description: This is the place to stop! The people here are so kind & friendly. Great coffee art for those photos and everything is delicious too!! So glad we found this stop!!
author: Carrie L.

description:
"No place like home" is a great way to describe home! First time coming here  I had their lavender latte thought that was already original and good. Now, coming again tried their matcha and birthday cake lattes and must say this time totally one upped my last time coming here! 

For the lattes: yes, just get the birthday cake latte! Such beautiful art work and I actually didn't think mine was too sweet or over powering. It honestly tasted like a very tasteful mocha to me rather than an overbearing sweet drink. My friend also ordered the matcha latte which was more of a subtle tea taste rather than coffee. So I did prefer the birthday cake latte over the matcha one. But if you just want something not too over powering or more tea like I totally recommend the matcha latte! 

For the toasts: we got the tomato toast with an egg on the top and the chicken sausage toast. The chicken sausage toast was very filling. It was good and very herby like. The tomato toast was obviously less flavorful but more light weight and the egg we added paired well with it. I totally recommend both! 

Overall: this is such a cute coffee shop and great coffee too! Only down side is that parking is a hassle also finding a spot to sit you really have to have luck on your side. I heard you can also only sit for 2 hours... not sure if it's true or not. But in the end love this place and so excited for the new things they will come up with! Very impressed with everything so far.
author: Leslie F.

description:
Stopped by here for a quick cup of coffee with a few friends. Fast and friendly service, but crowded indoors. I'm sure at off-hours, if would be a nice place to chill and have a cup of coffee "for here" as the atmosphere is very "instagrammable".

They have a very unique selection of lattes, of which I chose the lavender latte to go. Beautiful presentation, however as I sipped on my coffee, I found later that the lavender pieces were a little annoying to drink. 

Overall would definitely come again, especially to try that birthday latte! And of course to take more photos :) 

Pro tip: it's super close to the Moraga steps! 7 min walk away!
author: Tina T.

description:
I've been wanting to try this place ever since I've seen friends' instagrams and yelp reviews. It was worth the trip! The latte art was beautiful. I got the birthday cake latte and chicken meatball toast.

As soon as I got my latte, I couldn't stop taking pictures. I am thoroughly amazed by the amount of work they put into it. I know what you're thinking-- what does a birthday cake latte taste like? It tastes like a vanilla latte! Just more colorful.
The toast too was delicious and went perfectly with the latte. My friends got their toast with a fried egg and that looked delicious.

The baristas were so nice and warm and were eager to give me recommendations. For my second cup of coffee, I got the hangover (sparkling americano) which was interesting. 

There were a lot of ppl here and it was very very busy. It may not be a sit and study for long periods of time type of cafe, but beautifully aesthetic! Perfect for the 'gram
author: Grace L.

description:
I love coming to Home for a good latte and to have a nice chat with some good company! They do a good job of promoting interactions with the people you're with by having designated tables where you can't use laptops (which is really cool!). But if you're coming here to study it's best to come early because you might have a hard time getting a table when it's busy since there is a laptop restriction on some tables.

The specialty lattes here are delicious and come with cute designs on top! The drinks aren't sweet so if you prefer a sweeter latte then you should let the cashier know when you order.

We ordered the Coconut Vanilla Latte ($4.75), Lavender Latte ($4.75), Holy Cow/Condensed Milk Latte ($4.75), and the Birthday Cake Latte ($5.00). Out of the four drinks we ordered the Holy Cow and Lavender Latte are probably my favorite although the design on the Birthday Cake Latte is the best looking one out of all of them!
author: Nicole C.

description: I love, love, love trying different tea lattes, and this lavender Jasmine tea latte was FANTASTIC.  I was full and wasn't going to get anything, but then I saw it on the menu and it kept calling me.  I'm so glad I gave in.  The first thing that hits you is how fragrant it smells, then the taste is just as beautiful.  The only issue is the little lavender bits are awkward to drink, but a small price to pay for an otherwise beautiful tea latte.
author: Susie D.

description:
My friend and I went on a weekday around 2pm and it was pretty busy. There was practically no seats left and we had to ask a friendly table to share until we saw seats open up.

We ordered the birthday cake latte (for the 'gram!) and the cookie monster latte. Also ordered the egg in a basket. The birthday cake latte was tasty! The cookie monster didn't taste like cookie butter to me, but it was good too. 

Would definitely come back again! Seating is limited but the coffee is great and the workers are super nice.
author: Michael T.

description:
It's like dessert lattes are a specialty here. Very Instagram worthy and you'll see a lot of people come by for their Birthday Cake Latte. Even the regular latte is on the sweeter side. 

It's a good space to meet with friends and they keep a section for non-laptop users.
author: Theresa D.

description:
Home Cafe is really as good as it gets!
I always want to branch out and try new coffee places, but somehow end up coming back to this quaint little coffee shop!
With really modern light up letters that say "HOME", the decor is very inviting. There is a good amount of seating and, in addition, they recommend table sharing with others so that everyone can have a seat and enjoy their coffee.

I've tried a couple of their drinks: The birthday cake latte (of course, I had to for the wonderful rainbow design), red velvet latte, lavender latte (both iced & hot), and most recently, their rose latte which is seasonal if I'm correct!
I have never been let down by one of their lattes; the hot ones give the best mouth feel and have a nice amount of foam consistently, while the iced ones are the perfect pick-me-up on a warm day! If you're scared of the floral lattes, don't be! They are not overpoweringly floral or sweet, which I definitely appreciate as someone who is not fond of sweetness. Lattes range in price from $4-8, depending on if you get add-ons like soy milk or extra shots!

Food-wise, my favorite is the egg in a basket, which is a fried egg in the middle of a crispy, buttery piece of toast with a hole in the middle. (Don't worry, the hole of bread comes on the side!) At $5, it is not super cost effective, but a lovely snack to go with your coffee for sure!

Only comment is that it is a little on the pricier side, but I have no doubt the price is worth the quality (food, service, environment)! You'll definitely be seeing me here time and time again.
author: Alexi G.

description:
Stumbled upon Home a few months ago and I really like it. While def hipster, bougie in vibe . . . it's not pretentious. The coffee menu is pretty simple (though no non-fat milk) and the staff is extremely helpful and friendly. One complemented my I-Hotel shirt, so there's the five right there! 

For a work/study location, there are plenty of tables that fit one or two people, power outlets, and the wifi is free and strong. There are also two-three tables that are LAPTOP FREE tables, so if you just want to read or sit and think about stuff, there is a space for you too. There is no parking lot, so be prepared to feed the meter on Noriega.

I have found myself setting this as a destination on more than one occasion and have been satisfied every time.
author: Bruce R.

description:
I came here on a Sunday morning around 10:45am hoping to get some coffee, toast, and some work done. But boy, it was packed inside! There was a line, but it moved pretty fast. There were no empty tables, but the cashier told us that they do "table sharing", so if we see open seats, we could sit there. We ended up sharing a table with someone else and were able to get our work done while enjoying coffee and breakfast.

As for drinks and food, we got a soy matcha latte, soy hazelnut latte, chicken meatball and pesto toast, and a bacon and corn toast with an added egg. I really like how they let you customize the sweetness of your drink. Hazelnut latte was my favorite, slightly creamy with a prominent hazelnut flavor. The chicken meatball toast was the best out of the two toasts we ordered! The only downside was the knife they gave us was really dull and we had a hard time cutting up our toast. 

Service was A+, super friendly and they also helped clear our plates after we were finished. I can't wait to come back to try some of the other drinks, this place is super cute! 

My tip: If you're planning to do some work, I recommend coming early on the weekends since it's like a battle to get a table (people were grabbing chairs and tables left and right lol) and the line was practically nonstop!
author: Cecille W.

description: The service, food, and drinks were good. My tiniest gripe is that it is so busy! Props to the shop for having a good business but I just felt a little cramped during my experience there and it also affects the noise levels as well.
author: Tracy T.

description: I started my Mother's Day with Home SF Birthday Latte & Lavender Latte and both were amazing! I figured the Birthday latte would be on the sweeter side and requested for it to be less sweeten and it was prefect! My daughter enjoyed her Lavender latte very much, perfect hint of lavender. Their latte artwork is magnificent! We also ordered the Truffle in Paradise and Egg in The Basket toasts and both tasted delish! I will def come back to try their other crafted latte!
author: Linda P.

description:
I've visited this cute coffee spot many times and always walk out with a great experience. Today, I tried their seasonal special pumpkin spice latte. O M G. They use fresh pumpkin and what a difference it makes! Seriously. Try it if you get a chance. Next level PSL haha. I've also had their rainbow latte (get it for the Gram!). Yummy as well. 

Foodwise, I've always gotten the toasts here as well. I've tried almost all of them and have been happy. Visually appealing AND delicious? Yes. 

It can be tough to get a seat here, and they encourage you to get to know each other rather than being digitally plugged in! Totally home-y. 

Another note: This particular visit, I got my food to go in case I wasn't able to snag a seat, but I ended up finding one! A staff member came by to clean up the table and I mentioned to her that I got my food to go and was hoping to get it for here instead. I wasn't necessarily requesting for a change, but she picked up on it and offered anyways. Long story short, she showed she cared and it's definitely appreciated. Attentive and genuine service--also from the cashier! Thanks for making me feel welcome. HOME will continue to be one of my go tos.
author: Mariel A.

description: Cute place and very friendly and helpful staff! Got the famous birthday cake latte and was thoroughly impressed! Wish they had non fat milk though. Will definitely come back to this location! Great place to meet up with friends or do work/schoolwork, plenty of tables. Also a very clean place. Must visit!
author: Ariel C.

description: Wifi is expected to be down for over 3 hours and there is no mention of this before people buy anything and sit down. Wasn't mentioned when I asked for the wifi password either. Wth? Only mentioned after I said it seemed the wifi was down. With such a high percentage of your patrons coming in with laptops to do work, it is only courteous as a business to mention wifi is down upfront. Not cool Home, not cool.
author: dianne l.

description: What a fun spot full of dessert meets coffee combinations. A good friend with a sweet tooth took me here and I wasn't sure what to order and the helpful lady up front suggested something after asking me my sweetness preference. She recommended a rose latte and I really liked it- it has hints of floral and typically not a coffee person really enjoyed my drink. I was told the other location is one big instagram opportunity!
author: Priya S.

description:
I ABSOLUTELY ADORE that this place is called "Home". Stopped inside randomly one day and tried the jasmine lavender latte. SO GOOD. Highly recommended. 

Their birthday cake lattes are really beautiful. I love the colors. Must check out if you're in the area.
author: Linda N.

description:
This is truly a home away from home especially if you wish to live in a home straight out of a Pinterest or Instagram blog. From adorable little succulent plants to twinkling fairy lights, Home is your picture perfect coffee shop. 

This is a great place for studying or getting work done or even watching cat videos for two hours straight. I love a lot of their creative lattes (lavender, red velvet, coconut vanilla) though my go-to these days is the sea salted caramel latte. The birthday cake latte is quite similar and may be my new favorite just because of how pretty it is with its sprinkles and colorful latte art.

The staff here is super friendly and the space is always clean and tidy. The music and conversation here is always at a good volume so you can drown it out with your own headphones or let it be the background noise to whatever you're doing. There's plenty of tables and seats but due to how popular this cafe is, it may be difficult to find a seat sometimes in the late afternoon.
author: Diana C.

description:
Receiving a delicious latte decorated with beautiful latte art will surely brighten anyone's day. Home, a local neighborhood coffee shop in the Sunset district, is one of the best places to go to for just that. Not only is their coffee delicious, it's almost too pretty to drink. Home brews De La Paz coffee, which is really good! My favorite is their lavender latte. It's not too sweet and you can definitely taste the lavender flavor throughout. I also love how they sprinkle lavender pieces on top, which makes the latte art so much prettier. I also tried the coconut vanilla latte, which was tasty, but a tad too sweet for me.
 
What draws me the most about this coffee shop is the gorgeous, Instagramable latte art. It's usually different variations of the heart or sometimes a bear, but from the matcha latte to the lavender latte to the red velvet latte...each one is unique in color, which makes the drinks even more beautiful. Recently, I discovered their most beautiful latte, which is the Birthday Cake latte. It has rainbow colors and sprinkles throughout the design...super gorgeous!

Food - not only are the drinks Instagramable, the food is definitely Instagram-worthy as well. Home sells a variety of toasts from sweet to savory that make an excellent snack with your coffee. They range from about $4-$7 per slice with additional add-ons available (fried egg and bacon). A little bit pricey for toast, but they are usually on-point with presentation. 

Cons - not the place to go to for coffee when you are in a hurry, crowded, hard to get a table, closes early. Also, I asked for my latte for here and they put it in to-go cups.

Home is a very cute, small coffee shop located near the corner of 19th and Noriega. The staff is friendly, the decor is simple and modern, and WIFI is available. Parking can be a challenge, but apparently it hasn't stopped anyone from coming because most of the tables are usually taken by people with their Macbooks. I wish they were open later as well (closes at 5pm). Overall, excellent coffee shop for good tasting and good looking coffee and toast!
author: Jean S.

description:
Loved it !
Pros: Fast service, picture worthy lattes, yummy food and great staff
Cons: food came out at different times, three came out and then it was about 10 mins for the other two meals to come out. Food took a little while, so we all finished out drinks before our food came out.
That said the lattes were delicious !! On top of being delicious they were beautiful. 
The food was so yummy !! We got the 2 bacon corn and egg brioche, one bacon corn and tomato brioche, on egg in a basket and one cinnamon toast - super Yummy !!
Drinks - pumpkin spice, the birthday cake, hangover, salted caramel, vanilla coconut - super duper yummy ! 
Parking was easy-we got there at about 930 on Sunday and parked right in front. 
We would definitely come back - when we are back in the city !!
author: Shahna G.

description:
SO cute. SO SF. SO quintessential not trying too hard.

Came here with some girlfriends to start off our rainy day daytrip around the city! I was so glad we found a table here--yep, that's the hardest part...finding a table to enjoy your craft coffee and baked selections. Otherwise, the WIFI is strong, baristas are friendly and cool, and ingredients are unicorn-unique.

I had the lavender latte because I love lavender, and wanted to go for something on the neutral side, not over sweet or bitter. I love the look and beautiful colors of the birthday cake latte, but our friendly barista said that that was most definitely one of the sweetest ones on the menu. The latte was delicious and made with soy milk, since full on dairy never sits well with me. Drinks are made with artistic talent, efficiency, and lots of love! The lavender bits on top were the perfect touch!

A wide variety of people were chillin' inside Home on a rainy weekday--from groups of students to families and people just doing work. I was surprised at how busy it was at like 10AM. There are restrooms at the end of the hall, and because seating is tight for how popular the spot is...most people end up sitting together and I'd say that this place is all communal seating. Pricing for the drinks are typical for the Bay Area, but I think it's completely justified for the nonjudgmental service, quality brewing, and fantastic ambiance of this minimalistic spot. Rock on Home!
author: Jodi H.

description:
I'm not sure if this is the original Home, or if it's just another location amongst several, but this spot is perfect. Completely unassuming and filled with young students cramming information, prepping for upcoming tests no doubt.

They have all the special drinks you've no doubt heard about through Insta but without the lines and latest generation of youth who can't live without staring at this phones and taking the perfect picture. I do have to say this place isn't as instagram worthy as other locations but I think that's what makes it special.

Birthday cake and cookie dough latte - big thumbs up. Just don't expect them iced. Not gonna happen.
author: Kevin J.

description:
I've been wanting to try Home for years and finally came here to do some work/studying with my friend. I got the lavender latte and I believe she got the birthday latte and we both loved our drinks! I really liked the ambiance of the place and the staff were super sweet too!

The only problem was that we didn't realize that you couldn't use laptops on some tables which was slightly annoying since almost all of the tables were occupied (usually by 1 person at a 4 person table). So we had to move back and forth with our stuff and drinks a few times. It would be nice if we were told that when we were ordering and said it was our first time here.
author: Brianna A.

description:
Before heading to a photography trip a group of us decided to meet here to grab our morning coffee and breakfast. When you get here it's easily recognizable because the sign can be seen and they also have parking on the street. Although street parking seems bad, it's really not hard to find parking for this coffee shop. 

When walking in you get a sense of "home" and maybe it's because the environment is cool and decorated with a lot of things that make you think of home. They have creative pictures on the wall that depict home whether it be by the shelves they have with books, pictures that say "home is where the heart is" or just the warm welcoming when you walk in. 

What I like about this place is they have menus that tell customers what they offer in terms of coffee, tea and pastries if you have to wait in line. But they also have two big "scrolls" that list their drinks too! It's unique compared to other coffee shops. What makes this place unique is that they offer a variety of coffee and tea such as : birthday cake, Cookie Monster, hangover and chocolate mint latte. 

They have a lot of seating where they could seat a total of 35-40 people! Just to let you guys know though, they do have tables that have a sign that says laptops are not allowed on the table. 

I would have to say that there were only two people working the front so it took awhile to get your coffee because only one person was actually making the coffee. When I ordered my coffee it took almost 10 minutes to get it and I think it is because there was only one person making the coffee. Since there were only two people working the front, the person not making the coffee sometimes had to help serve the coffee or pastry so those waiting in line had to wait until she came back. What I like about this place though is that the staff is super nice. They legit being your food, drinks and utensils to you which most coffee shops do not do.  

The only downfall about this place I would have to say is that they have one bathroom so if you need the bathroom you got to wait in line. So if it's busy at this coffee shop be ready to just wait. 

Overall I would most definitely come back and try more of their creative coffee!
author: Nadine Y.

description:
There's no place like HOME...

With that said, this cafe is my favorite now. I have happened to beat the rush so I was able to grab a seat. The service was great, they were helpful and quick. They have it down to a science since most people are ordering latte's with designs and within 2 minutes we were served. 

We tried 
*Red Velvet Latte - Not as sweet as I thought it would be, it's rich and strong.
*Birthday Cake - Everyone's got to have it once right? I like this one better than the red velvet, because it wasn't as strong. 
*Condensed Milk Toast - It was good, if you're a fan of condensed milk then it's probably a homerun you. But since it is condensed milk on top, it isn't as crispy as other options they have. 
*Eggs in a Basket - My favorite between the two. A nice runny egg inside the toast, smothered with bacon bits on top. 

I'm impressed with HOME, sometimes pictures are deceiving because the stuff looks so good it builds up expectation and sets the bar high. But the presentation matches the product. These guys take pride in latte's being an art. 

Only thing I would like to see is the menu expand. Even though I wanted to try all the toast, it would be nice to have more variety to choose from. And the seats fill up fast and by people doing homework, work, etc, which occupies those seats for longer.
author: Arron E.

description:
Very cute atmosphere. 

It always seems packed but by the time you get your order a table will open up.

They have a wide variety of lattes to try the most famous being the birthday latte. Don't be afraid to get it if you think I'll will be too sweet. It actually has a nice balance.
author: Ann L.

description:
The Birthday Cake Latte is as yummy as it looks! I love how pretty it is! Staff is nice. Cafe atmosphere is hipster. It was pretty busy on a Sunday afternoon. I had to wait awhile before I was able to snag a spot to sit. 

If I'm ever doing tours for friends or family visiting from outside of the Bay Area, I'm definitely bringing them to this sweet spot! I can't wait to try other awesome offerings from this cafe in the near future.
author: Cindy M.

description:
You should know what to expect when you come here. Just because you had a distorted expectation does not mean this place did not live up to standards. I am specifically referring to those reviews here that talk about how the birthday cake latte does not taste like birthday cake and thus it's a bad rating ... I am not sure that it say "tastes like birthday cake," what it says is that it is a vanilla spiced latte. It tasted exactly like that.

I honestly felt bad for the owner who had to disclaim to me when I wanted to order it that it doesn't taste quite like birthday cake it was just a fun name and looks like one. I don't feel like this is necessary.

Home SF is amazing. From their vast offerings of unique lattes, flavors, ice cream and desserts to their SUPER clean and well kept interior space, it is everything I could have not imagined being on Clement in Outer Richmond. This place is hip beyond its neighbors for sure. 

Yes, I got the birthday cake latte, yes I got it for the grams ... and guess what? I actually also enjoyed it! So rare to be able to gram something cool and ALSO find it tasty. Yes it isn't a nitro cold brew, weighed gram by gram to perfection flat white with chestnut finish and notes of lavender, but it was damn good for what it was. 

You'll find laptop city here, and they do have wifi which is nice. There is a sweet space in the back I didn't get to check out but you know I'll be back for all the amazing other things on the menu. Welcome home!
author: Lorrie M.

description:
I came here with my boyfriend for an afternoon of studying/working. When you enter the cafe, the server greets you "Welcome home", which I thought was sweet. 

The cafe is decorated quite nicely with ample natural lighting, warm colors, fake plants at each table, and "HOME" in large colorful letters. However, despite this, it is pretty dirty in this cafe... there are crumbs and oil stains all over the table and seats. I had to wipe down the table with water because I was not comfortable putting my laptop and cell phone on it. 

For drinks and food, we ordered the matcha latte, lavender tea latte, and sausage toast. The drinks were just okay, not very rich or flavorful. The toast was also okay. Considering how dirty the cafe was, I was worried about how clean the food was. 

Overall, everything looked cute and nice, but actually wasn't so cute and nice.
author: Christine L.

description:
I came in on a stormy, Sunday afternoon, in need to study aka get my shxt together before Monday. I was greeted by the barista at the counter who said, "Hi, Welcome Home!" He asked me how my day was going, and made some small talk, which made me feel really welcomed and comforted. He noticed that I was a first timer and recommended some of their top creative cups and toast. I went with their most popular: lavender latte (added almond milk) & tomato, truffle oil, pesto toast (added egg). 

A cup of coffee + toast came out to about $15, which may cause some reluctance, but I was more than satisfied with my order. I was hesitant to get the lavender latte because I was afraid the floral taste would over power the espresso. I was reassured by the first sip. Mmmm.. There was a hint of lavender mixed with a rich espresso taste, topped with frothy foam and dried lavender leaves. No wonder it's one of the most popular drinks. I underestimated the size of the tomato, truffle, pesto, egg toast. It was very filling! 

This place has so much potential with a creative theme. I wish they had a larger, more spacious venue because it was pretty packed. I was lucky enough to get a table to myself, but at least 4 other people asked if they could share a table with me. I didn't mind the new company, but I was a little embarrassed that my laptop, notebook, pencil bag, and cup of coffee were taking up 90% of the table. So much for sharing, lol oops. I would also suggest some pillows on the benches to really captivate the whole "home" theme. They really should get some extension cords too since everyone brings their laptops and the location of outlets is scarce. 

Overall, I love their service, creative cups and the throwback 2000's jams they were slappin. I would come here to study, although it can get a little noisy. Nothing like a pair of headphones to fix that problem. Best of all, they have fast wifi despite everyone being on it. (Pw: welcomehome)
author: Rachelle Y.

description:
Ambiance & service:
My friends and I came here at around 3 pm on a Thursday, and it was surprisingly pretty crowded. We were able to find a seat, but just be aware that a lot of people come here to study-- and I see why! The decor inside is really cute and the service is super friendly!

Food:
I ordered the coconut vanilla latte and I definitely recommend it. The coconut flavor wasn't as strong as I thought it would be, but I actually liked it this way! I think that the sweetness from the vanilla balanced the light coconut flavor perfectly :) Plus, the barista makes the most "brew-tiful" latte art-- he made mine Totoro!
I also ordered the toast with tomato, pesto, cheese, and a fried egg on top (extra cost for the egg). It tasted SO GOOD. The toast was a bit sweet and the toppings were savory, so the flavors really complimented each other.
It was around $14 in total, but I definitely think it's worth the money. The food was surprisingly pretty filling and you can take the most adorable instagram pics! 

This is a must-try little cafe! I know that I'll definitely be back!!
author: Monica W.

description:
I ordered a coconut vanilla latte to go for $4.75 for a 16oz, a bit pricey but I guess it's right around the same as Starbucks? 

The latte was good and I'll be back to try some other items but the attitude from one of the drink makers killed my mood a little.

when I was first handed the drink, there wasn't a lid on it (lids were on the right of where to get drinks being done) I became a bit confused but this was no big deal, Peets does it too but I guess it took me by surprise a local shop didn't already put a lid on a drink. there were so many people also I feared running into people trying to get my drink, then getting my drink and possibly spilling it because I'm running into someone else. 

what dampened my mood upon receiving my drink with no lid, the drink wasn't filled to the top. I double checked with one of the baristas and they mentioned it is done by how many oz is poured.. and it ended there when I said "oh. okay." haha it was a bit awkward since there was a pause and I already was taken by surprised with the no lid. I think it registered to the barista then I might possibly "want something?" so then they asked me if I wanted more ice or milk to fill it time but I guess opportunity window had passed and my mood was already set lol at the time, I didn't want to stay longer than I had to, and I ordered to go haha

maybe I just had funny employee or homie was in a bad mood or a off day. again I'll be back cuz there are many drink options but I'll be sticking with to go orders from here for a while.
author: Yeanne L.

description:
Drink
I've been seeing pictures of this birthday latte all over IG, so since I was in the area I thought to try it out. We ordered the birthday cake latte and the condensed milk latte. Both drinks were so ridiculously sweet that I could barely taste any of the espresso. It's either that or there was way too much milk compared to espresso in the drink. 

Atmosphere/Service
The shop is quite cute and with all the white in the shop, it's definently very instagrammable. On the sign at the cashier, it does say that they want people to socialize so no laptops during these certain days/hours (quite odd, because i think this would be a great place to study otherwise)
author: Kristen L.

description: Good  Iocal place for a latte with a creative twist. Friendly staff and good place to meet and greet . Staff and service can be slow at times. Good place Just as long as your not in a hurry.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Who knew the Sunset district had such a cute little cafe?! In love with the colors on the Birthday cake latte and the Lavender Latte! 

The ambiance is very hipster and inviting but it gets pretty packed so looking for seats can be tough. Plus parking can also be difficult too. 

I still need to try their toast since it was sold out when I went
author: Frances K.

description:
I like this cafe! They have cool, aesthetic decor and studying here feels nice and comfie. Overall, the store is pretty clean. They have good quality drinks and toasts, however, it is quite pricy. I have been there twice. The first time, I got a matcha latte and a chicken meatball with pesto and a friend egg on toast. The toast was pretty delicious, but it cost $7-8 so I wouldn't order it too often. The matcha latte looked cool and was not bad.

I came back to study here with my boyfriend and I got a hazelnut latte and we shared the chicken meatball pesto toast. We studied here for finals and it was a great environment. Again, I like how clean and well decorated everything was. 

We ordered the ICED COCONUT VANILLA LATTE to go and it was SO GOOD. This drink bumped my review to 5 stars because my boyfriend and I really, really enjoyed it. The hot lattes I had ordered in the past was not too worth it, but this drink is! I don't know anything about coffee, so I can't describe the tasted very well. However, trust me: it's really good!
author: Jessica L.

description:
Came here just to try their Birthday Cake Latte.

My friend said they've changed up their recipe and it used to taste more birthday cakey, which she preferred better. However, I liked the latte! I thought it would be super sweet considering the name, but it wasn't an overpowering amount to sugar. I could still taste the coffee and my morning quench was satisfied. The latte was so pretty and full of rainbow happiness!
author: Tiffany N.

description:
Home Cafe is one of my favorite places to grab coffee and a snack with some friends! I love the creative lattes they have, and all their toasts are delicious. 

Most recently I tried the birthday cake latte and it was very yummy! A bit on the sweeter side, but that's how I like my coffee. The latte art here is so cute and definitely instagram-worthy! Out of all the lattes I've tried, my favorites are the birthday cake latte and the nutella latte. Honorable mention goes to the coconut vanilla latte! 

My favorite toasts are the chicken meatball pesto toast and the bacon, cheese and corn toast. The bacon and corn toast is a special so be sure to ask if they have it!

Home is a great place to get some work done, but be wary of their peak hours! I'd recommend going early to get a seat because it can get crowded during the day time. (They also have a 2 hour seating limit but not sure if this is enforced haha)
author: Tara A.

description:
One of my favorite coffee spots ever. I normally always get the coconut vanilla latte, and it's not too sweet. It has a lot of coffee flavor and a subtle taste of coconut. I've also had their Seoul much avocado toast which is amazing as well!

I like the modern design of the inside, super aesthetically pleasing. Lol. Parking when I went wasn't too bad either. I parked at the meters out front. 

I always make it a point to come here whenever I'm in town especially since there aren't that many great coffee spots in the east bay!
author: Gabby A.

description:
On the bus today, we saw two families bump into each other and greeted each other with a smile and a hi, how are you?!  As the lady and her son got off, the mother bid farewell to the other family.
Lady: It was nice seeing you!  Goodbye!  Stay Warm! Merry Christmas and Happy Holidays!
(trailing behind was her son...)
Son: Bye, happy birthday!

That precious moment probably made everyone's day, mine for sure. 

My friend LOVES birthday cake anything; birthday cake cookie, birthday cake macaron, birthday cake brownie, and so when she heard about the Birthday Cake Latte at Home, she had to try it.

Even if it's not your birthday, order the Birthday Cake Latte and the presentation alone will bring a smile to your face.  Take a sip and it will not only warm your belly but satisfy your sweet tooth.

Even if it's not your birthday, pretend like it is.
author: Linda N.

description: Love this place! The coffee is delicious and I love the way they decorate the top of the coffee. The toast was so good! The service is great, and the place is decorated so well. Whenever I return to San Francisco, I will be coming back here!
author: Jasmine J.

description:
Definitely has a "home" feeling. I came here on my lunch break around 1:30pm on a weekday and every table was occupied. Good thing I had to order to go.

Got a warm red velvet latte, and it was delicious. It wasn't overly sweet, which I liked. My latte came with a cute leaf -- I'm always a sucker for latte art. They have interesting things on the menu such as coffee with coke, birthday cake latte, etc.

Can't wait to try their other drink menus next time.
author: Julian Y.

description: Trendy little coffee shop with lots of nice decor. I noticed a lot of kids came here to get their pretty coffees to snap or put on their IG accounts. The coffee itself was not bad, although I'm not a coffee drinker so I can't be a fair judge.
author: Milton F.

description: Cute, busy little coffee shop with interesting drinks. Try going for something fun (there's special drinks on a sign beside the cash register, and not on the menu). Quick, solid coffee and tea options.
author: Kevin N.

description:
Such a cute little coffee spot that often come
out with new and delicious flavored lattes that you can't help but try! I love coming here when I'm in the area, or whenever I'm craving for a new and unique flavored latte. Definitely recommend trying this place out
author: Monica-Leah A.

description: Disclaimer: did not actually order anything here, but after my friends and I consumed coffees and boba guys our bladders were really suffering. We hobbled all the way down from 16th Ave steps searching fruitlessly for civilization... until we stumbled across Home. Because they were closing we couldn't order anything but they let us (party of 6) use the bathroom for free. Truest homies. Pulled through in our darkest hours. Major shoutout.
author: Hairol M.

description:
Hipster coffee done right. 

Love their specialty section of coffee that brings a twist to the traditional boring everyday selection.
author: Kevin W.

description: Took my cousin for her and my first time! Walked in and the place was filled with people. The girl at the register noticed I was looking for a table and kindly offered to ask one of the tables to share their table with us. But by the time we finished ordering, a table was free. It was nice of her to ask. We ordered the infamous birthday cake latte, rose latte, and condensed milk toast. All three were very delicious.
author: Ting Y.

description:
I recently found a coffee shop that I loved, and so I didn't have the highest expectations going into Home. I was absolutely blown away.

My friends ordered a matcha green tea latte iced and a London Fog earl gray latte, and both were extremely satisfactory. I, myself, ordered a rose latte, and it wasn't as sweet as I thought it would be, making it a perfect drink after a long day around SF.

Of course, the latte art was extremely cute, and the next time I come back, this is definitely going to be a stop!
author: Angela L.

description: Home has a chill environment to it and a place I'd do my hwk for sure. Just I never would come here again since I'm a huge fan of matcha and of course I got the matcha latte. It tasted very bland like it was the cheapest matcha they can order. Nothing special with it. But the birthday cake is what they are known for as their other special lattes. So I'm knocking -1 star for bleh matcha but overall the environment was great and the birthday cake latte was good and very different, but tasty. I personally don't like sweet lattes so that's the only reason I'm not attracted to this spot. Great design for the birthday cake though!!
author: Garrett P.

description:
Home is such a lovely neighborhood coffee shop. The staff is super friendly and the service is great. They have a pretty lengthy list of coffee, tea and non-caffeinated drink options as well as several toast selections. 

They are most popular for their creative menu, which includes a birthday cake latte with rainbow latte art, a cookie monster latte flavored and topped with speculoos cookies, and a lavender latte. Their drinks are not too strong or overly sweet. 

Their toasts are pretty delicious! The bread they use is cut so thick and is buttery. I really liked the tomato, truffle oil, and pesto toast, with an added egg. Their condensed milk toast was so good, too. 

This is a great place to do some ready, get a little work done, or catch up with some friends over delicious coffee & toast.
author: Rose A.

description: Love!! Coffee is amazing! And the cute latte art? An added plus. There was a long line on Saturday morning, but the baristas there are amazing. The wait isn't too long, even with the art! I love the ambiance and the natural light they get, and their level of service is excellent. I wouldn't exactly suggest people who want to get work done to come here because it does get busy and naturally, noisy. But there is a good amount of seating if you want to hang out and catch up with a friend.
author: Athena L.
