description: the name says it all. the food feels like homewarm and sweet. i got the sweet and condensed toast and the cookie monster latte! i would come back for the latte everyday it was perfect lots of parking and seating. staff is friendly as well.
author: Alyssa J.

description:
Pros:
One star for getting the drinks fairly quickly and another star for presentation! The birthday cake and jot chocolate was beautifully done. I would give them 2.5 stars because the lady at the counter was able to accommodate a change in our order.

Cons:
On weekends, they only had one counter to allow people to use their laptops and we were told we couldn't use our laptops in the other tables available (minus a star; luckily they let it slide). After arriving there around 2, they also announced that they're closing 2 hours early at 3, without any notice or signs outside (minus another star).

Suggestion: try to expand the location or have long tables and benches/chairs to fit more people. Also, please post a notice that you'll be closing early
author: Jessa May C.

description: A few friends had recommended this place to me because they know I love coffee and lattes in particular. It is a little far out from where I live, but my boyfriend took me here on my birthday to try the popular birthday latte. The woman at the cashier was SUPER friendly and helpful when deciding what we wanted to drink. 10/10 for customer service. As far as the latte goes , this was by far the BEST latte I have ever tasted! Not only does it look pretty but it tastes delicious ! Will definitely be coming back here .
author: Ruby S.

description: I come here often enough that their baristas know my order, by the time I finished paying, my order is ready! I love this place, especially their iced chocolate mint latte, and sometimes they have this chewy mochi thing, it goes really well with whichever coffee you are going to order. Oh, try their toasts as well!
author: Renee L.

description:
Visited on a Friday (day after Thanksgiving) at about 4 PM.

WIFI PW: welcomehome

--AESTHETIC-- Such clean, warm vibes. It's packed with people studying and enjoying themselves. The room is a light gray and all decorations are simplistic and sweet. The menu is written on a huge pull down brown paper scroll, much like a classroom or art studio. A few tables have succulents.

--SEATING-- There's a window bar and long wall of tables. It's rather small (and popular) so it may be difficult to snag a seat.

--MENU-- The menu has a great array of coffees and teas. They also have a toast section if you're feeling hungry. I like how they have a creative section, where the coffees are a little spunkier. 

Coconut Vanilla Latte ($3.75): This is the best latte I've ever had. It's sweet from the vanilla, and aromatic from the coconut and coffee. It's a house favorite, and now I know why. You have a choice of milk, but whole milk is the only complimentary milk choice. Soy milk, for instance, is extra.

Drinks are served in porcelain cups if it's not for to-go. (They accidentally gave it to me in a to-go cup, however). They naturally do latte art, too.

--OVERALL-- If I was from SF, I'd definitely go here for a good study grind and cup of coffee. I wish they didn't charge extra for the milk, though. And being a big tree hugger, I wish I got my coffee in a porcelain cup (but it's ok!).
author: Telena V.

description:
Home is home. It's such a nice cafe to grab a drink and chat with a friend for hours. The size of the cafe is small, so it can be hard to find a good table. I recommend asking to share a table with someone for the meantime until you see another table open up. I also found it odd, but necessary for them to have certain tables that didn't allow electronic devices. 

It's unfortunate that finding a table is such a big issue for some customers, however I think their drink menu kinda makes up for it. I ordered the iced hot chocolate, which tasted like iced chocolate milk and had a scoop of vanilla ice cream on top. It was so delicious! 

All in all, even if there aren't seats to sit down in, do buy a drink to-go!
author: Patricia L.

description: This is LITERALLY my favorite place in San Francisco!!! The coffee is always so good, the staff is crazy friendly, and the place is perfect!! I've had the Iced: Red velvet, mint chocolate, Cookie Monster, and salted caramel. All of them are amazing!
author: Deyanira O.

description: I like their condensed milk latte and the fact they have other specialties. I've also tried their cookie monster.  It's just hard to get friends to come since they think I just want to go home.
author: Ernest M.

description: One of my friends mentioned how I would enjoy the coffee here especially since I'm not a coffee person. She advised me to get the Nutella one since she has a good feeling I would enjoy it. When I got there I saw the Cookie Monster and the birthday cake one. I ended up getting the birthday cake since it looked pretty (I know) but it was very good. My friend got the sea salt caramel and that was very tasty as well. The staff was very friendly and it's very chill. Definitely coming back!
author: Maricela O.

description:
This place is such a cute and "home-y" cafe that I wish I went a lot earlier in the day. I went when they were almost closing and was sadly unable to try out the condensed toast everyone was raving about. I did however try out the birthday cake latte and lavendar jasmine latte. 

Honestly, nothing special about the birthday cake latte. I just tasted whatever but at least it was pretty! If you're just here for that IG pic then get the bday cake. The lavendar jasmine latte however was TO DIE FOR. It definitely hit the right spot with that SF windy weather. The flavor wasn't overly floral and it had a nice light taste to it. Would definitely order again!
author: Connie Y.

description: The drinks here are amazing! The taste and atmosphere are very pleasing. If you want great photos for Instagram, come and get the birthday cake coffee.
author: Susan S.

description:
I've been to Home probably a dozen times since they've been open and have never had a bad experience! In the beginning, the two owners handled everything from taking orders to making the coffee and toast. And they still managed to remember your name and ask how your day was going! As time went on, they hired new employees who are just as friendly and awesome. 

I stopped by during lunch today to pick up a lavender latte for myself and a drip coffee for a colleague. They ran out of drip coffee so I waited several minutes while a new pot was being made. The nice guy behind the counter offered to give me a complimentary second cup of coffee to make up for the wait (which I totally did not mind at all). I didn't take him up on it, but I really appreciated the gesture. My lavender latte was perfect and my colleague really enjoyed her coffee. 

I've had several of their flavored lattes (lavender, chocolate mint, red velvet, etc) and can honestly say that I would recommend them all. This is probably my go-to cafe whenever I'm craving more than a plain latte because of the variety on their menu. I highly recommend Home if you're in this part of town and need to satisfy your coffee fix!
author: Olivia V.

description:
Such a cute concept! Had this bookmarked for days and finally checked it out during our Christmas shenanigans. We ordered the birthday cake latte and a chai tea latte with cinnamon as well as the sausage pesto bread. All were yummy and under $20. Absolutely friendly and sweet customer service, the drinks were delicious, and the toast was a nice filler until we got our busy day started. I for sure will be back to try the other pretty drinks, why not! Also, I loved the decor for the cute little cafe, so home feel, but with a magical twist. 

Only one star was docked because it's really hard to get seats here. You are most likely going to have to wait for 10 minutes, share with someone, or go outside. Aside from that I love this place next time I will come earlier, so I can get my seat and enjoy all the goodies they offer. Thank you Home, for being so welcoming to me!
author: S S.

description:
Not coming home again 


Both toasts came out cold, the latte art was beautiful but the taste wasn't great. We tried the Nutella (which really didn't have much Nutella flavor), the Cookie Monster (which personally the biscoff latte at pier 39 was better), the birthday cake latte (which was pretty sugary but didn't taste like cake. Just looked like a unicorn fart), and the lavender tea latte (which was fine but underwhelming). 


Maybe it was the over hype we were hearing about this place but sadly it seemed more like it was just trying to be an Instagram trend. 


If you're a fan for coffee, it's probably worth skipping, but if you like fun drinks and don't care about the coffee then this place will probably be a smash hit. No knock on any of the staff. They were very nice. For a place called "Home" it wasn't very "Homely" the interior was maybe a dorm room or a bachelor pad but Home? No it didn't have that warm cozy feeling. 


Honestly one of the worst reviews I've given a place that didn't give bad customer service, that's how disappointed we all were by this place. Hopefully they can tighten up their food program a bit.
author: Kanoa U.

description: Love their toast and diff flavor latte. Had red velvet, lavender, birthday and matcha which is my fav. Service is good too
author: Christy V.

description:
Full disclaimer: I do not drink coffee. I do however, drink teas. Their earl grey is great, so that makes me happy already :)
Hubby said their lattes are very good. 
BUT, BUT! Their toasts... or the toasts! I do my best to not eat bread in my day to day life, but their toast, I just can't... it is irresistible! I love the "in the basket" one and the condensed milk one. I would love to know how they make them, actually, scratch that. If I learn to make it, I will make it all the time and it is definitely NOT good for me,

LOVE this place, people are also super friendly!
author: Nastia R.

description:
This place is so simplistic and aesthetically pleasing, I fell in love with the place the moment I walked in! From the moment I stepped inside, we were welcomed with warm smiles. The coffee is also divine! I had the Birthday Cake Latte and also tried the coke-tastic (expresso, coke and ice cream). 

What really stood out to me was the amazing customer service. They truly made me feel at home! If you're a latte art lover like me, you know a picture is worth a thousand words. Annie (the nicest cashier/barista I've ever met) went above and beyond to make sure I was satisfied with my order. I had ordered my drink to drink there but they gave it to me in the to-go cup since they ran out of mugs. Annie knew I was looking forward to take pictures of the latte art so she came up to my table and let me know that when they get more clean mugs washed she would have them re-make my drink. Coffee that is carefully crafted and artistically decorated is worth enjoying A true symbol or a promise from the barista creating the drink!

Definitely try it out! You won't regret it!
author: Mavy A.

description:
The crew working here was so sweet and friendly even though they were very busy.  We loved meeting them because we had found them on instagram before our vacation started.  It was fun to see the beautiful drinks in person.

The decorated lattes and hot cocoa were amazing.  Beautiful and delicious!!  

The food was freshly made and super yummy!!
author: Renee M.

description:
Very cute place. Decently sized. Alot of tables. Wifi! Decor is very cute and pretty!

Customer service is good and nice.

Ordered several lattes here. Hazelnut and lavender. Drinks are delicious. Foamy. Not too sweet.

Tried the toast with condensed milk as well. It was good but a little bit too sweet for my liking.

Overall very cute coffee shop with good drinks and nice customer service!
author: Michele G.

description:
This cafe is just adorable! 
Got just a latte though I should have tried a special (they have rose latte, lavender, coconut vanilla, and more and they all look sooo good)
author: Connie H.

description:
Reasonable line up and decent foods :) !
I loved their lattes. Tried birthday cake and mocha, full of flavor and unique!
author: Sunmin C.

description: Drinks are good, nice and cozy environment. But I can't say their lattes are perfect, still can improve.
author: Yuna Y.

description: I loved this cafe! As a barista from Seattle it's really difficult to find coffee I actually enjoy but the baristas here at Home knew exactly what they were doing. I got the birthday cake latte which is flavored with vanilla and my boyfriend got the Cookie Monster. Both were delicious and very well balanced. My sister in law got a latte with soy and it tasted just as good. The baristas are friendly and knowledgeable about their menu and local attractions. They gave great suggestions for my family and I and we really appreciated their hospitality. They really did make us feel at home!! Special shoutout to Emerald! It was her first day and she was already doing fantastic!
author: Ashleen K.

description:
I've been eyeing this place for awhile because of its aesthetics, but honestly if I knew that their toast and lattes were THAT bomb I would've visited sooner. 

Today I visited w/ my friend due to a spontaneous city adventure. I ordered the birthday cake latte and tomato cheese toast w/ pesto, and my friend ordered the hazelnut latte.

My first impression was that the place was super cute and aesthetic. It's a nice place to hang out with friends and grab coffee. The only thing I would change is the amount of tables; we were scared we weren't going to get a seat when our lattes were ready. 
 In addition, our order actually got lost and I had to ask them if they were making it (after waiting for 20 minutes). They apologized and one of the guys working was nice enough to offer us a toast on the house. He was super sweet! But I didn't get to catch his name.

But anyways, the lattes and toast were good!

Birthday cake latte 10/10, the guy even made my latte art 10x better than I thought it was going to be - it was a swan instead of a typical heart/Rosetta.

Tomato cheese toast - 11/10. It was expensive but so worth it. Savor every bite because I promise you will miss it once it's gone.

Chicken meatball w/ pesto - 7/10. We got this on the house and wished we ordered another tomato cheese toast. The meatballs were a bit too salty for me but the pesto was solid.

Overall, this place is definitely one to check out if you're in the city. Thank you Home for the wonderful lattes, toast, and especially the amazing service! I will definitely be back soon to try the condensed milk toast and other creative lattes!
author: Sandy L.

description: I had the birthday latte and a little strawberry pastry! The strawberry pastry was above average. The latte was so cayoot! And also very sweet which I liked. The line was pretty long and it was hipster central for sure. There were people doing homework there which is an unfathomable idea to be because of the noise level there. It was very cute!
author: Tilly D.

description: I loved the atmosphere here, it was so cute and no better way to say it than "home-y"! Although the food and coffee was alright...I think I would come back for the cuteness of it!!
author: Angelica T.

description:
Started my new year at home!! So excited to finally get the chance to head down here with my friend and it wasn't too crazy that day which worked out great!

The birthday latte didn't disappoint! Love the ambiance and honestly, the lady at the counter was sooo sweet that I felt like I was welcomed home!

But with any good place and instagram worthy products, you'll always get a line so please be patient and have some time before you come or go during the weekday! No toast for me that day since it was sold out but can't wait to go back! :)
author: Ellie W.

description:
Nice hip coffee shop to get some work done. Trendy and modern atmosphere crowded with youngins alike focusing on their computers. 

Says there is a courteous 2 hour table occupying time limit but it's not enforced and I don't see people really leaving within that frame. When I've been here, I always see a few open spots by the window free so it's never fully packed. 

Have tried the iced latte and cold brew both on rare sunny SF days. Both were refreshing and gave a nice boost of energy to focus on my oh so exciting apps. Want to try some of the specialty drinks some day. 

Can't think off the top of my head a hip coffee shop in the area, so I guess I will be back! And kudos on the self serve ice water
author: Carissa G.

description:
A must stop for your daily coffee fix or study place! From the drinks to the ambiance, this place really has it down! 

Every time I've been here both the lattes, and toasts have been phenomenal! All the times I've been here (mornings) there's been seating. It's so quaint and cozy inside, the interior is pretty home-ey haha. 

Coffee recommendation: I've liked everything I've tried so far! (Some might be on the sweeter side, so check it out with the Barista)
author: Kim N.

description:
What a great selection of lattes and toast. Omg. Home is the perfect spot for a perfectly made latte. They have all the usual classic espresso drinks, but they're definitely known for their creative, more specialized drinks. I ordered the lavender latte with soy milk and I was so pleased. There was the perfect amount of foam, art work was gorgeous, and not too sweet. The aroma of lavender was light and not too overwhelming. 

They close early and parking is hard to find, but if you appreciate a nicely crafted cup of latte, you just visit this spot. On another note, there are also outlets throughout the small cafe, which makes it a good place to study. However, there's a two hour limit for table.
author: Diane T.

description: I ordered a lavender latte and holy cow latte. I was pretty disappointed with both because it tasted like just a regular latte :/ I was expecting a more potent flavor of lavender. The holy cow had a similar taste as the lavender latte but it was little sweeter! I think I'll give it another shot based on previous reviews. I do think the price doesn't not equate to the portion of the food. But I guess you do pay for the beautiful latte artwork and aesthetic purposes. I do want to try their toasts though!
author: Sarah F.

description: This place is great!! They let my friends and I use the bathroom as they were closing
author: Havannah T.

description:
There is an abundance of hipster coffee shops in the city and Home is one of them. I've been to Home a couple of times now and it's always been quite pleasant. The location is nice for all of us Sunsetters because it's a decent coffeeshop..in Sunset. LOL. Parking is easy because it's in Sunset. The cafe itself is very spacious, plenty of seating, well-lit, and there is an ample amount of power outlets. However, I will say that they sometimes play the music TOO loud for a cafe LOL. I go here to do work and I usually listen to music from my headphones so I don't really need to hear more music blasting in the background on top of that, especially since they don't play like normal coffeeshop music all the time (sometimes it gets a little like R&B vibey/too much going on and not so much acoustic chill, let me sip my coffee and be a burrito blanket type of music, ya know what I mean?)  

The coffee is decent. I've gotten a cappuccino, a nutella latte, and tried their drip coffee and I gotta say hipster coffee is hipster coffee. It's pricy for a cup of joe, but you pay for the atmosphere I guess? The hipsterness? LOL. The actual quality of the coffee is decent. I've had better. But it's definitely not bad, it's decent. The food here is tasty also. They have a lot of different toast combinations and all the ones I've tried are very good. However, once again it's pricy but tasty. I think that's why I'm not head over heels for this place. The fact that it's so overpriced for what it is. It's easy to spend ~$10 here just for a piece of toast and caffeine. But sigh. That's SF for ya! Anyways, overall I like this coffee shop. It's a nice place to get work done and it's got good coffee/food. Be warned: it gets crazy packed by like 9:30/10 AM.
author: Amy T.

description:
This is a great place for 'tea/coffee time' with your friends. The staffs are super nice and polite. They thank each and every customer for being so patience and swinging by to try the famous birthday cake latte! 

Dranks: Coconut Vanilla Latte - I was surprised that you  actually taste coconut AND vanilla. The foam art was super cute and made it more enjoyable.

Affogato Coffee - Very insta pic worthy! The best part is, they give you a WAFFLE CONE! 

Birthday Cake Latte- I added a shot of espresso because I usually don't like my lattes too sweet. The barista was very honest about the sweetness which i'm giving her my 2 thumbs up!

Toast:
Chicken Meatball Pesto Toast - WORTH every single calories! Especially with the EGG! 
Tomato and cheese toast - Pretty standard, tomato was sweet and fresh.

The only downside of coming here on the WEEKENDS is the line and seating. A lot of students would come here and stay more many many many many hours on their laptop leaving the rest of the customers either standing or force to take it togo without fully experiencing this cafe.
author: Cyndi L.

description: Cute hole in the wall coffee shop. Was pretty packed! The drinks are very unique and the service was good! We got the coconut vanilla latte and the red velvet latte. The flavors were really strong and tasted delicious, but they were lukewarm :/ would have been a lot better if they were hotter.
author: Elise P.

description: I SPILLED MY PERFECTLY SWIRLED SWAN LATTE ART: (not clickbait) Yes, it was a sad day for latte-fanatics in the Bay Area and around the world. Although, my friend on the other hand has a seem-less hand-eye coordination, and so she maintain a perfect swirl on hers. Our drinks are called Birthday Cake--the taste was subtly good and energizing. I decided to pair it with a "weekend special" toast which comprised of bacon, mozzarella cheese, and corn sprinkled on a well-crafted crunchy toast. Overall, the experience was great--ambience epitomized a café, toast + latte art paired well, and the customer service was friendly. It is worth the morning wait on the weekends.
author: Ryan E.

description:
This is a pretty hipster latte place that is pretty decent. They make very creative drinks. Average price is about $5. The plus side is that every drink comes with a double shot in it. They do have some good breakfast items. 
I would recommend the red velvet latte. It does get pretty busy in the morning.
author: Kevin S.

description:
Came here AGAIN & tried the tomato truffle oil pesto toast w/ an egg & bacon crumbs also tried the condensed milk toast, now I can officially say I've tried everything on their menu & everything tastes bomb.

Also tried the birthday cake latte (good but nothing too special)
Lavender latte would be my favorite 

~~~~~~~~
The food, the ambiance, the variety of what's on the menu. Definitely would come back. 

I tried the eggs in a basket & chicken meatball pesto. Made to perfection & wouldn't be surprised if the rest on the menu won't come short.
author: Precious C.

description:
Missing Vancouver's London Fog so I came here to try their latte!

Upon arriving an hour before closing Saturday, line was quite short and seats were very scarce. I ordered a London Fog Latte and Birthday Cake Latte. I made sure to drink the London Fog first since the cashier kindly let me know the Birthday Cake was on the sweeter side to not skew my tastebuds. The LF was more like an earl grey tea latte, not enough hints of vanilla and if anything, was watered down. I was disappointed it didn't match Vancouver's but the Birthday Cake made up for it! It was nice and creamy and not overly sweet until you get to the bottom where the sprinkles linger. 

Would definitely want to come back to try their other creative drinks. Skip the London Fog if you're longing for Vancouver.
author: Anny H.

description:
Guys, I don't even know where to start!  The cafe was super cute, and I still can't get over how great the name is. When I walked in, several friendly faces greeted me and welcomed me "home."  Brilliant, right? Anywho, the boyf and I hit up their cafe at 9:30 on a Monday, and it was BUSTLING. 

I've been obsessed with Home for months now! I stumbled upon their instagram and knew I just HAD to try their lattes and toast.  After studying their menu for a while, my boyfriend and I decided to get three lattes and two toasts.  I wanted to get insta-worthy shots (obviously) so I went with the more creative concoctions, but everything sounded awesome, and I have no doubt they would've looked just as beautiful.  I was tempted by the lavender and matcha lattes, but I ultimately decided to order the birthday cake, cookie monster, and nutella lattes.

All three drinks looked AND tasted totally amazing. Although I loved them all, my fave was the birthday cake drank.  At first glance, I thought it'd be too sweet, but it was perfect in every way.  I half expected unicorns to appear and dance around me as I sipped my coffee by the window, ha.

Their toast was bomb as well.  They were several delish options available so it was a tough decision, but we decided to try one savory and one sweet.  I can't remember the exact names, but I'll describe 'em to y'all so you know exactly what to get.  

The first one had egg, tomato and pesto and the second was drenched with condensed milk... or should I say magical condensed milk?  I mean, these were ridiculously nomtastic.  I didn't think they could top drinks, but honestly, I think I enjoyed the food even more than the coffee.  The texture of the toast was amazeballs, and both flavor profiles were out of this world.  The condensed milk was weirdly addicting - I could've easily devoured 2 (or maybe 3) of these babies!  Anywho, don't take my word for it, go and try everything yourself!  I have no doubt you'll have an awesome experience so you're welcome in advance.
author: Kimberly K.

description: Home does the most beautiful espresso art you've ever seen!!! Super friendly staff, creative lattes (flavors too) and great tasting coffee. The coffee itself exceeded my expectations too! I wish there were a Home in Seattle.
author: Katie K.

description: Probably the most beautiful coffee I've ever had.  Service was super nice, friendly, and fast.  Very clean chill environment.  Only downside is that you have to pay for parking.  I got the birthday cake latte.
author: Johanna P.

description:
If you have ever wondered where to grab a snack, coffee, or espresso drink in the Sunset District then look no further than Home.  I have passed by here so many times heading to 19th ave to get to school but today I had to grab a latte. 

I have been to Green Bamboo, which is next door a couple times and every time I go there I always want to grab a cup of java from Home. 

Most of my friends have been to Home and they always talk about the lavender lattes here. I always thought it was just a myth about how good the lattes are here but I was proven wrong today.

As I entered Home today the first thing I noticed was the lighting inside. It was not overly dark nor bright but balanced enough to where the seated customers could do work on their laptops and read their books. It seems like the crowd that then to come here are college students and young business professionals. There are several tables and some window seating as well. There is enough room that you can maneuver around this place and not bump into tables or other customers.

I went to the counter to review the menu and they offer coffee, espresso drinks, and a few pastries as well. I knew I was ordering the lavender latte but I also wanted to get something sweet but not too much to go along with my drink. One of the items that they offer is toast. Now, the toast that they offer here is not just your ordinary toast out of the toaster. They have toast that comes with various spreads. The item that jumped off the menu was the Condensed milk toast! I had no idea what I was in for but it was definitely excited for it based on the name. 

After placing my order I waited for a short time for my order to be prepared. There is a very relaxing vibe that it present here. Unlike Starbucks, there is no infestation of customers and excessive laptops and cell phone chatter. Instead, there an inviting and warming atmosphere that is reflected in the staff and business. There is a want and desire to find a place to sit while here and enjoy your food or drink. 

Once my food was finally ready I was on my way. I opened my food container with my toast as soon as I got to my car. Let me just say that I was ecstatic for my toast and my latte. The toast looked some warm and fresh that I had to take a bite. My first bite of this toast was like tasting ice cream for the first time. I knew that I was going to like it but I did not know that I was going to LOVE IT. The toast was soft, flavorful, sweet, and a bit creamy. Just an abundance of flavors bursting from this one piece of toast. The reviews about this place are truly right on. The toast here is clearly life changing because I am now a HUGE fan of this place.

As for the lavender latte, the aroma of the latte is relaxing but there was nothing overly extravagant about the drink. I liked the taste and the balance of espresso to the milk and foam in the drink but it was alright. I get the allure of this particular drink but it doesn't necessarily blow me away like the toast. 

I would have to say that HOME knows how to cater to the local demographic. In being a cafe in the Sunset district their menu seems to be geared towards 20 and 30 year olds. I could almost see this place as a smart cafe if that was the direction that they wanted to take here. The setup here is already somewhat reflective of a smart cafe but either way this cafe is a reflection of the community around it. 

They make good lattes and AMAZING toast. What else really needs to be said. Don't believe me! Come on in for yourself and check it out.
author: Robert F.

description: A cute and hectic spot, I loved everything about this café.  The "welcome home" greeting is so sweet, the effort they put in creating the lattes, and the flavors are all what make this unique space a great stop for caffeine. I ordered the rose petal latte and enjoyed every sip; my friend got the condensed milk latte and really liked it too. The aesthetic is on point, and the prices are fantastic for such pretty coffee. I can't wait to come back!
author: Mina D.

description:
Absolutely love this cafe! Everything from the ambiance and service to the food and the coffee is amazing. Tons of tables but it does tend to get pretty crowded (especially on weekends), and they ask that you don't stay longer than 2 hours. The cafe has a really cute modern/hipster feel and is very sleek. Easy to find and a good amount of metered parking outside!

I got a chocolate mint latte and the pesto meatball toast. Beautiful presentation for both! The toast was absolutely delicious - a thick piece of bread that was crispy on the edges but soft and buttery on the inside, topped with flavorful meatballs and pesto. The latte was good too, but it got cold pretty quickly. I'd love to try the other drinks and menu items, and I'd love to come back!!
author: Kathy C.

description: Cute cozy little place to have a hand crafted coffee. Their avocado toast is scrumptious! Love the simplicity & diversity. Great place to enjoy great company. Cannot wait to return. There's no place like Home.
author: Rae T.

description: This was one of the trendiest and cutest breakfast/brunch place! I think their lattes are reasonably priced for the amount they give you&they are also really pretty! I went with my friend and i ordered the birthday cake latte which wasnt as sweet as I thought it'd be since I thought it would be super sweet cause its birthday cake flavored but it tasted like espresso so that was really nice! I ordered the milk&cereal toast which was super good! My friend ordered the cookie butter latte which also wasn't super sweet so that was really nice cause you still get your daily dose of caffeine :) she got the abb's toast which is strawberrys and bananas on a toast!
author: Tiffany W.

description:
Loved this place! Super nice staff, delicious drinks, fast wifi, ample seating. 

I had the birthday cake latte and lavender latte, which a lot of people seem to order. With good reason, because they're both phenomenal. I also had the cinnamon sugar toast, which was simple but very well prepared. 

Can't wait to make it back here and spend more time working!
author: Aidan S.

description: Love this place! Delicious coffee and very peaceful atmosphere. Can get really crowded on the weekends but definitely worth the wait.
author: Gia M.

description:
I'M HOME!!! 
TL;DR: Recommendations: Coconut Vanilla Latte and Chicken Meatball with Pesto.

Home is so cool. I really like their decor; feels comfortable. You have the window bar seat, tables, and pillows to sit on if you're by the wall. They have string lights and light up letters HOME. There are succulents on the tables and shelf. Their menu looks like a scroll so that's creative. You'll only see the available drinks on the wall; the toasts are by the counter.

Lines are long. I arrived [at] Home around 11am and the line was by the door. It was a 20-30 minute wait to get to the counter. Once at the counter, you tell the nice young lady what you would like to order. There's a nice selection of lattes and toast you could choose from. I ordered Iced Hazelnut Latte, Iced Coconut Vanilla Latte, Egg in a Basket Toast, Tomato Truffle Oil Pesto Toast, and Chicken Meatball with Pesto Toast. I swear it was shared. I'm not fat :(

Iced Hazelnut Latte - Too much latte, not enough hazelnut. I think I expected more of a nutella drink but sadly, it wasn't.

Iced Coconut Vanilla Latte - I liked this one because it was a heavy coconut flavor. It was the right amount of sweetness too. I would recommend this one if you like coconut and sweet drinks.

Egg in a Basket with Bacon - This was good. It's a little bit on the plain side without the bacon IMO.

Tomato Truffle Oil Pesto - Loooove pesto. This had a lot of flavor and it was sooo yummyyy.

Chicken Meatball with Pesto - hands down, my FAVORITE of the 3 toasts I tried. The meatball was soooooooo taaaastttttyyyyyyy. The pesto just added to its deliciousness. Drooling as I type this.

Will be coming back in the VERY near future!
author: Benita M.

description: This place is nice and quaint! Came here around 8 am and no one was around. Had my birthday cake latte (it was sweet to me but not overly sweet). Also had the sugar toast. Both were delicious! Would def come back to come try more drinks and this time a savory toast. Prices are decent and staff is wonderful. Can't wait to come back!
author: Tina D.

description: The cutest coffee shop in the city! I ordered the Rose Latte iced and it was heaven. If any of y'all are into that latte aesthetic artsy stuff, then this is your go-to spot. Overall it's a friendly, bright, and Home-y vibe..
author: Josh B.

description:
Super cute little cafe in the city! I've been here a few times and the coffee is good! I find myself very productive when doing homework at coffee shops so I'm glad I found this place. Only downside is that they restrict some tables to customers who are not there to study so that the tables don't become occupied for hours. Totally understandable. If you plan to come on a weekend to study, make sure you go early to snag a table. 

The coffee and toasts here are really good. My favorite latte so far is the sea salt caramel iced latte. Yum! Their toast with toppings is the perfect pairing to coffee and small enough to snack on while studying.
author: Lushi Z.

description:
Greeted by a great barista who welcomed me home. I asked if the birthday cake latte was sweet because personally, I don't like sweet drinks. He simply addressed my concern by saying they could make it not sweet. 

Got my order and took an instagram worthy photo. #basic I gave it a sip and I am impressed. The design is beautifully crafted and it tasted amazing(not sweet just how I like it). Will definitely swing by when I am in the area.
author: Elim K.

description:
Addicted to their coffee?!??! Hell yea!! I have been coming here at least once a week this month because I want to try all the special flavors they have to offer! So far my favorite is Lavender Latte with almond milk! 

Pros: Everything is good!!
Cons:Lines are long and on the pricey end for coffee with almond milk.
author: Tiffany C.

description: Home is probably one of the cutest coffee shops I've been to. They have an expansive list of uniquely flavored lattes like, the birthday cake, Cookie Monster, and a Nutella latte. I went there and ordered a rose latte while my friend got the red velvet one. Both lattes were great, I would've preferred mine hotter, but you can simply ask the barista to make yours at a hotter temperature when ordering the drink.
author: Sarah R.

description:
Absolutely in LOVE with this cafe! If you haven't checked it out already, definitely add it to your "must-go-to" list.

Drinks:
* birthday cake latte +5/5
Not only is it beautiful to look at, but it also tastes amazing. But even if it didn't taste that great, just look at it.. it's so pretty! 
* holy cow latte +4.5/5
My bf ordered this one & loved it! It's the condensed milk latte & surprisingly not too sweet either. 

Food:
* Chicken meatball toast +5/5
Wow, this was gooooood. Make sure to add an egg on top too because it's a necessary finish touch. 

It tends to get pretty packed so if you want to secure a spot to study/get work done, come early! Also, the service is amazing & the Asian girl at the counter is soooo sweet (I wish I could remember her name to give her a shoutout ). Can't wait to come back & try the rest of the menu. :)
author: Rachel Y.

description: I came here on a rainy day with a friend to do work and ordered a rainbow latte. I was afraid it would be too sweet, but you can customize it to your liking! Not only is the decor spacious, the drinks are super pretty and great for pictures. The only thing is that there are not that many outlets available so make sure your electronics are charged before coming here!
author: Amy W.

description: Very cute and cozy atmosphere! The toast was delicious and prepared beautifully. I ordered chicken meatball pesto and added an egg on top, cooked just how I like it. Had to try the much talked about (and photographed) birthday cake latte, which did not disappoint. It's sweet, but not overwhelmingly. Definitely give this place a try! But keep in mind that it does get crowded, so getting a seat might be tricky at busy times.
author: Alicia E.

description:
I actually came here on the day of my birthday to get the birthday cake latte. It's pretty and totally something you would post on IG, but it did not taste that great. I love birthday cake flavor in general and though it was that. I guess just how it looks is "birthday cake". It tasted like a regular unsweetended latte. Not really impressed. I also got the chicken meatball pesto toast which was pretty good, but I wasn't super impressed either. I felt like I could have easily made that at home with my bread, jar of pesto and my frozen meatballs.

Overall, it's a cute place with free wifi (the ask that you only stay for 2 hours though), but the food and drink I had was just mediocre.
author: Sophia Y.

description:
This place is really small and cute. The decor is adorable :)

Free wifi and a good ish amount of tables. 

Parking isn't that bad in this area on weekdays! It's 2 hour parking around the neighborhood :). 

The iced red velvet latte is my favorite here! It's really yummy. My friend tried the hazelnut latte, which was less sweet but still good.
author: Melanie T.

description: Beautiful coffee shop! I got the rose latte and it had gorgeous latte art and a great aroma as well. Lighting in here is good and a lot of people come to study. Friendly staff too! A nice place to meet up and chat for hours. Everything about this place is creative
author: Isabelle N.

description: Artistic Instagram worthy coffee!! Recommend the rose latte. The toasts seem yum too but I didn't get a bite lol
author: Alicia Xiaorong Z.

description: I stopped by with some friends when I was in town. The barista recommended trying one of their most popular latte's, The Birthday Cake Latte. It was presented very nicely and appealing to the eye, but not very fond of the taste. It tasted like a regular latte but sweeter than usual (I'm not a big fan of super sweet drinks). My boyfriend ordered the Pesto Chicken toast with an egg on top and the hazelnut iced latte. I liked the hazelnut Latte better than mine, very refreshing and tasted very good, not too sweet and not too bitter. I recommend that one instead. The toast was very thick of bread, and the chicken was okay. Not worth the $7.50 price on my opinion. Overall, I like their motto and the ambience, very hipster and cute. I'd go with their iced lattes better than the hot ones. I would go again but this time go with their iced drinks.
author: Joscelynne R.

description:
I love the pretty gimmick but the interior aesthetic overall is still a little harsh (to me) - although I can still appreciate it makes a nice IG background. 

I can't really fault the delightfully silly lattes for being too sweet - but they are. It's not a surprise that they look better than they taste,and the main point seems to be photographing them, but it's still a bit of a shame to me.
author: Lisa K.

description: The lattes here make me soooo happy! Visiting from LA for a week and looking for study locations other than Starbucks and immediately fell in love with the photos from this cafe. We were dying to try this place. It's packed and people have to expect to share tables and shuffle around but very nice vibe. Beautiful Christmas music is playing in the background and good enough that I didn't want to drown it out with my own earplugs. There are power outlets every 2-3 tables so you can stayed powered up so long as you're polite about running a cord under someone's feet if not immediately next to one. I tried their red velvet latte and egg in a basket toast. The toast was fluffy, lightly crispy, buttery, herby, and eggy. The drink is a nice milky mocha and very red. This place put me in a good mood.
author: Sara C.

description:
This is a pretty cute little cafe and I came by to try some toast and a unique flavored latte. I got just what I wanted! I came here on a weekday afternoon and business was pretty good! It wasn't crowded thankfully, so I was able to get a table here and work as well as eat. They say that you only get a 2 hour limit on your tables though, so that other people can also sit and enjoy. The staff here is very friendly and made it feel like HOME.

With all the choices, I finally settled on the Holy Cow condensed milk latte and the condensed milk toast. I went with everything condensed milk and was really satisfied with what I ordered. The condensed milk latte was very unique and was just the right amount of sweet. The condensed milk toast was really heavy and filling and was a bit too sweet for my taste. I did enjoy both items I got and will probably come back for more in the future! The staff say the lavender latte is quite popular here. I would definitely recommend this place!
author: Catherine S.

description:
Found this gem, while looking for a quick sit down morning stop with a coworker. Such a cool spot to start the morning and the place has so much character with it's clean lines decor. I appreciate the feel and ambiance of the space created.

Ended up getting a "Hangover," which is a sparking americano. Some fizzies with that kick needed to jump start the morning. Also ended up getting the chicken pesto meatball toast and went for the egg on top. Everything you need in a plated breakfast onto a piece of thick toast. A taste of weekend brunch for the weekday. Will come back to try out the other toasts they have to offer!
author: Vincent L.

description:
I can't say I have the greatest experience at this location. Their craft of lattes are great, but the customer service was a bit tad meh me after im not sure if she was the shift manager or what. 

I asked if they can do a Birthday Cake Latte but with out the latte. The cashiers was able to accommodate, we can do it, but it will have to be sprinkles, perfect ok lets do it I reply.  but then, who ever she was shift manager what ever side swiped and added her 2 cents by saying "we don't normally do this but this is an exception and only this one time" you have high chairs but you don't have time or want to put a tad bit of sprinkles on a drink which the purpose was stated for a kid. (Smh)

Deep down inside I have the Wicked Witch of the East laugh. Let's set the record straight your business is in the Sunset.... its surrounded by families with young children too, you can only put sprinkles this one time on steamed milk for a kid? Well look minus 3 stars. You're giving me the impression that this isn't a kid friendly place. I definitely will not be coming back here. This is SF everything is friendly, dog friendly, special needs friendly, and kid friendly. I feel bad on this is how your business was represented today for me. Hopefully this review acts as a constructive criticism to help you adjust your business to its community.
author: Conchita B.

description:
Sweet, clean interior. Cutesy decor. Comfortable. Not a lot of knickknack. Just pristine tables and cozy seating. Good Wi-Fi, great coffee and easy going vibes. Loved my salted caramel almond milk latte. Wasn't really feeling the toast. Wish they had a wider selection of food stuff. Place was rocking when I got in there. Almost every seat taken. Chill music playing. I understand its popularity. There is something very HOMEY about it.

Extra Credit: ice water pitcher with cups on a  separate table. I drink a lot of water and I hate asking for it. Sanitary water cooler dispensers are my jam! YUH!
author: Rosalyn W.

description:
Coconut vanilla latte.  Just get it. 
Just smooth, slightly sweet goodness with a hint of coconut. Delicious. 

Wonderful flavors that I will slowly check off each time I'm in the neighborhood include: Red Velvet Latte, Birthday cafe, even affogato.
author: Denise M.

description:
It's like breakfast at home!

I was visiting a friend is SF when I came here on a rainy Monday morning, and walking into this place I just felt all sorts of comfort and coziness. I just loved the atmosphere and the decoration in this café, it's a great place to study or catch up with friends.

The staff was super friendly and helpful, and talking to them definitely brightened up my day! So I started my day with the Iced Chocolate mint latte and the Tomato Pesto Truffle toast!  Both items did not disappoint,

All I can say is, next time I return to the bay area I'll definitely come back here for breakfast again!
author: Querida X.

description:
Came here for Sunday brunch and found parking right in front. My friend and I ordered the tomato, truffle oil, pesto toast with fried egg, condensed milk and butter toast for dessert, a matcha latte, and the lavender latte. It was delicious! To be honest I didn't think one piece of toast would fill me up. I thought I would still be hungry after that, but boy was I wrong! Surprisingly my friend and I got soo full. Their toast is super thick and cut just right. 

Everything about this cafe is aesthetically pleasing. It's modern and hip. They also have little signs on the table that say "enjoy each others company. No laptops here please". But I saw like three people on their f*cking laptops! This place can get so packed and they're taking up all the seats/tables! Wtf! This cafe is not for that. Go to Starbucks or something.. 

Anyways I will come back to try their birthday cake latte!
author: Jamie G.

description:
Home serves a variety of flavored coffees and teas, with a nice, simplistic touch. Be sure to have one of their toasts alongside, as they're so delicious!

The chicken meatball pesto toast was exceptional. The chicken meatball slices were juicy and succulent, and the pesto and freshly grated cheese also added extra savoriness. The edges of the toasted bread were very crispy and the thickness of the slice helped absorb all the juices from the sausage (and runny egg yolk if added on).

The lavender latte was delicious and creamy. The dried lavender buds sprinkled on top were pretty, and the drink overall had the right amount of floral essence. I also recommend the matcha latte, which has a deep, earthy flavor.

Service is top-notch and super friendly. The cafe is always packed, so consider yourself lucky if you find an empty table, especially on the weekends.
author: Priscilla W.

description:
We regularly order holy cow and lavender latte. Quality and flavor is no longer consistent....please retrain your new hires. 

On a good note, thanks for regulating on the laptops.
author: Margaret O.

description: I had the lavender almond Milk latte and it was absolutely delicious. So smooth and just the right temperature. Beautiful too!
author: Nicole K.

description: If a unicorn were to open up a coffee bar this would be it! Crisp white cafe with the most fun, colorful and happy inducing treats & drinks. You will find yourself smiling with every sip or bite.
author: Ruby C.

description:
I liked it. Didn't 100% love it.

Good- super cute Space. Ok staff. 
Bad-understaffed. The lavender pieces on top of my drink were better on my latte than in my mouth ;)

Lavender latte with almond milk- $0.75 for almond milk, ouch. Plus $4.50 for the latte. Enjoyable? Kinda. Espresso worked? Yeah.

I wanted to check out the toast but ehhh.... Not very appealing today.
author: Michelle C.

description:
The interior design of this cafe was very homey and modern. I stopped by here on a Sunday to get some work done but wasn't able to focus due to how noisy it got. I wouldn't consider this cafe a study cafe at all...more of a catch-up kind of spot! Many people ordered their bread dishes and were chit chatting. PLUS the seats were so close that it was impossible not to be distracted.

PROS:
-clean
-spacious
-nice workers

CONS:
-may get very noisy, AVOID WEEKENDS
-coffee on the pricy side
author: Mary L.

description: 4.5 stars for this excellent little cafe in the outer Sunset neighbourhood! They have an excellent selection of lattes and other speciality espresso drinks! Crowded like theres no tomorrow but you can always get a space at a shared table and meet folks. I also go the Egg in a basket.. so delicious.. picture a brioche toast with a fried egg with runny yolk inside.. very savory french toast-ish! Will be back if i'm in the area!
author: Sudipto G.

description: Drinks were really good got my husband a birthday cake latte for his birthday and a coconut vanilla latte for myself and two pastries. For a Saturday pretty busy but staff has very nice very friendly gave great service. First time here like the menu a lot and it's a very nice & clean place.
author: Michele T.

description:
As soon as you walk in you see a sign that states this place exists because two people met and fell in love, which was sweet. (Low-key regretting not snapping a photo for this review now.)

The staff, which seemed to be fully female at the time I went in, was incredibly nice and friendly. The girls were all really sweet and talkative. One helped us get seated because we weren't aware that the shop encouraged shared seating. Which makes the environment seem more communal and furthers this idea of friendliness.

The toast I got with corn and bacon was a nice treat, and almost as aesthetically pleasing as the lattes. We ordered a lavender latte and a birthday cake latte; The baristas are very talented. This is definitely a place to stop in if you appreciate great service and cute latte art for your Instagram.
author: Elliott F.

description:
I got the birthday cake latte and it was beautiful as always. I was very surprised how good it was because I thought my latte was going to be super sweet and a "birthday cake latte" didn't really sound appetizing to me. But I'm glad that I got it because in my opinion, it tasted more like a vanilla latte. Also, customer service is great here. The staff was very kind and welcoming.

Thank you for reaching my expectations, keep up the good work!
author: Chloe C.

description: very "cute" place that's far off the beaten path, but still packed nonetheless. I assume most of the patrons were UCSF students or adjacent folks. Anyway, it was kind of hard to get a table but my fiancee and I were able to get there. We had a lavender latte (which my fiancee said was not quite lavendery enough), a coconut vanilla latte (far outside what I normally get, but I wanted to do something different. it was pretty good, the tomato toast, which was really tasty, and a coffee cake thingy which was delicious though a little sweet. Very interesting crowd, some lady had a professional photographer taking pictures of her drinking coffee. a little odd but it's SF! Service was prompt and friendly. If I come back to this area, I'll probably stop by.
author: Samir K.

description:
I returned with my family this time, on a weekend. And boy this place gets packed. This time all of the baristas and servers were super friendly and energetic about their job! Absolutely loved their Energy! 
We ordered our drinks to enjoy at the cafe but there were no seats to enjoy them inside. So we happily enjoyed them on the retaining wall right outside. 
Annie was super sweet and kept an eye out for a table for us, when it became available she held it for us and had it wiped down. They were so accommodating to our group, they won my patronage to Home Cafe on this day...
author: Sabrina V.

description: One of the best cafes I've been to! Tried the bacon cheese corn toast was bomb! I love floral teas and such, and the rose cafe latte was amazing! Def recommend
author: Karen V.

description:
Had to follow the hype and visited on a Saturday afternoon for a birthday cake latte. I haven't had coffee for the longest time but figured I'd make an exception just this once :)

Home is a pretty small but lovely and cozy cafe. When my sister, mom and I entered we had to squeeze through people because the entrance was narrow. Be aware, Saturday afternoons are busy! Tables were absolutely full, but luckily we were able to get a table. The line moves rather smoothly and quickly. 

We ordered a mocha, Cookie Monster latte and birthday cake latte. All were exceptional; props to the barista dude -- latte art was great! We didn't get to try any of their toast/food since we were already full from an earlier lunch so I'll have to come back for that. The only downside was that I think it was pretty pricey; I see it as paying for latte art. All in all, it was more for the experience for me.
author: Janine M.

description: Absolutely love this cute little coffee shop! The customer service is very friendly and helpful. It is a very calming ambience and aesthetically pleasing. I ordered the lavender latte (light sweetness and soy milk). I especially enjoyed the fact that you can change sweetness and of course the option of milk.
author: Marianne S.

description: Very cute little place. I usually get the iced salted caramel latte ($4.75) in a to-go cup. It is super smooth and creamy and just the perfect amount of sweetness. While I enjoy the drink, I'm not a big fan of the food options. They only serve toast, and expensive toast at that. I wish they had some cheaper pastry options (like a muffin/danish, even a cookie) that I can munch on while working. I always find metered parking right in front, but if you're planning on staying for a while, the amount of quarters you drop can really add up! Finding non-metered street parking is a much bigger challenge and a further walk. This place is also always filled with people on laptops, so if you plan on working as well, it can be tough to get a seat at a table that allows laptops.
author: Kim W.

description: Delicious coffee and the staff made sure to explain that the birthdaycake latte is not meant to taste like cake but is a hazelnut vanilla latte. They even offered to make it less sweet, which turned out perfect. Only bummer was I didn't see that the kitchen doesn't open until a little later, so don't show for eggs in a basket I'm the first couple hours.
author: Keri W.

description: Cute, roomy café in a modest location. The claim to fame seems to be drawing on the lattes, and the fancy flavors like lavender and chocolate mint.
author: Yu C.

description:
Always drove past at night, never realized it was a beautifully lit cafe. When you walk in, the place really opens up to you. Loads of decorations on the walls and windows that allow the morning sun to pour in. They have and tables that have signs saying "no laptops" to make sure there's an even ratio of people who work and people who talk! 

In addition to the unique types of lattes Home offers (like Cookie Monster, Birthday Cake, the "Hangover Cure"), Home also offers a variety of toasts. My friends and I ordered these things to try:

Birthday Cake Latte
Cookie Monster Latte
Condensed Milk and Butter Toast
Eggs-In-A-Basket Toast
Cinnamon Sugar Toast

The lattes are beautiful! Literally spent 30 minutes taking pictures Against the natural interior lighting next to the window (got some stares but people asked for recommendations from me!) Birthday Cake Latte looks amazing - the taste is sweet (not too much coffee taste, and it's a tad weak, but presentation deserves an A++). Cookie Monster has biscotti crumbs and pieces layered in it, so it tastes like cookies and milk! 

I think my favorite Toast was the Eggs in a Basket. The yolk oozed perfectly, and its flavor blended well with the Toast. Condensed milk was sweet but not overly powerful, while the cinnamon Sugar was cinnamon sugar layered over the Toast (still super good! But less unique).

Service was super friendly! They offered great advice on which Toast to get and even warned me of the "possible color differeces" when using soy milk instead of regular milk for my Latte pictures. They also bring the food to you which I thought was really nice of them! 

Overall great, well lit and decorated place with light lattes and a nice breakfast snack before starting your day. Definitely coming back for more!
author: Ian T.

description:
Service was friendly. Food was good. Ambiance was nice. Definitely gonna come back.

Specifically got the birthday cake latte. I'm not a coffee person, but this made me want to come back for more.

Also got the chicken meatball with pesto sandwich with a fried egg on top. Bit pricey, but I felt classy and delighted to eat a sandwich with a fork and knife LOL.

The workers seemed very chill, like nothing bothered them and it was a pleasant change from seeing rushed workers that don't brighten your day. I find small things like this to be great for a nice quiet coffee date.

As said, this place is cool to bring a friend or two for a quiet coffee date. In fact, I'm already planning one.
author: Alvin D.

description:
I'd give Home 6 stars if I could! My bestie and I made a breakfast stop here before heading to the 16th Avenue tiled steps. When we arrived, the girl at the cash register was accommodating and super friendly. She explained all the popular food and drink items on the menu, as well as gave us a few of her personal favorites. It was incredibly helpful for us first timers.

We both ended up getting the birthday cake latte. Being a non-coffee drinker, I was nervous to try it but to my surprise, the coffee wasn't overly powerful, and the sweetness was perfect. Many times birthday cake flavored things are sickeningly sweet but the sweetness totally balanced the drink. Shoutout to the latte artist for giving us beautiful drinks. As for food, I got the chicken meatball pesto toast. Super impressed on how flavorful the toast was. My bestie got the tomato truffle oil with pesto toast and she was raving about the truffle oil. 

Sigh, if only our hotel was near Home, I would have chilled there every morning. Thanks for such a memorable cafe experience! Nothing compares to this in Hawaii.
author: Nicole S.

description:
As others have stated, it can be quite hard to get a spot to sit. Luckily people are friendly and don't mind sharing tables. Wifi was consistent. There was a steady flow of people coming in on Saturday, so it can get quite loud if you're doing work there. Workers are nice and talkative.

I'd definitely go back for the tomato pesto toast.
author: Johnny L.

description: This matchagato is the best invention ever! The weekend bacon corn egg brioche is amazing. The only complaint I would have is that it's really hard to grab seats. But besides that, the service was great and the food and coffee~ FAN-EFFING-TASTIC!
author: eunnah s.

description:
It's fricking toast!! What's not to love about toast?

I am admittedly bias because I love toast (especially brick toast - a SoCal thing?), but that shouldn't dissuade you when I say it's pretty good. At least try it once if you're around the area. 

I've only gone once so far, but willing to come back. 
Will update later on.
author: Dan L.

description:
Home is a very cute and modern looking coffee place. I've been here about 3 times and have had great experiences every time. The staff is super nice and if you come early enough there is seating. I think I arrived before 9am all three times and found seating. On the weekend if you come after 9:30 there is a bit of a line and seating is hard to find. There is also plenty of metered parking outside and if you're willing to walk a bit there's residential parking. 

I've ordered the holy cow which is basically a latte with condensed milk. It's delicious and not too sweet! I've also tried my friend's birthday cake latte which was also really good. It was also very pretty!! 

I'll definitely be returning soon and definitely want to try the frozen hot chocolate next time!
author: Kelly S.

description:
Home is a cafe that looks and feels like it came straight out of Pinterest-- succulents on the tables, all-occasion lights, instagram-worthy drinks that are a little out of the ordinary, and a comfortable, cozy environment. Perfect for playing catch-up with friends or doing work. For all the times I've come here, I've only heard old R&B from the early 2000s (is it called old school yet?). I have only seen a lot of locals (including myself) hang around the establishment.

They offer your basic espresso drinks (latte, americano, cappuccino, etc.) as well as their specialty drinks and teas. I like trying the unique stuff always, so I've had their red velvet latte, lavender latte, coconut vanilla latte, and the holy cow (condensed milk latte). I still have yet to try the rest of their extensive menu! They also offer some pastries and toasts; try their condensed milk toast! That one is really good. I haven't had their savory toasts but I bet they're as delicious. Almost reminds me of a more slightly Asian version of The Mill on Divisadero.

The staff here is great too. Everyone I've approached and ordered from have always been super kind and accommodating even when I get that guilt of staying a little past closing time and cleaning. This place is definitely one of my favorite cafes on my list in SF.
author: Kathleen S.

description: Was delicious was light and refreshing while still leaving your tummy pleasantly content
author: Jessica G.

description:
Surprisingly amazing. First off the decor made me believe that this place may be an over hyped hipster place, but the employees are these humble friendly workers. 

The food and coffee is just like you expect it to be from the pictures.
author: Tiah T.

description:
insta-famous for a reason 

this is a great spot for a snack and drink while working on something or chatting with a friend. 

i came here to work on some stuff and the staff was so helpful. they even helped me find a seat while i was waiting for my drink. extremely attentive and responsive. 

I ordered the coconut vanilla latte. It was delicious. I had it iced because it was such a hot day. I also ordered the meatball/pesto toast because I'm at Home Cafe! It was super yummy. The toast was really thick and filled me up for a while. 

I will definitely be back! 

Also, i love their little sign-in books. super cute to doodle in.
author: Tina Y.

description: Nice place with a good variety of drinks, a decent amount of seating, and a nice clean bathroom. It showed up on a Yelp search for "vegan breakfast," but in fact they don't have a single vegan breakfast option or pastry. That's Yelp's fault, I guess, but it is surprising you can't even get toast with jelly. I drank my soy latte and left in search of food.
author: George K.

description:
Home is the perfect place to either have a good cup of coffee with friends/family or to study. I love the natural lighting and the color scheme of this cafe. 

The soy lavender, hazelnut, and vanilla lattes all taste fantastic! The drinks are crafted with the right ratio of coffee to milk. I come here regularly! 

Please also don't leave without trying their savory or sweet toasts!
author: Ha H.

description: Love this place a lot! We've enjoy the atmosphere here. The coffee and toasts are awesome!
author: Evelyn W.

description: I bought their mint chocolate latte (iced) on a whim, and it was damn good. The expresso shots are strong. The baristas seemed awfully nice, and as I grow older, I have really started to appreciate things like good customer service. Hoping to try their other stuff soon.
author: Lucy T.

description: Found this place via Instagram of all places, and knew I wanted to check it out on my road trip down there! The place had an amazing menu, rose lattes, Nutella lattes, even cookie lattes?! This one here is the birthday cake latte, a simple vanilla latte, but with the awesome rainbow latte art!
author: Natalie M.

description:
"Welcome Home" is what the nice lady behind the counter said while I ordered. I asked what they recommended other than my usual vanilla latte. They have three popular favorites, lavender latte, sea salt caramel and coconut vanilla. I went for the coconut vanilla which was delicious. 
The inside is clean, modern and inviting. Loved the paper scrolls on the walls with item choices and the green plants on all the tables. Enough seating options for quite a few to sit with a friend and work on a laptop, even the parking outside is very good. It's meter parking in front, but at least there's some! In SF, that's a treasure!!
author: Danielle G.

description: WOW. The most creative/amazing/Insta-worthy lattes I've ever encountered. UGHH amazing...the birthday cake latte is a must and I also really love the lavender latte. I'm a bit obsessed with latte art, and this place takes the cake. Also, they have pretty delicious toasts. The buttered toast with condensed milk is FANTASTIC - absolutely warm and fluffy and delicious. The savory toast with tomato and pesto was quite lovely too. This is a great place for working or hanging out with friends or photoshoots (which I actually saw happen while I was there). If you have a sweet tooth and are in need of a new Instagram food pic, come here and you will not be disappointed. The baristas are so friendly and talented, the music choice is relaxing, and the ambience is really cute.
author: Katherine Z.

description: I'm going to update my review for Home. Whenever I give a crappy review, I always go back to see if things have changed. Last Saturday I went in and spoke to the manager (Angie?) and we talked about how bad the previous experience was. What a sweetheart and it was clear that she had spoken to the staff due to the review. Because there's nothing worse (in reality of course there is) than paying some bucks for something and the folks don't give a shit you're there and that they feel it's a privilege that they are serving you. I really think they have shaped up. I was greeted, and there was no back and forth chatter about the previous night's partying between employees. ~And~ the latte was perfect!
author: Alex H.

description:
It's pretty good here. Was pretty excited to try their thick toasts. My friends and I came here around 1130am on a holiday Monday. The tables was all filled. But we just had to wait in line to order and a table opened up. Not too bad. We ordered the Pesto Tomato Truffle Oil toast with an added egg, Cinnamon Sugar toast and the Eggs in a Basket added bacon. Not going to lie, but I love all of them. The toast was buttery, thats amazing! The savories ones are super yummy. Like a breakfast openface sandwich but better. I do like the tomato toast a little better than eggs in a basket but that basket has BACON (we added the bacon)!! Who doesn't love bacon?!! The cinnamon sugar was good but I think that trouble coffee was better. 

We also ordered 2 hot latte and 1 ice green latte. I think the coffee are more on the expensive side but I think they were good. I got the almond latte, it was pretty tasty. A good blend of coffee and milk.
author: Sandy B.

description:
When you walk into Home you feel like you've just been taken out of the Sunset district and into the Mission district. This place definitely stands out from all the Chinese restaurants/businesses that populate this street.

Seeing that most people post about their birthday cake latte, I had to try one for myself. While waiting for my drink, I was slightly disappointed to notice that most of their flavored coffees come from Torani's syrups. If I'm  paying around $5 for flavored coffee, I would hope to see something a little more unique. 

With that being said, overall flavor of the coffee wasn't bad. Could've been a little less sweet but it wasn't by any means too much. I would want to try a regular latte next time for a better comparison to other coffee shops. Their novelty drinks are fun to try but I can't justify getting it all the time for the price.
author: Spencer E.

description: This coffee spot is probably my favorite one in the entire city. Its comfy, the staff are friendly, the food and coffee are great, and their playlist is almost always on point!  If you can make time, I recommend eating in so you can get the full experience this place has to offer.  My favorite lattes are Birthday cake and Lavender!
author: Angelica F.

description:
I wanted to come here to try their toast but they were sold out when I got there. So if you wanna try it, don't get there before closing. The decor is so cute and cozy! The girl at the counter was super sweet!! 5 stars for their service! 

I ordered the London fog which is an earl grey tea latte. I added some sweetener because it wasn't sweet enough for me. I'd rather have the option to add sweetener versus it being to sweet. I'll be back to try their toast!
author: Vy T.

description: The only real wait is the line, after your order of coffee, 5-10 minutes and your drinks are ready. Got the rose latte and the sea salt caramel latte. A little in the sweeter side but definitely bonus points for the creative flavors. Cups are filled to the rim, friendly staff, and great atmosphere overall. Definitely coming back!
author: Elizabeth L.

description: Nice place to hangout if you're not being charged for parking! I come here every Saturday. The cashier knows I always order something with caffeine, except today I bought a simple Hot Chocolate to expand my horizons. Did I mention the cashier on Saturday's always asks my name? It's cheaper if you take the bus, walk!
author: Julio B.

description: The matchagato is the one to get (Matcha + ice cream)! This place offers innovative flavors keeping me intrigued. Another favorite is the Lavender Jasmine Latte. I can't wait to try their toasts and the red velvet latte next. The ambiance is casual and young. Lots of students here on laptops.
author: Erin C.

description: Very tasty chicken meatball pesto on homemade toast. Good pastries but it ordered from wholesale bakers. Coffee and espresso is better than average.
author: Aaron K.

description:
Very friendly staff! The lavender latte had just the right amount of sweetness and although the lavender was pretty subtle, I liked the bits they sprinkled on top. The bread in a basket was really simple but in the most delicious way. The tomato truffle oil toast was a bit cheesy but so tasty. If it's for breakfast, I'd probably get the egg in a basket and for lunch the tomato truffle. Everything came out pretty quickly and I was very satisfied with my breakfast.

Very cute decor too!
author: Christine L.

description:
LOVED this cafe. Here's a breakdown of my experience

Service was A++++. I love a good coffeeshop but if the service sucks then I'm outta there and never coming back. Cashier was so sweet and really takes the time to get to know each person who walks through the door (asking how my holiday was, remembering my name for my second order) #itsthelittlethings. 

Coffee: I can't speak for the drip coffee, but I enjoyed my lattes (all three of them). I got the Chai Latte, Cookie Monster, & Birthday Cake. Loved the Cookie Monster one because when the cookie bits melt into the coffee you taste little graham cracker chunks and its SO BOMB. Birthday Cake Latte had me on the fence because I was scared it was going to be overly sweet and gross BUT NO! It was so pretty and the foam was just right, instant LOVE. 

Home really is such a welcoming place, you literally feel so comfy curled up next to your friends with all the laptops all spread out. Arrive early to snag an outlet & good parking is limited.

I wouldn't recommend this for someone who is looking to get some studying done because of the noise level and so many distractions (this place is so darn cute).
author: Michelle G.

description: Loved this spot. They have a variety of specialty coffees which include different ingredients. Tried the Iced Rose Latte and the Birthday Cake Latte, both of which were extremely good. The employees were friendly and helpful. The only downside is that it gets crowded and there's not much seating. My friend and I actually shared a table with someone who was studying alone at a 4-person table. My friend and I tried the egg toast and the cinnamon toast, both were really good. Will be back without a doubt!
author: Alyssa S.

description:
Ok so the name of the worker I referred to in my last review is Annie; she's still amazing, you'll love her. Another worker that's really cool is Carl (possibly Karl). Anyway, he's pretty chill and good vibes from the staff all around. 

I have finally tried the food, and I am obsessed with their tomato truffle oil pesto toast. Get the egg on top!!! I would re-create this in my own apartment, but I know I won't be able to do it justice so this place can continue to take my $6. Or is it $7? I don't know; I just hand them my card and I always leave them a gracious tip and I wonder why I'm such a broke college student.
author: Rachel M.

description:
Ahhh I'm home!
This place is a great addition to the outer sunset along with the one up bar, which I believe they're owned by the same people (i could be wrong though).

Unfortunately I'm not someone that goes to coffee shops and spends countless hours there, however the fact that people do that here is pretty cool, it's always packed with people either working or studying.  As far as their drinks/coffee goes it's truly great, I've come here countless times and I really like their matcha green tea latte, also their Ethiopian blend coffee is pretty delicious as well.  They also do have toasts snacks,  I have had their eggs in a basket before which is good, however I'm just not a big fan of it.

All in all this is definitely a much better alternative to Starbucks or most coffee shops, oh and btw they offer free Wi-Fi.. Sweet!!!
author: Josh Giosue D.

description:
Highly recommended!
My first time coming here while visiting San Francisco.  My wife and I ordered cinnamon sugar toast and chicken meatball toast with an iced red velvet latte and iced soy vanilla latte. The food and the drinks tasted great! And we especially loved the nice family friendly atmosphere. I would definitely come back on my next visit.
I highly recommend this place!
author: Paul T.

description:
I started going to this place since it first opened and I love it! The ambiance is super cute and home-y! There are tables on the side of wall that sits 4 comfortably for you to enjoy a cup of coffee, study, hang out with friends/family, go on your laptop, or read a good book. There's also a couple of seats along the window sill, which brings in great natural lighting. 

The coffee here tastes and looks amazing! I haven't tried all of them, but everything I tried so far tastes so good that I keep reordering it. I usually get eggs in a basket and a coconut vanilla latte (either hot or cold). The coconut is not overpowering at all. They put extra effort into the presentation with latte art. Cookie Monster and Birthday Cake seem to be popular. They look pretty, but they might be too sweet for my taste. 

I usually see a couple of baristas and a cashier working on shift so your drinks/food come out fast even if it's busy. The service is friendly.  They're personable and it seems to be genuine. Keep up the good work, and we appreciate your above and beyond customer service! 

Their menu includes savory and sweet brick thick-cut toast, iced/hot coffee, iced/hot tea, affogato, ice cream, and a variety of pre-made pastries. 

I'm happy for the owners since they're always busy, but as a customer, that's the only downside since it's hard to find a table during peak times/hours, which seems to be all the time now, but I did notice they opened a 2nd location on Clement! :)
author: Karen P.

description:
Ditto everyone's comments about how this a beautiful place to take photogenic photos of friends with creative latte designs/beautifully presented toast. 

Unfortunately, I can't bring myself to give them 5 stars due to their wait time and limited seating, though their employees are always graciously apologetic when people start waiting around in the small cafe, trying not to be in others' ways. It's the kind of location where people might dash for a table as soon as people begin evacuating from it, and it's not nearly a large enough space to stand around comfortably.

Also, I'm glad I didn't visit their Yelp page before going, because while I love the food and employees, I think I'd have walked out thinking it was overrated given the somewhat gushing reviews here. It's a wonderful location, but it's not the first place I'd recommend to visiting friends.
author: Kristine L.

description:
Omg I fell in love with this place. Everything about it is so cute...the decor, the latte art, down to the little plants at every table. Came here with a friend around 2 today. It seems like people come here just to get stuff done rather than just hanging out. Lots of people brought their laptops and were just working away. I would say tables are first come first serve.
