Parking - not bad. There is metered parking as well as residential parking if you are willing to walk a little more.

Service - good! They were nice and very patient with my indecisive self. 

Drinks - 
1. Red velvet latte - it tastes as good as it looks! Nice hint of chocolate but not overpoweringly sweet. Just enough so the coffee isn't too bitter. 
2. Lavender latte - I didn't get to try this myself but my friend is a fan of it. 

Definitely will be back!
author: Coco L.

description:
This place has a unique menu of lattes such as red velvet, condensed milk, coconut vanilla, and lavender to name a few. I was about to go for red velvet but the staff recommended coconut vanilla and said it's not as bad as it sounds haha. I guess people are hesitant about this drink because it's artificial coconut. 

Anyway, it taste great! I love how it the coconut compliments, rather than take away the vanilla latte taste. I'm not sure how artificial coconut is suppose to taste like, but I'm glad I can still taste the vanilla haha. 

It's a great place to study! Unlike Starbucks where high school students are taking over just to watch Netflix, people at Home Cafe come here to read the paper or get some studying done. It's a nice location away from college campuses.
author: Danae L.

description:
Stopped by here for a quick coffee and toast on a rainy morning and I was very pleased with my experience! 

I ordered a lavender latte with an egg toast. The service was great and the ambiance was nice and calm. The only reason I am not giving them 5 stars is because the egg toast was a bit too oily for me. The butter drenched throughout the entire toast and some parts were just too heavy to eat. 

On the other hand, my lavender latte was lovely and I could seriously drink one of those everyday!
author: Maria P.

description:
I love how meta the name of this place is. I followed their Instagram page before I walked into the coffee shop, and knew after looking through the feed I would love it. I walked in on a cold afternoon. The vibe of the shop was sleek and clean, but welcoming. The menu is written on large sheets of paper that are hanging on the walls, and the tables have cute succulents and plants as centerpieces. 

My friend and I were able to snag seating after ordering, which seemed like an impossible feat at first because of how justifiably crowded the shop was. My friend and I ordered lattes - her's a lavender latte, and mine a birthday cake latte. The birthday cake latte tasted exactly like it's namesake: like liquefied Funfetti cake. The foam on top of the latte was thick and creamy. The latte art was a rainbow leaf, garnished with rainbow sprinkles. My friends latte was also great. Not too sweet with a hint of lavender and garnished with lavender. Lots of photos were taken, and laughs were had. I can't wait to come back here to try more!
author: Rutuja R.

description: A little Home away from Home. The only thing is I wish I could create the beautiful artwork on my coffee at home. Simply loved this place. Amazing food and coffee. The atmosphere is great, very mellow you can come hang with friends or study.
author: Amita S.

description:
Came by for a mocha the other day and the service by the staff was good.

The mocha came out with decent latte art. Requested the drink half as sweet and the mocha was delicious.

Cafe us comfortable to sit and get some work done.

$4.5 for the mocha. Credit cards accepted with $5+ or a $.5 surcharge.
author: Derek S.

description:
Amazing coffee shop. 

Delicious, creative lattes (e.g. Birthday Cake, Nutella) and a warm ambiance. 

Spacious tables at the window; makes for some of the best window seating if you care about that stuff.

I love their savory menu like the Eggs in a Basket. Order that with a latte and you're set for a filling breakfast!
author: Oliver D.

description: Update: came back and had to dock this place down two stars. I was so impressed with this cafe and took my friend to come try the famous birthday cake. As I was watching the worker pour the latte, she suddenly put on a disappointed face that clearly indicated she messed up. When my friend received her latte, it looked like a mess. It was clearly a cover up for the screwed up latte art. While I understand that you want to salvage as much of the aesthetic as possible without starting over, it's clear that people come to take pictures of the latte. I was kinda embarrassed to have taken her there.
author: Lilian K.

description:
I believe gentrification has even spread to the Sunset. Ever since Bashful Bull closed, it seemed like this location had a tough time finding a replacement. It became a shabu spot (which I actually liked), then a Korean bar. I don't know if it transformed itself into any other businesses since then, but I think this new contender may be here to stay.
When it used to be Bashful Bull's, you could get a very cheap, mediocre meal. (So long Bashful, you had quite a run.) Now you can pay about the same amount for a tasty beverage and a snack in a much cleaner, trendier cafe. They have a simple hand-written menu on what looks like a large piece of parchment paper.

I've tried their green tea latte and iced green tea latte. Both were delicious and reasonably priced. The iced latte was very sweet, but refreshing, and came in those mason jar glasses I like so much. 

They have a lot of options for toast. Is it just me or is toast super trendy these days? I tried the...
Tomato, Truffle Oil, Pesto Toast - topped with freshly grated parmesan, torched:
I wasn't expecting much. I mean... it's toast. Most of us have these same ingredients, so it's not difficult to replicate at home. But it was delicious and savory. I'm a sucker for freshly grated parm. It is definitely on the oily side. Since there's already pesto, I didn't think the truffle oil was necessary. The toast is a thick cut, so it was able to absorb the oils and juices from the tomato. 

I did feel intrigued to try the other toast options. It can get crowded here, since it's one of the only trendy cafes in this neighborhood, but the service is pretty quick and friendly. This is a good place to have a chat or get some work done.
author: Joy W.

description: I love Home! The birthday cake latte is delicious and the customer service is great. The only thing I dislike is that there are never any seats available due to everyone enjoying the free wifi, coffee, and food.
author: Natalie G.

description: The birthday cake latte on Instagram is what drew me in. Surprisingly enough, I came in and didn't even order it. Instead I tried the coconut vanilla latte and it was sooo good. I just wish it was hot, I received it warm. The vibes and decor are so cute, it's just a fun place to hang out. I also love how simple and straight forward their menu is. I also wish they were open longer, they close at 5 pm.
author: Zeezee M.

description: SUPER GOOD EGGS IN A BASKET. Like honestly it's egg and toasted bread so I don't understand why it tastes THAT good
author: Kara P.

description: Finally tried some of their toasts a while back and forgot to come back and write a review... The toast was good! We got the one with tomato and another with corn, both with eggs (which were perfectly cooked!) Tasted really fresh, a little pricey so I won't be here all the time but it's a great stop when I'm looking for breakfast in the city!
author: Miwa B.

description: Seriously one of the cutest SF cafes I've ever been to! I love the location also.. close enough to the beach, SF State and of course home! The menu is great too with very unique drink choices! I love the lavender latte as well as the red velvet one. Of course the toast, pesto, chicken sausage and egg is delicious too!! I just love the concept of this place because it's not super fancy expensive food but just what you need to add a boost to your studying/day! Also a great place to study if you can find a spot!!
author: KT N.

description:
This place really does everything right. 

When we first entered the cafe, the baristas greeted us by saying "Welcome home". The place also have great natural light as well as a cute design-y feel (and they have wifi!) They offer a wide selection of creative lattes (as well as the usual coffee beverages) as well as a selection of toasts. I opted for the birthday cake latte (mainly for the pretty design) as well as the meatball toast while the boy got the red velvet latte and the tomato toast with an egg. Honestly, everything was done really well. I particularly liked my birthday cake latte; I normally hate cake flavored things but it wasn't too sweet and was quite delightful. The meatball toast was also great, quality meatballs on a toasty brioche. If they weren't located in the Sunset, I'd be here all the time.
author: Becky M.

description:
Cute little coffee shop that serves a large variety of  homemade toasts and coffee. 

Can't go wrong if you order the tomato, pesto, truffle oil toast! It's super tasty and you're gonna want to keep it all for yourself! You can also add a sunny side up egg on top of the toast of you're feeling extra fancy! 

Their coffees here are yummy and not too strong. Nothing extra ordinary, but coffee doesn't need to be! Some of my favorites are the holy cow (condensed milk latte) and the lavender latte.
author: Lisa W.

description: I found out about this place on instagram, and yes, it is very insta worthy. Really cute and you definitely get a comforting, warm vibe when you walk in. The birthday latte is good, but the cocotini wasn't the best. The flavors of coconut, sparkling water, and coffee didn't mix well for my taste. The tomato truffle toast was definitely my favorite and the sunny side up egg was cooked perfectly. Def recommend if you're in the area!
author: Danielle O.

description: Got the condensed milk toast and birthday cake latte! I was scared it would be too sugary.... but it was perfect! Also recommend the lavender latte!
author: Taran C.

description:
I sat in the hot sun that was magnified by the windows for an hour and I would still come back. That's how much I like this place. Home is an absolutely adorable cafe. The main issue they have is just how busy they are. I came on a weekday at around 12:30pm and every seat in this place was taken except the long table facing the sun. I really hope they consider putting some shades here because the sun makes those seats almost unusable. I ended up making a small jacket fortress just so I could see my laptop screen (and to prevent my laptop from overheating). There's also no outlets for the front half of the cafe Parking is metered out front and there seems to be spots available around the block. Service is also very very nice and attentive.

All that being said, Home is still a great study spot and dishes out some seriously tasty toast and coffee. I also appreciate that they have cold water out for self-serve. I got 2 drinks: a hot lavender latte and an iced mint chocolate latte. For toast I got the chicken meatball pesto and the tomato truffle oil. Both with an added egg on top.

The lavender latte was delicious and gorgeous too look at. The lavender is distinct but not overpowering and I'm glad it's not too sweet. I wish the espresso was a bit stronger though. The iced mint chocolate latte was also good but got boring fast. It's also a very light drink that tastes like nothing after a while. It's still very refreshing though.

The chicken pesto toast is what you should go for if you're looking for something closer to a meal. I was starving so it wasn't quite enough but it's a good size for a light lunch. It has a slight sweetness with all the spices and it's quite tasty. However between the meatballs and the tomato toast I preferred the tomato. I usually don't tomatoes that have a raw edge to them and truffle oil is always a bit iffy depending on how a place uses it but I really did enjoy the combination. I would definitely get this again. No matter what savory toast you get I highly suggest topping it with an egg. It's fried perfectly and really makes the meal that much more perfect.

Overall, Home is a fantastic spot to get some work done and enjoy a light snack.
author: Vivian C.

description:
Cute and cozy cafe!

I came here a couple of times when they first opened, and it's wonderful to see how successful this place has gotten. They have gotten more tables and seating and I've noticed they even hired more staffing to help out with the increasing business. The owners are also a very sweet, welcoming and friendly couple! 

The menu is creatively hung on the left side of the wall upon entering. The non-coffee drinks are on the left of the wall, and the coffee menu is on the right towards the cashier. I've enjoyed the coconut vanilla latte (although they could have been more lighter on the sweetness, it was delicious), the matcha green tea latte and the holy cow latte (condensed milk!). I personally would have to pass on the salted caramel latte and London fog latte (earl grey with vanilla). 

Of the two thick toasts (Condensed milk toast and Tomato, truffle oil & pesto toast) that I've tried, they were both absolutely delicious! The condensed milk toast was buttery, sweet and creamy. The tomato, truffle oil & pesto toast was flavorful, had great texture and also buttery! I would order those two again as well as look forward to trying the others. 

With increasing business, getting a table may be hard depending on what day and time you go, so just be mindful about that! This place has free wifi and I believe they have outlets near almost every table. It's a great place to study, get some work done or simply catch up with a friend or loved one!
author: Kris C.

description: Great Food and VIBES. Workers here super nice and stuff!!! Will recommend for cute and tasty drinks. Yum yum yum
author: Veronica L.

description:
Basing this on my last visit about a week ago. 

One of the employees was incredibly surly. Grungy-looking Caucasian girl. Owners, get her attitude in check before people just stop going to your cafe because of her. 

She glared at me as I placed my order. Glared at me when I went and told her (with a smile) the water jug was empty. She turned away wordlessly and disappeared into the back...and her colleague smiled at me and said the water will be out in just a moment. 

This chick glared at me as I brought my dirty dishes to place in the collecting tray. Wtf. I'm cleaning up after myself and you're glaring at me? GET THAT CHIP OFF YOUR SHOULDER. 

Not coming back here ever again. I'll make condensed milk toast at home if I have to. 

Oh yeah. The music is still WAY TOO LOUD.
author: Evelyn C.

description:
It sure feels like home here. The staff here are so friendly and so welcoming. I am always greeted with big smiles when I walk in.

I've come here a few times for a quick breakfast. I usually order a latte along with a tomato, pesto and truffle oil toast. The coffee is just what I needed early in the morning. The toast is very filling and very delicious! 

Overall, I really enjoy the atmosphere here. I love just coming in, grabbing some coffee and toast, and then go about my day. The drinks are great. The food are tasty. I can't wait to come back and enjoy some more!
author: Wendy Y.

description: Relaxed and cozy, this place is great for a quick and tasty cup of coffee or tea. The menu of food is quite limited, but everything they have, very well combines your choice of drinks.
author: Maddox C.

description: I've been here 3 times in the last 2 months that I went up to NorCal. I always get the Rainbow Latte - not only are the colors beautiful to stare at, but it tastes even better =D
author: Boris C.

description: Home is one of the cutest cafes in SF! Located in a quiet neighbourhood, Home offers the best lavender latter I have ever tried, and it's Japanese curry scone was delicious!
author: Tiffany T.

description: My home, busy busy cafe with work from laptops crowd and students during school year, owners invested in the neighborhood and likewise, bravo to them and their staff making it so home
author: Felicity V.

description:
Welcome Home - such a cute greeting when you first walk in. The small cafe is brightly lit with ample natural lighting. The decor is simple and modern with the beverage menu written on a scroll next to the wall. The food menu is separate and available at the register. This place is self-service so order at the counter and pick up when its ready. 

Note that seating is tough because of the smalls pace and its popularity. The laptop working area is revered to certain tables so if you're planning to settle in for the long haul, be aware. At first I was thrown off by this, but I definitely see the practicality since seating is limited and this is a popular spot for coffee goes of all kinds. 

The coffee is delicious with a nice variety of more traditional drinks and their creative drinks that are so Instagram worthy/famous. Feeling not too adventurous, but not too simple I opted for the Lavender Latte and did not regret. The coffee is subtle, sweet, and fragrant. I also go the chicken meatball toast, which took a little longer than the advertised 5-15 minutes. It kind of reminded me of the sweet chicken meatballs you get at Costco on thick cut butter and onion toast. It was good, but I don't think it was worth the price and the wait.Although I probably wouldn't order the food again, I would definitely come back for the coffee.
author: Jen V.

description:
My colleagues and I found this place through Instagram where we spotted a "wandering whale"...a latte made with a foamy whale on top. The whale is our business logo so we decided to take a field trip to Home for an off site business meeting. 

We loved the interior decor, and super friendly and competent staff. The infamous Whale latte barista did not disappoint with her talent and taste skills. We had a coconut vanilla latte, classic latte and salted caramel latte. We also had egg in a hole and toast with melted frosting like yumminess. 

Delicious!

While the food is classic and simple, the device is excellent and the coffees are extraordinary. 

The barista noticed we had a newborn in tow for this off site meeting and made a special baby whale one one of our lattes! Super touching and above and beyond.

We will for sure be back and are lighting up social media in hopes that Home's upcoming second location is a success!
author: A M.

description: Amazing coffee shop! Great atmosphere, beautiful aesthetic, perfect for instagram. Baristas are extremely talented, staff is incredibly kind, really nothing not to love about the place. I drove about half an hour to visit, and would do it again without a doubt. The coffee is delicious as well as the toast, and also a great place just to sit down and chill, or even get some work done. Love it, will be back soon for sure!
author: Sydney G.

description: Great customer service! The breads tasted great and the coffee was great! A nice environment in the City. They have tables for computers and tables for non-computer use. This is not a big location but a nice one. I will be back! Keep up the good work! Nice clean restrooms and just a clean establishment overall.
author: Al C.

description:
Cute coffee shop that's known for their lavender latte. I've been here 3 times and have only tried that one. It's a nice smooth latte with lavender flavor that isn't too strong. They have other lattes such as red velvet, hazelnut, birthday cake, etc. I had an issue with my drink during my second visit and the owner quickly reached out to me! Very great service. 

Lots of tables but the place gets crowded so it can be hard to find a seat. They have a 2 hour limit.
author: Jenn T.

description: Every time I go my drinks are delicious and aesthetically pleasing (always a plus), as well as the lovely staff who are so kind and really make this joint feel like "Home."
author: Michelle D.

description:
Home is a small, hip cafe that's great for studying or getting some work done. Since it's so small, all the tables are communal and it seems like everyone is friendly. There's counter seating along the front and then a wall of tables -- this is where you'll find the outlets. 

I ordered the ice matcha latte, medium sweet, and it was pretty good. Nice creamy matcha flavor without being too powdery. Drinks for there come in a cute mason jar. The drinks are a tad pricey, but you get a pretty good amount.

Other things to note:
- When I was there, they were playing '90s music (BSB, Brittney Spears), thumbs up!
- Only one bathroom =/
- You'll have to ask for the Wi-Fi password because it's not posted anywhere
- They have a sign at the register that says to limit your stay to 2 hours. It doesn't seem like they enforce this
- If you happen to sit next to people who are chatty while you're trying to do werk, it kinda sucks...

All in all, Home is a nice place to put your head down or to grab a drink with a friend.
author: Doris K.

description: Relaxed and cozy, this place is great for a quick and tasty cup of coffee or tea. The food menu is quite limited. Staff was friendly and warm. Definitely come back.
author: Thatcher C.

description: Such a cute ambiance, nice service and wonderful for friends but also quiet enough to study or read. I love the matcha green tea latte iced or hot with almond milk unsweetened ! So delicious ! Super cool drinks a def must try !
author: Lara C.

description:
One of the better study spots I've been to! Such a cute place with a good amount of seating. They serve coffee and various types of toast for food, and you pick up your orders at the counter when they call your name. I went with a friend to go study on a Sunday, and ordered and tried each other's stuff. You know, sharing is caring! :) 

I ordered the Coconut Vanilla Latte and the Tomato Truffle Oil Pesto Toast with an added fried egg which was an additional $1.50 i think?? My friend ordered the Lavender Latte and the Chicken Meatball and Garlic Toast. The toast was thick, and basically an open faced sandwich. Very hearty and tasty! The chicken meatballs were very flavorful and I actually liked it better than the one I ordered. Both of the lattes were very good in their own way, and I could not even force myself to choose which one I like better because they're both great! They also came with cute latte art, and the lavender latte even had some lavender garnished on top for aesthetics. 

The only downfall to this place, is that it closes early at 5 pm! I tend to study later into the night so it would be nice if it closed later. But anywhoo, I would definitely go back, especially to study. Good lighting, free wifi, plus great coffee and actual meals! It has everything you need to get your study on or just hang out with friends. :) 

P.S. If you're studying, I would bring some headphones because it can get loud here and there...I mean, you are at a cafe!!
author: Amanda C.

description:
Tried quite a few lattes:
Birthday cake
Matcha
Red velvet
Cookie Monster 

All quite good! Red velvet is really sweet just fyi
author: Ivan C.

description:
I had the birthday cake latte half sweet and with almond milk. It was delicious! Just the right sweetness and had a coffee taste still. It was a bit pricey adding the almond milk. The downside was that they only have whole milk as a regular milk option. No skim or low fat which i usually prefer. 
Also shared the chicken meatball toast and bacon and corn. Both were delicious. 
I just wish they had more milk options!
author: Christina L.

description: Great coffee drinks, awesome toasts, and a really down to earth crew, make this place well worth your while. Some tables are laptop restricted, but there are plenty of tables where you can just chill with your laptop and not be bothered. Keep in mind that the general rule in restaurants is if you take a table for a longer time, the tip should increase accordingly.
author: Mosey S.

description:
Chocolate Mint Latte |$4.25| 
This place is so so comfortable to be at. It's always a peaceful quiet environment with friendly workers ! One of the best places to eat a little snack, drink a cup of coffee, and do your work/ studying there.
author: Terilyn W.

description:
No place like Home! Came here with a friend to study for the boards, and noticed that this is the place to be when you want to get things done, as everyone had their laptops out. There were many creative latte options, which made it difficult to choose. I decided on the lavender latte, and so glad I did! The lavender was strong, but not overpowering. I felt relaxed as I was drinking it, but in reality still had a lot of work to do.  There was even lavender sprinkled on top of the foam, which was a nice touch. 

The baristas were friendly, and gave good recommendations. 

There's toast and pastries as well, but I didn't get a chance to try them. Will be back to try them next time I'm in the Sunset!
author: Ivana Y.

description:
LOVE this cute neighborhood cafe! Where have you been all my life?! I'm so glad they decided to stay open. :)

The drinks have cute names and they are delicious! I usually go for the red velvet latte or lavender jasmine tea latte. mMm... And whatever type of toast you order - it always turns out tasting amazing! My favorite is the corn, bacon, and cheese with a fried egg on top!

Service is on point, as the owners and baristas/cashiers are super friendly and sweet! One of the girls even knows us by name and knows our order as well! Can't wait to go back this weekend!
author: Ann T.

description:
Love everything about this cafe. Easy all day parking (where do you find that in the city?) and the best selection of hot and cold drinks. Their toasts are very good as well! I love that it has natural lighting and they play 90s love songs all day. What's not to like? It's great for meetings, studying or just hanging out with friends :) highly recommend! Oh also their baristas are one of the friendliest in the city; one really feels "at home" when they come in. :) 

My favorites are the hot or cold organic matcha latte, lavender latte and the COLD hot chocolate (so decadent and yummy!)
author: Sophie L.

description:
My favorite part of this cafe is the interior. It's really pretty, very well designed *especially* for a café in the Outer Richmond. The people come in second - they're so nice and remember you even after you've only been there once or twice, perfect for a neighborhood café! And there is wifi. Because of these three things, this has become one of my top 3 cafes to do work in the Richmond. 

I also know that everyone else is obsessed with the toast - especially the Avocado Toast Sampler, which includes their Br-Avo, Seoul Much Avo & Let's Avo-Cuddle toasts (have you gotten the hint that this place is cute?). I tried it during my first visit and wasn't super into any of them. So far, the only spot that gets expensive toast right in my opinion is The Mill but that's an unfair bar to judge them against. So while I'm personally not a fan of their toast selection, there's a 90% chance you as an avocado loving millennial will love it. 

Their baristas are also very skillful and they serve De La Paz coffee (the sister brand of Four Barrel). They're known for their large "creative" drink selection, most notably their Birthday Cake latte. I personally do not trust sugary coffee drinks like this, but am tempted to order it one day just for the instagram.
author: Rachel E.

description: We absolutely loved this place! It has a homey, coffee shop vibe. The staff was friendly and helpful.  We ordered three of their toasts and enjoyed them all! Also, the birthday latte and Cookie Monster latte are the bomb.
author: Chloe P.

description: 3 words: birthday cake latte. Not only was it delicious, it was the most decadently beautiful coffee drink I've ever had. It almost hurt my feelings to drink it. All three workers were so kind, engaging and excited to make something beautiful for us to enjoy. I would def come back here!
author: Kaela O.

description:
Finally got around to trying this coffee shop! I usually wake up pretty late, so I haven't had a chance to try it since they close pretty early. 
I came during the perfect weather too! The place felt especially cozy since it was raining. The interior was a lot bigger than I had expected. There are tables next to the wall with outlets that are perfect for studying, bigger tables for bigger groups, and also seats next to the window. I just love the way the interior is designed and how everything is arranged! 

When I saw the menu, I was a bit surprised. I probably looked at an older picture of the menu but I didn't think the toasts would've went from $4.50 to $6.50 in such a short time. The lattes were also a dollar more than I had expected. :( I ordered the organic matcha latte and eggs in a basket toast. I'm always a bit scared when I order matcha at a new place because there's always the fear that it's not authentic matcha. However, the server asked me how sweet I wanted it and that reassured me. Most places, if any at all, won't ask you for the sweetness level of a matcha latte. Moreover, he told me that their matcha was organic so the bitterness of it was strong. Thus, I got lightly sweet. 

They bring the food and drinks to your seat, so you don't have to go pick it up. That's some great service. Of course, they were very friendly and helpful too. Moreover, they pick up your plates and cups when you're done too! If they don't, make sure to bring it back to bin to save them some work.

I was a bit disappointed when the toast came. It was a lot smaller than I had expected for $6.50 and the egg looked like it was fully cooked. However, once I started eating it, I really enjoyed it. The buttery toast was very soft, similar to the brick toast you might have had at Asian dessert places. When I finally got to slicing the egg, it was still runny! I love my eggs with yoke.The only downside to this was that it was too salty for me. I couldn't eat it without drinking anything. 

I was super excited to get my matcha latte. Getting latte art is always fun and something to look forward to. The taste was perfect! It was probably one of the best matcha lattes I've had, and if any one knows me, they know how high my standards for matcha are. Good thing I had it lightly sweetened otherwise it would've been too sweet for me. The matcha was so strong that some of it dried and stuck to the mug! The matcha flavor was very well defined. I might have to ask where they get their matcha haha. I would definitely come back for the matcha latte, but I would ask them to make it extra hot next time because it was already cold by the time I had drank it. 

In conclusion, I would definitely come back here! Whether it's for the food or the ambiance. I really want to try all their toasts and lattes.l even though they're quite pricey. They're all so unique and sound so good. I'm thinking about getting the lavender or red velvet latte and the chicken meatball toast the next time I come.
author: Tina P.

description:
Lattes: pretty in aesthetics and in price, if you really just want a picture of it I recommend splitting with a friend. For some reason the prettier the latte the worse it tastes so go for the regular ones if you want a good latte. 

Toast: AMAZING, but it also so expensive so I again suggest you split with a friend. 

Ambiance: Crowded most of the time, but they do encourage you to sit with other people to maximize space.

Service: Amazing, A1. Definitely the reason why I'm giving this place 4 stars 

Parking: its SF what do you expect, but sometimes you can get pretty lucky with the parking meters!
author: Lili L.

description:
Home is hands down my favorite & go to cafe even if I don't live in the neighborhood!! I go to school down in San Jose now but whenever I do come home, this is my go to coffee shop. The ambiance is perfect for getting work done or just catching up with friends. My friends and I love coming to Home for a nice cup of coffee and to color and destress. 

Their drink menu is simple with a pretty decent variety. I feel like sometimes coffee shop's menus can be overwhelming but not this one. I love the aesthetic of the menu. It's clean, simple and legible.  My favorite drink is the Holy Cow which is a latte with condensed milk. It's good both hot or cold! A few other drinks I highly recommend would be the London Fog Latte, Lavender Latte & the Chocolate Mint Latte. I haven't tried the toast yet but I'd love to one of these days! I always hear great things about the toast. 

The owners are super friendly and welcoming. The baristas here are also really nice and friendly. I love that everyone here actually try to talk to you as opposed to just taking your order. A simple "how are you doing today?" goes a long way. Everyone's attitude builds a warm environment to be in. Love it here!!!
author: Carmen S.

description: Really cute place! Customer service was great, the guy helping us had good recommendations and  the coffee/teas and snacks were delicious. You can tell they care about their customers and regulars coming in and for the duration of the stay. We had the jasmine lavender tea latte as well as the espresso based lavender latte which are both highly recommended. Thanks guys for a memorable experience.
author: Michaela R.

description:
I spent the entirety of my spring break days inside of this coffee shop, (trying) to get work done. I love the atmosphere of this place -- plenty of outlets, throwback music, and natural lighting!

I consistently found parking along the suburban streets (try along 17th or 18th), and seating inside the coffee shop wasn't too difficult to manage -- granted, these were weekday mornings. I went once on a Sunday morning, and the place was packed, so we worked at the donut shop across the street instead.

Their lavender and matcha lattes are great - both the lavender and matcha flavors are incredibly strong, which I appreciate. I also ordered the birthday cake latte, but it was meh to me...can't doubt how pretty it was though! The tomato pesto toast, with a fried egg of course, was also delish.
author: Ingrid A.

description: My favorite coffee shop to visit when I come to the city, the ambience is absolutely blissful & the red velvet latte is heaven in a cup, easily one of the best lattes I've ever had! I'm from LA and we have some pretty amazing coffee there but nothing even compares to the coffee at Home :) I look forward to it every time I plan a visit!
author: Sami H.

description:
This place is so great! Really enjoyed my time here. 

Came here due to a recommendation of a friend and so happy I did. Was greeted with friendly faces from everyone working. Didn't know what to get and Carl helped me customize my drink based on my preferences. My name was called and was delighted to see some  awesome foam art. I sipped my lightly sweetened Sea Salt Caramel latte and ate this heaven sent mango pastry, both were delicious. I sat at a table that had a sign saying something along the lines of "no laptops..enjoy each other's company" - good reminder. This place definitely makes you feel like home as you don't want to leave. Stayed so long I ordered more food and tried two versions of their toast.. so good!

If you're in the area, go to this coffee shop and find the cool guy with the man bun named Carl. He was super friendly.. actually everyone there was, so you can't go wrong no matter what.
author: A W.

description: Love this new spot! Vibe is good and so is their Lavender Latte. Definitely will be back to try all other lattes!
author: Cindy N.

description:
They have cruffins too (as of 5/28/17)! Walked in only wanting a cappuccino and walked out with that and a coffee cream cruffin after telling myself the day before to take it easy on the carbs. But alas, at Home, you must treat yoself. Not sure where they get their cruffins, but it was delicious when warmed up!

I'm a fan of their creative lattes, cappuccino and toasts! I've only had the eggs in a basket and cinnamon toast, but everything else looks great from what I've seen in person.

4 stars for being a unique coffee spot close to my house.
author: Annie C.

description: Are you a sucker for taking pictures of your food/drinks for instagram? If yes, this is the place for you! Their latte art is beautiful and the lattes taste delicious. Try the lavender and birthday cake!
author: Vickiiieee V.

description:
A great coffee shop. They have an excellent selection of different lattes and teas. My personal favorites are the lavender latte, hazelnut latte, and the red velvet latte. All the lattes are unique in their own right. 

I've tried the egg toast as well as the condensed milk toast. I personally found both of a toasts were too sweet and had way too much butter on them.

Thing I like most about this coffee shop is that it's not very busy and very quiet. It's a great place to come to do some work and read.

The only knock I would have against this place is that the Barista was incredibly unhelpful and giving recommendations on what to order. I asked her what was in the red velvet latte, and she just told me that it was exactly how it was written up on the menu... When I ask for recommendations on the various types of toast she just told me that all of the toast or equally the same. Would be a little bit more helpful if she had some opinion.
author: Sam C.

description: I personally enjoy the environment of home a lot! It's very modern CUTE sleek Instagram spot! The food is very delicious and they have a huge menu for drinks!! TJE service here is phenomenal! And i love how clean the store feels! My favorite toast is the sausage toast. However I feel like sometimes the portions are really small for the price. They are inconsistent with the portions!
author: Carissa C.

description:
This was my second time going to Home. It's always great to find a great coffee shop by just walking by. 

I got the cappuccino dry and they made it perfect. Most people are good at walking the fine line of a dry cappuccino but they nailed it both times. 

The inside decor has a nice home vibe but also a little modern twist. It's a great place to work since it's not very loud and it's also a great place for conversations with friends. 

If you are ever in the area I suggest you give home a chance
author: Andrew H.

description:
My roommate has been low-key incepting this place into my mind ever since she came a few weeks ago. "You know what would be good right now? A lavender latte." "You know what we should get for brunch? Toast." And on and on until I finally caved today and came here to get a bit of studying done.

Rating Breakdown:
2/2 Stars for Taste -- 
Keep in mind, this rating is based purely on the lavender latte. It's definitely a top contender for the most instagrammable cup of coffee, with its latte art splendor and real lavender dashed artfully across the top. I'm not a huge fan of lavender, but I was pleasantly surprised. Not too sweet, and the lavender taste was subtle. At one point, I'm like, I wonder if I'm supposed to eat the lavender. DON'T. Potpourri in my mouth. My friend was sitting across from me and had to take a moment to laugh out loud at the horror and regret in my eyes. 

0.5/1 Stars for Value -- 
At $4.50 a cup, this is definitely SF-priced coffee. But I guess if I think about it, a cup of boba sets me back about the same. Still, this isn't something I'd dish out for everyday, maybe a treat yo'self splurge. 

1/1 Stars for Customer Service -- 
Friendly and fast service with a smile. The wifi is fast and the natural sunlight of this place makes it a great place for studying. There is a courtesy two hour limit for table space, but it was pretty empty when I was here, so they didn't really enforce this policy. Also, they encourage patrons to share tables, which I think is adorable. FUTURE HUSBAND, PLEASE COME SHARE MY TABLE.

Bonus star because I would definitely be back to try their other novelty coffees. There's a condensed milk latte and red velvet latte that I have my eye on. Sweet, sweet diabetes in a cup. 

TL;DR: Good study spot. Try the lavender latte.
author: Abby W.

description:
A-OK. 

I am constantly checking Yelp for hot and new restaurants and cafes for interesting things to eat. I stumbled upon this location and the red velvet latte and toasts really caught my eye. 

Upon arriving, I realized that this was previously the sister soju place of Tonight Soju. Now it's a really comfy-looking, study cafe. There's tons of seating and tons of students here that come here for study sessions with their buddies. All of the tables are separate, but they're used as communal tables.

We ordered an affogato, red velvet latte, and the  (#2) condensed milk toast. I thought the affogato was decent, but a little too sweet. The red velvet latte was VERY red velvet in taste, but not very much of a pick me up. I think that you should pass on this if you want something a bit stronger. I really liked the toast. It's crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside.  

I think I will definitely be back. It's in a very convenient location for me and it has a lot of variety. (I will be back to try the lavender latte!)
author: Lyra C.

description: Charming neighborhood vibe, most pleasant on a warm day. The best mocha I've ever had. Rich and not bitter. On my list of top coffee shops to visit.
author: Paulina F.

description: Amazing coffee and toast. Perfect for a Sunday morning. Very comfortable and lively atmosphere. Staff are super friendly and responsive. Rose latte was the best I have ever had.
author: Jeremy W.

description:
Home is where my heart is!! I love this cafe. It's so cute and cozy. The decor is simple and sleek, with scroll-style menus, string lights, and succulents on each table. Very hip and modern feel to this place.

The toast is to die for! They're a tad bit on the oily side but just so darn comforting and tasty. I've tried the chicken meatball and pesto which is delicious!! Even better with a fried egg on top, which is cooked with a perfectly runny yolk. The eggs in a basket is also equally as scrumptious. I want to try the sweet toasts in the future; the condensed milk and cinnamon toasts sound so good!! 

The coffee is pretty good too, albeit a little on the sweet side. I've only tried the creative drinks - the lavender latte and the chocolate mint latte. The lavender latte is excellent, with bits of lavender sprinkled on top. The chocolate mint was a little too sweet for me, but next time I'll ask them to adjust the sweetness. 

The staff is super personable and friendly here and always refer to me by name. Home is a perfect place to study or to catch up with a friend. The wifi is fast and works great! Also love that they play old school r&b here.. Perfect music to study to!

Try and get here early - it tends to get packed later on in the day.
author: Cheryl N.

description: First time here, very welcoming! Greeted right when I walked in. Cashier gave me run down on menu and popular suggestions. Love that they have outlets under the benches...makes working from 'Home' (see what I did there) easy. Only thing is if you're going to get on a conference call it's not quiet so you may have to step outside. Overall great coffee/tea/toast spot. I'll be coming back.
author: J G.

description:
Go here for the toast...any toast

Chicken pesto toast was very flavorful and they don't skim on the toppings. 

Home is a very cute and relax cafe with free wifi. If you are looking for an alternative place to relax other than Starbucks check out Home cafe

:)

#supportlocal
author: Carol Y.

description: Home is definitely a cute cafe to go to on a sunny Saturday morning. It's a bit crowded and the espresso does take a long time to receive so if you have a lot of time, I would recommend coming here for the lavender or nutella latte. The cinnamon toast was delicious and if you're looking for something a little bit more filling, the Eggs in a Basket with bacon bits is a winner. YAI.
author: Grace L.

description:
"Welcome Home" they greeted as we made our way to the counter. Sweetest thing ever. Sweeter than any of the ex-bfs I ever had. HAHAHA *lame joke alert*

Imagine TRYING to telling a friend you're going here. 
Friend: are you going out?
You: yeah
Friend: where?
you: Home. 
Friend: i thought you said you were going out???
You: i am. I'm going Home. 
 
HAHAHAHHA. No? ok... I'll stop.

Before you boo me for the 3 stars hear me out first. This 3 star will be temporary. Will be back to try other things and re-rate if deemed respectable. My friend's neighbor opened this place up and she's been telling me to try it out. Didn't hit me it was the place until I was inside of it. 

The cashiers were uber adorable and sweet. Walked into a modern/hipster looking cafe with tables filled up of people on their laptops or people chilling with friends over coffee. Cashier recommended the toasts and said the special of the day was good so we listened to her advice.

Bacon & Corn Toast: Exactly what it is. Corn and Bacon smeared all over the toast submerged in a layer of cheese. Maybe I didnt pick the right toast? I thought it was just ok. Usually I die for bacon because I had my first bacon when I was 21. So.... anything bacon is heaven. But the dish fell short for me. Should I not be expecting more? Should it taste just as salty? Just as dry? I don't know. 

Was not in the mood for coffee or latte, so my friend, Lauren C., got the coconut juice. They just cut the coconut up and VOILA.... FRESH COCONUT JUICE EVERYONE! Very refreshing.

The tables all looked full so the waitress kindly guided us to tables with only one person so we could share the other half. It was very cozy to say nonetheless. But i felt bad because my friend and I were just having a convo and the person in front of us had their laptop up and studying. Soooo we didn't stay long.  

UPDATE 11/1/15: 
Upgraded from 3 to 4 stars. As promised I came back to try everything out again. Stellar customer service. I actually studied here from 9:25AM to 3:00pm. No mean looks, no rush from the employees to kick me out. I actually felt like being home and super productive. 

Holy Cow (condensed milk latte $3.75): She sold me at condensed milk when the cashier was making recommendations. I'm not a strong coffee lover person, so this was perfection. Sweet but enough kick of caffeine to make me do work. (i'm the kind that never drinks caffeine so when I have a sip of some i get super jittery and hyped). Super good flavors!

Condensed milk toast ($3.50): Sounds simple right? Toast with condensed milk? I actually grew up with this and my mom would make before school. Loved the combination and brought back a lot of childhood flashbacks. If youre not too into sweet, I probably would not recommend this.

Matcha Latte (idk the price b/c my friend got it for me): Super good! I LOVE matcha so it was a wonderful combination. It wasnt too bitter but not too overly sweet. Got the matcha flavors balanced with latte. 

-Great wifi, comfy benches to sit on or chairs while studying, outlets at every other seating. Perfect for studying.
author: Chena N.

description: This coffee shop is one of my go to places in San Francisco, parking can be difficult but if you're lucky you'll find one right in front of the shop. If you are ever looking for a good latte, iced or hot, this spot has many different flavors such as hazelnut, nutella, red velvet, etc. My faves are hazelnut and the holy cow. In addition to their delicious latte selection, this spot has savory toasts and one sweet toast that are simple yet flavorful. Not only does this spot have such great coffee and food, it has a beautiful aesthetic for pintrest worthy pictures.
author: Tina A.

description:
What a great find for coffee and a quick morning bite! I'm not a true coffee person, but when it's made well and uniquely, I can certainly appreciate it. I got the lavender latte and it was yummy. There were so many others that I wanted to try though. As for food, I got the toast with butter and condensed milk. It's a dessert, really. But I didn't care. It was a little bit of heaven. 

If I'm around the area, I'd definitely go back!
author: Natalise K.

description: It was a bit crowded when I got there, so I had to wait a while to grab a table. But other than that, the workers there are so nice and the latte that I ordered was one of the best I've ever tried. Also, the condensed milk toast was soo good. Next time I visit SF, i'll definitely come back.
author: Valerie S.

description:
The Tomato Toast with pesto and truffle oil and an added egg was delicious, with the egg cooked perfectly sunny side up. It's a bit of a splurge though,  with the toast being $7 and egg an additional $1.50. 

The Lavender Latte with almond milk was delicious as well, with a slight hint of lavender and actual lavender flowers on top. It wasn't a strong flavor, which is something I prefer.

The service was really nice and friendly, and the spots along the wall have pleasant spots for studying, though they get crowded early. My friend and I visited on a Wednesday afternoon and had to sit against the floor to ceiling window on a sunny day. Unfortunately there were no shades to protect our faces from being burned in the sunlight. This really killed the chill, cozy vibe of the cafe and my friend and I were very eager to leave as soon as possible.
author: Addy Y.

description:
I LALA-LOVE this cafe!

Right when you walk in, you honestly feel so welcomed and the cozy but open air environent really does make you feel at home. I can stay here all day if I had time! 

The staff here is so cute. The front of the cafe has a sign that says "All because two people fell in love." The owners of this cafe are a married couple and they are just the cutest and the sweetest. They are really great at welcoming their guests and remembering familiar faces as well. There was a week where I was in the staying in the city and had final papers to work on so I came here multiple times that week. I was greeted with a "hi, welcome back Rachel" and I love how they remembered my name since they get soo many customers a day (granted I did stay for quite a long time).

For the coffee, it's so delicious! They serve basic drinks such as the usual mocha, latte, cappuccino, americano, etc. and they also serve specialty drinks such as lavender latte, red velvet latte, coconut vanilla latte, etc. I've tried their lavender latte and I really liked it. The floral flavor wasn't too strong and overwhelming nor was the latte too milky. I normally get their regular mocha and it's always made just right and they make their drinks so aesthetically pleasing as well - great for instagram pics!

Their food is so yums too. I tried their chicken meatball w/ pesto toast and it was delicious and  pretty! I love this food concept and it pairs greatly with a cup of coffee. Next time I'm there and a little hungry I want to try their condensed milk & butter toast too (:

Wifi is great here and they have a lot of outlets all around the cafe so it's great for studying. The warm environment is also great for just catching up with friends for a bit. I def recc this place to all my friends who live in SF or are visiting for a day. I've brought a couple good friends with me to this cafe already and they have all loved it just as much as me! What a gem.
author: Rachel T.

description:
Once you walk in and notice the comforting and chill vibe the clean atmosphere exudes, you'll realize how much their name fits!

They offer a wide variety of classic coffee drinks, yet the highlight of their handwritten menu lies in their "creative" specials. With creations from their sparkling Americano "Hangover" to their creamy latte concoctions like Lavender, Nutella, or Condensed Milk, you can't go wrong with any of them, if you can decide which one to get! After some tough deliberation, I settled on their Red Velvet Latte which came bright red and was artfully crafted to be silky and subtly sweet. 

My only issues for this place though were the snarky customer service and the people knowingly just hogging the tables without any drinks, especially individuals who would take up an entire large table. 

Other than that, this quaint cafe is cutely decorated and invitingly cozy, making it the perfect stop for a drink in the Sunset. Plus it's just a couple blocks to or from the tiled steps and Grand View Park!
author: Kyrie S.

description: Had their birthday cake latte and egg in a basket toast today. Both were delicious. The only downside is it's always busy and can be a 10+ minute wait.
author: Adrienne L.

description:
Wow. Seriously! I'm hooked! Their coffee and lattes are superb! I usually get the ice chocolate mint latte, which take me to another place emotionally. Like...I'm going to cry, it's so beautiful. They've got a great mocha, something called Holy Cow, which is a latte with condensed milk, and a bunch of different toast!

I'm obsessed with their butter and condensed milk toast. I believe the toast is brioche, which is a beautiful bread! I've also tried the chicken sausage toast with a fried egg. Wow, this one is also amazing!! It's got pesto, chicken sausage and a fried egg. Just take a look at my photos and drool! If it opened earlier than 8am, I'd be there every day on my way to work! 

The service is friendly. It sometimes takes a while to get your coffee, but only when it's busy. Be patient. It's worth it! They also have baked goods from When Butter Met Sugar. Give those a try because they are crazy good, too!

I'm constantly trying to make excuses to go Home. I'll see you there!

Price point: $4-5
author: Aaron Y.

description: I had a wonderful experience here at this charming little coffee shop. Half of these stars go to the accommodating girls behind the register. The other half of these stars go to the prettiest latte I've ever had. I ordered the birthday latte and the girls personalized a special message for me after my friend shouted that it was my birthday. They customized it with my favorite colors and brought it to our table. Home Cafe definitely knows how to make a bday girl feel special
author: Sophia L.

description:
I went to Home Cafe for the fourth time this morning and I had another wonderful experience! My first time there, I had the cookie monster latte (a Speculoos cookie butter coffee) and it was delicious. Since then, I've also enjoyed their rainbow, lavender, and nutella lattes. All of their drinks are unique and delicious.

Their food is also amazing! I've had their sweetened condensed milk toast as well as their toast topped with truffle oil, pesto, and tomato. Both meals have been great. They are just the right size (a thick-cut piece of toast generously topped with the advertised garnishes) that satisfy your carby-cravings. I'll definitely continue to frequent this cafe!
author: Noreen C.

description:
Found this place via Instagram. It's a very cute, little cafe and I love the ambience and how the entire cafe is so photogenic!
Not only do you get to experience beautiful latte art from the local baristas, but you get to enjoy great coffee. I ordered the popular birthday cake latte with almond milk, which was an extra 75¢. It was delicious! Not too bitter and not overly sweet, which I was expecting but I was pleasantly surprised! 
They have an arrange of unique drinks. I will most certainly be back to try more!
author: Erin M.

description: The line is crazy, but their coffee and food things are great. Really nice people who work there also
author: Pravin P.

description: Just randomly yelped a nearby coffeeshop/tea place to kill some time and my friends and I ended up here. I ordered the Lavendar Jasmine latte which was very fragrant and light. I wish it was a little thicker but other than that I thought it was a good drink. The decor is hipster and very clean and modern. It is a small place so not good for a lot of people to gather at. I would def recommend this place to people :)
author: Jane K.

description:
Very cute place to take Instagram worthy pics! I got the Birthday Cake latte which was surprisingly pretty good and not too sweet. I do think 5.25 for a small drink is pretty pricey. 

Bummed though that they put my drink in a to go cup when I asked to have it for there. I wanted to take cute pics!
author: Clarissa O.

description: I really enjoyed the drinks , great espresso quality with perfectly steamed milk. I really liked the latte art they serve the drinks with , it makes for a really special experience .
author: Frankie G.

description: I have been to Home twice so far. Today I got the Rose Latte, which I didn't see on the menu, but saw lots of beautiful photos of. I asked the woman working there and she said she would gladly make it. It was delicious, I could smell the roses when it came. It is definitely worth the try. I also had a chicken pesto sandwich, which was delicious and filling. Last time I went, I got the birthday latte, which looks beautiful in photos (since it is very colorful), but didn't have any unique flavor in my opinion. Will be back to try more soon!
author: I K.

description:
I've been here about 3 times now and I must say this is definitely one of my favorite cafes in SF. Depending on the day and time, you can either get a seat the second you get there or end up having to wait around to find a seat. However, they encourage you to share tables which is really great if you're a social butterfly. From my experience, I've gone here one time expecting to stay about a half hour or so, but I actually ended up staying for about 2 hours talking to this couple that one of my friends and I met. If you don't feel like waiting for a seat you can always take the drinks to go! 

Seating aside, the food is definitely delicious and they have a variety of drinks and toast to choose from. Yup, TOAST! From their toast options, I've tried (and nibbled from what my friends order) the cinnamon sugar toast, the eggs in a basket (with bacon YUM), and the chicken meatball with pesto and a fried egg on top. The first time I had eggs in a basket I thought it was buttery and seasoned well. One critique I have about it though was that the egg whites were mostly cooked (they still had a little bit of translucency) but not to the standard I usually like to have my eggs. After that first time though it's been cooked well and it tasted especially scrumptious with bacon added on top of it. The cinnamon sugar toast, from what I remember, wasn't too sweet and something I think I should try again soon. I had the chicken meatball toast most recently and it's the most filling out of the others I had because of all the ingredients in it especially the fried egg. The fried egg however was a bit chewy on the thinner edges of it because I think it got cold so the fried ends just didn't keep its crispiness. Other than that though I would say the toast is something to try out, especially for that oozing egg. 

Now, onto the highlight and main reason why Home cafe is so popular: LATTES! I've only tried two of their lattes from their menu: the lavender latte and cookie monster latte. The lavender latte definitely has a subtle lavender taste so it's not overpowering at all. The baristas add a little bit of lavender flowers on the very top which make for an aesthetically pleasing photo for social media. It's pretty but I like to scoop them out after taking a dozen photos so I don't have bits of lavender floating in my mouth. The cookie monster latte is my ultimate favorite latte. It's one of the more expensive lattes (next to the birthday cake latte) but the price is equivalent to a frappuccino from Starbucks. I gotta tell you though, if I didn't control myself I would've downed the cookie monster latte in one go. They use cookie butter in this latte and it just fills your tastebuds with a sweet, buttery, and cookie like taste. In addition, they add little bits of cookies in your latte which melt into the latte and make the drink all that much better. 

Overall, Home is a really nice and small cafe. The place is on the small side and sometimes you may have to wait (unless you're lucky like I have). The service is really nice the the past few times the person at the register is always super social and friendly.
author: Emily T.

description: Good place for afternoon coffee and a warm sandwith. If you plan to spend some time with laptop - watch out, as not all tables are "laptop allowed" :)
author: Maciek W.

description:
11/30/2015 Update: Came back to try the chicken sausage & pesto toast with my sister and her bff on a Friday afternoon. We ordered our lattes (which were delicious) & found a table to wait for our toast. The cashier said it should take about 10-15 minutes - which we thought was understandable since there was a good amount of people sitting & waiting. Little did we know, 30-45 minutes has passed, we finished our drinks & still no toast. My sister went up to ask how much longer and he said should be soon.... but we think they forgot. He apologized for the wait and said he'll toss in a free egg ($1.25) for each of us - which we were excited about. Literally 5 minutes later, he came out with our toast... that wasn't hot & didn't have an egg - you've disappointed me Home... 1 star for cozy setting/good music and another for free wifi.


7/15/2015: Great place to get some work done -- w/ free wifi! I ordered a red velvet latte & corn/bacon toast and my friend ordered a lavender latte & a meatball/pesto toast w/ an egg on top! 

Everything was so delicious, workers were friendly, & they played great music. Will definitely be back to try some more of their lattes & toast!
author: Carrie L.

description:
Best toast everrrr
Got the meatball with pesto one. Each bite was so flavorful. Toast was crispy and tasted buttery. Could also taste the melted cheesE. Kind of pricey but you're definitely paying for quality

Nice interior
You seat yourself and they bring the food to you.

Instagram worthy place
author: Amy V.

description: The first cafe I visited after first moving here from the East Coast. Great food, drinks, and friendly staff! Definitely a great spot to take visitors
author: Camille C.

description: The latte was decently good, but the experience was poor. The worker wouldn't let us use our laptop  after we sat down because there was a small sign designating almost half the place for NO LAPTOPS. All the other tables were full so we ended up having to ask strangers to share tables with them. That was one huge inconvenience about the place. Not too many outlets. Some things to consider if you're coming here.
author: Ting Ting C.

description:
Home....what an accurate name for this coffee shop, because when you enter through the doors, you actually feel like you a home. -end cheesy intro- 

Seriously! This place is awesome, and let me tell you why. They have amazing specialty drinks and the list of homemade creations is crazy long too! Today I had the "Birthday Cake" which was deliciously sweet, but more than anything, amazing to look at. Previous to that, I enjoyed one of their teas. One could argue that both of those choices are probably not the best representations of their coffee/espresso, but both of the things I got were absolutely yummy and I would 100% recommend. The only thing about this business is that is getting too popular for its size. The two times I have gone, it has been super crowded.

That being said, the most difficult part of a Home experience is finding a table. If you are doing takeout, this will not be an issue. Just enjoy the amazing toast offerings and coffee.
author: Kaitlyn F.

description:
Home is a modern little cafe between 19th and 20th. 

I tried an iced mint latte and found it a bit on the sweet side, but very refreshing. While the drink came out fast, the actual service was a bit slow. I loitered a good 5 minutes before even being greeted - a tiny snafu, if you ask me. I was also interested in trying the toast, but couldn't bring myself pay the price asked; it's pretty steep at $6+, even for "artisan" toast. 

As for the ambiance, it is definitely a place that I would like to be able to sit and catch up with friends, but I'm not sure if there would ever be a seat for me.

Case in point:

The group before me was a group of three women, one with a small child. They were relegated to sharing one bar stool while enjoying their coffees and toast. Though they didn't seem to mind, it seemed a bit rude when you saw multiple tables (meant for 2 to 4) occupied by 1 person mindlessly surfing the internet on their laptop.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
It's about time! Finally, a reasonably-sized coffeehouse in the city with friendly service, delicious food, and a coffee & tea menu that goes beyond a simple latte and fancy pour-over coffee. Let me explain... 

Home serves De La Paz coffee so there's definitely upscale, artisanal coffee on the menu. But nowadays, it seems San Francisco is oversaturated with cafes tailored only for coffee purists. Sometimes you just want to lounge at a place that has good coffee without the pretension. And sometimes artisanal coffeehouses in the city seem to attract customers who are too cool for school. Home is, well, homey! You can have the Iggy Azalea "fancy" coffee without the attitude or "trying-too-hard" environment. On top of that (as kitschy it may be to some), I occasionally enjoy flavored lattes. Their iced lavender latte is particularly lovely. It has a slightly floral profile, but the espresso is still very present --- silky and luxurious in the milk. 

Their chicken meatball toast is so on point! I wanted to scarf down the whole thing, but I realized this was something worth eating very slowly. The meatballs are especially tasty: savory (as it should be!), but also with a subtle sweetness. Did I mention there's a thick layer of cheese?! Also, this toast (like all of them on the menu) are knife-and-fork situations. These aren't meant to be eaten by hand: 1) because of the size of the toast and 2) you lose the delicacy of the "fancy" toast by not eating it with precision. 

The baristas and other workers are very friendly. I mean, they actually LOOK and SOUND happy. That's a great sign. If the front of the house has good energy, I'll assume folks in the back are equally satisfied working there. After all, this place is called "Home" -- it better be stable and warmly like a true "home." So far, it seems to emulate these traits.

The space itself isn't necessarily "homey" in the conventional sense. I expected very cozy seating and design, but the interior is quite modern and simple. That's not to say "modern and simple" can't be homey, but usually the aesthetics of "modern and simple" are design-focused rather than utility-driven. All in all, the set-up is perfect for working/studying though many customers come in with friends or family for a quick coffee catch-up. Thankfully, I've not encountered a moment yet where I can't find a seat. A plus: there are individual bar seats at the front facing the window. I work solo a lot and don't like occupying an entire table if I can avoid it. (I always feel awkward taking a whole table. Hey stranger! You're free to share with me! [But most folks don't ask to do that.]). 

So, some final thoughts: high quality and reasonably-priced food and beverages, friendly service, nice surroundings, free wifi... oh! and awesome music... WIN. WIN. aaaand WIN. Home has definitely jumped to the top as one of my favorite coffeeshops in the city. How serious is my appreciation for Home? I take 2 MUNI buses from Pacific Heights to Home in the Outer Sunset. That's real.
author: James Z.

description: Wow, what a lovely cafe! You can tell that people here put their heart into their craft. Not only was the almond milk latte excellent, the handcrafted pumpkin muffin was super fresh and soft. Despite having my order to go, the barista Still made sure that my latte had a nice design in the foam. The cashier was super friendly and welcoming-- "home" definitely is a fitting name for such a cozy, quality shop. Add in some Christmas music and warm lighting for the holiday spirit, it was a perfect experience!
author: Victor V.

description:
I love coming here to study or do some work. So in love with their playlist too. Noticed because one time I forgot to bring my earphones but that proved to be no problem.

I noticed recently they seemed to have had some new drinks! I usually get non-coffee drinks since I don't really drink coffee but I might try one next time. Their hot chocolate and matcha latte are delicious. Tried the fragrant lavender jasmine latte last time I came by, and it was so cute with the little lavender pieces. As for toasts, I've tried their chicken sausage one, which was delicious, and their cinnamon one, which was also delicious (and I don't even like cinnamon that much)! I don't know what they put in it.

The baristas and their crew are all so friendly and helpful too! :) I wish they open until later in the day too.
author: Sara T.

description: I've been here several more times since this review and my go to is the coconut vanilla latte. I'm not even a coconut loving person. It's so good! Everyone who I bring loves this cafe too :)
author: Corinna T.

description:
I'm not sure, upon self reflection, why I need to pay $8 for an egg inside a hole in a piece of toast.  Besides that though, the place is voraciously pretensious.

Okay fine, the speciality latte list is frankly fantastic.  But I need the food to meet the decor attempt and airy airs.  Then, I'd be very, very sold.
author: Kevin D.

description: Best lavender coffee I've ever tired! I enjoy their funny & creative cups that they offer! Just wish that there was more "enjoy each other's company" tables vs 90% seating area is for laptops! Other than that, can't complain!
author: Mary J S.

description:
I had high hopes for this place after reading all their wonderful reviews and I was not disappointed!! I came early this morning right when they opened and ordered a lavender latte for myself and an Affogato for my boyfriend. And yes he had the Affogato at 8 am on a cold ass misty foggy San Francisco morning. Both were delicious and beautifully presented! The barista was really nice and friendly and you could really tell he took the time to make our drinks. 

They have sooo many drinks and toast options on their menu that sound delicious and I WILL be back to try them ALL!! 

The interior is very homey, quite a bit of seating, easily a nice spot to get some work or studying done. This may be my new go to spot for a quick caffeine fix!
author: Linz C.

description: The cutest little cafe with the nicest staff. What's more is that they can do the coolest latte art and have a variety of unique drinks available. They have a wide selection of different toasts, too! It's the perfect spot to work at for the day- maybe you'll love it enough to call it your second HOME ;)
author: Jenna F.

description:
Been wanting to try Home for awhile.  Thank goodness they opened here in that soju bar's short lived spot.  He and I had to run off to San Mateo early last weekend and I wanted some breakfast beforehand.  He didn't want to wait for one of their awesome looking toasts, so we ended up just sharing a Mint Chocolate latte & running across the street for some donuts.  Double shots are in all the lattes.  It was about $4 and unfortunately they only have whole milk.  Stingy me didn't want to pay extra for soy or almond milk.  I've been noticing a handful of coffee shops only offer whole, I wish they would at least consider 2% at the very least, I mean we are pretty health conscious here in SF.  

We got the drink to go but unfortunately it took about 15 minutes to receive.  I'm sure if we got one of those toasts we would be looking at at least a half hour.  Service is friendly but when you get to go, it should never take more than 5 minutes for a latte and that's even pushing it.  There was only one guy acting as barista though.  Latte was good and not too sweet but the mint flavor was pretty faint.  I would be willing to come back to dine in for another unique coffee drink (red velvet latte may be next) and either the truffle or chicken meatball toast.
author: Cat C.

description:
1). Friendly staff
2). Clean interior 
3). Coffee was a 3 out of 5
4). Kind of expensive for what you get.
5). I'd go back.
author: Robert W.

description:
I really enjoyed my first time here. We sat here for about 2 hours, but it didn't feel like it. We left once it got crowded. Service was great and I'd definitely be back again. I'd have to say that you'll rarely catch me in a cafe, but this place felt like HOME. Anyway, let's get to the food review. 

Ordered 
Lavender Latte 
Frozen hot chocolate 
Chicken, meatball, pesto, egg toast 
Condensed milk and butter toast 

My friend really liked the latter, but I would've preferred a green tea latte or something. 
The frozen hot chocolate was worth a try 
The chicken, meatballs, pesto toast was delicious 
The condensed milk and butter toast was really sweet

Prices are average

Give it a try!
author: Maggie W.

description: Greeted with a warm "Welcome Home." The hostess finds out what you like and provides a recommendation. I rarely take that advice but this time was different and I'm so happy I did! The birthday cake latte (doesn't taste like birthday cake..I was nervous because I don't like cake) is absolutely beautiful and tastes like a vanilla hazelnut latte. It's a work of art!
author: Nicole A.

description: Delicious coffee. I definitely recommend the birthday cake coffee. The environment is warm and I feel very at home when I go. It's a perfect place to study or take your friends out on a coffee date
author: Lucia B.

description: Sigh I'll definitely have to give this place another try. Trekked all the way out here on a weekday before work (around 7:30am or so). But the kitchen doesn't open until 9, so all they had available were drinks and pastries. The pastries weren't bad, don't get me wrong, but I was craving hot breakfast food. But I guess that'll be for next time. I ended up ordering a hazelnut latte and a couple of warm pastries--they were all really good! The bacon spinach pastry was my favorite, and I don't even like bacon! The ham and cheese croissant was delicious as well. The croissant was just the right texture--light, fluffy, and rich in flavor. Both pastries were quite large, and one would have been more than enough, especially with the hazelnut latte. Prices here are reasonable and the staff is super friendly. Can't wait to come back and try their breakfast food!
author: Ashley Y.

description: I am absolutely and totally sold on this place. I came in wanting to try the birthday cake latte and found myself tempted by literally everything on the menu (lavender latte, holy cow latte, cookie monster latte, etc.) I wanted to get it all! I ended up with the birthday cake latte and my friend ordered the lavender latte so we could taste a bit of each others drinks. The birthday cake latte is super aesthetically pleasing. I was worried that it would be overly sweet or that it wouldn't taste too much like coffee, but I was pleasantly surprised when I took my first sip. It was a really well balanced drink with the right amount of sweetness. It almost had a hazelnut undertone to it. My friend's lavender latte was equally as good! Floral and sweet without being overwhelming. In both cases, the coffee stood out even with the added flavors and nuances. I will most likely go back to this place as soon as I can because I am on a quest to try all their other lattes!
author: Lakshmi M.

description:
A very cute little place that looks totally different from the soju bar it use to be. They have a pretty extensive list of drinks and toast. I wanted to try a toast but I opted to just try the coffee for now.


Lavender latte: 4/5: pretty good flavor, you can definitely taste the hints of lavender and the de la Paz coffee tastes pretty Damm good. It's creamy and also not too sweet. I would say if you aren't looking for anything too sweet but with a hint of lavender this is the drink for you. Oh and all coffee drinks come with two double shots FYI! 

this review is based off of one drink but I'm convinced that I'll be back more often to try their other drinks and the toasts! And I'm sure I won't be disappointed with the other drinks. If you are looking for a good new coffee place to try in the sunset this is one to check out!

Total for 1 drink: $4
author: Stella J.

description:
"Welcome Home"! is how our waitress greeted us. What a cute concept. The cafe definitely has a homey feel, and the servers/barista are very friendly. It's a good place to catch up, get some work done, or just come people watch. The layout of the restaurant is very simple but had cutesy decorations that were welcoming to all types of visitors (thus the Home concept). 

I wanted to try everything but of course as a first time visitor, I got their famous lavendar latte, condensed milk toast - and my friend got their coconut milk latte. EVERYTHING WAS SO DELICIOUS. I don't like coconut milk (yes I'm weird) but that was soooo good too! Not too sweet - which is a plus. I wasn't sure on how to approach cafes that offer unique twists on coffee but Home definitely hit the spot. I can't wait to come back and try their affogato, earl grey latte, and jasmine latte as well as their other toasts. 

Note: They only offer whole milk. According to person who was ringing us up, it's because they do latte art and all milks other than whole milk won't show up as nice. However, they do offer soy milk and almond milk as subs.
author: Annie L.

description:
had a hot matcha latte. was a little powdery, but i liked the level of sweetness and the strength of the tea.

it's a cute place. i usually get too distracted to study at cafes, but if you're into that, it's a good place for getting work done.
author: Heather F.

description:
Home is one of my favorite cafes in Sunset! The drinks are good and the service is always so friendly and cheery.

The entire place is very Instagram-worthy and nicely decorated! The overall ambiance feels very relaxed, with plenty of natural lighting and soft music. The cafe is also pretty spacious (which is extremely rare for cafes in Sunset/SF) and everything is very clean (even the bathroom). Someone working there usually wipes down the tables before the next guest sits down. 

Besides your typical coffee & espresso drinks, Home also offers some pretty unique offerings including lavender and coconut lattes. My favorite is definitely the lavender latte!! It's sweetened with lavender syrup and garnished with real petal bits! They offer both a lavender coffee latte & a lavender tea latte; the tea is a bit more aromatic and lavender-eque.

They do have a small selection of decaf drinks, but the only decaf coffee they offer is a pour-over. No decaf espressos :( 

*Biggest bummer is the parking - there are metered parking spots right outside or free street parking (if you're lucky) a couple blocks away.
author: Samantha C.

description:
"I gotta get get gotta gotta get home.."
Home by Magnetic North.

There's no better name for this cafe than Home. I love the interior design. That "whiteness" and natural lighting was a plus. Downside, the dimness was a little hard to study with. 

There's plenty of tables and some outlets as well. Did I mention free wifi? It's an ideal place for studying and catching up. The place gets crowded fast, so come during off hours to guarantee yourself a seat.
