***Tip: Study with some headphones as it can get pretty noisy

Their drink menu is vast and creative. There's so many that I want to try but sadly only one of me. I guess I'll take it slowly, and try a different one each time. For now, the Nutella Latte will do. 
++cute latte design
+super rich and creamy
+chocolate w/ enough caffeine to wake you up

To give you an idea of their other options: Lavender Latte, Hangover, Matcha Latte, Drip Coffee, Iced Coffee, Holy Cow .. and so many more!

Not only do they have drinks, they also have really creative toasts as well. Eggs in a Basket was my choice for today. One perfectly sunny side egg embedded in the toast with light pepper seasoning. Also, very very heavy buttery coating. I loved the presentation and idea, but it was just so so for me as it was a tad too salty and I felt the guiltiness of it afterwards. Still willing to try the others though! 

Lastly, props to a fantastic service. Can't wait to go back Home. 

Instagram worthy. Yelp worthy. Fifi approves :)
author: Fiona L.

description: Stopped by here with my friend and we both loved it. The staff is super friendly & helpful! The drinks were great & the place is very aesthetic, hahaha. Nice place to study, though it can get pretty crowded. Super cute coffee shop though, would definitely come back! :)
author: Bianca Juliene C.

description:
Wide selection of lattes & I love the ambience in here! I ordered the holy cow latte which had condensed milk in it & the bf got the iced coconut vanilla latte - both really good. 

They ran out of toast tho :( so I'll be back to try the other lattes & the toast!!
author: Kelly C.

description:
The staff are very friendly. Food and coffee were excellent. 

This place caters to the college students. Which is not a bad thing. Except you cant find a place to sit and eat or drink your coffee. 

Everyone is on their laptops for hours on end. They told us we could share tables but it is alil awkward when these students are on the laptops and were just eating, chatting and sipping at their table  

If you don't mind it then your golden. Me personally am not a fan. 

Hopefully they will consider some out side seating in the future.
author: Heather T.

description:
Run by a husband-and-wife team with Hollywood looks and next-door neighbor charm, Home is a quaint new cafe that will add some real coffee cred to Central/Outer Sunset. It's not a place I'd go and get my daily coffee (that honor goes to Henry) because their two-shot Americano, while delicious, doesn't have enough caffeine to last me a full day for some reason (and unfortunately, the same has to be said about their drip coffee...really wish they offered more than one size for their drinks!).

But that's totally okay.

Because Home isn't for that kind of coffee drinking. It's more of a place you want to go to treat yourself and when you aren't on a time crunch. It's best enjoyed when you have the luxury to sit down and enjoy your food and drink, maybe with a friend you haven't seen in awhile, or a place to spend a quiet morning with your SO, or even just to get some me-time with your Mac or moleskine. The atmosphere is lovely, with plenty of seats and succulents. Andytown may have its Snowy Plover and Trouble may have its toast and coconuts, but Home has its Hangover (sparkling Americano) AND Eggs in a Basket! Both of which are better than their fancier and more expensive counterparts in Outer Sunset. If you're a fan of Hollow in Inner Sunset, you'll love Home--the creative drinks are more reasonably priced and the space is more comfortable.

Home is a new business and it looks like they're expanding and still playing around with their menu. So far I'm very happy with what they have to offer and I hope the Sunset ends up being their new home for good.
author: Tiffany H.

description:
I'm so happy Home opened as it's hard to find good coffee in the 'set!  Home is spacious, bright, and has a lot of natural sunlight.  I love the simple decor as it's clean and not cluttered. Mini succulent plants on the shelves, fresh floral arrangements line the tables., and a giant scroll against the wall featuring their menu.  It's very inviting and comfortable, which makes you feel right at "home".  Great place to study or meet up with friends to catch up.

I've been here twice and Annie already recognized me and chatted me up.  She and In are very friendly.  

Mocha - Comes with marshmallows, but "A" had it omitted.  He ordered it regular sweet and enjoyed it.  However, I thought it was too sweet for my liking.  

Red Velvet Latte - Excited they make red velvet latte here as I don't have to trudge all the way to Never Too Latte.  I asked for it to be not so sweet and it came out perfect.  

Matcha Green Tea Latte - Delicious!  The matcha was subtle enough that even "A" said it was good.  

Cinnamon Sugar Toast - Not your everyday toast!  It tastes like cinnamon toast crunch.  The bread is about an inch thick and eat bite is covered in buttery, sugary, cinnamon-y goodness. Must order!

Tomato + pesto + truffle oil + parmesan - Savory thick cut toast! Delicious!  

They have a variety of other specialty drinks, different toast options, and pastries.  I can't wait to come back!

And don't forget to put your dishes away when you're done, you're at "Home" after all.
author: Candice H.

description:
Great place to get good toast and coffee. Friendly staff and pretty decor.
My favorite is the bacon and corn toast. They have an option to add an egg but I usually decline because it gets messy, but if you like egg, than this is awesome for you!

Note: They only allow you to sit in the shop for 2 hours. Plan accordingly if you want to study or do something that may take time.
author: Cicely T.

description: Long overdue review, but this place is awesome. I love the cozy vibes the interior and atmosphere give off. Their lattes could use a little more taste, but that's just my preference since I like my coffee super sweet! It'd be cool if they could add an option to adjust your sweetness. Anyways, I'm so glad my parents found this little hole in the wall. We always stop by whenever I'm home. I've tried all of their toasts and they are ALL sooooo delicious and flavorful. My family orders each flavor every time we come. The staff is also super friendly and welcoming, which complements the feel to this coffee shop! Rain or shine, I definitely wouldn't mind stopping by the next time I'm in town.
author: Lauryn S.

description:
-gorgeous space amazingly designed by annie.
- wonderfully friendly owners and operators
- tasty baked goods to accompany outstanding  coffee drinks skillfully crafted by the boss.

what more can you ask of the former space of sunset's fabled Bashful Bull location?

the cinnamon toast and sweetened condensed milk buttered thick toast is quite the find too! 
if you want a savory option, a true winner is the chicken meatball toast with an over easy fried egg (so AZN) and so tasty!

I cannot say much more. except "THANKS to  In and Annie"  for opening up a great business so close to my office.

I may become a regular here, soon.
JYW 10 year Black Level Yelp Elite approved.
author: Jeff W.

description: In love with this place! The staff is super friendly and polite. It's a cute hipster looking cafe and small. The tables are set out so not all of them are used for laptops which is pretty cool. The lattes are really pretty with their designs and good. I had the birthday cake latte so pretty and taste definitely recommend my friend had the Nutella latte and said it was really good and tasted like hot chocolate so it's on the sweeter side. Also has a strawberry pastry very good moist and taste. This place is a must!
author: Valeria F.

description:
I love a good pour over. I also love a strong cold brew.
You know what else I also love!?? CONDENSED MILK TOAST. My grandmother would sometimes make it for me as an after school snack. I was one happy little girl with a sticky face. 

Home is a great new addition to the 'set. Thanks for opening!! I don't have to trudge all the way down toward the beach or head to inner Sunset when looking for GOOD coffee in this area. Home is bright, airy, and spacious. Lots of natural sunlight, which instantaneously puts me in a better mood. 
 I absolutely adore the way it is decorated. Clean, simple, not a lot of clutter. Some potted succulents on shelves, and a giant scroll with a small menu. 
 Lots of seating if you want space to read a book or pound away on your keyboard. 

Home brews with De La Paz & Four Barrel beans. They offer lattes and teas...my beloved condensed milk toast as well as some savory versions, some pastries..Just an all around noteworthy place in the sleepy Sunset. I feel like Noriega is on the up and coming.. First we get a brewery, now Home!

You know what else rocks about Home? They are super nice! Very friendly and they get to know their customers. 


I just feel right at Home.
author: Susy C.

description: Truly welcoming and friendly staff. The atmosphere here is nice and relaxing and thus good for working or reading. Many people seem to mean to stay for a long time and they occupy the many outlets. Seoul much avo is mind blowing! As for the lavender latte, although I do like the idea, it is a bit too sweet to be my kind of latte.
author: Lily O.

description: I used to love going to Home for their matcha lattes and toast. But lately their matcha lattes have been inconsistent and are unfortunately a ripoff because they taste like warm milk. Tasteless and no matcha flavor at all and you're paying $5 for it. Even I, could make a better one. Sometimes though, the matcha lattes are good, but not great. I wouldn't order the matcha latte again.
author: Harper W.

description: Visited from out of town on a Tuesday morning and absolutely love it! Ordered one of the eggs in a basket toasts and also tried the rose latte and birthday cake latte. The food & drink exceeded my expectations and the service provided was great! Cozy spot, friendly staff, available metered parking. Will definitely come back I'm in the Inner Sunset.
author: Christabel A.

description:
Amazing little find on my way to my nail appointment in the Sunset. 

As a new mother, I am in a constant and desperate need of coffee. However, I don't just want "a coffee," I want good coffee. That means dull Starbucks will not do. I've been San Francisco-nized, this most likely means that I need the high-end, organic, gluten-free blah blah sh&t.  Haha. 

Ok, fine, enough crazy coffee rants. Back to Home - super cute cafe that serves some really yummy/cute toast. I have only tried the cheese, pesto/tomato toast and it was good. Also, the lavender latte is just lovely. 

Quick props to the ladies working the counter - they saved me from a ticket. I decided it was a good idea to skip paying the meter right outside the shop. The ladies saw me walking in and as my back is turned to my car and I'm ordering, a meter maid begins the ticket writing process. One of the sweet girls quickly tells me and I run to plead with the meter maid. It worked, no ticket, but I did get some damn good coffee. 

Give this cute place a try if you're in the hood.
author: Irina R.

description: This place gets busy. It's hard to find a table. Do know that. They actually have a limit for how long people can stay. The drinks were decent. It's more for the look of the drinks than the taste I think. I got a lavender latte and it was really good, but coffee wise, it was okay. For how crowded it is, I think it's only worth coming back for a to go drink. It's a nice place to sit, if you can find a seat.
author: Julie L.

description: First off, coffee & food is why this place is getting any stars (which would be at least 4-stars). Huge minus' for the way seating is handled there. Came here on Mother's day, got drinks & food to stay...coffee & food shows up.No where to sit, mainly because 3/4 of people there, which had finished their drinks (many with just empty cups on the table next to their laptops) just sitting. the time we were there, only one table opened and left, the rest just reading their facebook. The fact the place is really small and basic customer base is inconsiderate, drops this from 4-star to 2-star. Get your coffee and food togo, or try the other coffee houses in the sunset.
author: L G.

description:
Dude Where's My Coffee?
One Man Coffeepack
Harold & Coffeemar Go To Coffee Castle
Half Coffeed #neeeardecoffeebeeeach
Fast Times At Coffeemont High

Was so ready for The Hangover carbonated coffee to be mind = blown, coffee = brewed. The batch I got was at a flatness that felt more like a slight tang than bubbles. I need more fizz action - if it doesn't make the back of my nose twerk, why am I drinking this? #thatswhatshesaid #nothating Might give it another try in the future.
author: Dan B.

description:
This is the kind of place I love finding on Yelp. 

Home is a wonderful and warm coffee shop, not pretentious at all. I hope it stays just how it is, because it's perfect. The ambiance is clean and cozy, plus the cashier and barista were so friendly and kind.

We ordered a "hangover" (sparkling americano), nutella latte, cinnamon sugar toast, and condensed milk toast. It came out to about $19 for the four items. The drinks were delicious and the toast was super thick and soft, kind of like Asian-style brick toast but not as crispy. We enjoyed everything and would definitely order the same on our next visit.

Thank you, Home, for the pleasant experience! We'll be back soon!
author: Jenn C.

description: Love the atmosphere! It's the perfect place to study, grab coffee, and a bite. Mellow music and spacious tables. They have a variety of creative latte drinks that you have to try. They do, however, ask that you limit your study time here to two hours. I'm sure they wouldn't mind as much when it's a slow day. Friendly staff!
author: Meagan C.

description: This place is all about the cuteness and is well worth a trip or two. I came here to see the Birthday Cake Latte in person, and I am happy that I did. It's so pretty. Of course I did what everyone did and instagrammed that baby pronto when I got it. What I didn't like so much was the chicken meatball toast. I like my meat salty and savory, but this one was more so sweet. Well, I'm going to keep this review as short as my visit was. All in all- just come here for the birthday cake latte. It's like drinking a cupcake :).
author: Mimi N.

description: Super cool environment, except people take days to leave. Cmon guys just drink and eat your stuff and let other people sit down. Haha. I got an iced coconut vanilla latte and my boyfriend got a hot chocolate mint latte. They were both really good but my boyfriend wished his was a little hotter. Really good and def coming back!
author: Hayley D.

description:
Everything is so lovely here! The atmosphere, service and coffee drinks are amazing. 
My friend and I went here during Sunday afternoon and all of the tables are filled up already. Such a busy afternoon, but it's ok since we wanted to order drinks to-go for this visit. My friend ordered the Caramel Latte, while I ordered the Lavender Jasmine Tea Latte. Both of these drinks were deliciously and beautifully made. Mines had the right amount of Jasmine and lavender scents and taste, along with the taste of coffee combined. I wished I could've thought to buy another cup. I will definitely plan to come here more often. 
Overall, definitely check out Home if you're close by Noriega and/or Ocean Beach. It's worth the trip to try out one of their creative coffee beverages.
author: Vivian L.

description: I prefer the other location compared to this one a lot more. I came today around 12:20 to get ice coffees to go and the line was long. Had to wait 10 minutes for my order to be taken and around 15 min  for my drink to be made. The one star is for the girl  taking my order without her I would give this a 0 star if I could. I wouldn't have minded as much of the wait if I didn't have some place to be and the workers were actually working faster instead of talking mostly. I asked for a iced chocolate mint latte extra sweet and less ice and a normal ice coconut vanilla latte. The coconut vanilla was fine but the girl making my drink put a lot of ice in my drink and she realized that and asked if I wanted less, and I said yes. She then went to scoop out the ice and just gave it to me like that. She couldn't at least top it off with more milk or something? It just feels stupid to wait 30 minutes for a coffee not even filled all the way and the coffee had no mint or chocolate flavor whatsoever.. Don't think I'll come back to this location.
author: Kayla F.

description:
This is really a very laid back and also a non-intimidating cafe, which I love. Sometimes cafes can feel too high-end and bougie, but this one is just comfortable. That's defintiely not to say this one isn't up to par-- it actually means the opposite. I really love an establishment that feels personal and knows how to treat guests.The service is great, and the drinks are so aesthetic, also v. yummy. My best recommendation here is the matcha latte! Really earthy and full bodied. Have never been disappointed.

My ONE downside of this place: if you're listening owners of Home, please change your hours! I only get to come here once in a blue moon, but I'd really love to come around more often. It would just be amazing if the hours extended until maybe 7pm so that I can have a chance to relax with a comforting matcha after work. I promise you, I'll throw you my money.
author: Melissa G.

description:
A pretty chill spot in the Sunset district. There is only street parking but it wasn't too difficult to find a spot. Inside is your typical coffee and tea spot. There are some long and round tables for people to chill and do work. When I was here the place was packed and there was no where to sit. The restroom was clean and well maintained. 

I decided to get a green tea latte. I was surprised by the taste of it. Although it was a little on the sweet side, I did like that it wasn't screaming hot and that I did not have to wait a couple of minutes for it to cool down. For coffee and tea place, they have plenty of choices of baked goods. 

The service here is pretty good. Despite looking like they were slammed, they were able to give me my drink in a timely fashion. I definitely liked the environment and the aura of this place, and I look forward to checking this place out if I'm in the area.
author: Jason P.

description:
Decided to come here to get some work done. Tables were full and I was in line for a drink. Luckily as I just finished ordering a drink, a table left and I sat down. I noticed people come and go quite frequently, unlike other coffee shops where people sit for a long period of time. As I got up to grab my drink, I noticed they had a 2 hour seating limit sign! Oh well. I enjoyed my drink and got my work done.
The drink was the usual hipster coffee pricing, $5+. I got the lavender latte because that's what the cashier recommended. Gotta say it was pretty good. The lavender was subtle and not overwhelming.
Good drinks, good vibes, only downside is that you can't stay too long.
author: Kev L.

description: Checked this spot out w/my teen during Spring Break! It was recommended to me by a co-teacher & she was right about everything! On our first visit, we ordered Nutella Latte, Birthday Cake Latte, Abbs of Toast & Let's Avo-Cuddle. So delicious and the space is cute. The space is not big but I wouldn't worry about that if you come here. All the stars are for originality, flavor, creativity, & of course the customer service. The young lady at the counter was very nice to inform me about the Birthday Cake Latte not tasting like it but simply inspired by it & it tends to be on the sweeter side. She recommended lightly sweet and it was PERFECT! I don't like my beverages too sweet. So big thanks to everyone for our 1st time experience! We will definitely be back and bring more customers w/us to enjoy.
author: Linette I.

description:
+ Excellent lattes - just tried a new item on the menu, the holy cow (condensed milk latte).

+ Menu with a good amount of drink options and food too.

+ Friendly and sincere service. The cashier knew everyone who walked in and they appeared to be regulars. 

+ Clean, open space with plenty of tables. 

+ Another review notes the drink menus and they are worth mentioning. Gigantic butcher paper rolls bolted to the wall that roll down like scrolls. Very nice touch.
author: Maya S.

description:
This is a little gem in the sunset district. I came here last Friday with a friend and had an awesome experience. I ordered an affogato and she ordered a London Fog.

This place probably serves the biggest affogato in San Francisco. I've had Front and Four Barrel's affogatos which were half the size. In addition, it comes with a cone! I can't tell what kind of ice cream they use, but they use Four Barrel for the espresso. The slight bitterness of Four Barrel was masked by the sweetness of the chocolate. The combination was truly magical.

I had a sip of my friend's drink and it was also really good. I think It was earl grey tea with some milk or cream. 

The interior of Home is super nice! A great place to get some work done or to just hang out with friends. The place is large enough for a lot of people which is nice. 

I would definitely return and I hope to try some of their toast next time!
author: Lydia H.

description: Loud with uncomfortable seating. Decent but expensive toast dishes, sour espresso. Friendly and welcoming staff.
author: M W.

description:
Great place to study or do homework! They have cute decorations, food, and drinks.

I tried the Sea Salted Caramel Latte and it was soooo good. Cute coffee art as well. Will definitely be back!
author: Linda C.

description:
Delicious toasts and such nice people!

Egg in the basket- my favorite item here, so buttery, but in a good way because I usually dislike butter and I loved this! The thick toast is carved out in the center to fill with a perfectly cooked yet runny egg. Cut-out piece of bread is crisp and sweet, served on the side. Was told to dip that piece with the runny egg... Hmm yes it was soo good!

Chicken meatball toast- good. Reminds me of the Chinese green onion/pork thread buns. 

Lavender latte- solid and beautifully presented. A bit too sweet for me, but I think many people would like it. A bit challenging to drink because dried lavender may get into your mouth, then you find yourself trying to spit it out and still looking like a lady :) a straw would be great

Space is simple yet spacious, not that many seats. Food took a little while to come out though the place wasn't that busy. So just make sure you're not in a rush! ;)
author: Iris H.

description:
Yass! Affogato here is love! I mean, what's not to love? Normally only a shot of espresso and a scoop of ice cream, this affogato takes the cake and adds a waffle cone on top of your drink to go. Their coffees and toasts are also of the tasty variety.

If you need a midday pick me up or if you need a spot to get some work done, come here for a caffeinated treat.
author: Amy L.

description: Cute place for a fun cup of coffee and light bite to eat. Birthday cake latte with almond milk is . Brioche toast is delish. Definitely worth a stop. And near the 16th street stairs if you want to take a stroll afterwards.
author: Abigail S.

description:
First off. How cute is this place ?! :)

Love that there are more coffee shops opening up away from the hustle and bustle of Irving and the non-existant parking in the outter sunset hipster hub. 

Bright and airy with ample work space and outlets, Home might be my new home. The servers are super sweet and friendly. They have a good selection of drinks and serve De La Paz and Four Barrell. There's also some pastry options and made to order Toast.

Items ordered: Guatemalan Pour Over & Hazelnut Latte; Chicken Meatball Toast
author: Jenn Y.

description:
I think I may have stepped foot into Home at the peak of rush hour. There were dozens of high schoolers swarmed around tables. But in the midst of this madness, after patiently waiting in line, my drink was served to me in literally minutes. 

I commend the staff for their fast and welcoming service. The lavender latte I had was delicious. I have no complaints. I'll make sure to update my review once I'm back for a breakfast treat. (The eggs in a basket looked delicious!)
author: Sarin P.

description:
Awesome specialty lattes and toast!!

We came in on a Friday morning and the place was pretty packed. Seemed like a good sign.

We ordered the lavender latte, chocolate mint latte, and the chicken meatball pesto toast with a fried egg.

The lavender latte was so beautiful. They decorate the latte with actual lavender leaves which I thought was a great touch. It also tasted great, the lavender flavor wasn't overwhelming at all and was really light and floral. I really enjoyed it!

My boyfriend got the chocolate mint latte, only lightly sweetened. He really seemed to like it as well. I tried it too and thought it had good flavor but could definitely see it being way too sweet if we hadn't lowered the sugar.

The chicken meatball pesto toast was out of this w o r l d. It was so much more flavorful than I had anticipated and was the perfect size to share for two people! Would highly recommend adding an egg because the thick toast soaks up the yolk pretty well and made it even more delicious :3

The service was really helpful and friendly! They made the place feel very home-y. Definitely ask for recommendations if you're not sure!

Overall, while this was pretty pricy - ~$4.50/latte, $8 toast, I think that the quality was worth the price! I will definitely be back to try their other toasts and lattes :)
author: Kimberly H.

description:
Love the toasts here! My boyfriend and I visited this place around 11 am on a weekday. The place was filled with people and there were no available seating so make sure you check before you decide for here or to go. 

I ordered a chocolate mint latte with my tomato pesto toast. The chocolate mint latte was SO sweet. I actually could not finish it because it was so sweet. However, it may be because of the type of latte I got so I will try their other drinks. The tomato and pesto toast was delicious. It was full of flavor and I love it that the bread was crunchy and not soggy. I also added an egg on top which made it even better. 

I will definitely recommend this place but be cautious of the sweetness of their drinks.
author: Arda S.

description: If you're looking for a cute aesthetic cafe to chill or do homework at, this is the place! It has several seats facing the window so if you're into individual work and fresh sunlight then sit there but if you're more of a group seater they have several tables too! They have a bathroom as well! I got a vanilla latte and the birthday cake latte. Both equally good but I prefer my drinks pretty sweet so the birthday cake one is now my new go to! The service is pretty good and fast. Super efficient. Can't wait to come back soon :)
author: Jessica Y.

description:
I love going Home! (see what I did there)

This place is adorable and the drinks and pastries/toasts are great. I have tried their Hazelnut Latte, Affogato, London Fog, and the Hangover drinks and a few of their toasts - just to name a few. The place has a modern feel to it with their decor. There are lots of tables (with outlets) and the tables are large and not crammed next to one another which is a bonus plus. I can see myself doing work here with a nice cup of coffee. It does get packed during the weekend, even a little too loud sometimes, but I see many people who would just get their coffees to go instead.

The service is nice and the people who work here are always so friendly. I even visited Home when it was 10 minutes till closing and the workers here didn't rush us to get out or anything when we sat down for a bit to chat. They even asked if we would like to sit in even though they were closing in just a few minutes. 

This is definitely a place to check out if you're in the neighborhood and parking isn't too bad either.
author: Victoria K.

description: definitely a great place to study and complimentary wifi. There is a lot of seating, but a lot of people occupy the tables for their computers. The coffee here is generally cheaper than other cafes but I enjoyed the atmosphere here. I came here with 3 other people and we got one cold brew, one normal latte and an affogato. The affogato came in a large mug with an ice cream cone. Cold brew wasn't bad at all and the latte was great as well. Overall, coffee wasn't bad and would definitely come again if I am in the area.
author: Kenneth L.

description:
I'm HOME!! 

Well not really, no pajamas and a blanket but close.

It's a great space with great people and great food.New flavor combinations & original menu items. 

It's light and bright inside with lots of busy people. Socializing, working and relaxing.

They offered for me to bring in my pup which is a big deal for me. I actually moved from the South Bay because of the criticism I got for having a dog. So being close to home, going out with my pup and being able to have her freely around and doing things I enjoy makes me feel @ HOME!

; )
author: Jessica M.

description:
Came here at 10am in a Wednesday. Where all them college students come from?! There's a long row of tables  and chairs along the wall to and near the front window to accommodate those that want to get some work done whole enjoying their coffees/teas. By noon, every table was taken but don't be shy to share a table.

This is my first time getting coffee with latte art in an actual mug...It's a very different experience! Got the MATCHA latte with soy with light sweetness (total was $5.71. I love that they asked me about my sweetness preference) Really felt the coziness of home, especially since they have cushions to make sitting extra comfy :)

Free Wi-Fi, sufficient outlets, a bathroom, and FOOD -you could basically live here! That is, until they close at 5pm. that's not convenient for students wanting to pull late nighters. But hey, the beauty of a small shop is that they can set their own hours and I can respect that.

Summary of experience:
--Pretty stong cup of matcha! It taste healthy which is all I was looking for. A bit clumpy toward the bottom, maybe bc I drank it slowly trying to savor it.
--That was an expensive latte...Wonder why iced lattes are like 50 cents more expensive
--I would definately want to come back for the ambiance. Music playing on speakers was pleasant and noise level at Home isn't distracting and loud; there's a zen-like vibe to this place
author: Jade Z.

description: This place is a great to study! The decor is super cute!  I love the environment! The staff and everyone here are super friendly. The lattes are delicious! Will come here again to study and try some other drinks/treats!
author: Gina P.

description: Birthday cake latte was amazing. Got it decaf nutty and smooth zero bitterness. The jasmine lavender latte was great as well - delicately flavored with light and airy foam. Didn't get to taste any of their toast options sadly as the kitchen closed at 4. Definitely will be back when we are in the city.
author: Mohamed M.

description:
Nice cute little cafe located in the sunset.

Cold brew was pretty good and cheaper than other places i've been too. 
Their affogato was also pretty good as well! ice cream was really creamy.

Would come back again if I was in the area
author: Brian L.

description:
I've been here a few times to try their different lattes. I've had their lavender earl grey latte which was pretty good, a little too sweet, and also a little pricey. I've also had their red velvet latte which did not taste that great but okay-ish. It kind of tasted like a burnt mocha.  Their toast is pretty good. Although I've only had one of them, eggs in a basket, I'd definitely go again for it, but it is on the saltier side. 

If your looking for a cute coffee place, you should define fly come here, but if your looking for a really good cup of joe, I recommend going somewhere else.
author: Ambur -.

description:
Great coffee and service.

As you may have read, it gets busy. I feel it's a bit difficult to maneuver around once you've paid due to the arrangement, but the lattes made are pretty good.

This is my fourth time here so yeah, it's cool. Today, we had the Holy Cow and the Cookie Monster.

Both lattes had a smooth, rich layer of froth that I crave. The cookie monster comes with little cookies that go great with this froth; it made for a good bite. It's also not too sweet which I did not expect, but my friend was fond of. The holy cow has the lingering taste of condensed milk and is sweeter which I liked. Lastly, the lattes didn't taste strong in my opinion, but I think they're prepared with two shots. Maybe it's that good because it's no issue for me.

All in all, you'll get a good latte. I do wish they had a larger size, but it is a nice serving.
author: Raymond L.

description:
THE cutest coffee shop I've ever been to! The atmosphere and ambiance really does make it seem like home(although my home looks nothing like it). The lights that dangle across the booth seats make the whole place soooo cozy! And how can I forget about the succulent plants on each table?! The plants give this place life! 

They have quite an extensive menu for their creative coffees. It was extremely hard to choose what to try because everything looked SO good. I opted for the holy cow, a condensed milk latte, so the BF(not a coffee drinker, LAME) and I can share. I snapped a photo of my drink and the barista told me to come back when it's not too busy so she can make me a prettier drink! 

Don't worry barista, I'll be back for your famous toast and your other delicious drinks.
author: Jenny C.

description: Any place with condensed milk toast is a winner. This is a very nice cafe that lets you sit and get some work done. They have a few nice options of toast. And they have nice lattes for those of us who like a sweeter option. They have a good amount of seating room, but the wifi does lag on downloading very big files.
author: Nikita K.

description:
Came in early on a Saturday morning, wasn't fully awake but the cashier sure was preppy.  I ordered a Cold Brew and Eggs in a Basket.  The coffee was nice and strong, not too watery either.  My toast was simply delicious.  It's a fairly thick slice of buttered bread, an egg layered on top, along with pepper spices.  Nice kick and really satisfying meal.

This place has changed a few times already, from Bashful Bull to Shabu Tonight to ii-Cha Soju Bar in the past few years.  I'm hoping Home stays a lot longer.  It's got great service and it's a nice place to sit and enjoy a cup of coffee.
author: Karen L.

description:
This cafe has a very good atmosphere for studying. The decorations are very cozy and gives off a hipstery vibe. Word of warning, it is a bit loud due to the volumes they get, so bring good headphones.

Parking isn't impossible, but it still takes some times to find. Nowhere near as bad as the parking in downtown area, so it's not a huge problem.

The coffee is pretty good. I usually order a lavender latte, I don't recall trying their other selections. They serve the usually coffee orders, as well as teas, and a couple of specialty drinks (like the lavender latte, and also red velvet coffee).

The price of the food is a bit high for me, but it is pretty good in terms of flavor. Their toast's crust is hard to cut, but it's not their fault. Toast is just like that. I usually get the chicken meatball pesto toast.

It's my default study area, I haven't really found any I really like. I'm open for suggestions.
author: Virginia B.

description:
We were so thankful that Home was opened on New year's day. My friend has been wanting to try this cafe since forever and finally got a day off, so we made a trip down to SF.

Even though the place was packed, seats all taken, lines up to the front door, it went fairly quick. When we got our drinks, tables simultaneously opened up, so it worked out. The lady who took our order was genuinely friendly and super attentive.

My friend ordered the birthday latte and I ordered the lavender latte with soy. Both were delicious. I really enjoyed my lavender latte. It had strong lavender scents, light lavender taste, but tasted so good! I'm lactose intolerant, so I really appreciated the soy option. We really wanted to try their toast, but they had ran out when we got there. 

The look and feel of the cafe was really home-y and cute. (Lol see what I did there? ) I would definitely recommend trying this cafe. There are so many drinks on the menu I'm definitely coming back for! And I'm sure they are just as good as the ones I've tried. The latte art also makes everything so much more enjoyable!
author: Christine L.

description: Great food. Great coffee. Would love to see some dedicated food or coffee only tables, it is often hard to find seating because of the popularity as a study space.
author: David G.

description: For the sweet tooth coffee drinkers, this place offers a good variety of different coffee drinks while also offering the normal cappuccinos and lattes. Employees are great and friendly. And the toast is a must get! Seating is very limited during lunch hour and can be a pain to wait for someone to leave. Advised to go not during lunch rush.
author: Katty X.

description:
Great service and good toast.
I tried the lavender latte and it was predominantly coffee flavour with a subtle lavender taste. The butter and condensed milk was tasty, very sweet so if you're not into that this isn't the toast for you. However the real winner is the egg basket toast. There's a runny egg inside and the other seasonings they put on top really makes this toast a winner.
I can't wait to be back!
author: Bianca M.

description:
Great coffee shop. Annie and In are a very nice couple that run and man shop. So far I've had the drip (good), the pour over (even though it's made in an electric pour over I wish it was hotter) and the affogato (espresso was great just wish the ice cream wasn't so icy). 

All in all I'd return. Great addition to this side of the SETS. 
Nice decor and great service.
author: Liz N.

description:
It was my first time at "Home" and I can't wait to come back again. 

I love the long list of creative drinks that they offer. The customer service is great, as the cashier was really helpful in helping indecisive me choose what to order. I ended up ordering the lavender latte with soy, and it was amazing! It was light and creamy with a subtle lavender taste (I wish there was more of a lavender taste though!). My best friend ordered the Nutella latte which was also delicious and unique.

It was quite crowded when we went but I love the atmosphere and cutesy decorations. Will definitely be back "home" soon!
author: Jacqueline C.

description: Abso-fruitly loved it here! After finding Home on Instagram I knew I had to make a visit during my first trip to the West Coast. The staff was so warm-hearted and welcoming. There wasn't any table space when we arrived but they assured us the turnover rate was high and there'd be an open one soon. So we ordered eat-in and balanced our mugs while waiting. A table on the other side of the cafe cleared up but a group that came after us claimed it before we could hobble over without spilling our drinks all over each other. A few of the staff members were kind enough to ask that party to wait for another table, as we had been waiting first. My family and I were super grateful and touched by the staff's act of kindness! I LOVED my birthday cake lattes, hot chocolate and coffee!
author: Reeba I.

description: While I didn't try their coffee I'm sure it's just as good as EVERYTHING else we had.  I had the lavender latte with their weekend special (toast w/corn,bacon and egg, my BF had a chai latte w/ egg in a basket and it was all DELICIOUS! I was definitely satisfied with my mini meal that left me pretty full.  While it is a bit overpriced it's well worth it.  I'm definitely gathering up my girls and taking them here.  No doubt I'll be back.
author: Paola I.

description: Home is one of the newer hip cafes on Noriega, quite a change of pace from what I'm used to in the outer sunset, but still filled with natives. They have a nice variety of drinks and snacks. Apparently it's a great place to study (lots of outlets, fast wifi, good sized tables). I came here with a few friends for some coffee and to catch up. I got a hot Lavender Latte which was really good, the lavender was light in flavor and there were bits of lavender as well. My friend got the Coketastic - coke, espresso, and ice cream... interesting and delicious, think of it like a lighter and carbonated affocato. Overall their service is great and their coffee is solid.
author: Elaine N.

description: Came here from a friend's recommendation to grab a drink and do some work. The first thing that stood out to me was how friendly the staff was. My girlfriend went with the infamous Birthday Cake Latte (for obvious reasons. It's a freaking ) and I went with the Lavender Latte since I'm a huge fan of lavender flavored drinks. The Birthday Cake is unreal looking and is a must if you want the Home experience and the Lavender Latte was delicious. The place gets filled up fast so try to get there early.
author: Darwin N.

description: Best cafe spot in San Francisco , the workers are beyond nice. Makes you feel like you are actually at home. I would also like to thank Raina for her kind and helpful advice for first time customers.
author: Bryan P.

description:
I like the atmosphere and set up of the place! They also have some outlets, and they don't cram tables just to have more seating and more business. It's nice that they limit the number of customers who can be inside, thus limiting sound levels.  But...

1. They close so early - 5pm?!
2. Loose leaf tea is advertised for $2.75 on the wall, but I got a Mighty Leaf tea bag in a mug of hot water and was charged $3. What??

It seems like a decent place, although just average.
author: Greg L.

description:
Home is a trendy and cozy cafe that can truly become anyone's home! This is only my second visit here since I live in Philly, but it's a must see location each time I'm back in the Bay Area. While I wouldn't recommend their iced teas, their wide array of teas and lattes are sure to satisfy your drink needs. My personal favorite is their condensed milk french toast, because who doesn't like condensed milk!? The french toast is slathered with creamy and fresh condensed milk, with the top slightly torched for a crispy edge. More than just the food and comfortable location with loads of table space, their customer service is on point. While being patient with my million requests for more water, the staff was kind and took the time to remember my name. As far as cafes go, there's no place like home!

Best Menu Items!
+ condensed milk french toast
+ hot teas
- iced tea
author: Sabrina W.

description:
I love it when coffee shops insist on doing things right.

On a hot day, my partner and I wanted the tea lattes iced and Home told us that to ice them would take an hour because they would have to cold-brew them. 

About 55 mins later, the London Fog (earl grey with vanilla) and Lavender Jasmine tea lattes came out and were delicious. They used organic Mighty Leaf tea bags (high quality, for bagged tea) and real lavender buds in the milky white tea latte and it's so fragrant and pretty.

The space is modern, naturally daylit and spacious. Would come back if I'm in the Sunset again.
author: Letitia L.

description: Delicious coffee and delicious toasts! Got the birthday cake latte because of the pretty pictures of it here on Yelp. Mine was just as cute as I expected it to be! I did originally think that it would be extremely sweet (I mean, it's called birthday cake) and just really got it for the Instagram pics (lol), but it wasn't! It was perfectly sweet and wonderfully done - at least to me. My friend got the cinnamon toast and it was amazing! I will definitely be back to try their other toasts and creative coffees!
author: Trisha D.

description: Ah-maaaazing!! Uber creative environment, and friendly upbeat staff. The perfect place to spend a quiet morning, weekend with friends, or a quick coffee to go. Clean inside, happy atmosphere, and a fun place all around. But not just that-- the drinks were all so beautiful and creative, but not over-the-top. More importantly, they were delicious and hit the spot. It is now a must for every time I visit San Fran.
author: Sophie R.

description: If you love coffee or just need to study then this is the place for you. This place is rather small but that's what makes it cozy. I can see why this would be the perfect spot to get work done or just to chill. But when it's packed, it's harder to find a place to sit and you might have to opt for take out. As far as food goes, there's many options for those who need caffeine or just a bite to eat. They offer a variety without taking away the simplicity which I like. I definitely recommend giving this place a try!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
I've Been wanting to come try out this place and I finally did on my day off. We got there around 11:30am and the place was packed, but some people were leaving and we were able to get a table pretty fast. You can grab a table and order your food and drinks, it is a self served place. The staff is really friendly and nice. 

They offered a variety of both hot and cold drinks. I ordered a iced matcha latte with soy milk since I'm not a coffee fan. They asked if I wanted less sweet, regular or extra sweet. I got it with regular sweet and it was not overly sweet and had a nice matcha taste. My cousin and friend order the hazelnut latte and coconut latte. We also order their toasts: the cinnamon sugar toast, the tomato, truffle oil pesto toast , and also the egg in a basket toast (add extra bacon crumbles $1.25) please! Everything tasted really good and it was quite filling. 

Definitely coming back to try their condensed milk toast and corn/bacon toast (the corn/bacon toast is only available on the weekend)
author: Vanessa M.

description: This place is super creative! What an interesting concept. Tried the matchagato and loved it! Great for matcha lovers. I can't wait to come back here with my friends. Also, this place has a really great atmosphere. It's kind of hipster trendy and plays really good music. Love it!
author: Zoe P.

description:
The cutest coffee shop owned by a lovely couple in the heart of the Sunset district. I've been coming here more then quite a few times and I can tell you this place really does make you feel at home with their relaxing music and delicious drinks. The staff is always so friendly and the owners really do try to get to know you. I was surprised when I came a few days ago and the owner still remembered my name even though I haven't been there for 2 months! Haha. 

Few of the things I've tried here are:
+Classic Latte
+Mocha
+Birthday Latte
+Iced Rose Latte
+Coconut Vanilla Latte
+Lavender Latte
+Vanilla Latte
+Affogato
+Matcha (Iced & Hot) 
+Mighty Leaf Tea (green tea)
+Cinnamon Sugar Toast
+Condensed Milk, Butter Toast
+Tomato, Truffle Oil, Pesto Toast w/ an egg on top!
+Chicken Meatball with Pesto toast
+Eggs in a Basket toast

Everything is made really well, but my go to order is always the iced/hot matcha with soymilk. They have plenty of chairs and tables along with outlets so you can easily study here by yourself or with friends. I'm so glad Home also extended their hours from 4pm to 5pm so now I can stay here later! Parking isn't so bad when there is residential parking just blocks away.
author: Elisa S.

description: LOVED this café: beautiful interior & such a special treat!! I wish I could try all their Creative drinks, I want to go back already! If you have to choose though, the Cookie Monster Latte and Birthday Cake Latte are the pick me ups you NEED!! Guaranteed to brighten your day amidst the SF fog.
author: Erin S.

description: With just the simple concept of coffee and toast, they have changed the game of the basics. The amazing service is just the icing on the cake. This is definitely a breakfast I will come back for.
author: Alyssa C.

description:
Delicious toast and great service! I got here in the afternoon and it was pretty full but there were a few open seats so I snagged one. I got an iced coconut vanilla latte which was the perfect amount of sweetness and came out in a mason jar. 

I chose the tomato truffle pesto toast and the girl at the register asked if I wanted an egg on it, and I highly recommend everyone get this toast with the egg! The toast was nice and thick and my only complaint was that the knife wasn't very sharp so it required some arm muscle to cut through the crust. Other than that, there was a perfect amount of pesto and the egg was nice and crispy on the bottom with a runny yolk!

This place has plenty of tables and really cute decor. I would definitely come here again to plug away on my computer, especially since there's Wi-fi!
author: Grace C.

description:
Came here for the pretty rainbow sprinkles birthday latte. Left feeling pretty satisfied. Although I admit to being a liiiittle bitter that my rainbow latte art wasn't as pretty as the other birthday lattes. Guess I will have to come back to get that perfect insta *rolling eyes emoji*

Taste-wise: I asked for soy milk because I'm lactose intolerant. I was told that they will still use a bit of condensed milk in the drink. That was fine with me. It was on the sweet side, but what else would you expect with this drink?! 

I also felt older than the average age by 8-10 years. The crowd seemed very college/high school. Not super shocked though! There are a lot of fun latte drinks. Very instagrammable :P
author: T D.

description: Atmosphere is warm & welcoming. The staff has service mind. Variety of creative custom drinks. I got hazelnut cappuccino. It was excellent.
author: Kate K.

description: This place deserves a 5 stars. The ambience is perfect. Love how cozy the cafe is. Not overly crowded. We didn't have to wait to get seats. We ordered the chicken mushroom toast and condensed milk toast which were super delicious. Their drinks did not disappoint too. The lavender latte, matcha latte and hot chocolate were all awesomely tasty. Definitely recommend place for people to work and s
author: Qianqi L.

description:
Home is such a warm place. They truly fit their name! I always feel at ease when I walk in. 

I've been here several times and have loved every drink I've sipped. However, what got me to write this review was their salted caramel hot chocolate. 

While coffee or tea are the go-to for most, some days I just want a hot chocolate. When I order hot chocolates from other cafes, I typically get this super sweet chocolate explosion in my mouth. I don't like that. So when I ordered a salted caramel hot chocolate, I was in for a serendipitous experience. I also threw in a big marshmallow since I was especially connected to my inner child. 

Maybe it was a good day for them, or I just never knew how to make it right, but man this hot chocolate was SMOOTH. It was so delicate on the palate and had the right balance of chocolate, caramel, and sweetness. It surrounds you in comfort and warms your soul.

I left feeling comforted, rocking a huge smile on the way out. 

TL;DR: As far as I've tasted, the drinks are great. Don't be afraid to get what sounds good to you. I personally really enjoy the salted caramel hot chocolate.
author: Krissel A.

description: The interior of the cafe is very neat and aesthetic. The food and drinks are great. It's a good place to relax and clear your mind. I feel at home here. I would recommend anyone to go there.
author: Annie Y.

description:
GREAT SERVICE. SUPER FRIENDLY. 
Came in on a Friday morning and ordered a red velvet latte. Sadly I didnt taste any red velvet flavor or even a hint of it.. But it did have a great fresh, coffee flavor. I will come back and give it another try bcuz this place offers more than just coffee and tea! And its a great place to hang out :)
author: Alyssa C.

description:
My first time here. It's warm, welcoming and the owners are super friendly! I introduced myself to them, Annie and In. They told me a bit about their story and it was heartwarming.

The coffee was beautifully presented and the egg in a basket is delicious!
author: Bernadette S.

description: I would go to Home everyday if I lived closer.  Even though I live on the other side of SF, I still manage to make the trip to the sunset area once a week to get me some birthday cake latte or a lavender latte.   You must try the toasts!  They are delicious.  My favorite is the condense milk one
author: Cathy M.

description: This is my absolute favorite coffee shop EVER. The cinnamon sugar toast is so amazing I had to eat it every morning before I left SF! The people are so friendly and efficient. The coffee is also so good, I love the hazelnut lattes. 10/10, I wish I was back in San Francisco - and this coffee shop is one of the reasons why.
author: Asia M.

description: I had high expectations for this place, but unfortunately, they were not really met. when we first walked in, all the tables were full of people sitting on their laptops. There is a sign that says no laptops at certain tables, but there were people sitting at those tables with them... obviously the rule is not enforced. Due to all of this, there were NO tables opened. The food was pretty good, but the portions are pretty small for $7. I got the rainbow latte, which was very sweet. But the presentation was very good. Anyways, I would give it 3.5 stars but whatever.
author: Andrea N.

description: Loved it here!! Best service and amazing food and coffee ! Recommend the famous birthday cake latte
author: Sarah B.

description:
Cozy, neighborhood spot.

Nutella hot chocolate - so yummy and not too sweet.  Perfect on a chilly morning.

Condensed milk toast - so good I almost at the whole thing - mmmmm
author: Jade B.

description:
I absolutely adore this place. Not only do they have an amazing selection of songs but it's a perfect place to study. The decor is very chic and modern, and it feels very home-y inside (especially with the cute Christmas lights dangling around the cafe). The owners and staff are also incredibly nice and they love conversing with their customers and getting to know them. Which in my books, is always a plus :)

I personally love a good ol' cup of joe. So it's the perfect place to get just ya daily cup of drip coffee. Like I did today! Haha. But I do recommend their Lavender Latte and their toasts :) Their menu is very innovative and I'll definitely be back to try everything else on their menu! 

Oh and did I mention free wifi?
author: Leah C.

description: This place is definitely a must go, the lattès are actually art. I've gone twice since I discovered this little gem and am now determined to come back and try every single drink on the menu. So far I've tried the signature Birthday Cake, Red Velvet, and Nutella lattès. The aesthetic of all of the drinks are just insane, I couldn't hold myself back from the picture. The only con I would have to give to this place is the right space, I've only been on weekend so finding somewhere to sit was a bit of a problem considering he amount of people, but I managed to find a way to squeeze in. Parking was no hassle. Customer service was beyond excellent, and the owner (I'm assuming) is the sweetest little woman. Overall 10/10 experience, I just hope they expand their space someday soon!
author: Adele J.

description:
Really good drinks and a very comfortable study space, Home is popular for the various flavoured lattes and its toasts. While I found the toast tasty but overpriced, the latte was excellent. I had the lavender latte, and there was a light but distinct taste of lavender that did not overwhelm the drink. Home has a huuuge selection of lattes so I would love to try the other lattes in the future as the Nutella latte, red velvet latte and the lavender jasmine tea lattes all sound wonderful. 

Fairly close to SFSU, this cafe has a lot of students so it can be hard to find seating but it does have WiFi (you have to ask for the password) and also good lighting for working (it's a hipster cafe that doesn't try to shroud you in relative darkness!). Overall, would totally return to try the various other drinks when I'm looking for a comfortable study space.
author: Michelle Y.

description:
I've been meaning to come here for the longest time! I woke up early one morning and arrived at about 8:30am! Luckily I snagged a nice seat, because an hour later almost every table was filled.

Friendly staff who came to check up on me a couple times to make sure everything was okay. Drinks are about $4-5. I got the coconut vanilla latte! Apparently, it's their number one drink. As someone who isn't a fan of coconut..I actually loved loved this drink. Plus, there was just enough of caffeine to keep me wired for my 3-4 hour study sesh.  Home is a great study environment with tons of outlets and tables. Also, parking isn't much of a problem. There's free parking in the residential area! 

Plus, their music is on point! Laid-back, feel-good music ranging from Jason Mraz to Boys 2 Men. I'll be back, Home!
author: Fanny H.

description: Such a beautiful and heartwarming concept. More coffee shops need to be like this. Walking into this place is already so homey. Every table is filled with friends having conversations and students studying on their laptops. There was a bit of a wait, but nothing outrageous. I loved the decor in here and the giant letters that spell out HOME. I got the caramel sea salt latte and it was phenomenal! It wasn't too sweet and they gave the perfect amount of coffee so I craved more after the fact. They also offer a variety of tantalizing breakfast toasts that I cannot wait to come back and try!
author: Anna Z.

description: Met a friend here for coffee, her favorite coffee haunt, my first time. Loved the different variety of coffees and the mellow atmosphere. Ordered a decaf coconut vanilla latte, and it was delicious! The prices may seem a little high, but the cup size is huge and worth every penny. As I can never drink without a snack, I ordered the cinnamon toast which was a thick piece of toasted bread smothered with cinnamon sugar mixture and butter. Sweet, but hit the spot. While Home doesn't have a ton of seating, it's definitely worth dropping by for a coffee that is way better than Starbucks.
author: Debbie F.

description: Good coffee. Pretty artsy with the foam. Lots of people take pictures of that type of stuff here. I like the interesting frozen hot chocolate they serve with ice cream on top. Very unique.
author: Sebastian M.

description: We stopped because my daughter found this cute trendy coffee spot online!  She had a Birthday Cake Latte & my wife had a regular latte. It was busy but we found a place to sit & park without hassle & really enjoyed our coffee & atmosphere here. We loved that a lot of the tables had a "No Laptops at this table" sign on them which kept the heart of the cafe engaged in conversation & fun. The laptop crowd was in the rear & they were welcomed too. A great way to keep every table from being full with people that could be there for hours on end. We really enjoyed this place.
author: Mark H.

description:
About the place: so fresh and so clean. Cool design, clean, modern and great place to work. Pretty good play list also :) it does seem to be a college kid hangout spot which is perhaps why it opens later than most spots I frequent. Normally packed with students and text books. 

About the service: baristas and counter staff are always friendly and helpful. They all look like they love their job which is refreshing. 

About the food: one of the best almond croissants I've had. I could tell it was really fresh. They also have an amazing croissant with strawberries and custard in the middle that will knock your socks off. Lavender latter with almond milk is delish as is vanilla coconut latte and Nutella hot chocolate. 

Notes: it is a bit pricey. They only pull double shots with their drinks so you can't add a shot, you must add two AND it's $1.50 seems high to me :/
author: Neal B.

description: Only came to this place because my friend wanted a rainbow hot chocolate - which was cool! I then saw that they have Red Velvet latte... so why not give it a try? Turned out the coffee was just OK OK, even though there was a good taste of red velvet. Nice, cozy place!
author: Hanna F.

description: This place is amazing. I went here with three of my friends (we're all students at SFSU). When we ordered, my toast order hadn't been sent through and so after 25 minutes of waiting, I asked a worker there if my toast would be out soon. When she went to the kitchen to check, it turns out that the computer goofed and my toast order didn't go through. She was super sweet and gave me a different toast to help hold me over to my original order arrived. I would have never expected getting a free dish, and the fact that they did that really means they care about their customers. I would definitely come here again. I would get this place a 10 star review if I could. The food and drinks are amazing.
author: Alexis L.

description:
What's not to love? Large windows to let in all the sunshine, plenty of seating, and very modern and simple decorations and furniture. Menus are written on brown butcher paper pulled down from suspended rolls. 

We ordered the chicken meatball pesto toast and condensed milk and butter toast. Both were amazing. Chicken meatball was really flavorful and would be a great snack or even a light meal. As for the condensed milk toast, the rich butter taste doesn't hit you immediately so it goes from "oh this is good" to "oh...THIS. IS. GOOD." a second later. I tried an iced Holy Cow which was the condensed milk latte (too much condensed milk right...NAW) which was pretty good, sweetened with condensed milk rather than whatever else they would use. The lavender latte is my favorite though. Very fragrant and soothing lavender taste, it's good iced or hot. Everything comes out very quick so even though we were in an extreme hurry, we were in and out in 20 minutes--got our 5 drinks and 2 orders of toast (and gulfed down the 2 orders).

Parking can be tough on Noriega, but there are always people leaving so it's not so bad. Great place to catch up with friends, do a little studying, or stop and relax (with a lavender latte of course).
author: Kat H.

description:
Didn't get a chance to eat here due to the extremely rude customer service. We got into the store at 4:25 and were deciding what to order at the register. By the time we began ordering drinks and asked a few questions to the cashier, it was 4:31. When we picked out two food items, she tells us "sorry, kitchen closed at 4:30". Seriously, no heads up? no common sense? 
SMH.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Love the assortment if flavored drinks here. I always get the lavender latte and it has just the perfect amount of lavender aroma, sometimes too sweet but other than that I have no complaints. There also a coconut drink and other really enticing options. 

This is definitely not the place for a coffee snob to go to. But for an average coffee drinker, it's a good spot to hit. The atmosphere is very clean and calm. Very good work area and there's plenty of seating to study. 

The toasts here are also great! The actual bread is nicely toasted and I had mine with a pesto and fried egg. Delicious and seasoned just right!
author: Melanie L.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE!! Honestly, I can't distinguish Home from home because Home feels so much like home to me! Lol...get it?

Anyway, this is by far the best place to get excellent toast in the City. The three that I've tried are the condense milk toast, eggs in a basket, and the chicken meatball. All three are amazing, but my fave two faves are the condense milk and the eggs in a basket. You really can't get the quality of these toasts anywhere else...not even Socal. They also cost a decent price, not expensive at all. If you're going to come here and chill, you might as well get a toast too while you're at it because to me, that would just be a waste! And if it's too crowded to take a seat, get that toast(s) to go! 

Coffee here is pretty good as well. My go-to is the mocha, not to sweet, decadent, and definitely goes well when I eat my toast! Holy Cow and Matcha Green Tea are also favorites from their list. 

Studying here is great too if it's not crowded. I've came here a couple of times during the weekday hours and it's a good place to study. I don't need to bring my headphones when I'm here because they play bomb ass music coming from the 90s and early 2000s, so I'm good :).

Come to Home if you want to feel a sense of home :).
author: Michelle S.

description:
perfect atmosphere to be a worker bee, friendly staff, delicious pastry, adorable interior, perfect lighting for aerial view digital images esp by the window

First off, one of my closest friends is a loyal customer so it was kind of mandatory for me to check out the place. The owners (we ran into them once at Peet's one day--cute couple!) are very sweet and genuine. The tables were all inhabited by individuals working hard on their screens getting whatever type of work done. The setting is quite and just the right level of peacefulness to be productive and motivated.

There is a plant in a vase set on each table which gives Home a very minimalistic/home-y vibe. The table is a neutral tone of grey. 

As for the pastries, I tried the mango coconut Danish/pastry. It was super good! I looked forward to each bite. The mango was fresh and the serving was pretty big. My friend has the matcha latte. It was a bit powdery at first since it's organic, however, she added brown sugar which made the texture smooth. She loves their matcha and chai latte as well as their many pastry selections. 

I probably need to come back and try the other gems in their menu so I can give better feedback on this joint. My guess is that it'll still be good my second time around. Even if the delicacies/beverages were unappetizing, I think I might still come back just for the pleasant work vibe it gives off. Plus, they have a water station. 

5 stars... for now!
author: Rebecca B.

description:
Home! I just love the name of this place!
When my sister told me this place had a lavender latte, I had to look up this place and try it out. 

Came here on New Year's Day and was surprised they were open! Thank you! It was pretty much packed and we got lucky to find the long table near the window open for a huge group of people. There is a great variety of choices. Also, we didn't have too hard of a time finding parking, probably because it was a holiday. 

I was happy to hear that I could order the lavender latte, iced :D and I ordered the boyfriend a sea salt caramel latte. Although I wanted to order it to sit in because it came in a cute mason jar, I knew I wouldn't be able to finish it quick enough before the group decided to leave. The lady who took our order was super happy, energetic and nice! She also brought our table an extra chair because some of us were just standing around. They just call out your order, so you have to keep an ear out because it can get kind of loud in there. 
My lavender latte was just perfect! I've tried making at home home before this, but it wasn't that great. This had the perfect amount of lavender. I oddly like things that taste like flower! Just has a nice fragrance to it. 
The sea salt caramel was great too. A little too sweet for me, but it still tasted really good. I want to come back and try a bunch of the other Creative options they have. They all sound delicious and look really pretty. I really like how they allow people to sit there for about 2 hours to share the space with other people.

I'm rarely in this area of SF, so I'd be glad to come back in the future and try everything else.
author: Janet T.

description:
Yelp Review

1. Staff Friendliness: 5
2. Staff Knowledge: 5
3. Staff Efficiency: 5
4. Transaction Time: 5
5. Order Wait Time: 5
6. Register Counter Cleanliness: 5
7. Kitchen / Prep Area Cleanliness: 5
8. Dining Area Cleanliness: 5
9. Resroom Cleanliness: N/A
10. Storefront Cleanliness: 5
11. Food Handling (i.e. clean hands): 5
12. Food/Drink Presentation (i.e. wrapping, boxing, pouring): 5
13. Food/Drink Preparation (i.e. made with care): 5
14. Food/Drink Value: (i.e. worth the price): 5
15. Food/Drink Taste: 5

(Total score) / (Questions Answered)  = (Yelp!)

I had the coconut milk latte. It was good. Coffee flavor wasn't apparent and potency was weak. I prefer third-wave coffee, which is aromatic and highly caffeinated.
author: Charlie A.

description: I really love the ambiance of the cafe - it really does feel like home. The coffee was great and they have wifi to do some work! I would say it gets a bit crowded at times but there's actually a lot of seating. It's also close to the 16th Ave Tiled Steps.
author: Anuja S.

description: So delicious! It's super trendy and cute for photo ops! The toast was soo delicious, I got the Tomato & Pesto toast, but I tried my friend's Egg in a Basket toast and it was better.. like SO good. I also had the Birthday Cake Latte, it was super sweet and so pretty! The coffee taste wasn't overwhelming and it was really good. The only reason I am hesitant to rate this 5 stars is because the seating is extremely limited and it is super crowded. Overall, I would recommend.
author: Leah M.

description:
Mm.. Lavender jasmine tea latte.. 
I'm usually not a big fan of lavender because it reminds me of soap, but the balance of all the flavors was amazing! Would come back just for this drink. 
Really cute space - definitely a nice place to meet up with a friend, relax, and get work done.
author: Christiana C.

description:
You must try the iced chocolate mint latte! I'm obsessed and you will be too! 

What a great addition to the neighborhood! Home serves great caffeinated drinks and awesome bites! I've only had their condensed milk French toast, which was delicious, but have eyed other people's food. I can't wait to try more. 

The owners are really sweet and I really hope this place succeeds! It makes me so happy when I see the faces of the people who have put so much into their business. 

Great spot for studying, doing a little work or just taking a little breather from life. I love the layout and how much natural light this place has. 

I wish I could leave work right now to grab my new favorite drink...
author: Anastasia N.

description:
the birthday cake latte is so instagram worthy!!!
i asked for it to be less sweet but it was still kind of sweet for me and while it wasn't the best latte i had, it was pretty good! and cute!! 
the cashier was super nice!
author: Priscilla P.

description:
I think this will be my favorite breakfast place in SF! 

Their toast are amazing! If you want a savory toast go with the truffled toast! And if you want something more sweet for breakfast, the condensed milk toast is the one! I ordered both so I can get the best of both world. And the condensed milk one is just amazing!
author: Herman L.

description:
I think I found my favorite little cafe. It's relatively easy to get to and there's plenty of parking around, Sunday is free parking too. 

Anyways, I ordered the birthday cake latte mostly for the Instagram pic because it's rainbow and cute latte art but aside from that it's delicious. It's picture and tastebud worthy! For food I got the egg in the basket with bacon crumble on top; AMAZING!! The toast was so thick and buttery. The food came out relatively fast with great customer service 

This place does not disappoint, I will definitely be back. Come early, I got there right when they opened on Sunday (8 AM) and by the time I left (around 845 AM) all the tables were occupied.  They also only serve the food till the bread runs out.
author: Erica D.

description: Not enough seating. Full of hipsters on laptops just sitting at the few tables they have for hours. What else do you expect. The lattes were beautiful and tasty. I just wish we had a place to sit.
author: Brittany N.

description: If you plan to study here on a weekend, I recommend coming before 9:30 so you can grab one of the laptop tables (certain ones on weekends have little placards that say no laptops to encourage conversations). I have to say, the birthday latte is as delicious as it is pretty! It has a sweet and creamy taste to it and was paired perfectly with the crumbly blueberry muffin. The lavender latte is also pretty good and has quite a floral taste to it. This place is super home-y and I would come again!
author: Jessica W.

description:
When going to a coffee shop to do homework, I look for 4 things: 
drinks, food, space, and outlets. 

Home is exactly that! It's spacious and has a lot of outlets, which is a PLUSSS. Aside from the interior, the drinks here are very good as well, and I love the different drink options that they offer. My favorite here is the coconut vanilla latte! The toasts that Home offers is delicious as well, from sweet to savory toast depending on whateva ya feel like eating.


Home really feels home-y


OoOoo & i forgot to mention, friendly staff & a poppin' playlist
author: Jane N.

description: This is a really cute cafe. The interior designing is super clean. I only tried one of their drinks, the matcha green tea latte, didn't get around to trying their toast. The drink was actually pretty bitter even with light sweetness. So if you have more of a sweet tooth I would say get half to full sweetness instead. But the drink was real nice and smooth, and the little artwork they do with the milk is a nice touch.
author: Megan M.

description: Crowded . No room to eat. They share tables with strangers. The food is a small portion size. However they did take care of my friends eggs until they had her order right.
author: Rana M.

description:
Lovely customer service! It was my first time at "home" and was a bit overwhelmed with their creative drinks menu, but the girl in front gave me a lot of suggestions on their best-selling lattes. So I got the iced vanilla-coconut latte and my friends got the lavender latte and red velvet latte, respectively. These flavors were said to be some of their best! 

    The latte in general is good but I don't really see it as coffee-coffee. I know they use de-la-Paz coffee beans (sister company of 4-barrels) and usually it's super fragrant but the drink was more on the milder side. I didn't taste much coffee even though they used 2 shots of espresso and it really felt like flavored milk with a hint of coffee, instead of the other way around. The good thing is that they let you add another 2 shot for extra $$! 

   The owner sent me a message and recommended that I try the iced lattes with more ice or to add an extra 2 shots of espresso for $1.50. I'd like to share the advice for people who like a stronger coffee flavor like me! 

    In terms of the different infusion flavors, they still have a long way to go but they are a relatively new coffee place so they have time to improve! I'm rooting for you "home"!
author: Janet K.

description: Love the shared open space. Great place to grab a cup of coffee and catch up with an old friend!
author: Shivani R.

description:
I don't drink coffee but the birthday cake latte was perfect. 

It taste good and looks amazing. Just the right amount of caffeine to get my errands done and it made by day.
author: Miri L.

description:
Cute neighborhood café in unassuming Central Sunset, otherwise known as Parkside. The have a somewhat large variety of caffeinated options, including coconut juice in an actual coconut (personal favorite since I don't enjoy doing it myself), and a few selection of toasts, my favorite being the eggs in a basket. The toast is quite simple yet delicious - bread, eggs, red pepper flakes, salt. The bread is perfectly warm, slightly toasted, yet soft. The egg is baked into the toast, still runny, oozing in yolk to dip the toast in. I tried replicating this at home, but it just wasn't right. Therefore, I just keep coming back for it! 

Though, not an ideal place for large groups or loud chattering, as most people who come to Home are either working or studying on their computers, I presume.
author: Michelle L.

description:
Had the lavender latte and it was delicious. Not overpowering, just A gentle hint of flavor. My only complaint: wish my latte was warmer! I arrived just as they opened so I understand they needed time to get ready, but still would appreciate my latte to be warm. 

Didn't catch her name, but she took my order and was genuinely so nice and sweet. There was a line of people ready to order, but she took a quick minute to ask how my morning was. Customer service, is so rare these days.
author: Seony K.

description: Very cute and trendy place, attracts the younger crowd.  Cafe and food are good.
author: HQ S.

description: Annie and In are the hosts with the mostess! This swank looking cafe feels like home (seriously, pun intended). Great coffee, food and ambiance. In a world of Starbucks and Dunkin Donuts this place gives one a refuge from the norm. Keep up the amazing work. This place is something special.
author: Cornel E.

description:
Saturday, 11:30 AM.

Quickie:
+ Drink/Food quality
+ Service
+ Hygiene
+ Atmosphere
+ Turnaround
+ Menu variety
+ Layout

And then...?
Home offers tasty snacks and drinks. Friendly staff create a welcoming environment. Good job!

**********
Constructive comments:
*Source ingredients
*Compost options
author: Chuck N.

description:
What a cute little coffee shop! 

A perfect place to sip on some coffee and snacks, plus there's free wifi.

I came here in the morning to do some work and have breakfast.  I went with an iced LAVENDER LATTE and a TOMATO PESTO TOAST.  

The Lavender Latte had just enough lavender flavor, and it wasn't too overpowering.  This is topped with some fresh lavender, so you get a subtle floral scent with each sip.  

The toast here is served on a nice, thick piece of soft and buttered toast.  They have several options, but I had to go with the Tomato Toast since I'm a huge tomato-lover.  The toast is perfectly toasted, topped with pesto, truffle oil, tomato, and melted parmesan.  This is pretty filling-- I was full until the afternoon!  I would order this again next time. 

The only downside is that Home closes at 4pm, so if you're looking to do some work til later, keep this in mind.
author: Stacey K.

description:
Home is where the heart is, if you know what I mean.  Been here a couple times, dine-in and to-go. I can honestly say that it's a much different feeling dining in and taking out to-go, especially for the coffees! Would prefer dining in with this cute little place. I'm usually a fan of the Matcha green tea latte but at times I feel a bit more creative with the nutella latte. A thumbs up for the matcha latte! For most of the times that I've been here, it has tasted pretty strong and flavorful with just the right amount of sweetness.
