As for the nutella latte, it's decent but I typically do not taste as strong of a taste for the nutella. Depending on the barista, there are pretty designs made by the frothed milk - cute cute! 

I have also tried a variety of their toast but what I enjoy the most is the pesto chicken meatball toast! It's baked very soft and has a strong pesto taste. The meat is flavorful and spiced with garlic (YES, GARLIC IS LIFE). For times I'm feeling more of a sweet toast, I like to order the condensed toast. Decent but nothing really special.
author: Eva C.

description:
You know that meme about $4 toast in San Francisco? Well, you can get $8 toast here. I admit it's pretty delicious - the toast is thick and soft and the toppings are seasoned well.

It's a good place to sit down and work, but there aren't too many tables and it gets busy and full, especially on weekends.
author: Theresa M.

description:
First time here and i got their Sea salt caramel latter with soy milk and less sugar. It is da  (for me at least).
I didnt know what's their popular drink when i got there but thankfully i ordered a good one.
Will come back here for sure :) 
Oh and their customer service is .
author: Michelle T.

description: Beautiful, cozy just like home! Tried the condensed milk toast with almond milk latte..!
author: Rhea M.

description:
Ehhh, I didn't love it when I came here even though I really wanted to. When they first opened, I was so excited to have a cute coffee shop in the neighborhood. I payed them a visit after lunch one day which was just a few blocks down. Since I was already parked for lunch, I just walked up. However, parking tends to get ugly on these few streets and its not unheard of to park a few blocks away and walk in.

Upon entering, the space felt inviting. It was home-y white space area that was minimalist but in the best way possible. The menu was written on a roll of butch paper thats hung on the wall next to the cash register. As I was reading the list of drinks I became more and more excited. I ordered a Holy Cow and took a seat.

Within moments my drink came and I look my first sip ANDDDDDDDDD it was sort of a let down. The drink wasn't exactly what I wanted. There seem to be too much milk, just a tad too sweet, and something else about it was just off. I'm not sure if it was the drink I ordered, the service that day or if that's how it was suppose to taste. I left disappointed but maybe I will be back again. 

Next time I want to try their toast, they may just save them for me.
author: Michelle L.

description: Home is so cute. I love the concept, the cozy feel, and the lighting in here. Not to mention, their beautiful lattes that are destined for instagram, and their delectable toasts! A great snack or brunch to go with a nice conversation or a book. Parking is usually pretty easy, even on weekends. Unfortunately I don't think the lattes taste as good as they look. The less beautiful ones taste better. Such a tough choice! Beauty or taste?!
author: Lydia W.

description: Love love love this place! Please come to LA! I ordered the lavender latte and it's by far the best lavender latte I've ever had. The place was also pleasingly aesthetic-great for those who love taking pictures for social media!Customer service was also great! Will definitely come again next time I'm in SF!
author: Tida P.

description:
Came here for lunch and we ordered the following:

-Holly Cow Latte (good)
-Coconut Vanilla Latte (very good)
-Tomato & Truffle oil Pesto Toast (very good)
-Chicken Meatball w/Pesto Toast (very good) 

I just wanted to tell everyone how much I loved this place and I can't wait to go back.

*The staffs were Super Nice & Friendly ^^
author: Wendy L.

description: As a college student, I like finding places to study and enjoy a great cup of coffee, with or without my friends (studying is important!). Home is constantly racking up customers, and the reasons are obvious. Home's specialty lattes and creative drinks taste amazing, its environment is so welcoming, one can say it "feels like home," pun intended.
author: Sarah N.

description:
My favorite coffee shop in the area. Nothing comes close. I wish I can come here everyday to get my latte and toast fix! The service here is super friendly too. 

My usual order: 
Iced coconut vanilla latte - served in a cute mason jar.  I would request for less sweet and it comes out just the way I like it...creamy and strong. I wish all coffee shops would carry coconut milk.  

Pesto, tomato, truffle oil toast - can't believe something so simple like toast can taste this good. I be adding a fried egg on top of it too. 

The only downside is it's hard to get a table. Gotta come early.
author: Cathy M.

description: Pretty sure that the people who work here are some of the happiest, kindest people in San Francisco. It makes my day to come into Home SF for a coffee with friends. Their toasts are delicious, I seriously daydream about them. Fantastic spot to start your day in the Sunset!
author: Ellie J.

description:
I absolutely love Home.  Stumbled upon it by accident a few weeks ago and have made it my weekly work/coffee/toast spot ever since.  The staff is super friendly, the environment cute and stylish and most importantly, the coffee and toasts (and super creative list of latte creations) are all amazing.  My one and only mention is around the bathroom and sort of cleanliness of the kitchen area.  For such an adorable, thoughtfully done place, I am continually shocked and grossed out by the gas-station-like bathroom.  It's usually pretty dirty (definitely doesn't appear to be cleaned daily) and is extremely bare and cold-a stark contrast to the cafe in general.  Since they're serving food here, it always gives me pause that if their workers use this bathroom, is our food being handled by the most clean of hands?  I would love to see the bathroom kept clean regularly as well as some touches to make it feel as "homey" as the rest of the cafe so I don't walk out feeling I need to wash up again after I leave. 

Lastly the little area where they prepare the food and coffee is also pretty cluttered/messy and unappealing and given they're preparing food back there, it seems like it could use some refining to give patrons the confidence that everything is up to code, etc.

I don't mean this to be harsh because I truly love this place but really do hope these things can be improved soon.  
Hope you can appreciate the feedback, Home!
author: Sarah F.

description: Joaquin makes the BEST latte you've ever had. I've been going for the last two weeks just because I crave the delicious coffee they make! Friendly staff and awesome environment. I highly recommend.
author: Olivia M.

description: I came here Thursday morning after my class to study. I walked in and the workers greeted me. They were very nice. I ordered the chocolate mint latte. They made the drink quite fast and so I received it right away. I usually don't like coffee much, but this actually tasted really good. The atmosphere was quiet enough that I could get some studying done. The seats can fill up, so better to go earlier rather than later. I will definitely be back to try their toasts and to get more studying done.
author: Allyson L.

description: Very creative with their coffee and expresso drinks. Gets crowded because people camp out with their laptops. Get their early b4 the student crowd.
author: Joe B.

description:
I was very surprised by how nice this café was! Came with a group of about 10 friends (we were all able to find a spot to sit) for breakfast. The cafe is quite spacious and had a very "hip" feel; many people were doing work on laptops/reading as well. 

Followed the recommendations and ordered the Lavender Latte to go. I think if I had gotten it sit-in then it would have also been in a to-go cup but don't take my word for it. Anyways, the Lavender Latte was wonderful!! I was expecting something too sweet but it was perfectly balanced with enough foam on the top that it wasn't overwhelming but wasn't too thin of a layer either.

My friends also got several toasts but I was too full to try any of them... I ate a piece of the condensed milk toast and it was delicious though--extremely rich and sweet, wouldn't recommend for a single person unless you have a crazy sweet tooth. 

Also shout out to the cashier and waiters! Very friendly service and they made an effort to make small talk with us.
author: Esther M.

description:
Such a cute place! And the workers are awesome. Good vibes.

The chicken meatball toast with egg was good. Pretty heavy but very flavorful.

The lavender latte was cute as well. They sprinkle lavender on top but I don't believe its infused into the latte. 
Limited seating because it tends to get packed.
author: Heejin L.

description: My absolute favorite coffee shop. My favorite. Home Cafe was the very first coffee shop that I went to when I first became addicted to caffeine. Ever since, I've been trying to find another coffee shop that matched with Home, but nothing does. If you enjoy sweet coffees Home is the place for you. I don't recommend this place for doing homework because it can get a bit loud on the weekends and even weekdays sometimes. However, the coffee is just too good and just put your headphones and you are good to go. I love coming here for studying. I recommend the iced coconut vanilla latte and holy cow, and the condensed milk toast. If you like tea more, I highly suggest my new favorite, the jasmine lavender tea latte with honey. Their service is very good and the person who takes your order is always so friendly.
author: Katrina W.

description: First time here and it was pleasant.  I just had coffee and a pastry but will come back again.  It was a little busy (Sunday morning) so I didn't feel like I could really enjoy my time there.  Decor was really nice. The breakfasts sounded really yummy.
author: Cecila K.

description: I saw many pictures about the birthday cake latte & I had to drive up to SF to give it a try. Turns out the latte tastes amazing and worth the try! :)
author: Maegan P.

description: I make it a habit to go to a different coffee shop every Saturday and picked Home for this week. I'm in love with their creative lattes! So instagram-able. I obviously had to get the birthday cake latte, it has freakin sprinkles! It was so hard to not drink it in one gulp. They don't have many food options besides their toast (no gluten free). I normally stay away from gluten but they sounded too yummy to pass up. I had the tomato and pesto and it was as good as it sounded. I would definitely come back.
author: Nikki H.

description: Millennial headquarter for this area. Not my thing. A must go if your a Millennial. I'm just jealous for not being young err. No one here but a grumpy old guy. Grumpier by the minute.
author: Bebe L.

description:
tldr:: Great drinks and food. Homey, cute, and relaxing atmosphere. Would definitely return. 

I went to Home on a sunday morning with a friend because we had student evaluations to write for the program we worked at. I had Home bookmarked for a while after I seen the amazing pictures on Instagram. It seemed like another one of the hipster coffee shops, which I usually don't go to unless I have some mad work to finish. We arrived around 10:20 and there were still tables open. They have outlets under every alternating table, which is good; can't have a coffee shop without outlets. And thank goodness they have a bathroom. 

Ambiance/ Appearance:
Home is so adorable; chill vibes all around. There is a succulent plant on each table...adding more hipster points. I like that they use a brown butcher like paper to write their drinks on the wall. They have a very earth toned gray scale color theme which makes the interior feel more relaxing. There are so many cute decorations throughout the cafe, ugh just can't get enough. 

Service:
The baristas are so kind. They explained to us menu items we weren't sure about, and made us feel comfortable and welcome.

Taste: 
I ordered the chicken meatball toast with pesto. It has pesto, sliced chicken meatballs, sauteed green onions, red pepper flakes and parmesan cheese on top. This piece of toast is huge and everything about it was so good. I am usually not a fan of chicken sausage, but this can be the exception. I also ordered a hot coconut vanilla latte, which was good. The coconut and vanilla balanced each other so that neither overpowered the other. 

The coffee was $3.75 and the toast was $5.75. Overall the food and drink was really good. I finished all my work by the time they were closing and it really helped me to focus being out of the house. I definitely recommend you giving Home a try and I can't wait to return to try their other menu items.
author: Vivian Y.

description:
I love this place!! :) I've been coming here periodically and it's my favorite coffee shop in the Sunset district. Perfect place to catch up with a friend or to get some work done. 

Pros: 
- Welcoming and super friendly baristas and owners 
- Their speciality is the toast which is SO goood especially with the egg 
- Very creative selection of coffee drinks, my go-to is the Sea Salted Caramel latte:) 
- Very "Home-y" atmosphere where I can be productive or able to catch up with a friend

Cons: 
- It can get really crowded (which is a good thing for them!) but harder to find a table/have to wait in a longer line 
- Wish they can offer more healthier options for breakfast (even as much as I love their toast) 

*Tip: come earlier in the morning to beat the crowds/to get a table; much better experience than coming around lunchtime.
author: Aimee W.

description: Best lattes ever! This cafe is such a fun stop if you have friends or family visiting. Not only are they famous for their unique flavors and latte art, but they also use a great Peruvian coffee as the base for every drink. Tea lovers can have fun here as well.
author: Hannah C.

description:
I love HOME!!! This is such a cute & welcoming cafe. I ordered the Chicken Meatball toast, Condense milk toast, and hot chocolate with marshmallow. They were incredibly delicious. I'm so glad I tried a sweet & savory toast. Both were very satisfying. The hot chocolate was amazing! 

The owners were absolutely sweet. Our food & drinks came in a timely manner and presented beautifully. I will definitely come back to try their other drinks, toasts, and pastries. 

There is no place like HOME ;)
author: Kristin L.

description: Way overhyped.  This place takes itself way, way too seriously.  I just saw some pretentious barista kick a family off of one of their precious "no electronics" tables because the 4 year old was on a iPad.  Must be great to have loads of free time dreaming up arcane and self-involved "rules," but some of us are just parents trying to get a moment of peace with our coffee where we can.  This place embodies the worst of the SF hipster scene.  This mom of 2 will be taking her business elsewhere.  I encourage other parents (or just those who care about being non-obnoxious) elsewhere.
author: Claire S.

description: Adorable little cafe with a great environment. The drink menu offers great and unique variety and the toast is to die for. The eggs in a basket are delicious and the other toasts are great an offer an option to add an egg on top!
author: Tara N.

description: Cutest coffee shop in sunset. I love their vibe and music they play. Yummy drinks , delicious toast. Space is the only problem, the line is always out the door and you'll find yourself awkwardly not knowing where to stand. Customer service is phenomenal!
author: Margaret W.

description:
I've come here to study a couple times and I'm absolutely in love with this cute little coffee shop! There's so much light, tables are spacious, and they've got great taste in music! Plus they've got some super fun lattes like the coconut vanilla latte, sea salted caramel latte, and lavendar latte.

The only thing is they close early (5PM) and it gets crowded so it's hard to grab a table.
author: Jingxi Z.

description:
Great little niche, great coffee, and great service. Their toast options are legit meals or filling snacks, not some dinky bread slices, they're also amazingly good. 
Sucks there's limited seating, and if you're sitting in front of the window, the sun might be killer on the face - if it's sunny. Ya know, SF and all - would help if there were shades or something. Community seating is encouraged, big group seating not so much. Again, limited seating, so please don't have a group meet up here.
author: Liz L.

description:
Working from Home on a Friday afternoon.  I started with a Holy Cow and Tomato Truffle Oil Toast for lunch.  Sipping on a Ginger and Peach iced tea makes work so much more tasty.  But the best part -- the music.  I super appreciate the Boyz II Men and SWV.  Takes me back to my high school homecoming dance!

Excellent service, yummy beverages, plenty of outlets and fast wifi.  This is by far the best place to work from home.
author: Stella K.

description:
What a change of pace for Noriega! Friendly customer service, good variety of eats and drinks, and a fantastic atmosphere to study (quite the number of outlets), catch up with a friend, or just relax for a bit.

Their specialty drinks (like the red velvet latte) rely on syrup or novelty, and aren't as tasty/uniqe as I had hoped. The selection of De La Paz and Four Barrel coffees are, however, an excellent choice.

Artisanal toasts! How long will it take for me to stop ordering these?! They get me every time. Their savory toasts (pesto tomato truffle is my favorite) are so perfect, and oh gosh, when there's an egg? Game over.
author: Colleen M.

description: Great little breakfast spot. The Coconut Vanilla Latté and Lavender Latté were amazing! The tomato pesto toast was huge and definitely a satisfying breakfast. Excited to come back next time I'm in SF!
author: Daniel E.

description:
Super cute cafe on sunset! Came around 2ish on a Saturday to do homework. This place can easily get packed! Home was smaller than I expected but still really cute. 
The ambiance is really chill. 

The workers are super sweet and patient. 

I'm obsessed with floral flavored drinks so seeing how they had lavender lattes really made me excited. 

Got an iced lavender latte and I'm obsessed. It wasn't too sweet or too bitter. You could taste the coffee but with that hint of lavender. I really enjoyed it. 

Definitely will come back to try their other drinks!
author: Amy T.

description:
'Home' cafe offers an extensive menu including toasts, non-caffeinated drinks, tea, and your typical cup-of-joe. It proudly boasts its superior ingredient quality, unique tea concoctions, and special caffeinated combinations in which unexpected ingredients are added to classic  coffee choices.

What to know about 'Home':

Very reasonably priced despite the creative effort by the owners. $4 can already get you any of their top tier coffee options.

'Home' utilizes De La Paz and Four Barrel coffee beans. Four Barrel has a couple physical locations in SF. It also offers freshly-baked pastries and overwhelmingly buttery cookies shipped each morning from SF's own 'Heartbaker' (I believe).

Modern, simplistic decor with dominant beach-themed colors of dark blue, white, dark brown, and gray that give off a vibe that makes every nook-and-cranny Instagram-worthy. In other words, the warm-heartedness from the owners and cafe's atmosphere is loyal to its name; home. Minimalistic layout makes 'Home' a hidden gem and complete beauty to Noriega street.

Plenty of seating to go around though it might get popular around lunchtime. Majority of customers were students and adults on their laptops while a few chatted the afternoon away.

Two baristas, one female the other male, I'm guessing were the owners, were some of the sweetest, personable, and most down-to-earth people. They were very welcoming, and answered all of our questions thoroughly since nobody else was waiting in line.

On the main street, parking isn't free though on the side streets, it is and in the daytime (when 'Home' is open) parking is relatively easy. Beware that parking meters can be fed solely with coins or charged to credit card.

Here's what my party ordered:

COCONUT VANILLA LATTE ($3.75): Very innovative concept; Love the idea of using coconut juice or milk inside a vanilla latte; For the first few sips, coconut taste is not obvious but gradually hints of coconut are apparent without overwhelming the coffee itself; Coffee taste was apparent but not strong enough probably since it would cover up the faint coconut taste; Could have been a little less sweet though this could be adjusted

HOLY COW ($4): Latte with condensed milk; Bro thought it could've been less sweet since condensed milk makes it sweeter than usual; Similar to Vietnamese Coffee though it's made with much better ingredients and a stronger coffee brand

ALMOND COOKIES ($?/2 COOKIES): Amazing; Loads of butter made cookies heavenly; Topped with almond slivers; Texture was very crumbly

If you're aiming for a one-of-a-kind coffee experience filled with either creative beverages, guilt-ridden cookies, or lovely interior, 'Home' is the ideal coffee shop in the city to go to. 'Home' sets the perfect example of how innovative coffee shops could and should be and really aims to cater to everyone by focusing on creativity.
author: Jacquie H.

description:
Funny thing is, I originally came here to use their bathroom. But one look around the store, I was pretty impressed of their layout. So I bought a latte, it's only proper. 

I tried their lavender ice latte and it's everything I've ever wanted in a floral coffee. It had the right amount of lavender flavor/aroma and espresso shot ratio. It brought out the perfect amount of sweeten. Plus I love how they sprinkle real lavender buds on top of the latte!

Great drinks
Helpful baristas
Clean interior..I'm sold! 

I'll be back (in Arnold Schwarzenegger's voice).
author: Diane N.

description:
I think this is great place to sit and chat with a friend or do some studying or some homework. I came here to get some work done on a weekend, and it was so busy, so I had to wait a little while for a table to free up. The place is very clean and nice. It has cute decorations and it's very simple. 

I ordered the iced matcha green tea latte and the eggs in a basket. I thought that the green tea latte tasted like the instant matcha powder from Trader Joe's. Although it didn't taste bad, it also did not taste much like matcha, so I am not sure if they use real matcha or not. I was not a fan and will probably not order that again. I thought that the eggs in a basket was too buttery and salty. I am open to trying other things on the menu, but with my two orders, I was not very satisfied. 

The reason I gave this place 3 stars despite my unsatisfactory food and drink order, I have hope for the other drinks or food items on the menu, so I'm willing to give it another try. Also because it is one of the only places in the Sunset that is good for studying or doing work. Great atmosphere overall.
author: Christina C.

description:
Loved my experience at "Home" today. Great, relaxing, welcoming atmosphere, which was facilitated by the friendly woman (who I assume is one of the owners) at the register. When I entered, she told me, "welcome home," and in a corny way, I truly felt welcomed back home to a place that I know I will return to. Very genuine.

I had a mint chocolate iced latte, and brought a book to read. Super comfortable and very well lit. 

Excited to become a regular here. Also, not sure what everyone's saying about this place being super hipster. It's just a well done place that many people frequent, it's as simple as that!
author: Lillian N.

description: I like this place. Their drinks were good, but not outstanding. I was expecting my drink to have a porcupine drawn on it like I had seen in pictures, but instead I just got the normal leaf. Good atmosphere though, I would say a lot of people were working but it was very crowded
author: Horatia F.

description:
Home is where it's at! Literally! I came in on Friday late afternoon with a friend. At that moment when I walked in i was memorized with the decor. Super cute and clean. It felt like I was literally at home! At that time it was packed, all the tables were taken. I ordered a Lavender Latte and my friend ordered the Holy Cow Iced. We both enjoyed our drinks but it was just a bit too sweet for our tasting. The environment is great for sipping on a cup a latte while doing some work! The staffs were friendly, overall I fell in love with this place. 

Definitely will be returning to try their toasts and more of their lattes!
author: Daisy C.

description: Very cute place with cute plant decorations & fun concept of being home. Bright with sunlight. A little pricey but it's San Francisco.
author: Julianna K.

description: Definitely one of my favorite cafes in the city. They have amazing toast and beautiful lattes. The shop is super cute and comfortable and I love everything about it.
author: Mila R.

description:
I'm just gonna keep coming back til I go through the entire menu (handwritten on butcher paper, nice touch, btw.)

So far be tried: 
-- iced red velvet latte: taste developed more strongly after I let it sit for a while, but still, it needs more red velvet flavor. Same goes for the hot version. 
-- condensed milk latte: delicious from the first sip but those last couple sips are where it's at!
-- condensed milk toast: it's amazing that I'm not 500 lbs because I want to eat or drink condensed milk in some form all the time. Home gives me my fix. 
-- cinnamon toast: the cinnamon sugar really seeps into the bread. The layer isn't always even, making some bites more overwhelmingly cinnamonny than others. 

Definitely unlike any Home I've ever known; this one is decorated with the most pretty elements -- succulents & plants abound. 

Complaints, & these are the reasons for that missing fifth star:
-- 20-25-minute wait time for toast & coffee to be ready. That's time I have to pay for, as the closest parking spots are metered. 
-- the first issue might be related to the second: several times I'll place my order with the wife & I don't know how or why, but my order doesn't make it to her husband at the espresso machine. He'll fill several other coffee orders & when I remind him I'm waiting, he'll have no idea I even placed an order! 

Improve on shortening wait times & on communication between owners & this cafe would be the perfect afternoon retreat.
author: Fancypants X.

description:
Came here for the first time on Saturday (9/24) and ordered quite a big brunch meal since we wanted to try a lot of the toasts. Ordered the Bacon Corn Toast, Chicken Meatball w Pesto Toast, and the Condensed Milk Toast. All were pretty good but my favorite was the chicken one because all of the flavors balanced well. 

The shop was filled with diners so my boyf and I were about to take our order to-go but one of the workers was nice enough to find us an open table and helped us get seated right away. She constantly checked up on us and was so genuine with her service. She really made the place feel like Home :')
author: Jennifer P.

description: The lavender latte is wonderful. All the food items are made with love and so delicious. Because the coffee and food is so good, you can never find s seat. Best to go early morning weekdays to beat all the students.
author: Dee Dee R.

description:
Super cute coffee spot, great place to study.  The noise level is pretty minimal so it would be perfect for a good study session. As for the coffee, it's really creative with all the different flavors that they came up with. The few that I've tried are
* Holy Cow 
* Lavender Latte 
* Red Velvet 
* Iced coffee 
* Coconut Vanilla Latte
* Espresso w/ condensed milk and ice (Yessss, I did actually request for them to make me my own Vietnamese Iced Coffee! :) ) 
As for their flavored lattes, it's really not all that strong espresso wise. You can barley taste the espresso shots. Not what I particularly like but if you're looking for something light and tasty, this is it. Just ask for half sweet if you're a bitter coffee lover like me.
author: Rachel V.

description: Very close to the tiled steps - I loved their iced coconut vanilla latte and the toast is great. Not enough seating inside as it was pretty busy.
author: John E.

description: I got the birthday cake latte and I was very pleased! I was scared that the latte was going to be too sweet because I don't like sweet drinks but it was perfect! The milk was steamed perfectly and the decor of the place was very aesthetic.  The staff was also very helpful and friendly.
author: Emily S.

description:
Who knew toast could be so good? Thick-sliced and soft, it felt like an upscale version of my mom's cinnamon toast.

The atmosphere is bright, modern, and clean. Lots of people chitchatting and working on Macbooks.

The menu is extremely clever - if you're looking for more than the old latte or espresso, Home has something to fit your palate. I had the Hangover, an iced sparkling Americano. Definitely fit the bill - coffee without my mouth getting a coating of cream, sugar, and flavouring.
author: Ari V.

description:
If you have a laptop and an appetite, then welcome home! When you walk into home, you get this modern feel to it. Almost everyone there had a laptop on their table or some kind of homework. With free wifi, coffee, delicious toasts and plentiful outlets, how could one pass up the offer of getting some work done here? Our waitress was so bubbly and gave us a full run down of the menu. 

I came with a friend and we weren't too hungry so we shared their special which was the bacon&corn toast. 
+Corn was fresh and sweet
+Bacon&Corn are actually a great combination of sweet and salty
+Cheese on top makes it taste like korean cheese corn
- I felt like the bacon was really salty. It was strangely salty for just bacon. It tasted almost like the bacon you would get in a jar for salad toppings. 

For most of the toasts, you do get a choice of adding an egg for $1! Unfortunately for me, I'm not a big coffee fan so I didn't order the coffee although everything sounded delectable. There's a wide selection of lattes in the 'creative' and classic portion of the menu that can be made either hot or cold but for the non-coffee fans, there's also an equally as impressive selection of teas and non-caffeinated drinks. 

Get the coconut juice! They serve it to you fresh from the coconut. It was such a great thirst quencher! 

****If it looks like there's no tables, ask the waitress. They do have separate groups share tables.
author: Lauren C.

description:
I went with my parents and it was slightly crowded, mostly young adults or college students working. People were very friendly and intermixed at other peoples' tables. It does have a very home-like vibe, which I adored.

I ordered the hazelnut latte and the bacon corn toast with an additional fried egg. It was tasty, except a bit difficult to cut. My mom got the condensed milk toast and my dad the eggs in a basket toast. I really liked my mom's, coming from a person with a sweet tooth. The seasoning of the eggs on my dad's and mine's was very well measured also.

The simple and minimalistic decorations were adorable and I would definitely come back!
author: Kacey A.

description:
Stopped by this new neighborhood restaurant for breakfast!  They have a variety of toast dishes.  I chose the "Eggs in the Basket", which is toast with the egg inside! It was delicious! I was told Home was noted for their coffee, but since I'm not a coffee drinker, I went with the Green Tea!

The host and hostess are very friendly.  Looking forward to returning and trying their other delectable delights!
author: Steven L.

description: This place is so good! The lattes are incredible and you have to get the egg on toast specials. The bread melts in your mouth and they fried the egg perfectly. I definitely want to go back next time I'm in San Francisco!
author: Daniel C.

description: Nice place. Interesting variety of coffee, tasty food. Tried the signature lavender infused latte with soy milk. It's on the sweeter side which suited my taste.
author: Oscar W.

description:
Q: for a girl who hates eating alone at a restaurant, where does she go for her hour long lunch? 
A: she eats in her car and then takes a fat nap.

So imagine her excitement when she finds out over the weekend that a new coffee shop has opened up a block away from her office. YUP, MUCHO EXCITEMENT.

It always sucks to go back to work after a three day weekend, but I was super excited for Tuesday to come along because I couldn't wait to check out this new spot during my lunch hour. Sometimes I'll hit up House of Coffee to do work on my laptop, but when I saw photos of Home on Yelp, I knew it'd be my typa spot. First off, they have succulents everywhere. Uhm c'mon, that already screams my name like they decorated the shop specifically for me. Yelp, is it ok if I give 5 stars just for that...? But it's not just the succulents that drew me in. If you take a quick look around, you can tell how much effort was put into decorating the space. I really loved the all around hipster/simplistic/wood vibe. 

Home offers different types of coffee including drip and lattes, but if coffee is not your forte, fret not, they also have drinks for fellow tea lovers. Pair a drink with a pastry and you're all set to relax with their soothing array of music playing in the background.

As everyone else has already mentioned, In and Annie are TOTAL SWEETHEARTS. I ordered a Hazelnut latte and sat down ready to munch on my lunch, but not before them asking if I needed a fork, napkins, or needed them to heat up my food. Prior to walking in, I was a bit hesitant because I wasn't sure if they'd allow me to bring my food to eat in their shop but they made me feel more than welcomed to chow down and chill. I'm sorry, but you're definitely going to be seeing me 4 days out of the 5 day work week because I am making Home my second home (no pun intended. just kidding, all intended).
author: Judith L.

description: When I walked into the cafe and the barista greeted me with 'Welcome Home" I was sold on the spot. The food and coffee are overpriced, but also delicious. Despite being rainbow, the Birthday Cake latte was not overly sweet and surprisingly well-balanced. The toasts are fantastic as well, just filling enough for a light snack. Great place to take a friend touring SF, as it's not too far from Golden Gate Park.
author: Rhea M.

description: I was visiting San Fran for the weekend and Home was close to my AirBnB so of course I came in two days in a row for my daily latte. I tried the lavender latte and the coconut vanilla, both iced. I was impressed and enjoyed both of them equally. The menu has so many other amazing latte options, I wish I could have tried them all. The ambiance inside was adorable, I could easily see this being a place I could sit and work if I lived in the area. The baristas were great as well, friendly and fast. Definitely check it out if you are close by!
author: Olivia C.

description:
So, I was at the donut shop across the way and I was super intrigued when another customer informed me that HOME recently opened serving a delectable Lavender Latte! It sounded so unique that I had to try it. 

ATMOSPHERE: Super chill, very easy to relax, spacious, good music; great place to come in the morning and hangout  

DECOR: Love the decor, the colors, the interior layout of the seats and tables; makes it look very spacious and roomy. 

BARISTA: tiny, very small espresso machine. only 1 barista could fit. 

SERVICE: Super friendly, young workers, very nice, barista is very good at making lattes, good foam 

LAVENDER LATTE FINISH: bits of pieces of Jasmine sprinkled on top or you could mix it in and drink with the latte. 

So, why did I give it 3 stars!? Because the Lavender Latte tasted burnt.... There wasn't an overwhelming Lavender taste, which I appreciated. However, the drink overall wasn't palatable and I couldn't finish the drink. I wish I enjoyed it because I had such high hopes. 

But perhaps next time I'll return to try another drink and definitely the toast. So, I'll have to update my review and hopefully give a higher rating :)
author: Mel H.

description:
Love this place! I think I found out about it through instagram and thought I would check it out. If you're looking for a good "instagrammable" place to get coffee, definitely check this place out. The aesthetics is very SF style and Tumblr and Instagram worthy lol. Parking can be tricky because it's street, and often times there is a wait for a table, but it's worth it. The people are unbelievably nice too! Annie, was especially sweet (I believe that is her name). My bf and I were waiting for our lattes (we got the birthday cake and holy cow - highly recommend. The lavender latte is also delicious); we had to get it to-go because we didn't think we would be getting a table due to how busy it was (we went a Saturday) and Annie not only helped us get a table right before our drinks were made, but she also asked if I wanted to get the lattes in a mug and my toast on a plate! She could have easily not said anything at all, but the fact that she went out of her way to make our experience better was SO nice! It seriously made my day. I don't think I've ever been to a cafe whose service is this nice, warm, and welcoming.
Oh, and the lattes and tomato toast were also beautifully made and delicious. :)
author: Linda L.

description: A pretty good coffee place.  Tried the lavender latte and milk & butter toast.  Both were very good.  Definitely go again if I am around there.
author: Liza T.

description:
Home has just coffee, tea, or hot chocolate for beverages. baked cookies are on the counter. coffee options: drip, pour over, expresso,  lattes, etc.

upscale ambience, bright interior.

brew: drip coffee (2.5) 
-cup was 3/4 full, reason? ran out of beans
cashier offered to give it to me free or i could wait 5 minutes.
i said: "u can't do that" and grabbed a cookie. asking: "how much"
cashier: "2.75, u don't have to do that".
-i gave her $3, got change
-coffee was four barrel ethiopian, very smooth brew.

eats: oatmeal cherry(2.75)
-real cherries, tasty oatmeal, worth the $$.

drips:
-pour overs (3.3ish) name beans
-fantastic coffee place, 
-worth coming here if i find free parking.
author: Victor G.

description: I enjoy the coffee, but the several times I've been here it's always been so busy that it makes it very difficult to find a place to study or get some work done which is why I go to coffee shops. It's a cute theme for a coffee shop but too busy for it's space.
author: Jeffrey H.

description: Part of me hates that I made the drive to find this place because now I've fallen in love with a coffee shop that's completely on the opposite side of the bay from me. First of all, parking is pretty easy, and the signage on this place is great (& adorable). You walk into a minimalist yet warm space that's possibly the cleanest coffee shop I've ever been in. The baristas are very kind and helpful, and don't mind chatting with you about the variety of amazing lattes they offer (I'm sure they get tired of everyone asking about their famous lavender latte but they were so patient). I'm a Philz addict so while I appreciate espresso what I really enjoy is a smooth cup, and I can't tell you how satisfied I was with this coffee. It was so incredibly smooth and the lavender complimented the taste without being overwhelming. I had an iced lavender late with almond milk, and although almond milk can be disappointing, it worked incredibly well in this coffee. My friend and I didn't try their toast (honestly I wasn't that interested at first. I came for the latte) but as we were waiting for our coffee we saw some of their toasts being served. My. God. The toast is HUGE and looked absolutely incredible. So Home has already won me over and I think I'll have to stop by any time I find myself near the Outer Sunset.
author: Sophia B.

description: Good selection of sweet and savory toasts. Delicious lavendar latte with just the right level of sweetness.  There's a fair amount of seating but it's taken up quickly. Skylights add to the airiness. Lots of people chatting and working.
author: Jay K.

description: I really do like this cafe. Been here a couple times, and the lattes are delish. I've had a vanilla soy latte, and also the lavendar latte. The lavendar latte is really unique, but be warned the lavendar flavor is STRONG! There is a nice amount of seating, but given it's fairly popular it's pretty tough to find a seat. My friend and I sat here for a catch up conversation, and I also stayed afterward to get some work done. A great atmosphere for both. Def recommend!
author: Diane G.

description:
FINALLY a nice cafe to hit up in the sunset district!

Actually, I shouldn't say that, because there are cozy spots out by Ocean Beach. That being said, this is DEFINITELY, the new cool kid on the block.

Ambiance:
I'd label it hipster. Strong neutral color palette (shut up interior design majors, I know neutrals aren't colors). Every table is decorated with a lone succulents; simple, yet charming. They have two (maybe one, don't remember) large fogged skylight/s, allowing for natural light to come in, but not too much light.

The Coffee/Food:
The menus are draped down the wall via a scroll of brown parchment-like paper, weighed down by little clamps to keep it in place, GENIUS. The coffee is good. If you're a coffee enthusiasts, they have four barrel pour over, SCORE! Their artisan toast is to die for, even though I've only tried one (the meatball/green onion...ORDER IT, LOVE IT, THEN DIE OF TASTE BUD ELATION). Just kidding, don't die.

LASTLY, but certainly not least, the Customer Service.
The owners, In and Annie, are awesome. Annie is adorable, very cute, and easy on the eyes. While In is a chill dude that you can chop it up with, not to be confused with small talk, for "chopping it up" is MUCH harder to achieve and should be respected and appreciated. Sorry ladies and gents, don't hit on either of them, they're an item [DOOR SLAM] so drown in your romantic sorrows with a splendid cup of Joe made carefully by them as they cheerfully bid thee farewell with their lovely smiles, for they know customer service is just as important as the physical product. They excel in this category and that's how you get repeat HAPPY customers, and I always recognize and appreciate.

In conclusion, if you're in the sunset district and don't want to drive out to ocean beach, GO HOME. See what I did there? They're not open Mondays.
author: Aaron C.

description: Love the lavender latte here! I tried the cold brew once and it wasn't too bad. Plenty of seating if you wanna swing by to catch up on some work.
author: Emily L.

description:
Great place to enjoy a quiet and relaxing afternoon.  I had the lavender jasmine latte and the chicken meatball pesto toast.  The latte was very good; sprinkled with lavender and lightly sweet.  The toast was awesome!  Don't be fooled; the size of the toast is enough for a meal.  I pretty much had a full lunch for under $10.  

Overall great calm vibe, really good drinks and great food.  If you're in the area and want a quick bite this is definitely worth a stop.
author: Tiffany C.

description: My wife and I came here for coffee, very friendly service and extremely good coffee. Love this place and will def come back
author: Jose B.

description:
Order: Lavender Almond milk latte & Corn and bacon toast. (about 14 dollars total)
**They don't have low/non fat milk. **They have almond milk, soy milk etc

My first time visiting HOME. My brother lives in SF and he told me that the Lavender coffee is awesome! They are using the lavender syrup and decor with lavender seeds (very clear), but the presentation and eco theme were good enough for me to pay 6-8 dollars per item. There were people studying/reading, so the cafe limited the time to 2hours so all of us can stay and enjoy. I was so happy that the place open on Sunday too! 

Will I go back? Yes, but I don't think I will visit for food.. Sort of pricy.. I wish to see what kind of coffee beans (good quality? hard to get in store?) and ingredients that they use so I know my money is worth to go back.
author: S L.

description:
Great new gem! Their coffee is pretty scrumptious. I tried the sea salt caramel: definitely salty! But overall good. The service is awesome! The staff is so friendly. 

The environment is pure tranquility. Love what they did for decor. So modern. 

Only 4 stars because some of their coffee choices are a little extreme for me: red velvet latte! Crazy!

But overall, great coffee! Definitely a regular here.
author: Raquel M.

description: The drip coffee was sooo acidic. I'm sure it was just sitting too long since clearly espresso is the focus of this place. Prices are fair.
author: Tim C.

description: Free wifi = nowhere to sit. The entire restaurant was filled with people on their laptops. We were set to order 3 toasts and coffees and enjoy breakfast but again there is no seating for dining. They should call themselves an Internet cafe.
author: Noel A.

description:
The employees here go out of their way to literally--make you feel at home. You can stay as long as you want (but I try not to abuse this since they are so nice about it), the lighting is just right, they put flippin' marshmallows in your hot chocolate--it's a win-win. 

The espresso drinks are also fun to try. I recommend the chocolate mint on ice. I definitely tried making it at Peet's and it did NOT equivocate. Betrayal--I know.
author: Stevie G.

description: I ordered the iced lavender latte and the egg in a basket. Couldn't ask for a better breakfast. The service here is very friendly and much appreciated! Would definitely come again!!!
author: Camly T.

description: I came here on a Saturday morning and fortunately there was a seat left by the window! It was packed however very clean. I have had a rough morning and being here definitely changed that. All the staff members were so nice, especially the girl at the register with blue-gray-ish hair, she recommended the Cookie Monster Latte and it was great! I also got the weekend special bacon, corn & cheese brioche toast and it was delightful. Love the vibe here and would definitely hang here a lot!:)
author: Alyssa H.

description: This is the best spot if you're a fan of Chai Tea Tea.
author: Mega Team R.

description: First of all, I adore the decor of this coffee shop. I would really love one of those wooden shelves in my room. Having said that, this place does really give off a homey vibe. If I lived closer, I'd probably be here every week. I didn't get a chance to try any of their toasts yet because I stopped by around 8am before work and their kitchen doesn't start until 9am, but I did order a drink and it was delicious! The lavender latte caught my eye at first, but I'm cutting down on the caffeine and they didn't have decaf so the woman working pointed out a perfect drink for me - lavender jasmine tea latte. Amazing. It even had real lavender sprinkled on the top of the foam! I also picked up an almond croissant, which was pretty good. They have a diverse selection of lattes and pastries, but I really want to try their toasts! Definitely will be back.
author: Stephanie G.

description: If I could give this place more than 5 stars.... I would.  The owners and the baristas are SO NICE.  There's a barista named James and he's so friendly and nice!  Same with Vashelle!  They remembered my name within the first few times I've gone and they always say goodbye when you leave.  #baristagoals  I ALWAYS order the mint chocolate latte.  It's amazing.  To be honest, I'm not much of a coffee drinker so I like sweeter drinks with some coffee flavor... and the mint choco latte definitely hits the spot dead on.  The holy cow is also really good.  And don't even get me started on their toast.  You HAVE to get it... that's all I have to say. *drops mic*  You have to come here... it's legit latte art goals, coffee goals, you name it.  p.s. their latte art is the best in the city too.
author: Sam L.

description: I found this place on a blog and thought it was too good to be true from the pictures..I have visited twice now with my husband & absolutely loved it! The staff are so friendly & most definitely give 5 start service..the menu is amazing- we tried a birthday cake, red velvet latte and a lavender one..we loved them all, birthday cake and red velvet are definitely on the sweet side but all worth trying for sure. The owners are so sweet, welcoming & friendly. This place is a little gem& we will be regulars now..well done guys! Only downside, which is not their fault is how crazy busy it gets- we had to wait on tables both times, which is annoying, but a testimony to how great and popular this place is :-)
author: Anna D.

description: Best lavender latte i have ever had. Looking forward to trying other things from here!
author: Some B.

description: Interesting place with unique approach. Love their coffee and it was make very good. I will come back for sure.
author: Anuta B.

description: I really wanted to like this place.  Just not my kind of coffee I guess.  Super sweet and for the hot cocoa the marshmallow doesn't melt.  The service is great just the drinks were mediocre.   Ambiance is super cute and service was on point.
author: Kathy C.

description:
I stopped by Home for a quick breakfast on my way to Richmond District. I was not disappointed at all!

I was expecting a typical SF cafe...where they can sometimes be a little snobby. I got the iced latte made with condensed milk (pardon me for forgetting the name) and the toast with pesto, tomato, cheese and a fried egg. 

While the food and coffee were delicious, what won me over was the customer service. 

I had asked for a water to-go and the cashier told me that they had a water station, but had to charge $0.50 for the water cup. I declined since I didn't want to have to pay for a CUP. He felt really bad and when it came time to pay for the bill, he reached into his pocket and said he would pay for our water and said "it was important to hydrate". I was so touched by his kind offer, but declined for him to pay for our water - really, we were fine without water! To top it off, the gal who eventually gave us our food was very sweet and attentive to what we needed (it was only forks and napkins, but still!). It was great coming across genuinely nice people in a coffee shop on a Saturday morning :) 

This trip to Home was a little quick, but I will definitely be back here to eat inside next time and try more of their delicious toasts!
author: Vanessa P.

description: Perfect place for an early brunch or simply a cup of coffee to start the morning with. I'd go to this place mainly for the visual aesthetic & friendly atmosphere, but the menu items aren't so bad. I got the lavender latte ($4.50) & the chicken meatball toast ($5.00); a little overpriced but it did taste good. Their creative latte menu has expanded, from what I've collected, so I'll definitely be coming back to try those out. The staff are very welcoming & made me feel very at home in this quaint little spot. I'd recommend coming here when it's not so busy, just so your order isn't rushed. LATTE ART IS SO WORTH THE INSTAGRAM POST.
author: Caitlyn Paige D.

description:
One of my favorite cafes in city, if not my favorite. Home has everything that you can ask for from a neighborhood coffee shop. A cozy space, thoughtful interior decorating, good music, and welcoming staff all contribute to a great atmosphere. The staff in particular is worth highlighting. They're incredibly friendly. One barista was kind enough to customize my latte art!

The food and drinks are both fantastic. They have some very creative lattes (like condensed milk, vanilla coconut, etc.), and they're all very tasty. Their sweet toasts is AMAZING. They're all very good, but my favorite is definitely the condensed milk...I'm getting hungry just thinking about it.

Finally, it's a great place to do work, and this means it can get a little crowded, especially Sunday afternoons, when I typically go. Still, I've never had a problem finding a spot, whether it means sharing a table or just waiting a few minutes.

Incredible food and a perfect atmosphere, a place that definitely lives up to its name.
author: Lawrence W.

description:
Whenever I'm craving creative coffee drinks/ need to get some work done I come here to knock out two birds with one stone.  My number one favorite drink is the iced coconut vanilla latte but not too long ago I tried the nutella latte and I must say I fell in love.  It kind of tastes like a milky ferrero roche chocolate ball. YUM!!! 

The cafe itself is decorated very nicely and has a decent amount of lighting.  However, if you have to sit towards the back of the cafe I will say it gets a little dark later in the day and I wish they would put brighter lights for the back area.  Otherwise very clean with a good amount of outlets to charge your computer.
author: Krystal L.

description: Not sure why this place exist, it's an internet cafe with coffee. No seats no socializing. It could be the distopia we are all moving toward. They have a sign claiming 2 hour maximum but it's in unforced. It's a huge waste of space in a city with space constraints.
author: Ryan K.

description: This place is close to home and I believe fairly new. Nice clean and quiet atmosphere; lots of people working but also people just drinking coffee and hanging out. I had the lavender latte and a cinnamon toast. Both delicious. Lavender is strong so I was glad this wasn't overpowering in the coffee. It was also a little sweet which was nice. The toast, well, it's cinnamon, and bread, and butter. How can that not be yummy! Very enjoyable all round.
author: Liz R.

description: I would give this place 5 stars if it weren't for the college kids that literally hog the whole cafe and sit there on their laptops and cell phones. They do not move for customers coming in. My best advice is they should really enforce their time limit.. we came in last weekend on a rainy Sunday and had to literally wait almost 20 minutes for someone to move, the whole hour we were there and got our awesome cake lattes none of the college kids bothered to move. Here I go ranting again because I'm frustrated.... In my personal opinion I would think that would drive away customers since there is a 2 hour limit, which is not enforced.... which doesn't make sense at all since it's a coffee shop that is a fairly small.... besides that! The food is good but pricey and the lattes are delicious. Don't expect to get a seat right away. You're better off at Starbucks!
author: Cupcake 1.

description:
This would be your hipster coffee shop in the sunset. You won't find one like this around the area so it gets busy. Generally there is a huge line for the order and when you are waiting to order it seems all the tables are full, but by the time you do order something will open up for you. 

The toast is yum, I think I've tried all of them and they are all great. The coffee on the other hand is meh, if you like sugary drinks this would be a good place for you... I personally liked the coconut latte and asked for it to be less sweeten and it was much better.  I've had friends try the caramel latte and they loved it also, lavender was a bit disappointing I didn't really taste it, there was just dried lavender on top of my coffee. 

Over all though it's a good place to sit and have a breakfast!
author: Yas J.

description:
Additional 50+ cents if you order "for here". Extra tax or fee beware!

The seats near the window can get extremely hot and bright (no blinds at their large windows)
author: Di A.

description: The coffee and toast was great! However, this place isn't a space to do work. I'd suggest that the establishment either hide the tables that allow laptops with a partition, or ban laptops entirely. I had a bad experience of guests badmouthing people working on projects and "taking up valuable space." I'm already experiencing gentrification on a housing level, I'd rather not experience it as I do work and drink my coffee.
author: Marc M.

description: I honestly didn't like their Lavender Latte ): it had toooo strong of a flower scent that made my head hurt. But! I did enjoy their Holy Cow Latte (dondensed milk). Although, I wish it had more of a condensed milk taste. Next time, I'm DEFINITELY coming back for their toasts!!!!!! They look sooooo good! & I'm looking forward to trying their different latte flavors next time. Maybe their coconut vanilla, matcha, or red velvet! :P oh... & their customer service was great! They were all super friendly. I had a great laugh from the cute smiley face that the barista drew on my latte lol.
author: Jenefer N.

description:
I really like this place the first time I went there. I ordered a lavender latte, and it tasted so good. Ever since that one time, I have been craving for that latte everyday. Finally, I had yesterday off, and I was so excited to visit Home again. But my lavender latte did not look like a lavender latte, or taste like a lavender latte. 
I took a sip of my latte, and thought it was weird... then I start to walk out, but I couldn't believe that was a lavender latte, cause first of all, there was NO lavender flower on my latte  :(
So I walk back and ask the barista if what she made was a lavender latte.

"excuses me, I ordered a lavender latte, is this a lavender latte?" I asked. 
She ask me, "does that taste like a lavender latte?"
"NO!" I replied. 
"Oh, I can add more syrup if you like."
"ehhh, no thanks!." I told her

After I left Home, I thought it was a very bad experience. Since I had high hope and loved my first experience there. 

I was shock there wasn't lavender flower on my latte, I mean I paid $4.5 the first time I was there, and I paid same amount this time around. Why was such important ingredient missing? I understand the lavender flower is not for the taste, but it was a fancy accessory for the latte.
author: Zee Z.

description: Five stars for the awesome 90s and 00s R&B music they play. The drinks and toast are pretty wonderful as well.
author: Devy E.

description: I usually don't drink coffee but I craved for it today and it was a chilly day. The place was packed and it was my first time. I was greeted by the 2 guys working there and asked me if I had any questions. They made me feel comfortable, definitely felt like home. I got the Holy Cow Latte and it was just perfect! Not too sweet & the temperature was perfect! I would definitely come back again when I'm in the area!
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Came to this cafe with my boyfriend pretty late in the morning. The lavender coffee was really really good! I was surprised, as I wouldn't have thought the floral flavor would be good with coffee like it is with tea. I would actually go back to have it again. I had the condensed milk toast as well and it was nice and sweet. A good light breakfast.
The cafe has a nice, peaceful atmosphere so I would probably come back here to do some school work.
author: Audrey D.

description:
I got an iced sea salt caramel latte and a special bacon , corn , cheese toast , total was $10.37 
- not the cheapest for breakfast, but definitely worth it !!!! 
- the sea salt latte was perfect, not too sweet ( the latte I had at trouble's was way too bitter) 
- bacon, cheese, corn toast so BOMB !!! Nice thick slice of toast with chopped bacon , corn , and melts cheese. 
- the toast was not too salty 
- their menu is on a piece of butcher paper on the wall :) 
- staff is friendly 
-I really want to come back to try the other stuff
author: Joyce C.

description: Great drinks, bread, atmosphere, overall great place to study/work. Had their birthday cake and coke-tastic, both were delicious!
author: Khanh N.

description:
This neighborhood definitely needed something like Home. I totally approve of what they did with the former space occupied by Bashful Bull. There are a good amount of tables. Got the iced salted caramel latte and it was noms! It was not too sweet and had a unique taste to it. 

I hope Home is here to stay!
author: Vanessa K.

description:
This place is adorable!! It's great for studying. I love all the natural light that comes in and it's also very spacious.

I also love that they make super cute designs in many of the hot drinks. Very instagram worthy!!
author: Clarice C.

description: Tables are first come, first serve and you pickup your drinks at the counter. My sister and I had the red velvet and chocolate mint latte which was not bad but pretty! I liked the chocolate mint better because it was sweeter and less coffee tasting. We also had the tomatoes, cheese and pesto food item and the eggs in a basket. The eggs in a basket was simple and too salty so I won't be ordering that again but the tomatoes and pesto was not bad. Something I can make at home but the bread was well toasted and soft inside. Nice place to get your studying on as well.
author: Amanda C.

description: Got the condensed milk toast... Surprisingly not too sweet (but i expected it to be super sweet). Went well with my Four Barrel Guatemalan black coffee! #excusemylipstickstain
author: Diana C.

description: First time here! I was in the neighborhood and wanted to try a new place. Home has a sweet atmosphere and staff is very friendly. I went for the Egg in the basket toast (added bacon crumbles) and a chai latte. Both were satisfying. The actual toasted bread is heavenly! I want to come back to try the birthday latte and the lavender latte.
author: Mag L.

description: First off I have to say well done to the people at Home. I came here when they had less than a hundred reviews and now I can barely find residential parking and a table. I have had their lavender latte and am waiting to try their birthday cake latte. Lavender Latte is a must and the art work is respectable and not your typical heart. The baristas care about your drink and put in the extra time and effort to make it as great as possible. The interior is beautiful and the placement of everything is superb. I really like the ambiance and feeling when I go in there. I have been here multiple times to just read or get some work done. This is my favorite coffee shop and I don't mind driving from daly city just for a cup of coffee. Its more than a cup of coffee but a whole experience and a different environment. They are definitely making a name for themselves and are going to need another location. Everyone who goes here should post a pic and put on IG, FB or SNAP because this places deserves to be known. Congrats HOME.
author: Brian C.

description: My date took me here & it was the cutest little cafe ever wish I could try everything but I live like 40 min away from this place . But if I ever do come by I would definitely visit again. wish they had more seats tho, that would be a plus.
author: Ana C.

description:
I wanted to catch up with a friend over coffee. She wanted to try out Home, and so we did. This was in the late afternoon on January 2. It was packed with people chatting and/or working. Though, I don't know how people can work in such a cramped and noisy environment. 

I ordered a soy latte, which came out to $5 ~ $5.xx. Crazyyyyy. Well, I guess that's how SF is these days with its coffee prices. The latte was lukewarm and super watery. It was pretty much the worse latte I've ever had. The price didn't make the situation any better. I'm definitely not coming back.
author: Ava C.

description: The decoration and ambience definitely provides a good working and studying place. Not only atmosphere but the lattes and toasts are worth the try. It's definitely a great place to go again.
author: Melanie N.

description:
Came here saturday morning. There's only 2 ppl working here. I guess they are the owners. It was not crowded but it was bustling. They definitely need some help if they dont want hangry customers waiting.

I ordered the young coconut and chicken meatball toast. The coconut was definitely not young. The meat was so hard to scrape off with my spoon :( so sad. The meatball toast was delicious but i dont know how much butter they put on there it was super oily! I could feel some liquid in my mouth when I bite it and I know it was oil. Nasty. Maybe cause they were too busy thats why they cant spend enough time preparing the food. Maybe. I'll come back again when they have new stuff on their menu.

Theres free street parking and also metered parking. Lots of other food places near it: twisted donuts, golden island (asian dessert place) and other boba places, japanese restaurants etc.
author: Inez J.

description:
Cozy little establishment off 19th avenue.

The outside doesn't do the inside justice. The space was definately much bigger than expected upon entering. Though more space could have been allowed if not for the book shelves against the wall. Still a great space. Loved the natural lighting near the windows for studying or drawing.

There were many caffinated and non-caffinated drinks available to choose from, but wished to see more food items to satisfy my hunger. All food items were served on thick toast with some sort of protein. I ordered the chicken meatball pesto and a standard ice chai, all were quite tasty. No complaints there.

Do wish they opened a little later and not closed at 5pm. But understandable when they open at 7am.
author: Amy C.

description:
Good coffee 
Friendly
Good location
Cool rainbow color latte
The workers are quick 
The tables are nice 
Want to go back now
author: Jordan Y.

description:
I love coming Home! This place has a bunch of great specialty coffee drinks and plenty of snacks that will fill you up. I love their tea lattes, with the chai tea latte and the lavender jasmine being my favorite. Their tea lattes are light and never overwhelming sweet.

For snacks, their toasts are very yummy. I ordered the cinnamon sugar, which is a great choice for anyone with a sweet tooth. On my next visit, I ordered the "Eggs in a Basket" toast. As much as I loved it while I was chowing down on it, it was extremely heavy and saturated with butter. It was too delicious in the moment to put it down and stop eating it, as any dish soaked in butter is, but my body sure paid for it afterwards.

It's a cute, smaller spot so trying to find a place to sit can be difficult. When you do find seating, it's a great and quiet place to study. The workers here, particularly the woman with the shorter, blonde hair, are so sweet and make sure you're as happy as can be while you're here.

I definitely recommend coming here and trying it out!
author: Kat L.

description:
2 stars based on service.  When you have a line, say hello and what not but don't sit there and have full on conversations about your weekend plans with guest.  You are too distracted to know you just had two walk outs due to 4 laptop tables or that the next person JUST wants a drop.

Maybe when other guest inquire about a table, don't mention it's for owners parents. 

Toast and coffee were excellent.
author: Ange M.

description:
The flavor in the flavored lattes can be stronger but the toasts were really good. I tried the red velvet and condense milk lattes and they both can use more red velvet or condense milk flavor. The chicken meatball, tomato pesto and condense milk toasts were all really good. 

Service was friendly. I wish the hours were longer. Instead of closing at 4pm, it would be great if they closed at 9pm. It's great to have a new cafe in the neighborhood.
author: Andy W.

description:
I love home - I look forward to going to the cozy, quaint environment. The owners are super sweet and accommodating. I'm also super glad to see that they've updated their opening hours! 

Food:
The toast is awesome (have you ever eaten something that buttery delicious?) the service is great, and the environment is relaxing. Highly recommend "eggs in a basket".

Teas & Lattes:
- They have bottle samples of teas that you can sniff-test before ordering.
- I'll recommend their lavender vanilla latte for a smooth & soothing shot of caffeine in the morning. 

Parking?:
A lot of meter parking open and available within the block on weekdays. I haven't been here on weekends yet. 

Noise levels:
- Quiet enough to have a conversation
- Too loud to comfortably listen to an podcast / conference call
- Music selection is really good, but since they have speakers in both sides of their cafe, there isn't a way to "get away" from the music.
author: Christina H.

description:
True to its name, this shop felt a good deal like home. The interior is well decorated and maintained, with thoughtful additions like picture frames, wall mirrors, and a string of lights that made the entire place look like a well maintained modern living room. The tables provided are spacious and exceptionally clean. In the 4 hours I stayed, I never felt too crowded nor too lonely as I was constantly surrounded by cheerful people having light conversations or other studious individuals. 

The wifi is pretty consistent, and outlets were plentiful along the majority of the tables. Extra points for the comfortable butt pads that are provided for the bench seating along the walls.

More points for the creativity in the drink menu. In additional to your coffee shop essentials, they have offerings such as Nutella hot chocolate, mixed lattes, and in house syrups. I went for an iced red velvet latte (it was early in the morning and I really didn't care what people thought of me at the time) that was very well done, and of course, it was in a mason jar. 

This place easily tops my list of coffeeshops in my neighborhood that I wouldn't hesitate to return to. Next time, I'll be sure to sample some of the toast that everyone else raves about. The lady sitting next to me spent all of 45 seconds devouring her buttered toast with condensed milk, and I really wanted to join her. Next time.
author: Chen-Chen H.

description: Beautiful interior and really friendly staff. It has a really good vibe, lots of seating.  Everyone is really friendly and good about opening up seating and the staff is great about clearing tables quickly and getting people seated.  Gorgeous latte art. I love the colors.  The reason for 4 stars and not 5 is that I wasn't all that impressed with the coffee itself.  It's gorgeous to look at, but really average to drink.  Their food looked very good, though I didn't try any.  I got the birthday cake latte because of how pretty it is and was less than impressed with the flavor.  Overall great experience! Cool place to check out!
author: Lisa O.

description: Insta-ready lattes and toasts that also taste good. I went in here two days after my birthday and they made me their classic birthday latte and wrote my name on it! Really nice staff. Good place to do work/study. Wifi and outlets available.
author: C.R. O.

description:
I absolutely love this place! I've been here so many times it's gotten to the point where Vashelle and Abby both know who I am and my usual orders are. The staff here is so sweet. I saw Vashelle warn one of the patrons that the meter maid was writing out a ticket. Now, that's kindness.

As for the food and drinks, you can be rest assured that they take proper care and are concise in measuring out the beans to give you that perfect cup of joe. My personal favorite is the iced matcha latte. They actually use a whisk to make the drink. My go to snack is def the egg in the basket. Need I say more?
author: Naomi Y.

description: Cute space to study/get work done if you're around the sunset! Coffee isn't bad and neither is the toast selection/food (kinda on the pricey side for toast though).  Came here with my friend when the place was pretty new and I thought it was adorable. Surprisingly on that visit we were able to get a table and enjoy the toast and lattes we ordered.
author: Briana L.

description: Charming beyond words. Simple yet comforting. I had a delicious dirty chai latte with almond milk and one of the toasts. I'd encourage anyone visiting the 16th ave tiled steps to stroll on by Home and great yo self!
author: Arel O.

description: Literally one of my favorite coffee shops now. Unique drink choices that come beautifully crafted - such as the sweet and overwhelmingly colorful birthday cake latte. Definitely the place to be! Workers are also super cheery! But be warned, seating is limited due to this place's popularity.
author: Jimmy S.

description: Lavender latte - Looks are deceiving! Microfoam not quite there and the fact that they use lavender syrup as flavoring made this drink too sweet. One star for using Four Barrel, which I miss ever since Tartine eased to serve it. Clearly they tried though, but next time I'll be better off making my own lavender latte at MY HOME!
author: Miss S.

description: Super cute, clean & trendy coffee shop. Excellent Cappuccino. Had the egg in a blanket with sprinkled bacon pieces. Super yummy....wanted to try everything on the menu!
author: Fi F.

description: I've been dying to try this place!! Came here on a sunny Monday afternoon and it was packed! Thank god someone left right after I finished ordering!! Anyways this is a cute place where you can study and hang out with your friends! I got the ice lavender latte and condensed milk toast and the total was around ten dollars! I would love to come back and try the rest of the stuff on their menu (:
author: Tina C.

description:
Good place with wonderful coffee. Line gets a bit long but other than that everything is A+ Try the lavender latte.  

Haven't tasted their food but from what I hear, its pretty good.
author: simon c.

description:
Today I didn't have a very good experience at Home Cafe. 

I ordered the ginger peach iced tea which was alright and found a spot near the window to study which was a little bright, but workable! The atmosphere was pretty nice and I appreciate the decor of the cafe.

A few hours later, however, a huge group of people came and it got really loud. Considering I was hoping for a place to get some work done, I wasn't altogether happy with that. 

Therefore, just know that although they have some good tea and coffee, it may get pretty  loud at Home and be hard to do work if that's what you're looking for, which makes sense it's home and home can get pretty loud with the whole family over.
author: Brendon P.

description: I love this place! It truly does feel like Home. R&B jams on that really get you in th groove to get some work done. Nice pillows to sit on to make sure you're comfy. The staff is super nice and very accommodating. If you're thirsty definitely order a cup of their speciality coffees and if you're hungry then you're in for a treat! I love, love, love their toast! I'm pretty obsessed and try a different one every time I come. Their specialty toast a big, buttery, thick, and topped with amazing ingredients. Today I had the egg and a basket which is something I usually make on the weekend but I don't think i can anymore ever since I've had the one here at Home. Their homemade toast is just everything! Definitely order one of these if you're hungry, its the perfect snack and you won't regret it!
author: Jessica B.

description:
Home definitely feels like home (: the workers are always nice and friendly! They make you feel welcomed for sure.

-Holy Cow: I got mine iced because it was a hot day. It's basically a latte with condensed milk. It's really delicious! I like my drinks on the sweeter side so I asked for extra condensed milk in mine.

-Condense Milk and Butter Toast: mmmmm super soft, thick toast covered in butter and condensed milk. This is a great snack/dessert. Make sure to eat it right when you get it because that's when you'll get that foodgasm after the first bite (; mm mm mm

-Tomato, truffle oil, pesto toast: yoooo this is it. This toast is simply delicious. You can definitely taste the truffle oil in this, which I really like. Together with the tomato, pesto, and melted cheese, this is so awesome. A must try!

All in all I'm really happy with what Home has to offer. One downside is that the tables are always full ): there always seem to be people studying/doing work so they stay for days.
author: Jackie T.

description: I got the birthday cake latte even though I was worried it would be too sweet, and I was pleasantly surprised! Not only was the latte art beautiful, but the coffee was not super sweet and it was really tasty! We also ordered eggs in a basket and that was delicious as well. Highly recommend if you're in the area! However, it does get pretty crowded so probably going during the week or earlier in the day would help. We somehow were able to snag a table around 10:30-11am on a Saturday :)
author: Sarah C.

description:
I love this place! 

The decor is so nice, hazelnut latte is so good, and staff is super nice! 

Most def coming back again
author: Tracy V.

description:
Hipster alert. 

Lots of tea, coffee and even non-caffeine drinks available. Apparently they have toast and other snacks too! 

I needed some coffee and my BF brought me here. I ordered the coconut vanilla latte with soy milk (4.75) and it was on the sweeter side so next time I will ask for less sweeter. 

Great place to get some work done but getting tables may be a problem bc there are so many younglings studying and hanging out

Staff is friendly and efficient. I'll be back to try other novelty drink items and their toast! 

Tip: credit card for $5 or more only
author: Elaine L.

description:
"Cuuuuuute..." is what you think walking into Home. I mean, at least if you're me, it is.

This is a very welcoming and very Sunset District place to grab a novelty coffee drink, eat fancy toast, and use some Wi-fi. Their "Hangover" drink is kind of a copy of Andytown's snowy plover - it's a sparkling iced americano and it's remarkable. They use Four Barrel and De La Paz for their roasters. I'm assuming they use the latter in the hangover because the coffee was bold and strong and not weak and flowery like Four Barrel (I hate Four Barrel).  

Oh and the toast! The condensed milk toast (very Sunset District, ya see?) is so damn good. It should come with a shot of insulin to save your body the effort because it's very sweet, but worth the grams of sugar. They even have condensed milk lattes if you're into matching.

You can stay for hours just working on your computer without being bothered - it seems like most people come here to get work done. There's limited seating, so you'll end up sharing the other half of your table with someone else, but that's okay right? You can watch them instagram their toast.
author: K M.

description: What a gem! Nice & thoughtful staff makes you feel welcome. Very cozy with little bit of greenery on the tables. Feels homey--just as the name suggests. Even though it's a bit of a trek for me to get to on the MUNI, I'd definitely make an effort to come back.
author: Yad L.

description:
Maybe I had high expectations for the customer service, but I came in and had to wait for a few minutes as the lady at the register chatted with the 2 guys in front. Perhaps it was because they want to know their customers better? At least acknowledge those waiting to place an order, so minus 1 star, BUT
