That said, the holy cow lattes were amazing! :) Recommended by my sister, and I have to agree that it was delicious. Definitely will return when I'm in the city again.
author: Victoria W.

description: My salted caramel hot chocolate was delicious, especially when they added a large marshmallow with a smiley face on it! Overall, it's a cozy cafe to chill in.
author: Winnie Y.

description: Super busy and hardly any space to sit but their birthday cake and red velvet lattes are super good! The staff is very friendly and sweet.
author: Katie P.

description: Yea it's cute, but impractical to have inedible lavender leaves in your delicious latte. I'm trying to think that the presentation outweighs the taste, but it doesn't really matter. We got one of the fancy lavender lot is, and then the regular vanilla one. Both were good, and we appreciated that they were opened early so we could we make a stop there before going to John Muir Woods. Husband wife couple were very sweet.
author: Thu M.

description:
My friends and I have been stopping by at this shop pretty regularly, so I thought it was about time I wrote something about it.

Some context; some of my friends and I enjoy exploring and trying the different coffee spots in SF and in the bay area, so we've experienced a lot. Home Cafe has a variety of espresso drinks, teas, toasts, and also some unique concoctions that you don't really see that often (the Coketastic is a must-try). But what I really appreciate about this shop is the customer service. For one the owners are really personable; it seems like they consistently remember all of their regular and somewhat-frequent customers. But in general, most of the staff aren't afraid to make conversation with customers, which is something I do enjoy as part of the coffee experience.
author: Ethan J.

description: Great place to study, great drinks and delicious toasts! I'm always down to come here :)
author: Rochelle A.

description:
I found this coffee shop on yelp and I went last week. This cafe is great and fancy! I really enjoy the drink and food. 

The decoration of this shop is very good. You can find lots of plants and enjoy the sunshine. It's also a good place if you want to relax with your friends. I think it is amazing when you are drinking a coffee and the  sun is shining on your face, while the plant is on your table.

My favorite drink is coconut vanilla latte. It has a light coconut fragrance and a little bit sweet. By the way, their toast is also very delicious. I recommend the Pesto tomato truffle toast. You can choose this toast as your breakfast. I think you will have a good start, then have a great day. 

The customer service is very nice. The cashier was really helpful in helping  me to choose what to order. They always smile and make me feel very warm.

I will always be here until I have tried everything. Really enjoy the food.
author: Annabelle R.

description: If you get the lavender latte, don't chew on the lavender! It's super cute inside but most of the time it's crowded.
author: S L.

description:
This is a cute little coffee shop in the Sunset. It's great because there really aren't a ton of spots like this in that area. The staff are super friendly and Free wifi is a plus! 

The toast dishes are delicious and I think they bake the bread there. I personally think that the chicken meatball toast could use less salt, but I still get it every time. 

It's great for getting some easy work done. You can bring a laptop, but they play music and people chat so it's not super quiet. It's great for getting some quick things done, but you probably won't be able to get totally in the zone or anything. I like that the customers are very friendly so people will share tables.
author: Elizabeth K.

description:
I don't normally sit down at cafes, more of a grab-it-to-go type of girl, but Home definitely feels like home. The first time I came here with two other friends because we needed a place with WiFi to do some research and planning for one of our trips. We ordered one of their savory toasts (I think it had bacon and corn in it) and also I got the holy cow (condensed milk latte). Both items were DELICIOUS! This is definitely a great place to get some stuff done while enjoying a cup of coffee. 

Also, I love their staff here! I've had extremely pleasant encounters every time.
author: Lina C.

description: The owner followed up and addressed my experience. Super sweet and thoughtful about everything. Really appreciate it!
author: Nicole W.

description: Local coffee shop with fantastic lattes. A must have is the coconut vanilla latte. Awesome croissants.  Loved it.
author: Matt B.

description: Great feel like Home ambiance. Good place to study. Great staff. Variety list of unique coffee with artistic cream on top and a selected menu of food and bakery choices. Try the hazelnut latte and egg in a basket toast.
author: Rose T.

description: short and simple. best latte's ever. sweet, creamy, delicious. the staff was so sweet and happy to help. i love cute little coffee shops like this.
author: Paige D.

description:
My boyfriend had stumbled upon this cafe while we were in the city, and I'm grateful he did. Home is the best coffee shop I've been to, from their food to the ambiance of the establishment. I had gone to the restroom while my boyfriend had ordered, so I cannot comment on the service. They serve your food to you, but do not check on you. You order in the front of the house.

Food: I had gotten the tomato cheese with pesto toast, which was perfect. The toast was very fluffy and thick, but toasted perfectly. The combination of the cheese, tomato, and pesto had a very nice texture. The appearance was very clean and cute. I also had ordered the chai tea, which is hard to go wrong with. The appearance of it was nice, but it was my own fault that I left the bag in the water for too long.

Ambiance: Vey modern and clean. With just enough plant life in the restaurant to bring in some color, as it does have white walls, chairs, and tables. They also have a lit up "HOME" sign in white, which is a nice touch to the atmosphere. Their menus are written in large brown papers deriving from a roll towards the top of the walls and on a black chalkboard in purple, green, and blue chalk. A place that you must visit to see for yourself. The neighborhood it's in is very cozy and comfortable as well. You can see the beach from there.
author: Michaela O.

description: Seen this place on Yelp a couple of times and I've been wanting to come here. It's such a nice dainty little cafe and the lighting is so nice(for the selfies and pictures). Even though it's not very big, it's very comforting and warm in there. I ordered an iced lavender latte and a chicken meatball pesto toast with an egg on top(I think I paid extra for it). The lady(cashier) was really nice. Right when I got my drink, I started taking pictures because that's the whole point right?? Haha just kidding but the lighting in here was too good not to take any pictures. They had succulents and plants on each of the tables for decoration and to add a nice touch to the pictures. The drink I ordered was good but I wasn't expecting such a strong coffee taste. It was very refreshing because of the lavender and the ice. It didn't take long before my toast came. It smelled and look really good. Popped my egg aka egg porn before and I ate it up. Even though the toast doesn't look very big, it's very filling. While we were eating, the lady cashier walked around and asked us how was our food. Love how she checked on us. I almost couldn't finish the toast but I had to because it would've been a waste. Overall I would come back. It's a cute hangout spot with friends.
author: Lisa W.

description: Lovely atmosphere, delicious options, and a wonderfully friendly staff! The lavender latte is a must!
author: Leah R.

description:
Some what of a coffee hound. Its rare you find such quality beans, unique drinks, amazing staff and delicious food. they have the best pastries , and they have my all time favorite breakfast invention. Eggs in A Basket . Or Toads in a Hole my grandma would say. 
If you are in the area. stop in ,it will make your day.
author: Joshua W.

description: Friendly staff, delicious food,  and the best lavender latte I've ever had. I came with a friend at a relatively early time so there was no rush and it wasn't noisy. My friend tried the condensed milk toast (no picture sadly) while I had the savory to at with the fried egg. And yes the egg is necessary. It was surprisingly filling with my lavender late, and if it were closer to my house I would probably come every weekend to read a book, study, or just to get out of the house and people-watch. Maybe next time I'll also drop by twisted donuts for dessert (always room for dessert no matter how full)!
author: Sherry Y.

description:
This place is so cute, food is delicious and the owners are so nice. I'm sure this place will be around for a long time.
My daughter's had the frozen hot chocolate,  condensed milk toast. And love them.
I have an iced hazelnut latte and a tomato,  mozzarella,  pesto, truffle oil toast. Delious
author: Jmarania M.

description:
Such a great place! Super busy on a Sunday morning but not a long wait for tables and the service is incredible. 3 girls were working this morning and every single one of them was cheerful and attentive, and they really go above and beyond to make sure you are taken care of. I tried both of the sweet toasts - the cinnamon and condensed milk - and they were amazing! I also really highly recommend the Nutella latte. 
Ever since La Boulangerie closed and reopened into something different, I've been on a hunt for a new coffee shop with a bunch of different and really good options - and this is it!!! I'll definitely be adding this to my regular routine. Thanks!
author: Natalie M.

description: I found this place on Instagram after a friend visited there page via Instagram and seen all the cool designs they did for their coffee drinks . One of the main reasons we visited to be honest and to our disappointment the drinks did not make it to us how we seen in a lot of the customers pictures from before. Before I left a barista asked how everything was I told her I was kinda disappointed because we didn't get the really cool designs we seen online in our coffee cup . She mentioned she was one of the artists that didn't happen to be making the coffee cups that day . So next time I know to ask and specifically ask for the design being advertised.
author: Rebecca G.

description: This place lived up to the hype. The toasts I tried (cinnamon sugar and eggs in a basket) were so delicious. The red velvet latte I had was yummy, too. My boyfriend was skeptical and did not want to try this place with me, but was pleasantly surpirsed and will be coming back with me to try other toasts and drinks.
author: Melissa S.

description:
Pulsing with life.

One of Paul Van Dyk's best songs: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=U5bTIvZ_GTo

Lyrics aptly describe this much loved Outer Sunset destination. Expect:

- Coffee with unexpected extras like espresso and Coke (didn't try) and lattes with lavender sprinkles (did try). Pretty, potent and perfect with soy milk (no nonfat).

- Toast with eggs built in (amazing) and toast with chicken and parmesan on top (also amazing). Both were impressive in size and both were impossible to stop eating.

- Staff with a smile as warm as the coffee and personality as rich as the toast. You feel both welcome and wanted.

- Design with an open feel that allows for plenty of seats to take advantage of the free WiFi. You can hide out in the back or near the open window up front. 

Spent $16 for everything during my two meals and few hours and felt like much more was received in return. Likely to be a neighborhood favorite for years to come.

One pulsing with stars.
author: Jason B.

description: Finally a cute. modern coffee shop reminiscent of my college days where I studied for hours. So glad this kind of gem showed up in the Sunset! Great drinks, big tables, and I like how there's a culture of sharing tables even if you are all strangers. Got the iced lavender latte and it had a good flavor, did not overpower the boldness of the coffee.
author: Wendy L.

description:
15.03.10     First Visit

Red Velvet Latte -------------------- 4 1/2
   Nice different color .... red
   Lightly sweetend ... good thing 
   De la Paz beans


Lemon filled doughnut ------------- 3 1/2

Nice new place

Placed had changed hand over the years
 Old school diner
 Bashful Bull
 Shabu Night
author: S.K. Y.

description:
Came here for a pit stop for coffee and some bread. 

Prices are reasonable for artisan style coffee and baked food. My friend ordered the egg toast and loved it. The coffee was great and was well needed. I ordered a banana bread that was perfectly moist. I will have to come back here to try their toasts and their "creative" coffee drinks.
author: Janelle S.

description: I live in the sunset and HOME is probably the best thing about this place. The coffee is amazinnng and they have a variety of flavours. I try to get there early to get the strawberry pastry because it's heavenly! Cute spot to work as well. Service is super nice. What's not to love
author: Ruchita L.

description:
Home is where our story begins...
(Let's play a game! Count how many "home quotes" I use in this review").

Home is appropriately named because it is my home away from home ( I come about three times a week).

There is no place like Home. The atmosphere is comfortable, the service is amazing. Everyone who works there or goes there to use the facilities (and I'm not just talking about the bathrooms) are super easygoing people. There is nothing like staying at home for real comfort. The drinks are reasonably priced and taste incredible! I have tried every single drink off the creative menu at least once, and some a few more times after they tried a new "recipe" on them. The toast that they serve with chicken meatballs, pesto, and a fried egg on top tastes like what my mom would serve at Home, delicious and warming!

I always hate leaving Home because Home is where my heart is and always will be.

Did you keep track?
(It was 6!)
author: Wilson T.

description: This place doesn't feel like it belongs in the sunset but it's a breath of fresh air. It's my currant favorite place for coffee. The decor definitely caught my attention. White plank wood booths with pillows, patio lights on the walls, succulents on the tables, and cute paintings on the walls. It had a serene feel to it. I've been getting the "Holy Cow" latte. It has condensed milk and is the perfect sweetness for me.  People bring their laptops and just hangout there. I've heard good things about their toasts but I have yet to try it. Baristas are also super friendly. Only flaw, they close on Monday. =(
author: Cindy H.

description: Cute cafe in a central location with plenty of seating, WiFi (have to ask for password), but outlets are only on the side wall where bench/booth seating is located
author: Katie T.

description: Really love this place! It genuinely feels like home. Staff is amazing and the interior is great, lots of natural sunlight- big tables and cute decor- utilizing the space perfectly. If you get here early (around 9:00), it's easy to grab a nice table with an outlet to study. As for the food, I love their chicken meatball toast as well as their condensed milk toast! Often get both if I sit there whole day. They also serve 'hangover' which is basically an espresso with sparkling water - its amazeballs! Definitely check this place out!
author: Kira U.

description:
I love it here! The atmosphere is great, the girl who rang us up was super nice and accommodating, and the drinks were great!  

We went to get our oil changed next door, and this little shop was just a dream come true! 

The drinks were good, maybe a little on the milky side.  But they were delicious!! We got the Mint chocolate, Coconut Vanilla Latte and the Lavender Latte.  
They were all good! I think next time I'll ask for a little less milk though.  

They also have no caffeinated drinks for those who are caffeine sensitive   

I will definitely come back here!
author: Kristin I.

description:
Home - 
/hōm/
noun
the place where one lives permanently, especially as a member of a family or household.

What an appropriate name for this cafe. It's simple yet sophisticated. The staff is incredibly sweet and the drinks are on point. Really, what's not to love?
author: Alexis W.

description: I came here last Thursday morning with my boyfriend to try out a new breakfast place.   It's a cute little spot and everything looked cozy and simply decorative. We were greeted warmly at the register and they waited patiently as I was deciding what to buy. I opted for the coconut vanilla latte and eggs in a basket toast, while my boyfriend got the green tea latte and condensed milk toast. They attempted to make a pig on the green tea latte.. Looked pretty good and cute! Everything was so flavorful and buttery!!!! The coconut vanilla latte was very nice but I didn't really get to taste the coconut much even though I asked for more coconut flavor. It's okay though because the green tea latte was ON POINT. Delicious. I drank most of his hehe and we ended up switching drinks to make me happy :) Will definitely be back for brunch in the future!
author: Fiona H.

description: Such a cute addition to the sunset district. The decor is very cozy & comfortable, as if you're at "home". I've been here a few times & had their iced coffee & lattes. Their staff is super nice & friendly & they make you feel welcomed. However, this place could get a bit crowded with people on their laptops.
author: Cara N.

description: I love Home! It is hip without being hipster and cute without being cutesy. It's basically just a great non-pretentious place in the sunset to get above-average latte, good wifi, and friendly service. My only complaint is the consistency - the milk has been burnt a few times. It's a small problem but one that prevents me from giving it 5 stars (for now) .
author: Kathleen P.

description: Phenomenal.  90's music, abundant seating, great natural light, friendly staff.  Did I mention the 90's music?  Come feel welcome, get lost in nostalgia, and maybe get some work done.
author: Hung N.

description: Delightful little cafe with a delicious latte. 4 stars for the ham and cheese croissant that was dissapointing and served cold.
author: Rachel S.

description:
Recently came here to catch who with some friends over coffee. My friend and I wanted to check this place out because we saw pictures on Instagram and it caught our eye. When we first walked in we saw that all the tables were all filled, it was definitely a place for people to study and work on their own stuff. There were accessible outlets pretty much anywhere you sat which was super convenient for those who were studying. Our concern was if we would even find a place to sit since there wasn't any outside seating either, but the cafe was very open and sharing tables was a common thing in order to accommodate new customers who came in (luckily we got a table just as we got our drinks!) My friends and I pondered on what to get, I got the London Fog (personal favorite from Verve in Santa Cruz and La Boulange) but the coconut vanilla latte also caught my eye. My friends got the red velvet latte (which was amazing) and the lavender jasmine tea latte. Both the London Fog and the lavender jasmine tea latte was pretty subtle in taste, but creamy. Personally, I would definitely go back and check out several more items on their menu and highly recommend.

Also, service was amazing, the girl who was at the cash register was super friendly and helpful. The staff made the spirit of the cafe very welcoming, and definitely made the experience that much better.
author: Cindy M.

description: Warm, simple, inviting environment w/ kind staff. Their lavender latte is delicious. Add an egg atop of their pesto tomato toast &it is a very flavorful and filling breakfast. Home Cafe is my new favorite Sunday morning coffee shop!
author: A A.

description: I got the condensed milk toast with a lavender iced latter and my boyfriend got the chicken meatball toast with a fried egg. Everything was really good! The service was an A+ and the aesthetic is super cute. Definitely going back!
author: Priscilla S.

description:
Such a cute and tasty little place. I love their theme of welcoming you "home" . You can most definitely taste the love put into their coffee & toast! 

I gave the lavender latte with almond milk a try & it was so so delicious! It didn't taste like it was loaded with syrup/sugar but more like a natural subtle flavoring. I also ordered the eggs in a basket which I thought might come out plain but it was also super yummy! Good job guys!
author: Brandi L.

description: We had the special bacon and corn toast, egg in a basket, and condensed milk and butter. Our drinks were London Fog, whole milk latte, and hot chocolate. Food was delicious and service was efficient.  I'd definitely recommend it to my friends and family.
author: Christopher C.

description:
I am giving this place a 4 star review because of their coffee and food. They have a great selection of creative drinks and their toast is delicious. In terms of their seating though, it's a fucking gamble see below:

BEWARE IF YOU PLAN TO DINE IN: 
It fucking sucks when you get there in hopes of having coffee and toast with a friend that's visiting and you find out that all the tables are full because all the students/ people working on their laptops have hogged up all the tables. They buy ONE cup of coffee and sit there for HOURS. Sure, the signs say something like "these tables are for you to enjoy your company so please no laptops" but the staff there don't really do much to enforce that rule. I personally think they should have a 90minute rule for people who just sit there and take up space. I've seen multiple people come in only to leave because of the lack of seating. If you're gonna work at a table for hours you better be buying more than 1 cup of coffee for the entire day because you just cost this cafe a shit ton of fucking money by taking up space. They should have a sign for laptop users "two drink minimum if you're gonna sit here for more than 2 hours" otherwise take your ass to a library or rent a co-working space.
author: julie t.

description:
I'm not a coffee drinker but I would say Home has some fantastic drinks.  The decor looks very cozy and you can tell it's probably the hip cafe to be at in the sunset.

My coworkers love the Chocolate Mint Latte and I've had the Holy Cow as well as the Hazelnut and they were pretty great.  Service is about what you'd expect from a cafe which is a good thing.  No surprises, no feeling of inferiority in the face of coffee ordering terminology.

I can see myself stopping by here on the way to the office in the future and definitely recommend it.
author: Chris C.

description:
I really like this place! It's not too crowded (yet) and the cold brew coffee is good and strong. The staff is friendly and I usually find a spot next to an outlet (but probably because I go on week days). Their wifi is really fast and reliable as well! Which is a huge plus!!!

I have yet to try the toast or any of the "creative" drinks but they look really good. I'm a simple guy so I just stick with my refreshing cold brew coffee.
author: Gregg H.

description: This place is just a little too loud to study. I had a red velvet latte and it was pretty good. The best part about this place was the customer service. I won't come back here to study but maybe to have a cup of coffee with friends.
author: Amy L.

description:
My best friend and her fiancé from SF took me here while I was visiting, and I must say - it's quite amazing. Comparable to Philz Coffee and Blue Bottle, without the annoying tourist hype. 

First off, the lavender latte (cold) was the best I've ever had. THE BEST. In fact, I'm still dreaming about it. I would totally move to SF just to have one every day for the rest of my life. 

The decor was also very cute and hipster, straight out of Pinterest. 

Other reviews said that this place gets crowded quickly, but it was pretty empty when we went. Bless the gods that made this happen. Late afternoon is best! 

Another "Best Ever Place" in my book. You must get a lavender latte here. You must. And then please send one to me in Washington.
author: Dorothy G.

description:
Okay coffee. The cappuccino I ordered had some amateur quality foam, which isn't terrible but the taste becomes a little too milky as time passes.
Nice atmosphere for studying, the pastry is good as well.
Card not taken for purchases under $5.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Love the simplicity and details at this place!

I wish you have Goat Milk Latte (tried that in Colorado and have not seen it in San Francisco...)
author: Shirley F.

description: Extremely happy that a new coffee shop opened up in my neck of the woods! The name of this shop speaks for itself! The ambiance is very welcoming and comforting the minute you step in. It is cafeteria style, so they take your order first and you can pick wherever you'd like to sit after. The customer service here is excellent, baristas are helpful and friendly. For first timers, they would go through the menu with you and give you recommendations. There's so many great and unique choices, but my go to is definitely the coconut vanilla latte with almond milk! I'll definitely be back more often to get some work done or even just to get my weekly coffee fill! :)
author: Kass L.

description:
Randomly stumbled upon this while in the area. So glad I decided to check it out. Small hipster-ish type of coffee shop. Their menu display reminded me of Pie Hole in LA. I had the lavender latte and it was so good. Never would have thought that combination would work, but it does. There were subtle hints of lavender. A must try if you're there. Comparable to other popular coffee shops in the city. 

All of the staff were super nice which is always a bonus. 

Will definitely come back to try other items on the menu.
author: Annie W.

description:
Annie greeted us at the register with a wide smile, completely patient with our stumbled order. For a brand new coffee venture, we were in for a treat!

Hungry and tired from a long drive, our eyes gravitated to the #5: Eggs in a basket. We did not yet know the wonderful flavors we would take in. 

The eggs in a basket was exceptionally hearty with a taste profile that matches no other breakfast coffee house in the area. 

I am very pleased to call this place home now, and am excited to see what else will come from their journey in the coffee business!
author: Amanda P.

description: Wow. I don't even write reviews, but their Chicken Meatball & Pesto toast convinced me otherwise. Their London Fog was quite nice too. Came here on a Wednesday at lunchtime, and it was cozy and not too crowded. I'll be back again for sure!
author: Laura J.

description: Wow the pesto toast with and egg on top was delicious! Great place to sit and work! Got a lot done including an awesome cover letter that has been getting me interviews left and right! Thanks Home!
author: Rodney D.

description: Come here for the lavender lattes and life changing toast, but most of all for amazing service :)
author: Faraz M.

description: Coffee here is always good! I have yet to try the toast... but I plan on it one day when I decide to let myself go lol! Make sure to come earlier on the weekends or be prepared to stand in a massive queue.
author: Michelle L.

description: The toast here is made with fresh quality ingredients. I ordered the tomato pesto toast with truffle oil, it was well worth it. I also tried the cinnamon toast and that was just as tasty. The staff are super sweet and friendly.
author: Jenny A.

description:
wanted to check this new place out!  the interior is so hipster and modern.  nice decorative art and looks cleans.  there are seats inside too and tables. i saw many people on their laptops here.

on to the drinks - pretty nice selection of drinks on the menu and the lavender latte caught my eye.  the barista was super friendly and asked me if i wanted the lavender jasmine green tea latte or the one w/ espresso.  i liked how she took the time out to explain each drink. i chose the expresso so it would wake me up!  the drink came out in 5 minutes and it was very tasty.  not too much foam and very creamy.  they even top it off with some dry lavender.

second time coming here I got the coconut vanilla latte.  nice light flavor and it even came with a nice coffee art for the foam :) good flavor and not too overpowering with the coconut.

overall - the drinks are good but the coffee isn't strong enough. it says each latte comes with a double shot... but the coffee isn't very strong. I'm used to philz so maybe I'm bias and I drink my coffee black. it's a place to get a drink to sip on but I don't think this coffee will keep me up. maybe I'll try the drip next time for a stronger coffee. I'd still come here because I like the flavors of the lattes though :)
author: Josie L.

description: Wanted to check this place out because of the great reviews. The space was cute and the menu is small but includes all of the cafe essentials. The reason I'm not giving this place 4-5 stars is they have a somewhat strange policy. No laptops at most of the tables to "encourage people there meeting with friends." Fine, but... 1. Lots of people meet with friends to go over things on their laptops, and 2. several tables had people camped out studying (how is this different than studying on a laptop) and one with literally a box of files and paperwork spread out taking up multiple seats. Especially strange experience after I ordered a full meal, then found a shared table, but was asked to move. I finished my coffee and unfortunately won't be back.
author: Cassie S.

description:
Searching for The Whole Package in any category is often as fruitful as embarking on a quest for the Fountain of Youth or the Holy Grail. You have the athletic point guard who can thread impossible passes and score at will, but has the same defensive capability as a wet sheet of toilet paper. Or the house that has idyllic views of the ocean and enough bathrooms for the entire family to shower at the same time, but sits downwind from a sulfuric factory. Or the spouse with a witty sense of humor and picturesque hair, but who snores like an industrial, hyperactive chainsaw.

Finding the ideal coffee shop in vocal San Francisco might be even more difficult, especially with thousands of differing opinions on the correct line of coverage to route boiling water in a pour over, millions of contrasting views on the specific Pantone blue wallpaper that would encourage the most peaceful meditation, and the billions of arguments on the appropriate positioning of windows to allow in the most conducive light for studying when the sun's angle shifts as the day progresses.

Home comes closest to that ideal.

Upon entering, the surprisingly warm greeting and genuine foray into conversation by the friendly owners makes you feel, well, at Home. Even after ordering and settling in, their hospitality extends to bringing drinks, straws, and napkins straight to your table and keeping a watchful eye for polished plates or empty mugs that can be cleared.

The diverse coffee menu features deeply flavorful pour overs that form the backbone of any legitimate coffee shop. The decaf Guatemalan has dark overtones that gradually strengthen as the brew cools. The Coketastic is an innovative combination of Coke, espresso, and ice cream that is simultaneously potent and refreshing, providing the perfect kick to start a busy morning or an energizing jolt out of afternoon doldrums. The Affogato offers a larger scoop of ice cream and an impossibly crisp and fresh cone. The sturdy cone can be used either as a ladle for the creamy ice cream and espresso mix or can be shattered to chip-sized pieces to create a small bowl of dessert nachos.

The lush slabs of buttery toast can function as light breakfast or indulgent snack. The Egg in Basket toast has runny yolk ready to infuse each bite, while the Condensed Milk toast has a rich sheet of pooled milk waiting to cascade onto each cut piece. The crispy cut-out part of bread that the egg displaced in culinary coup accompanies the Egg in Basket as a bonus.

The ample seating is represented by tables bathed in sunlight in the front or more coolly lit by ambient bulbs towards the back. Outlets are not plentiful but available under some of the tables, and an attentive mix of past-decade jams and current hits is undistractingly piped into the air.

Home is where the heart is.
author: Andrew M.

description:
I would love to give it a 5 stars but the cafe close too early. 
It close at 4:00 in the weekday and weekend they close at 5:00. 

 The environment is relaxing, not too noisy, staff are friendly. 

I got the lavender latte, it taste very delicious.
author: Priscilla F.

description: This place is delicious!!!! And the staff is very friendly. A great chill environment and vibe inside. I had the Salted Caramel latte iced and it was all soo good. I'll definitely be returning.
author: Steph S.

description:
What a pretty little place!! Have been walking around San Fran trying various coffee and toast places and this has catapulted to the top of my toast list. A nice variety of food and interesting drink options, very friendly staff and clean and attractive decor. 
My only criticism is the front window could use a shade or thermal window film because sitting at the bar along the front was downright brutal with the afternoon sun.
author: Colleen M.

description:
I happened to be driving down Noriega street one afternoon and noticed that the block between 19th and 20th has had a facelift recently.. and for the better. Instead of the old & vacant Eagles Drift bar, now sits a very cool OneUp bar. Next to that, is a sweet cafe which boasts coffee and tea. Curiousity got me walking in and here's what I found:

My initial take on this cafe: modern minimalist details meets warm and welcoming vibes. It's an open floor plan featuring beautiful wood embellishments adorned by mini-succulents and cacti. Fresh bohemian floral arrangements line the cascading shelves. It was sunny that day and thanks to the position of the cafe, the sun let in an almost stategically placed ray of sunshine.. that wasn't blinding! 

Onto the coffee: It doesn't get any better than this: Four Barrel and De La Paz? It's a coffee connoisseur's delight.  Delicious pastries and drip over coffees are also offered with a smile. 

I love the fresh take on a Menu: butcher paper rolls on the wall. I've never seen this done before! Fancy toasts, cool coffee & tea variations are offered and are so delicious. The owners aptly named the cafe, "Home", because well, that's exactly what it feels like. The color palette here makes you feel right at home; evoking feelings of peace, tranquility and relaxation.  The music selection feels up to the challenge as well. Lots of Jack Johnson, Sam Smith and Adele to soothe your soul.

I've saved the best for last. The real gem of this place are the owners. They are so sweet, welcoming and friendly. Even through my million questions about the menu, they were so patient and willing to give suggestions. I'm thankful this cafe has found a home on Noriega. What a great way to brighten up the block and what a great stop for some morning coffee and bites. I'll be back to try out new toasts and pastries and look forward to their success.
author: 3beeskitchen ..

description: Had the coconut vanilla latte and the bacon/corn toast. I couldn't really taste the coconut in the latte, but the vanilla flavor made up for it. The toast is a nice thick cut of bread. The bacon was finely chopped and corn tasted fresh off the cob. Pleasant and friendly service. The place was very clean and already packed with folks on their laptops at 9am.
author: Gaby E.

description: I live nearby and came for just a mid morning drink. My husband came once before and convinced me to get the egg in a basket, also known as jailed eggs. The toast was very buttery and extra salty but otherwise delicious! Not sure if the used a salted butter but it definitely had extra salt on top, which it could do without. I also got a London fog latte, which was good (aka earl grey tea with steamed milk). My husband got the plain latte which he enjoyed. My only gripe is that the seating was not optimized. A customer would take up a table for 4 and that is kind of annoying. Finding seating was a pain but luckily I can just walk back home to enjoy any drinks.
author: Crys L.

description: The inside of this place is so cute and their idea of handwriting the menu was awesome! Lots of natural light and seating for individuals or groups. We ordered a mocha which was good, very creamy and well blended together. Also got the Holy Cow Latte which I wasn't a fan off, you couldn't taste any extra sweetness from the condensed milk and it tasted like pure milk and no coffee. A little disappointed and I've had better.
author: Alyssa M.

description:
This is a very nice cafe. It's large and open with plenty of natural light that is good for reading or doing work on a computer. I tried three drinks here: the columbian pour over from de la Paz, the matcha latte, and the lavender latte. All of them were spot on  and had great flavors.

This place is also well known for the toast, which definitely lived up to expectations. We originally ordered a tomato pesto with fried egg, but they ran out of tomatoes so they replaced it with a chicken meatball. It was delicious, especially the fried egg on top. I would highly recommend that as an addition to the savory toasts. On top of all that, we were comped a slice of coffee cake (also good).

Needless to say, the service here is excellent. Everyone was friendly and nice and took really good care of us. It is one of the things that really stands out about this place. 

Overall, I think this is one of the best cafes in the city. Highly recommended!
author: George Z.

description: Love, love, love this cafe! I have been walking past this spot for the past few months waiting in anticipation for what it was going to be. When it finally opened I was blown away. The cafe was beautifully renovated and feels super inviting with the cool blue tones and wood textures. The coffee is also AMAZING! I've never heard of De La Paz coffee until today and let me tell you, it is the best coffee I've ever had. Rich, round flavor with a smooth finish- mmmmmm...wish I had one right now. The pastries and cookies looked amazing too. Good variety and I bet it will pair perfectly with my coffee. Will definitely be back soon. So happy this gem opened up in my neighborhood.
author: C W.

description: The lattes are fun and creative. It does get a little packed because there's a lot of foot traffic.
author: Connie G.

description: This was a must on my recent trip to SF just because of all the cute Instagram photos I'd been stalking of this place, and, yes, I had to post my own! My friend and I stopped by for what we thought would be a quick in and out before heading down to the south bay for the day. But...yeah. I ordered a lavender latte and egg in the hole, and he ordered an americano and lemon bread. Everything took quite a while to come out, but if you're not in a hurry and/or dining in, it's not too bad. We were just trying to make an appointment so I think it felt even longer to us. The lavender latte was very pretty and tasty, though I'm starting to think I can't do hot lattes any longer even though I ordered it with almond milk. My stomach still felt a little uneasy afterwards. The egg in the hole came with 2 thick pieces of toast with eggs in 'em and boy were they buttery. The little toast rounds that they had cut out were really good because they were small, but once I got to the actual toast part, I started feeling really heavy and gross. I barely managed to finish 1 toast, so this is definitely a dish to be shared.
author: Kathy L.

description: Really busy and a ton of people go in to just sit so there's a 2 hour maximum limit. The position of counter and chairs and tables make it a little awkward to wait for your to go coffee. My lavender latte was good but I wasn't sure why they put seeds in the coffee. Towards the end of my drink I was having to spit out seeds while shopping. Not cute.
author: Vanessa O.

description: Love this place! Probably the best coffee shop in the Sunset/Richmond area.  Their toasts are incredible, I had the chicken sausage and it tasted like savory heaven.  After 45 min my fatass was craving sweets so then I had to order the condensed milk butter toast.  When you get it tho, dont think, just eat the shit out of it cause if you started thinking about how fat and unhealthy it is...YOU WONT EVEN CARE CAUSE ITS THAT GOOD.
author: Vince L.

description: absolutely love this place. I live two streets up from there, and it's so refreshing to have an adorable cafe nearby with friendly owners who genuinely want to know their customers and have amazing food/coffee to go along with it. definitely will be coming here a lot :)
author: Steph P.

description:
If home is where the heart is, then I'd say I've definitely left my heart in San Francisco. This is a great new addition to the sunset. The couple who run this shop, is absolutely fabulous. They definitely made you feel like part of the family. Quaint little cafe with a handful of tables and booths. Plenty of people working on their laptops.

Ok, so enough about that. More about the menu items. Their specialty coffee options are off the chain. Let's just say at the end of our visit we had ordered five different beverages and three different toasts just to taste a sampling of their yummiest they had to offer. Think lavender latte, coconut late, espresso with condensed milk and my personal favorite a drink conception made of espresso, coke and ice cream. Delish! Think similar to root beer float with espresso. So good!

Yummy toasts included cinnamon and butter (my fav), sweetened condensed milk and tomato and pesto with egg. All fantastic. Rumor is there will me more additions to the menu to come! I cannot wait to go back and try more. Oh, and don't forget to buy the yummy brownie/caramel/shortbread things on sale by he cash register. You will not be sorry with anything and everything they have to offer. You will be so happy to frequent home time and time again.
author: Victoria O.

description: Probably the best place I've gone for coffee. Best service, clean and nice people. It feels like Home.
author: Mitch J.

description: Was definitely surprised by this place as I expected it to just serve coffee and small pastries. Turns out they have toast. I had toast with a poached egg and pesto and tomato and it was quite tasty. My friend had the Vietnamese coffee toast (it had condensed milk on it) and that was really good too. The milk made it like icing. My cold brew was strong and refreshing and my friend enjoyed the lavender mocha.
author: Sarah K.

description: This cafe is the cutest! The coffee tastes great (I got the iced Holy Cow), the pastries are delicious (I got the strawberry pastry), and the music is just right--they might as well have played music off of my Spotify playlist! Plus, the workers are so helpful and friendly. They make you feel right at home :) I will definitely be coming back more often!
author: Katherine D.

description: What an awesome cafe in the Sunset! The ambiance is nice and modern and the espresso is strong. Great place to spend a few hours sipping coffee and getting some work done. The folks working here are also top notch and extremely friendly.
author: Jonathan L.

description:
This is my 2nd time here and I gotta say that this place has definitely become my go to study spot. I really like the cozy atmosphere and the modern interior of the place. 

Seating: Plenty of space on Sunday mornings (gets pretty crowded after 1PM) with each table with its own plug for laptops/tablets.  

Food & Drinks: I got their Chicken Meatball toast with a fried egg on top and a cold brew. I highly recommend the toast especially for lunch. Its very filling and flavorful and compliments the cold brew/ hazelnut latte. They also have soy milk and almond milk for those who are lactose intolerant like me. 

Service: The cashier/baristas are very friendly and also bring the food/drinks to your table. I would say they have better service than most other coffee shops I've been to in the area.

I highly recommend coming early on weekends if you want a seat and headphones if you're trying to work here past 2PM (it definitely gets pretty loud here with families). 

*For the cook/staff: It would be really nice if the toast was cut into pieces than the chicken and egg put on top so it's easier to eat it.
author: Richard P.

description: I walked 20mins to get here, the ice mocha definitely makes me feel much better. Should have tried the toast cause seems like everyone recommended, also when I was here a pretty girl I shared table with was eating one of the toast, she was 100% focusing on tasting that toast, because she was the first person I have seen eating without playing phone or laptop for a long long time.
author: Donna Z.

description: its a cute little place. it has every cute thing you can think if from TYPO. They have a pretty good variety of coffee and tea drinks and amazing eggs in a basket. BUT there are never any seats. there is a time limit on how long you can stay but i never can get a seat! well not never, go in the middle of the day in the middle of the week.
author: Mimi H.

description: That eggie in the basket is marvelous! Also all those latte flavors that I can't wait to try lol I tried Nutella latte and Lavender latte, both super yummy :)
author: Meriem B.

description: Love their latte and toasts! I ordered a red velvet latte, lavender latte and a meat ball toast. Latters are not too sweet. Overall, good experience for my first visit. Nice place.
author: Kevi O.

description: Home is San Francisco, no doubt. If you're in the area, definitely worth stopping by for coffee and delicious toasts, both of unique varieties.
author: Veronica D.

description: The service here is absolutely amazing!! I got a hazelnut latte and condensed milk toast and both were absolutely delicious!! I want to come back to try m everything else. The interior decor was simple but cute and the atmosphere itself is just a great place to bring your laptop in or just grab a quick bite. Would highly recommend to anyone who is thinking about coming here!!
author: Vonny C.

description:
The lattes and toast here are pretty good. So far I've had the hazelnut latte (hot) and the salted caramel latte (iced). With the hazelnut one I couldn't really taste too much flavor other than coffee, but the salted caramel one had a good balance of salt, caramel flavor, and coffee. Neither of them were too sweet, which I really liked.

I've had the condensed milk toast and the eggs in a basket. Both toasts were made from the same bread - a fluffy sort of white bread - and toasted in butter to a perfect crispy texture. The condensed milk was a bit too sweet for me but I guess what do you expect, it's condensed milk. The eggs in a basket made for a very filling lunch for me when coupled with a coffee, and the egg was cooked to have a nice runny yolk.

Overall I think this is a great place with a nice atmosphere. It can get crowded sometimes, but if you're there alone it's easy enough to just share a table with someone else if you need to. If you're with others it may be difficult to find a table around noon to one (and I assume breakfast but I haven't been at that time). I'll definitely be back to try other latte flavors and types of toast!
author: Em F.

description: If I could open my own cafe, it would be this cafe. Minimal, homey, inviting, with the perfect brunch menu! I couldn't believe how much I fell in love with this cafe. I took my boyfriend here for his surprise birthday brunch already knowing what I would order based off of reviews and I was NOT disappointed! My taste buds were blown away by the chicken pesto toast with egg and coconut vanilla latte and lavender latte!!! Service was excellent also. I loved the atmosphere as well. A lot of college students come here to work or have meetings. It's peaceful yet a nice place for a hang out. I wish they had Home in Seattle! Such a shame because I'd be a regular if I lived in SF.
author: Shannon B.

description: Love this place! The coffee is good and the toast is delish (try #3!). If you need to work, there are plenty of tables and reliable wifi, and I have always found it to be quiet. The only problem for me is the hours. Any busy professionals, students, moms, or all of the above need coffee and toast before 8 am! :)
author: Jessica C.

description:
Fancy boba. Friendly service. Nice combo. 

Plenty of tables, menu on butcher paper.
Try the honey lavender.

I'll be back fosho.
author: PJ T.

description:
Very excited about this cute cafe that just opened up in the sunset!

Ordered ginger peach ice tea, pumpkin bread, and the pesto cheese toast. All delicious. 

Good music, fast wifi, easily accessible outlets, great minimalist ambiance, and a very friendly barista, Annie. Hope this place sticks around and that they extend their hours so I can enjoy it during the week before / after work!
author: Miranda F.

description: Beautifully curated space. I love the laid-back vibes of the place. My friend and I checked this place out for the first time recently. I got the pesto sausage toast and it was realllllllllly good and filling. Just what I needed to start my morning off right. I also got a mocha with extra shots of espresso. They pull shots in sets of 2 I believe.
author: Tati N.

description: I first noticed the design and how the place looked when I walked in and I really liked the ambiance. The workers were very attentive and friendly, giving us ideas on what to get. My big got the Matcha Latte and I got the Chocolate Mint Latte, which were both very good. I wish they told us that there was an iced option, I would have loved to try it in the mason jars. Overall, it was pretty good and I would come back just to try the iced drinks next time.
author: Vicky L.

description: Seriously my girl and I cant stop posting about this place! She's in front of me trying to get a dang photo for instagram haha. Really though, we tried two of their toasts, the cinnamon and the condensed milk, and their  hot chai tea and an iced sea salt caramel latte so we kinda tried a little bit of everything here! And ALL, including the servers, the atmosphere, location, all work together to create a wonderfully welcoming and delicious environment. Truly home sweet home
author: Mae R.

description: The staff was so friendly and welcoming. We enjoyed our egg in a basket dish so much we got another one to go! Coffee was well made and adorably designed.
author: Marisa M.

description: Came here with my friends, had the coconut, lavender, and mint latte and they were honest to god the best lattes me and my friends had ever had and the two dudes working there were super nice!
author: Sarah A.

description:
what a cool cafe. it is so clean there! 100% on rating! good stuff. very nice people here. they take their time to explain stuff to you especially if you have never been there before. They can get most of their drinks cold and now you can add egg onto the other toasts minus the sweet ones. 

I got the iced earl grey latte made from loose tea leaves so it takes a little longer as warned by the barista but it didn't take long really. I got the egg in basket toast and it was so buttery good. has a little soft yolk in the middle. Perfection! 

They have outlets and wifi available. they will give you the password for it. lots of natural light in cafe makes for a relaxing and calming setting. They play good music in the background. not too loud but if you're the type who can't study with background noise then you might have to wear ear plugs?! lots of people on their laptops and people with books studying here. succulents everywhere which is my favorite!! 

Wished they stayed open later. that's the only downside. maybe they will extend hours in the future?! can only hope :)
author: Jules L.

description: Home is definitely my new favorite cafe! The decor is so cute- rustic yet modern. I love the adorable succulents placed throughout the tables and shelves. It's the perfect spot to get some work done since there are plenty of seats plus outlets to charge your phone or laptop. I've only been here twice and ordered the Holy Cow Latte (latte with condensed milk) both times because it is absolutely delicious! There's so many drinks I want to try including the red velvet latte, chocolate mint latte, sea salt caramel latte, etc, but it'll probably take me awhile because I think I'm addicted to the Holy Cow. I haven't tried the food yet, but I've seen people around me order the toasts that smell amazing so I'm excited to try those too. And last, but definitely not least, the staff are the most friendly and welcoming people ever. :]
author: MissChelle C.

description: Great coffee and awesome service.  Only downside is that people like it so much, it's hard to get a seat.
author: Greg T.

description: This place is great.  The coffee is great and beautifully presented and the toasts/pastries are amazing.  I would recommend to anyone looking for a great local spot.  The lavender latte is on point!
author: Justin G.

description: Super fun neighborhood cafe!  I've tried almost everything on the menu & have recommended this place to many of my friends (who also love this place.).  Many unique drinks & yummy toast.  It has a cool hipster vibe, but you don't have to be a hipster to enjoy this cafe.  Come try this place out!
author: G W.

description:
Just came here today with my boyfriend after seeing a post on Instagram about it. This place is awesome! The people who work here are very friendly! I ordered the Holy Cow, iced because it was pretty warm out, and the egg in a basket. My boyfriend got a chocolatey minty latte, I can't remember the name, and the cinnamon toast. Everything was so yummy and had great presentation. Both our drinks were fairly sweet as well. Nice atmosphere. We ended up sitting at a shared table and had a great conversation with two young guys. Great atmosphere, great coffee, great toast! Definitely going to come here again next tie
 I make the long trip to the city.
author: Sofy Y.

description: Home is SUPER nice. Their drinks are delicious. I had a Salted Caramel Hot Chocolate and it's good. It's pretty sweet and they let you choose if you want a jumbo marshmallow on it, and if you do they put a little face on it in chocolate. Super cute. I also had the Eggs in a Basket toast and it was perfectly made. They put the extra bread on the side in a perfect circle and the egg yolk was perfect, not too runny but not too thick either. My friends had the Salted Caramel Latte, Tomato Pesto Toast, Strawberry Pastry, and Birthday Cake Latte, to which they said was absolutely delicious. Their customer service is FANTASTIC. So their computer had a technical problem and they were backed up. I had already gotten my toast for a while while my friend didn't get hers yet even though we placed our orders at the same time. So we asked them where her toast was and one of the workers there let us know what was going on (I believe her name was Abi/Abby) and they gave us a complimentary Condensed Milk Toast, which was, by the way, really really good. The condensed milk soaked into the toast perfectly and I really like how they brown the milk as well because it kept it from getting too overly sweet. And she asked if we needed anything so I asked for a toothpick so we could pop the bubbles in the latte (we hadn't drank them yet, waiting for the toasts to take pictures) and they offered to just remake our drinks for us although they totally didn't have to. And the remade drinks had extra cute swans and a Totoro instead of the standard latte art leaf that we had initially gotten. The baristas are super talented and the workers here are super nice and the food is super good. Overall, a definitely 5/5 stars experience.
author: Izik V.

description: This place is the cutest. My family and I went there and we all loved it. My parents enjoyed the coffee a lot. Limited pastries but what they had was delicious.
author: Zara V.

description: It's fancy toast and everything wrong with San Francisco, but it's pretty darn good toast. I definitely recommend the Cinnamon toast and the Sausage and Pesto toast.
author: Jeremy G.

description: I love this Cafe! I've been here three times so far and it's truly the cutest place ever. The cafe itself is brand new, and the decorations are adorable and dainty. Everyone who works here is very nice and patient (especially with me because I take forever to decide what to get). The customers who go here are all young students probably from SF state and whatnot. It's a nice place to bring your laptop and do your homework, but the ambience does get a little chatty, and when the cafe is filled people start sharing tables. So if you're the type to get easily distracted and what complete silence then maybe this isn't a good place for you. But the drinks here are amazing (definitely try the jasmine lavender tea latte) and their toast is sooooo yummy. Condensed milk is great if you want something sweet, and my personally favorite is the chicken meatball pesto with a fried egg on top... It's delicious. Try this place out if you haven't yet! :)
author: Margaret K.

description:
This place is so cute! The interior design was so modern and clean. It encompassed everything I loved about a cafe. Big, clean space, wi-fi, friendly service, and good products! I passed by just while driving and I was surprised to see that it was a cafe, so I just knew I had to try it out. I looked it up on yelp and was surprised to find out it was so nice. I was excited to try the things on their menu and it didn't disappoint! I ordered an iced lavendar latte and a cinnamon sugar toast, and while rining up my order, the lady was super friendly! She asked me about my day and made little small talk. I sat down and got my drinks after 5-10 minutes. The iced lavendar latte was so good! It wasn't super sweet, and they had actual lavendar as a garnish, which I'd recommend stirring into the drink to give it a stronger flavor. I know it messes up the pretty presentation, but the inherent lavendar flavor isn't super noticeable. It was light and refreshing, especially since it was 80+ degrees today.. It came in a cute little mason jar, and they serve it to you and bring up straws for you to grab yourself (in case you're a germaphobe i guess hahaha). The toast came a little after and I was surprised to find that it was a lot thicker than expected. I would say it's actually a solid inch thick, at least the slice I got. It wasn't super hot or anything, but served perfectly warm. The butter, sugar, and cinnamon were so tastey and there was enough of everything in each bite, even the crust! My friend also ordered an iced coconut vanilla latte, and I hate coconut, but it was actually really good and tolerable for my palette because the coconut was super light. The vanilla was more prominent but you can taste the coconut for sure. 

I definitely am coming back to try their other drinks because their creative menu looks amazing; I just wanna try everything! I'm so happy this place opened. It's super clean and the couple working this place is super friendly.  I can tell that they care about their products and customers, and treat them with love. I'm just sad they close so early ):
author: Holly P.

description:
Lovely little surprise on Noriega and 19th Avenue.
Nice couple serving up coffees and drinks with breakfast sandwiches.

We sat in the window seats watching the Sunset families stroll on Noriega early Sunday morning with a little bit of fog outside. Our family ordered two coffees and a milk drink for the youngest. Plus three breakfast sandwiches. The lady made certain the milk was not too hot. She was very thoughtful.

Worth pulling over from busy 19th Avenue traffic to discover this little gem.
author: Nancy M.

description: Very nice interior, made slightly annoying by all the 8.5"X11" signs describing how to be an adult (don't throw towels in toilet, put used dishes here, etc).   I had a latte, cold brew (which was served cold, but not brewed cold), and a kouign that was stale (at 10am). The coffee quality fell somewhere between Denny's and Peets. Very disappointed, but my wife liked her latte, so I added a star.
author: Tom M.

description:
Wow - I got the meatball pesto red chili pepper flake toast and the eggs in a basket. Mmmm mmmm good!!!! The meatballs had a little sweetness to them. I loved that!!! They've got the perfect mix of sweet and savory toasts here. 

Interior decoration is nice too...industrial style light bulbs, dark blue ceramic tiles on the walls, and mid century chairs with cactus and succulents all around. 

Can't wait to come back Home! ;)
author: Ashley M.

description: Wow this place is definitely worthy of its reviews always a popular place especially on the weekends. I came with a friend and got an iced hazelnut and iced lavender latte. And went with what other people said and got the pesto chicken meatball toast with fried egg on top. All were amazing. The lavender latte might not be for everyone but I can really taste the lavender in my latte. The toast was surprisingly filling and Instagram worthy. This is definitely worth a visit if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Ryan T.

description: Try the egg in a basket with the Nutella hot chocolate says my 10 year-old son, (or the almond croissant pipes up my daughter!)  Coffees are excellent too.
author: Shaun R.

description: Cool place lovely decor and ambiance. Had the hazelnut latte it was lovely! Also has eggs on toast - gotta have the added bacon bits. That's a Sunday morning well spent!!
author: Sinead M.

description:
My wife and I checked out Home over the weekend, and came away impressed with the way the place looked.  It looks like the owners are still getting their rhythm going, so things were a tad out of sync.  The prices are a tad high, but they offer variations of coffee or tea.  Pastries are offered as well.  We had the not so good Americano, so that was a big disappointment.  We'll give it a go, and hope it turns out for them.

BTW, that was one very very hot coffee...temperature hot!
author: Joel M.

description: Busy place. Really hard to find a seat. Staff was extremely friendly. Food and drinks were creative and delicious.
author: Myra E.

description: Cute, clean, spacious cafe; perfect place to meet up friends and/or spend some quiet time alone.   I can see myself coming here often as I am nearby every Saturday.  Staff is very friendly & easy to chat with.   Ordered the London Fog and loved the balance of tea to almond milk flavor (I'm a bit lactose so must sub out the whole milk); price point: inexpensive.  If you're sticking around, grab a toast snack to pair with your coffee or tea; their condensed milk & savory open-faced brioche toasts are delicious!
author: Jessica S.

description: Such a cute place. It is very spacious and clean. Staff is super friendly. Love their frozen hot chocolate and their bacon and corn toast. I will have to come back and try their other toast. I heard all of them are good. =)
author: Karen H.

description: Great staff. Super friendly and always happy. Great coffee. Iced coconut vanilla latte is my go to. Amazing toast. All of them
author: Jesse D.

description: Great atmosphere very pleasant staff, the lack of heating was apparent when I went in the morning as I was colder inside than out. The hot chocolate warmed me up but you could tell the pastries were from out of house and warmed up in a microwave of some sort.
author: Zachary B.

description: Home is fantastic. 1. Great coffee (fancy coffee in the sunset? Yes please!) 2. Great service- they are super sweet and friendly. Even though I've only been a few times Annie has always remembered me and chatted me up. 3. That food though. Yum. Get one of the toast options, they are delectable. 4. Nice large tables and great ambiance to get some work done or just hang for a while. Love this place!!
author: Susie W.

description: A new cafe off 19th and Noriega. It's super convenient if you miss your bus and want to go get a coffee while you wait 15 minutes for the next one and the owners are perhaps the sweetest people you will ever meet. It is great to see a business that still cares so much about the customer and put so much love and creativity into what they do. Good luck, Home! You are well loved in this neighborhood :) never change!
author: Joyce M.

description: Only place in the area to get cold brew. Nice atmosphere, free wifi, right next to the 28 so I always stop in when I'm waiting for the bus!
author: Erica L.

description: I dig it. Serving four barrel coffee and all sorts of interesting espresso drinks and pastries, this is a great place to spend an afternoon reading a book or doing homework on a sunny day.
author: Christopher B.

description: Really cute place to study. But gets crowded really fast. They have new store hours now from November 23rd, they are open all 7 days/week and M-F: 7am-5pm and Sat-Sun: 8am-5pm! Yay
author: Hanna M.

description: One of the best coffee shops I have tried in a while. Their cinnamon butter and the condensed milk toasts are delicious, although if you do not have a sweet tooth like me you might want to skip the condensed toast. Their drinks are excellent too: they have a great variety of teas and lattes so even if you are not a coffee drinker you have many options. I tried their  lavender jasmine tea latte which was simply delicious. My sister on the other hand ordered the coconut vanilla latte which tasted like neither of those ingredients but was nonetheless so yummy we did not feel like reordering. Excellent service, friendly staff/owners, and great ambiance; definitely a MUST try.
author: Casandra R.

description: From the atmosphere, to the service, to the food and drinks... A+++ in my books.  The quality of ingredients and thoughtfulness of the menu are truly shown in their plates and cups. This a must-go if in the area and a destination spot if in the city at all. Great job HOMEys!
author: Francis M.

description:
I come here all the time and every time is like the first. The owners are both super friendly and take the time to take care of your order and make it as best as they can make it. I love the variety they have for a coffee shop. Not only do they serve different and unique kinds of coffee orders (personally, I am a fan of their coketastic) but they also cater to non-caffeine drinkers as well. Their frozen hot chocolate is a must have. 
It has an amazing atmosphere to catch up with your friends or even just get work done with a side of (fantastic) toast. Their music playlist is always on-point and when I asked Annie (the barista/owner) explained that, as it is Home they played songs that they would have in their own home, which, to me, fits very well with the overall ambiance they try to create. If you avoid the lunch rush hour it is so relaxing and an overall chill place to be.
author: Danielle I.

description:
I was so excited when I saw that this place was opening in replace of Soju Tonight. Finally had some time to drop in for a pick me up, and was pleased to see a perfect menu, with a balance of your standard coffee selections, tea, and non-coffee beverages. I got the cold brew iced coffee, which was PERFECTLY brewed! Clean, crisp finish, not too watery and not too bitter/strong. I would say that it's on the medium roast side. The decor of Home is sophisticated, and very clean, (also super cute!).  And applause for the friendly customer service. Oh! And HOW AWESOME IS IT THAT THEY ACCEPT CARD/NO MINIMUM CHARGE!! WOOO! A rarity in coffee shops in SF. Definitely will be coming back, and will spread the word about Home. After all, I live right next to it!

5 stars to 4 stars: for a place called home, it's disappointing to find it closed at random times/early close times. Only downside.
author: Elizabeth K.

description: Pretty sure my latte was water and a dash of cream.. pretty disappointed considering the other reviews. Won't be back
author: Katie M.

description: My only complain is that they close too early! Nice atmosphere, good quality latte, cozy space with outlet and free wifi! There are a lot of coffee shops in sunset, yet it's not easy to find a delicate one like HOME
author: Chester C.

description: A very nice spot just opened. The owner is very nice and friendly! Had a cup of sea salted caramel lattee, not too sweet n not too salty, just perfect to me! Be sure to check out their creative menu drinks for the specials! Bravo!
author: Yong Y.

description: Great little coffee shop! Good selection of well baked snacks, solid regular drinks, and creative offerings as well.  Katie is so nice! Good decor, cool spot to do some work!
author: Eric S.

description:
Where the old Bashful Bull use to rest, stands a brand new coffee place called "home". I discovered the place when I was picking up cash at the nearby Chase bank and walked by. Intrigued, I looked at the menu and glanced inside. Seeing a good amount of customers, I decided to give this place a shot. Boy, am I glad this place opened up near me.

The first time I went there, I got the mocha and a Cinnamon Sugar toast. The barista told me they use Ghirardelli chocolate and marshmallows in their mocha - it was very good. It wasn't too sweet and it balanced out the coffee pretty well; I will definitely be getting it again. The toast was excellent - buttered with cinnamon and brown sugar while the bread was crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside.

I went here again recently and ordered the Americano and the same toast. The coffee is still good as is the toast. They have great consistency with their food and that's always a plus. The employees here are also very nice, accommodating and they always asks how I'm doing. Their great service is another aspect that will keep me coming back.

Overall, I think "home" is a great coffee shop that fits nicely in the neighborhood and has the ability to compete with the other new coffee places around the area. It has amazing toast, awesome coffee, and friendly employees. The fact that it is a brief walk from my house is also a huge positive. If you live in the Inner Sunset or are in the area, definitely try this place out. You'll be glad to go "home".
author: Austin C.

description:
Came here to study and get some breakfast the other day. I definitely liked that they had wi-fi and outlets, it was perfect for getting some work done. The atmosphere was pretty awesome: nice decor, not too loud, good music playing, and the staff were super friendly.

Now for the food and drinks:
Iced Hazelnut Latte: I love hazelnut so I had to get it. It was good, the hazelnut flavor was subtle, but noticeable. It wasn't too sweet but it hit the spot.

Condensed Milk Latte: My girlfriend got this, it was a little sweet for her taste, but it's expected of condensed milk. 

Nutella donut: The nutella was pretty concentrated in the middle of the donut. Once I finally got to it, it was pretty tasty. They even warmed it up for me!

Tomato-pesto toast: This was pretty amazing. Thick cut toast with pesto, tomato, and cheese. Can't get much better. 

They have a ton of other specialty drinks to try and all of the different toast options sound amazing. I'm definitely goinna come back here.
author: Melyssa A.

description:
Really wonderful service (warm and friendly!) and ALL of the toasts are incredibly delicious. I love the menu split between "Classics" (which are all prepared with lots of care and attention) and "Creative" where they get to play around with some delicious flavors (like their Lavender Latte).

The atmosphere is nice and calm, and the skylights really bring in a ton of natural light which is a big plus for me. Big tables and friendly people. 

I do wish the seating were just a bit more comfortable, but then again the one thing to watch out for is people that order one coffee and just stay here all day taking up tables, so maybe making the seating more comfortable would just make that problem worse. I'm all for finding a solid study/work space, but I also think you should at least keep refilling your coffee or something if you're going to block other customers from sitting down... Don't be that guy/girl.
author: Miguel V.

description:
Currently sitting and enjoying a coconut vanilla latte. Sooooooo delicious.

The young woman with a Russian accent (?) working the register was very sweet, charming and very knowledgeable. I'm thinking she's the owner of the cafe. 

The space itself is big with lots of tables (and they're CLEAN!)

From the taste and quality of my latte, clean enviroment, to the nice woman working I give this place 5 stars and will most definitely be back as often as possible even though its about a 25 minute drive from my house.
author: Brooke F.

description: Delicious! Afraid to post this because now the secret will be out...but I had to let HOME know they have a new fan
author: Lisa F.

description: This cafe is very quaint, bright and cute. Free WiFi, although not the best, and there weren't very many outlets. I ordered an almond latte. Coffee was pretty good, not bitter. The server was very quick and friendly. Unfortunately, they had zero vegan options, not even for a plain order of toast. Unless they add a vegan option to their menu, I most likely won't go back.
author: Dee J.

description: Home is my fav coffee shop now.  It is small but very clean and cute.  The cappuccino is very good.  I also tried 2 of their breakfast items and they both are good too.  It is a go to place if you want to enjoy a cup of coffee in a relaxing environment.
author: Chelsea S.

description: This is a cute little cafe with very unique drinks. I have been here twice and both times the staff have not only greeted me but have went over and beyond to actually have a conversation with me. I really appreciate a business with a heart. I ordered the coconut vanilla latte. It was made very well and I truly enjoyed it. I will definitely visit Home again when I'm in the area.
author: Fadzlyana I.

description: Hands down. My FAVORITE coffee shop so far. I'm so sad that I discovered this place just before I move away but I'm planning to come here everyday if I get the chance - because it's. so. damn. good. I think I could eat at least 5 pieces of their Tomato and Truffle Oil toast! That's the only one I've tried so far - but I'm sure all the other ones are just as good as well! And their lattes... Why is it not tomorrow morning yet?!
author: Mandy C.

description: This is my favorite coffee shop. Absolutely love coming here for the coffee and the chicken meatball toast! The owners are so nice and friendly and all the coffees I've tried (about 4) so far have been delicious. This place is getting popular and always seems filled with people every time I visited. I hope they extend their hours soon so we have the option to come in the evening.
author: Stephanie H.

description: We ordered two hot chocolates, one which had too much chocolate and one which had very little chocolate. We were told that toast would be at least 15min since the chef wasn't in yet but It was 8:20am and per their sign they serve food starting at 8am. Nothing about home left me want to come back and with so many wonderful coffee shops in town I won't be coming back again.
author: Alissa S.

description: With the stress of finals, Home really helped me relax and stay concentrated. I ordered a condensed milk latte (later found out its nickname, "holy cow") and it was heavenly. I would recommend it especially if you're a fan of coffee but appreciate it on the sweeter side.
author: Cameron C.

description: This coffee shop is adorable! I got their cold brew, which is amazing! My girlfriend got their vanilla latte and she loved it. We will definitely return!
author: Jessy R.

description: This place is AMAZING!! The atmosphere is super calm and pretty. Perfect study/ work spot. I got the coconut vanilla latte and bacon&corn toast. Kind of pricey but worth it. Also, the customer service is super friendly. TBH, i would live here.
author: Maggie W.

description: Everything is delicious, as you can see from the pics. Probably the best matcha latte I've ever had. Nice place to get work done- very fast wifi and great lighting. Excellent customer service as well. So happy this place is in the neighborhood! I'll be a regular.
author: Alex O.

description: Cute little coffee place. Stopped to get a latte while my car was getting an oil change. I feel like I should've tried the toast though.
author: Brian M.

description: Home" cafe offers great tasting coffee. Check out their coffee menu I found it neat. Baristas has great personality.
author: Sabina A.

description: A nice break from the hipster coffee joints! Cute place with Friendly service and most importantly great coffee (they serve four barrel) filled with high school and college kids either hanging out or typing away on their laptops. It's a good place to get coffee to-go unless you get their early enough to snag a table. They serve a variety of toasts which looked like a good light breakfast or snack. I'll have to go back when I'm hungry to try the toasts!
author: Christine H.

description: OMG delicious La Paz and Four Barrel coffees. The special toast things are amazing. We had decaf pour over, condensed milk toast and the egg poached in the middle of a fat piece of toast. The kid had some pastry which was good but can't compare to the toast creations they make right there for you. All wonderful.
author: jennifer k.

description: I typed "home" in my navigation system (it's "just a calculator" according to my "boyfriend"/airquotes) and ended up here instead of my trash fort. I was disoriented, perhaps from not being accustomed to sun or light or both at once. I wandered in toward the tantalizing smells of ground coffee. My body aching for caffeine... I ordered the lavender latte with almond milk (because I'm a fancy bitch) & the pesto tomato toast. DEAR GOD. Everything was delicious and I finished it much faster than anticipated! After I was given the Heimlich, my fault not theirs, I shed a single tear. It was that good. The thick porcelain cup in which my latte was served told me this was a classy ass joint. If they let me, I will be returning soon.
author: Rebecca C.

description: Home is a hidden gem in the sunset district with a cozy and ambient mood while providing high quality and creative coffee and snacks. I will continue to be a regular here.
author: Sammy S.

description: Walked in on my way home and was pleasantly surprised to see a new cafe had opened up. My first impression right off the bat was that they had an amazing interior decorator which helped them achieve a  well designed trendy,calming and refreshing atmosphere.
