Theres plenty of space to sit with outlets to plug in any electronic device , which is perfect for people like me who do most of my work on a laptop at a coffee shop. Oh and they have free and fast wifi. They serve only the best coffee (De La Paz and Four Barrel) and they actually put marshmallows in their hot chocolate!  I was immediately greeted with a genuine warm smile once I reached the counter.  I ordered a hot chocolate and gluten free chocolate brownie cake. It was to die for! The most delicious gluten free anything I have ever tasted.  It is definitely a must have when you go. Their friendly service, attention to detail and little extra touches will keep me coming back as much as possible. If you are looking for a higher end coffee shop without the snobby attitude...this is the place!
author: Astrea W.

description: The lavender latte smells so good.  It already has some sugar, so taste before you put anything more in the cup . . . the wonderful staff there stopped me just in time.  It is sweet enough as served.  Perfect cup on a cold day.  As for the toast, wow!  The tomato and pesto with a fried egg is a wonderful breakfast . . . could eat that everyday.
author: Steve A.

description: Ah, Home. At last I got to try you and I was not disappointed. The customer service was great from the two working today - very friendly and didn't rush me when I was deciding what kind of toast and drink to get. I ended up with an iced lavender latte and oh my, it was pretty and delicious. I can't wait to try all the other choices they have. I ended up with the condensed milk toast too, and it was the perfect amount, perfect consistency, perfect sweetness and butteriness, it was just... So yummy. Definately going back.
author: Shira S.

description:
I really loved this place! Headed here as a stop on the way to Trouble, funnily enough. We ended up staying here for a quite some time enjoying delicious drinks, eating delicious toast, and then eventually adding in some desserts too. We ordered a couple of the egg-based toasts and really liked them. Huge size, great toast - definitely a filling meal for the price you pay. 
We loved the desserts too. They're from a small vendor and they're really high quality.
We'd love to go back!
author: Felicia B.

description:
This place is the definition of being "HOME"

Ambiance, drinks, toast are all so heart warming to my soul and my stomach.
author: Virginia L.

description: Best latte in the city-- the coconut vanilla latte was amazing!! Can't wait to try more of the favors. Just wish they were open later and earlier.
author: Tyne B.

description: New place with a nice feel to it. The owner couple are super sweet and charming. The coffee and food are tasty. It's a great addition, and unique for the area it's in, as there is a lack of places offering quality pour over coffee. It's clearly a labor of love, and while there's some room for improvement, they're off to a great start.
author: Anna P.

description: This is such a cute coffee shop. We drop by here usually after we visit Twisted Donuts across the street. The owners are so sweet and considerate. Love how they put a giant marshmallow in the hot chocolate and mocha too. Yummmmmmms!!!!
author: Mary M.

description: New toast special! Bacon and corn. It's as wonderful as you think! And since my last post, I've tried more of the "creative" drinks. My usual is the delicious "holy cow" - condensed milk latte.
author: sina t.

description: We visited here for breakfast. They're toast was nice. We tried tomato and cheese one and chicken meet one, and both are good in different way. Coffee was normal. The atmosphere there was good and we spent nice time.
author: Kazuki N.

description: The lavender lattes are amazing! I'm at the cafe now and the aesthetics, the feel and even the music is perfect. The only thing I would complain about is that it's decently packed but I completely understand why. The people are generally friendly and will let you sit with them in their table. The staff is so easy to talk to and seem genuinely happy. I would definitely recommend stopping by and giving it a try.
author: Linda O.

description: I love it here! There's a relaxing atmosphere and it's really calming. I like coming here with friends and drinking coffee while just chatting. It's also a nice place for me to chill and do homework instead of staying at home. The lattes are yummy :) And I like that there is a variety of drinks and food. The staff is really nice, which makes the experience even better. Although, the only downside is that I wish they didn't close so early.
author: Daisy R.

description: This place has great coffee, tea, and toast. The prices are fair and the service is friendly and personable. The atmosphere is beautiful and clean feeling, but also cozy. I love the slight twists to traditional coffee drinks. My only complaint is that it's closed on Mondays and only open til 4 or so on the other days.
author: Nicole K.

description:
There have been several businesses in this location in the past few years but this the one I hope stays. We go for breakfast on the weekends and OMG. I just tried their Iced Coconut Vanilla Latte and now I am addicted. (Though I ask for an extra shot because I like insanely strong coffee.)

My kids love their cinnamon toast and my husband has the egg in a basket but the breakfast I dream about is the Toast with meatballs with a fried egg. Delicious. 

The couple who owns the place are there on the weekends and are super sweet. Even though I am not on first name basis with them, yet, their personal touches to everything, food, service and ambiance make you feel like family.

I happen to live a block away but if I didn't I'd travel. Parking is easy in the Sunset and I get a breakfast for a family of 4 for less than $30, which is unreal in this city.
author: Ann H.

description: This place is so cute! I'm so happy I'm able to find lavender latte closer to where I live!! :) The tomato pesto toast is delicious. I can't wait to try out their other items. The service was great as well. Maybe one day they'll extend their business hours!
author: Allyson L.

description: I wish I would of waited until I got to work for my coffee since there are better coffee shops around but it was on the way to the bus stop.  Workers here look tired, not the usual cheery people I see at my regular spots which probably explains how they messed up on my order bc they probably hate their jobs.  Ordered a latte with soy milk and by the time I got to the work my stomach was not feeling well! They probably used regular milk for my coffee which does not sit well for me or had bad soy.  Whatever is..I will not be back! Should of listened to the wife and went to the donut shop across street instead!
author: Marcus D.

description: Nice new place that serves de la Paz coffee. Much needed coffee joint in the heart of the Sunset. Yes, we all know that the outer and inner Sunset are taken care of! An added plus is you could get a donut at Twisted! Bright, sunlit, and normally populated by somewhat territorial college students. I've had the Hangover, a carbonated Americano, and it is excellent and addictive. I'd give another star overall, but service while earnest and friendly, still needs speed and polish. I know it is only about two weeks young, so I'm sure it is just a matter of time, and still going to be a customer. I will update review after trying more drinks and their toasts.
author: E. W.

description: Great coffe, great environment, friendly people. the cashieer even remembered my name as i made my way out!
author: Sabrina P.

description: Great spot for good coffee and a light breakfast. It's hard to find a seat but we asked a laptop worker to share a table. Would come back!
author: A S.

description:
I've never EVER left a Yelp review before, but Home is so amazing that I must. I've been traversing the city in search of the perfect coffee shop since my arrival 5 months ago, and I am pleased to announce that I have finally found it. They have an array of lattes for the latte drinker (which I am) and the De La Paz roast they use is amazing. I had the lavender latte this morning, and it is amazing. I shall be returning tomorrow to try the coconut vanilla, and every weekday thereafter until I've discovered my favorite. The customer service is outstanding, the decor is adorable, and the music is fantastic. 

This is the kind of cafe in which I could languish away an entire Saturday afternoon. 5 stars.
author: Mia W.

description: Quickly becoming my go to coffee place. The Coconut vanilla latte is so yummy. I can't wait to try other things on their extensive menu.
author: Martha M.

description: Great new coffee shop. The inside has very nice, modern decor. It's unfortunate I do not live by here otherwise I would stop by quite frequently. We ordered the condensed milk butter toast that has been much discussed. To my surprise, it was quite good, the condensed milk was not overpowering nor was it too sweet. The texture bread was crunchy enough and did not get too soggy. I also had the hazelnut latte which was excellent; not too sweet and I did not even have to request it. Great place to come and hang out for a drink or study. It's located in a quiet part of the main road too which helps. Will definitely try to come back ASAP!
author: Jimmy D.

description: It's official. I'm addicted to this place! Try the Coketastic. Bomb.com Staff is super friendly  too!
author: Brian L.

description: Love this cutesy, modern coffee shop in the Sunset! Great selection of coffee and tea and other ~creative~ drinks.
author: Alexa R.

description: I was on my way home from the dentist this afternoon and saw that a new cafe had opened up on Noriega Street. I stopped in to take a peek and was greeted by the owner as soon as I popped my head in. This is a really nice addition to Noriega Street. I know there are a lot of Henry's House of Coffee fans out there, but I prefer Home to Henry's. The iced soy latte I ordered was fantastic. They did a great renovation with the space and the interior is a soothing blue with plenty of benches and tables to sit at and while away the hours drinking coffee, enjoying a pastry and catching up with a friend, reading a book, or doing some work. They serve top notch coffee here (De La Paz and Four Barrel or was it Ritual?) and Mighty Leaf loose leaf tea. The menu features your typical cafe drinks including tea, coffee and hot chocolate and a few fun twists of their own, as well as a nice selection of pastries and designer toast options. The owner mentioned that in the future they want to look into serving brunch on weekends which I cannot wait for! Best of luck to Home! I hope they do well here. :)
author: Alice H.

description: Decided to give Home a try.  I wanted to like this place and support local small business.  Sent my wife in for coffee to go while I waited in the car with the dog. I wanted their regular drip but the wife decided to get me their decaf pour over.  The first sip was not hot and tasted sour (I drink my coffee black). Had a couple of more gulps and it wasn't any better.  Got home and dumped it down the drain.  May come back to try something else since there are so many good reviews on yelp.
author: R K.

description: Would give it 5 but what coffee spot doesn't open till 8am?! And they only have those trendy toast things. All else is good tho. Owners are nice, clean, good coffee!
author: Wyatt F.

description: Came with my mom, such nice staff!! We ordered the chicken meatball, cinnamon sugar, and the condensed milk toast along with the hazelnut latte and the lavender latte. AMAZING.AMAZING.AMAZING! Such great staff, very personable, and great selection! All their toasts are yummy and great for sharing!! Will definitely come back! (I think I got my mom addicted...)
author: Elizabeth L.

description:
The atmosphere and music is nice, a great place to get work done. Sometimes it can get a little loud and crowded during lunch time when all the high schoolers come in. I wish they extended their hours a bit, but I understand it's because they're still new. 

The toast (I've tried all except the cinnamon one) is really good! Not the biggest fan of the coffee but the tea was good too.
author: Seung L.

description: The toast here is really great. Coupled with delicious coffee and a nice atmosphere I'd eagerly recommend this spot
author: Patrick O.

description: This place just opened so decided to check it out. The service here is super friendly and nice. I had the condensed milk toast here. It was buttery milky deliciousness. I'll definitely be back for the coffee. I wish it was open earlier so I can get some before work.
author: Grace H.

description: What a nice and cozy cafe! I absolutely love caffeine and know a good coffee (that's made with love) when I taste one! The staff are so friendly and personable, I didn't feel like a stranger at all. Parking isn't that hard to find which is great as well! This has become one of my go-to places for a yummy pastry and latte.
author: Crazy B.

description: Another overpriced cookie cutter hipster coffee spot. I asked for splenda and I was looked at in disgust. I'll stick to Henry's.
author: Jay M.

description: The place is owned by the sweetest couple! The menu has a unique fun selection, and the ambiance is very comforting yet modern. A type of place much needed on this end of Sunset. Definitely coming back to this gem.
author: Diana T.

description: the people have spoken and HOME lives on ... insightful owners listened to their hearts and fans ... giving themselves some time and space for themselves, the owners have entrusted their staff to continue the warm and friendly service and good coffee ... aloha tim
author: tim y.

description: Excellent coffee n tea n pastries! Very soothing decor., chilling place to hang out n relax, friendliest staff!! Will b back soon.. Maybe every other day..
author: Jo B.

description: Great space, food and atmosphere. A little pricey on the food though. This review length will remain like this.
author: Jovi G.

description: really cute coffee shop offering some trendy toasts. service is always with a smile.
author: Rachel T.

description: So excited to have this great little coffee shop next to my house! The owners are SUPER nice and make great coffee. Love that they were so excited to here what the neighborhood wants in a local coffee spot. Can't want to try everything else!
author: staci H.

description: Kind, friendly, and knowledgable. The service is as great as the coffee. Also, some interesting options that I haven't found anywhere else and not pretentious, just good.
author: Justin S.

description: This is a great little coffee shop. My husband and I have been in the San Francisco area for 3 days and this is the 1st amazing coffee we've had. Great flavor, great service. Local products. The breakfast meals were absolutely delicious. I highly recommend this shop and will probably be back a few more times before we leave town.
author: L M.

description: Cute spot.  Gracious host and wonderful service. Coffee tasted great!. They ran out of ginger peach tea and offered to brew a fresh batch.  Didn't want to trouble them but the fact that they offered shows how much they value customer service.  Hope this place sticks around.
author: Yumi C.

description: Home definitely lives up to its name - I stopped by this morning to check it out and was pleasantly surprised by the kind staff, despite it just opening half an hour prior.  The menu has a lot of creative options, especially for the lattes and toasts! A friend an I got the hazelnut latte and coconut vanilla latte, as well as tomato truffle oil pesto toast and chicken meatball with garlic toast. It took roughly 10 minutes to make, but the wait was definitely worth it. The coffee was delicious - the hazelnut latte had an underlying hazelnut flavor, not too strong, and the toast is thick enough to fill you up! The flavors are perfect, and good for any time of the day. The decor of the cafe is also really cute - there are little plants at every table, as well as fairy lights and shelves filled with little trinkets. They have lots of seating to stay and chat with a friend, too. I would definitely come back again!
author: Cindy N.

description: the friendliest staff with the most delicious and creative coffee in town! they offer some great local goodies and make super tasty toast creations in addition to having lots of seating and free wi-fi -- wonderful place to study or pop in to grab a drink that'll make you want to come back soon.
author: Justine M.

description: Awesome find and great to have a warm, cosy and cute coffee shop - creative coffee, tea and food - in the neighborhood.  Great wi-fi and soft relaxing music as well
author: mihir m.

description: We had two chai latte and a London fog. Flavor and presentation were awesome, but for 5 stars the chai should have been hot, not just warm. Lemon cake was a generous slice and delish!
author: Andrea K.

description: this cafe is the cutest thing in an unassuming area. it's spacious, welcoming, and simple in decor. the guy working the counter is super friendly and talkative. the coffee is good but the flavored lattes are lacking in...well....flavor. i've gotten the red velvet and the mint mocha and both were pretty much just regular lattes. the TOASTS on the other hand are a magical thing. the bread is super light but chewy and they brush it in so much butter before sizzling crisp that there's no way you couldn't love it. i've had the egg in a hole and the pesto one and both were awesome. i can't wait to try all of the other ones.
author: Regina C.

description: It is a nice cafe. In fact perhaps it is too nice because people seem to stay for a long time. This has caused an issue for me because there are limited power outlets and getting a table near one can be a challenge. Regarding food and beverage, the cappuccino is good as are the pastries. The cappuccinos come with a nice design in the foam which always makes me feel a little guilty when I stir in a little sugar. The only other thing is that I feel like it's a bit pricey although not terribly overpriced considering the small size of the shop and the low turnover of the tables.
author: Gerry M.

description: What a great addition to the neighborhood!  The Outer Sunset definitely has been in need of some nicer coffee shops like this one.  The coffee and toast are both excellent.  I also really like the decor and set up inside.  A decent amount of seating and plugs at every other table in a really nice, clean, and uncluttered setting.  I've been able to bring my laptop and get alot of work done.  The baristas have all been really nice as well.  I hope this place continues to succeed!
author: Jessica R.

description: First time here. Tried their egg toast, and it looks nice but it was too buttery and salty
author: Carmen L.

description: I've been in a few times. Normally I don't like medium roast coffee, but the De La Paz (SP?) is really nice. The two people that run this place (husband and wife team?) are very friendly and genuine. They deserve neighborhood support as I see them busting their butts everyday trying to offer something nice in my community. Oh and my kids love the cinnamon toast. I'm glad this place is here.
author: J C.

description: The seating is great and the employees there are pretty friendly. The decor and the way they serve the food is very nice. The red velvet latte with soy was delicious and so was their cinnamon toast! I recommend both. Definitely worth the hype.
author: Emma D.

description: Came here with my bestie and we decided that Home was a very cute cafe with decent food. The interior has a minimalist feel to it with plenty of seating. I got the lavender latte with soy and the chicken meatball with pesto toast - a bit oily but tasty. The latte was good although the lavender didn't really come through. Would come back once in a while if I wanted to take cute pictures of my food .
author: Laura N.

description: Love the drinks. Tried chocolate mint latte hot and the young coconut juice. Awesome. Also like the eggs in a basket toast and even though they messed up my order, the service is great. :)
author: Bri L.

description: Free wifi, plenty of tables with outlets to do homework, quality coffee, and amazing toast.
author: Ashley M.

description: i honestly wish i could give this place 6 stars.  i was thoroughly impressed!  my high friend rolled into town and we were catching up the night before into the wee hours of the morning, so you can imagine how hungry we both were.  all the seats were filled when we first entered, so we decided to leave.  just then the gal from the front counter comes out to tell us she found us a seat because she was asking to see if anyone was leaving soon.  talk about best-in-class service!  turns out the sweet gal, annie, is one of the owners along with her fiance, in.  i ordered an iced latte and the tomato truffle toast with an egg on top.  i was blown away by the visual appearance of my plate and how crunchy, tasty, savory it all was.  a flavor explosion!  i literally mopped up my plate with the remaining toast!  it's definitely an awesome spin on my usual eggs with toast.  will most definitely be returning to this place and very soon!  grateful to have encountered such wonderful business owners and off-the-hook culinary delights!
author: Yan K.
